IAST: mā cid anyad vi śaṁsata sakhāyo mā riṣaṇyata
Griffith: GLORIFY naught besides, O friends; so shall no sorrow trouble you.
Devanāgarī: मा चिदन्यद्वि शंसत सखायो मा रिषण्यत
pada pāṭha: mā | cit | anyat | vi | śaṁsata | sakhāyaḥ | mā | riṣaṇyata || indram | it | stota | vr̥ṣaṇam | sacā | sute | muhuḥ | ukthā | ca | śaṁsata ||8.1.1||

IAST: indram it stotā vṛṣaṇaṁ sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṁsata
Griffith: Praise only mighty Indra when the juice is shed, and say your lauds repeatedly:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमित्स्तोता वृषणं सचा सुते मुहुरुक्था च शंसत
pada pāṭha: mā | cit | anyat | vi | śaṁsata | sakhāyaḥ | mā | riṣaṇyata || indram | it | stota | vr̥ṣaṇam | sacā | sute | muhuḥ | ukthā | ca | śaṁsata ||8.1.1||

IAST: avakrakṣiṇaṁ vṛṣabhaṁ yathājuraṁ gāṁ na carṣaṇīsaham
Griffith: Even him, eternal, like a bull who rushes down, men's Conqueror, bounteous like a cow;
Devanāgarī: अवक्रक्षिणं वृषभं यथाजुरं गां न चर्षणीसहम्
pada pāṭha: ava-krakṣiṇam | vr̥ṣabham | yathā | ajuram | gām | na | carṣaṇi-saham || vi-dveṣaṇam | sam-vananā | ubhayam-karam | maṁhiṣṭham | ubhayāvinam ||8.1.2||

IAST: vidveṣaṇaṁ saṁvananobhayaṁkaram maṁhiṣṭham ubhayāvinam
Griffith: Him who is cause of both, of enmity and peace, to both sides most munificent.
pada pāṭha: ava-krakṣiṇam | vr̥ṣabham | yathā | ajuram | gām | na | carṣaṇi-saham || vi-dveṣaṇam | sam-vananā | ubhayam-karam | maṁhiṣṭham | ubhayāvinam ||8.1.2||

IAST: yac cid dhi tvā janā ime nānā havanta ūtaye
Griffith: Although these men in sundry ways invoke thee to obtain thine aid,
Devanāgarī: यच्चिद्धि त्वा जना इमे नाना हवन्त ऊतये
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | tvā | janāḥ | ime | nānā | havante | ūtaye || asmākam | brahma | idam | indra | bhūtu | te | ahā | viśvā | ca | vardhanam ||8.1.3||

IAST: asmākam brahmedam indra bhūtu te 'hā viśvā ca vardhanam
Griffith: Be this our prayer, addressed, O Indra, unto thee, thine exaltation every day.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं ब्रह्मेदमिन्द्र भूतु तेऽहा विश्वा च वर्धनम्
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | tvā | janāḥ | ime | nānā | havante | ūtaye || asmākam | brahma | idam | indra | bhūtu | te | ahā | viśvā | ca | vardhanam ||8.1.3||

IAST: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścito 'ryo vipo janānām
Griffith: Those skilled in song, O Maghavan among these men o'ercome with might the foeman's songs.
pada pāṭha: vi | tartūryante | magha-van | vipaḥ-citaḥ | aryaḥ | vipaḥ | janānām || upa | kramasva | puru-rūpam | ā | bhara | vājam | nediṣṭham | ūtaye ||8.1.4||

IAST: upa kramasva pururūpam ā bhara vājaṁ nediṣṭham ūtaye
Griffith: Come hither, bring us strength in many a varied form most near that it may succour us.
Devanāgarī: उप क्रमस्व पुरुरूपमा भर वाजं नेदिष्ठमूतये
pada pāṭha: vi | tartūryante | magha-van | vipaḥ-citaḥ | aryaḥ | vipaḥ | janānām || upa | kramasva | puru-rūpam | ā | bhara | vājam | nediṣṭham | ūtaye ||8.1.4||

IAST: mahe cana tvām adrivaḥ parā śulkāya deyām
Griffith: O Caster of the Stone, I would not sell thee for a mighty price,
Devanāgarī: महे चन त्वामद्रिवः परा शुल्काय देयाम्
pada pāṭha: mahe | cana | tvām | adri-vaḥ | parā | śulkāya | deyām || na | sahasrāya | na | ayutāya | vajri-vaḥ | na | śatāya | śata-magha ||8.1.5||

IAST: na sahasrāya nāyutāya vajrivo na śatāya śatāmagha
Griffith: Not for a thousand, Thunderer! nor ten thousand, nor a hundred, Lord of countless wealth!
Devanāgarī: न सहस्राय नायुताय वज्रिवो न शताय शतामघ
pada pāṭha: mahe | cana | tvām | adri-vaḥ | parā | śulkāya | deyām || na | sahasrāya | na | ayutāya | vajri-vaḥ | na | śatāya | śata-magha ||8.1.5||

IAST: vasyām̐ indrāsi me pitur uta bhrātur abhuñjataḥ
Griffith: O Indra, thou art more to me than sire or niggard brother is.
pada pāṭha: vasyān | indra | asi | me | pituḥ | uta | bhrātuḥ | abhuñjataḥ || mātā | ca | me | chadayathaḥ | samā | vaso iti | vasu-tvanāya | rādhase ||8.1.6||

IAST: mātā ca me chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase
Griffith: Thou and my mother, O Good Lord, appear alike, to give me wealth abundantly.
Devanāgarī: माता च मे छदयथः समा वसो वसुत्वनाय राधसे
pada pāṭha: vasyān | indra | asi | me | pituḥ | uta | bhrātuḥ | abhuñjataḥ || mātā | ca | me | chadayathaḥ | samā | vaso iti | vasu-tvanāya | rādhase ||8.1.6||

IAST: kveyatha kved asi purutrā cid dhi te manaḥ
Griffith: Where art thou? Whither art thou gone? For many a place attracts thy mind.
Devanāgarī: क्वेयथ क्वेदसि पुरुत्रा चिद्धि ते मनः
pada pāṭha: kva | iyatha | kva | it | asi | puru-trā | cit | hi | te | manaḥ || alarṣi | yudhma | khaja-kr̥t | puram-dara | pra | gāyatrāḥ | agāsiṣuḥ ||8.1.7||

IAST: alarṣi yudhma khajakṛt puraṁdara pra gāyatrā agāsiṣuḥ
Griffith: Haste, Warrior, Fort-destroyer, Lord of battle's din, haste, holy songs have sounded forth.
Devanāgarī: अलर्षि युध्म खजकृत्पुरंदर प्र गायत्रा अगासिषुः
pada pāṭha: kva | iyatha | kva | it | asi | puru-trā | cit | hi | te | manaḥ || alarṣi | yudhma | khaja-kr̥t | puram-dara | pra | gāyatrāḥ | agāsiṣuḥ ||8.1.7||

IAST: prāsmai gāyatram arcata vāvātur yaḥ puraṁdaraḥ
Griffith: Sing out the psalm to him who breaks down castles for his faithful friend,
pada pāṭha: pra | asmai | gāyatram | arcata | vavātuḥ | yaḥ | param-daraḥ || yābhiḥ | kāṇvasya | upa | barhiḥ | ā-sadam | yāsat | vajrī | bhinat | puraḥ ||8.1.8||

IAST: yābhiḥ kāṇvasyopa barhir āsadaṁ yāsad vajrī bhinat puraḥ
Griffith: Verses to bring the Thunderer to destroy the forts and sit on Kanva's sacred grass.
pada pāṭha: pra | asmai | gāyatram | arcata | vavātuḥ | yaḥ | param-daraḥ || yābhiḥ | kāṇvasya | upa | barhiḥ | ā-sadam | yāsat | vajrī | bhinat | puraḥ ||8.1.8||

IAST: ye te santi daśagvinaḥ śatino ye sahasriṇaḥ
Griffith: The Horses which are thine in tens, in hundreds, yea, in thousands thine,
Devanāgarī: ये ते सन्ति दशग्विनः शतिनो ये सहस्रिणः
pada pāṭha: ye | te | santi | daśa-gvinaḥ | śatinaḥ | ye | sahasriṇaḥ || aśvāsaḥ | ye | te | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | raghu-druvaḥ | tebhiḥ | naḥ | tūyam | ā | gahi ||8.1.9||

IAST: aśvāso ye te vṛṣaṇo raghudruvas tebhir nas tūyam ā gahi
Griffith: Even those vigorous Steeds, fleet-footed in the course, with those come quickly near to us.
Devanāgarī: अश्वासो ये ते वृषणो रघुद्रुवस्तेभिर्नस्तूयमा गहि
pada pāṭha: ye | te | santi | daśa-gvinaḥ | śatinaḥ | ye | sahasriṇaḥ || aśvāsaḥ | ye | te | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | raghu-druvaḥ | tebhiḥ | naḥ | tūyam | ā | gahi ||8.1.9||

IAST: ā tv adya sabardughāṁ huve gāyatravepasam
Griffith: This day I call Sabardugiha who animates the holy song,
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | adya | sabaḥ-dughām | huve | gāyatra-vepasam || indram | dhenum | su-dughām | anyām | iṣam | uru-dhārām | aram-kr̥tam ||8.1.10||

IAST: indraṁ dhenuṁ sudughām anyām iṣam urudhārām araṁkṛtam
Griffith: Indra the richly-yielding Milch-cow who provides unfailing food in ample stream.
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | adya | sabaḥ-dughām | huve | gāyatra-vepasam || indram | dhenum | su-dughām | anyām | iṣam | uru-dhārām | aram-kr̥tam ||8.1.10||

IAST: yat tudat sūra etaśaṁ vaṅkū vātasya parṇinā
Griffith: When Sura wounded Etasa, with Vata's rolling winged car.
pada pāṭha: yat | tudat | sūraḥ | etaśam | vaṅkū iti | vātasya | parṇinā || vahat | kutsam | ārjuneyam | śata-kratuḥ | tsarat | gandharvam | astr̥tam ||8.1.11||

IAST: vahat kutsam ārjuneyaṁ śatakratuḥ tsarad gandharvam astṛtam
Griffith: Indra bore Kutsa Arjuneya off, and mocked Gandharva. the unconquered One.
pada pāṭha: yat | tudat | sūraḥ | etaśam | vaṅkū iti | vātasya | parṇinā || vahat | kutsam | ārjuneyam | śata-kratuḥ | tsarat | gandharvam | astr̥tam ||8.1.11||

IAST: ya ṛte cid abhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhya ātṛdaḥ
Griffith: He without ligature, before making incision in the neck,
Devanāgarī: य ऋते चिदभिश्रिषः पुरा जत्रुभ्य आतृदः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥te | cit | abhi-śriṣaḥ | purā | jatru-bhyaḥ | ā-tr̥daḥ || sam-dhātā | sam-dhim | magha-vā | puru-vasuḥ | iṣkartā | vi-hrutam | punariti ||8.1.12||

IAST: saṁdhātā saṁdhim maghavā purūvasur iṣkartā vihrutam punaḥ
Griffith: Closed up the wound again, most wealthy Maghavan, who maketh whole the injured part.
Devanāgarī: संधाता संधिं मघवा पुरूवसुरिष्कर्ता विह्रुतं पुनः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥te | cit | abhi-śriṣaḥ | purā | jatru-bhyaḥ | ā-tr̥daḥ || sam-dhātā | sam-dhim | magha-vā | puru-vasuḥ | iṣkartā | vi-hrutam | punariti ||8.1.12||

IAST: mā bhūma niṣṭyā ivendra tvad araṇā iva
Griffith: May we be never cast aside, and strangers, as it were, to thee.
Devanāgarī: मा भूम निष्ट्या इवेन्द्र त्वदरणा इव
pada pāṭha: mā | bhūma | niṣṭyāḥ-iva | indra | tvat | araṇāḥ-iva || vanāni | na | pra-jahitāni | adri-vaḥ | duroṣāsaḥ | amanmahi ||8.1.13||

IAST: vanāni na prajahitāny adrivo duroṣāso amanmahi
Griffith: We, Thunder-wielding Indra, count ourselves as trees rejected and unfit to burn.
pada pāṭha: mā | bhūma | niṣṭyāḥ-iva | indra | tvat | araṇāḥ-iva || vanāni | na | pra-jahitāni | adri-vaḥ | duroṣāsaḥ | amanmahi ||8.1.13||

IAST: amanmahīd anāśavo 'nugrāsaś ca vṛtrahan
Griffith: O Vrtra-slayer, we were thought slow and unready for the fray.
pada pāṭha: amanmahi | it | anāśavaḥ | anugrāsaḥ | ca | vr̥tra-han || sakr̥t | su | te | mahatā | śūra | rādhasā | anu | stomam | mudīmahi ||8.1.14||

IAST: sakṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasā anu stomam mudīmahi
Griffith: Yet once in thy great bounty may we have delight, O Hero, after praising thee.
Devanāgarī: सकृत्सु ते महता शूर राधसा अनु स्तोमं मुदीमहि
pada pāṭha: amanmahi | it | anāśavaḥ | anugrāsaḥ | ca | vr̥tra-han || sakr̥t | su | te | mahatā | śūra | rādhasā | anu | stomam | mudīmahi ||8.1.14||

IAST: yadi stomam mama śravad asmākam indram indavaḥ
Griffith: If he will listen to my laud, then may out Soma-drops that flow
pada pāṭha: yadi | stomam | mama | śravat | asmākam | indram | indavaḥ || tiraḥ | pavitram | sasr̥-vāṁsaḥ | āśavaḥ | mandantu | tugrya-vr̥dhaḥ ||8.1.15||

IAST: tiraḥ pavitraṁ sasṛvāṁsa āśavo mandantu tugryāvṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Rapidly through the strainer gladden Indra, drops due to the Tugryas' Strengthener.
Devanāgarī: तिरः पवित्रं ससृवांस आशवो मन्दन्तु तुग्र्यावृधः
pada pāṭha: yadi | stomam | mama | śravat | asmākam | indram | indavaḥ || tiraḥ | pavitram | sasr̥-vāṁsaḥ | āśavaḥ | mandantu | tugrya-vr̥dhaḥ ||8.1.15||

IAST: ā tv adya sadhastutiṁ vāvātuḥ sakhyur ā gahi
Griffith: Come now unto the common laud of thee and of thy faithful friend.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वद्य सधस्तुतिं वावातुः सख्युरा गहि
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | adya | sadha-stutim | vavātuḥ | sakhyuḥ | ā | gahi || upa-stutiḥ | maghonām | pra | tvā | avatu | adha | te | vaśmi | su-stutim ||8.1.16||

IAST: upastutir maghonām pra tvāvatv adhā te vaśmi suṣṭutim
Griffith: So may our wealthy nobles' praise give joy to thee. Fain would I sing thine eulogy.
Devanāgarī: उपस्तुतिर्मघोनां प्र त्वावत्वधा ते वश्मि सुष्टुतिम्
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | adya | sadha-stutim | vavātuḥ | sakhyuḥ | ā | gahi || upa-stutiḥ | maghonām | pra | tvā | avatu | adha | te | vaśmi | su-stutim ||8.1.16||

IAST: sotā hi somam adribhir em enam apsu dhāvata
Griffith: Press out the Soma with the stones, and in the waters wash it clean.
pada pāṭha: sota | hi | somam | adri-bhiḥ | ā | īm | enam | ap-su | dhāvata || gavyā | vastrā-iva | vāsayantaḥ | it | naraḥ | niḥ | dhukṣan | vakṣaṇābhyaḥ ||8.1.17||

IAST: gavyā vastreva vāsayanta in naro nir dhukṣan vakṣaṇābhyaḥ
Griffith: The men investing it with raiment made of milk shall milk it forth from out the stems.
pada pāṭha: sota | hi | somam | adri-bhiḥ | ā | īm | enam | ap-su | dhāvata || gavyā | vastrā-iva | vāsayantaḥ | it | naraḥ | niḥ | dhukṣan | vakṣaṇābhyaḥ ||8.1.17||

IAST: adha jmo adha vā divo bṛhato rocanād adhi
Griffith: Whether thou come from earth or from the lustre of the lofty heaven,
Devanāgarī: अध ज्मो अध वा दिवो बृहतो रोचनादधि
pada pāṭha: adha | jmaḥ | adha | vā | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | rocanāt | adhi || ayā | vardhasva | tanvā | girā | mama | ā | jātā | sukrato iti su-krato | pr̥ṇa ||8.1.18||

IAST: ayā vardhasva tanvā girā mamā jātā sukrato pṛṇa
Griffith: Wax stronger in thy body through my song of praise: fill full all creatures, O most Wise.
Devanāgarī: अया वर्धस्व तन्वा गिरा ममा जाता सुक्रतो पृण
pada pāṭha: adha | jmaḥ | adha | vā | divaḥ | br̥hataḥ | rocanāt | adhi || ayā | vardhasva | tanvā | girā | mama | ā | jātā | sukrato iti su-krato | pr̥ṇa ||8.1.18||

IAST: indrāya su madintamaṁ somaṁ sotā vareṇyam
Griffith: For India press the Soma out, most gladdening and most excellent.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय सु मदिन्तमं सोमं सोता वरेण्यम्
pada pāṭha: indrāya | su | madin-tamam | somam | sota | vareṇyam || śakraḥ | enam | pīpayat | viśvayā | dhiyā | hinvānam | na | vāja-yum ||8.1.19||

IAST: śakra eṇam pīpayad viśvayā dhiyā hinvānaṁ na vājayum
Griffith: May Sakra make it swell sent forth with every prayer and asking, as it were, for strength.
Devanāgarī: शक्र एणं पीपयद्विश्वया धिया हिन्वानं न वाजयुम्
pada pāṭha: indrāya | su | madin-tamam | somam | sota | vareṇyam || śakraḥ | enam | pīpayat | viśvayā | dhiyā | hinvānam | na | vāja-yum ||8.1.19||

IAST: mā tvā somasya galdayā sadā yācann ahaṁ girā
Griffith: Let me not, still beseeching thee with earnest song at Soma rites,
Devanāgarī: मा त्वा सोमस्य गल्दया सदा याचन्नहं गिरा
pada pāṭha: mā | tvā | somasya | galdayā | sadā | yācan | aham | girā || bhūrṇim | mr̥gam | na | savaneṣu | cukrudham | kaḥ | īśānam | na | yāciṣat ||8.1.20||

IAST: bhūrṇim mṛgaṁ na savaneṣu cukrudhaṁ ka īśānaṁ na yāciṣat
Griffith: Anger thee like soma wild beast. Who would not beseech him who hath power to grant his prayer?
Devanāgarī: भूर्णिं मृगं न सवनेषु चुक्रुधं क ईशानं न याचिषत्
pada pāṭha: mā | tvā | somasya | galdayā | sadā | yācan | aham | girā || bhūrṇim | mr̥gam | na | savaneṣu | cukrudham | kaḥ | īśānam | na | yāciṣat ||8.1.20||

IAST: madeneṣitam madam ugram ugreṇa śavasā
Griffith: The draught made swift with rapturous joy, effectual with its mighty strength,
pada pāṭha: madena | iṣitam | madam | ugram | ugreṇa | śavasā || viśveṣām | tarutāram | mada-cyutam | made | hi | sma | dadāti | naḥ ||8.1.21||

IAST: viśveṣāṁ tarutāram madacyutam made hi ṣmā dadāti naḥ
Griffith: All-conquering, distilling transport, let him drink: for he in ecstasy gives us gifts.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेषां तरुतारं मदच्युतं मदे हि ष्मा ददाति नः
pada pāṭha: madena | iṣitam | madam | ugram | ugreṇa | śavasā || viśveṣām | tarutāram | mada-cyutam | made | hi | sma | dadāti | naḥ ||8.1.21||

IAST: śevāre vāryā puru devo martāya dāśuṣe
Griffith: Where bliss is not, may he, All-praised, God whom the pious glorify,
Devanāgarī: शेवारे वार्या पुरु देवो मर्ताय दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: śevāre | vāryā | puru | devaḥ | martāya | dāśuṣe || saḥ | sunvate | ca | stuvate | ca | rāsate | viśva-gūrtaḥ | ari-stutaḥ ||8.1.22||

IAST: sa sunvate ca stuvate ca rāsate viśvagūrto ariṣṭutaḥ
Griffith: Bestow great wealth upon the mortal worshipper who sheds the juice and praises him.
Devanāgarī: स सुन्वते च स्तुवते च रासते विश्वगूर्तो अरिष्टुतः
pada pāṭha: śevāre | vāryā | puru | devaḥ | martāya | dāśuṣe || saḥ | sunvate | ca | stuvate | ca | rāsate | viśva-gūrtaḥ | ari-stutaḥ ||8.1.22||

IAST: endra yāhi matsva citreṇa deva rādhasā
Griffith: Come, Indra, and rejoice thyself, O God, in manifold affluence.
Devanāgarī: एन्द्र याहि मत्स्व चित्रेण देव राधसा
pada pāṭha: ā | indra | yāhi | matsva | citreṇa | deva | rādhasā || saraḥ | na | prāsi | udaram | sapīti-bhiḥ | ā | somebhiḥ | uru | sphiram ||8.1.23||

IAST: saro na prāsy udaraṁ sapītibhir ā somebhir uru sphiram
Griffith: Thou fillest like a lake thy vast capacious bulk with Soma and with draughts besides.
Devanāgarī: सरो न प्रास्युदरं सपीतिभिरा सोमेभिरुरु स्फिरम्
pada pāṭha: ā | indra | yāhi | matsva | citreṇa | deva | rādhasā || saraḥ | na | prāsi | udaram | sapīti-bhiḥ | ā | somebhiḥ | uru | sphiram ||8.1.23||

IAST: ā tvā sahasram ā śataṁ yuktā rathe hiraṇyaye
Griffith: A thousand and a hundred Steeds are harnessed to thy golden car.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा सहस्रमा शतं युक्ता रथे हिरण्यये
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | sahasram | ā | śatam | yuktāḥ | rathe | hiraṇyaye || brahma-yujaḥ | harayaḥ | indra | keśinaḥ | vahantu | soma-pītaye ||8.1.24||

IAST: brahmayujo haraya indra keśino vahantu somapītaye
Griffith: So may the long-mancd Bays, yoked by devotion, bring Indra to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मयुजो हरय इन्द्र केशिनो वहन्तु सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | sahasram | ā | śatam | yuktāḥ | rathe | hiraṇyaye || brahma-yujaḥ | harayaḥ | indra | keśinaḥ | vahantu | soma-pītaye ||8.1.24||

IAST: ā tvā rathe hiraṇyaye harī mayūraśepyā
Griffith: Yoked to thy chariot wrought of gold, may thy two Bays with peacock tails,
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा रथे हिरण्यये हरी मयूरशेप्या
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | rathe | hiraṇyaye | harī iti | mayūra-śepyā || śiti-pr̥ṣṭhā | vahatām | madhvaḥ | andhasaḥ | vivakṣaṇasya | pītaye ||8.1.25||

IAST: śitipṛṣṭhā vahatām madhvo andhaso vivakṣaṇasya pītaye
Griffith: Convey thee hither, Steeds with their white backs, to quaff sweet juice that makes us eloquent.
Devanāgarī: शितिपृष्ठा वहतां मध्वो अन्धसो विवक्षणस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | rathe | hiraṇyaye | harī iti | mayūra-śepyā || śiti-pr̥ṣṭhā | vahatām | madhvaḥ | andhasaḥ | vivakṣaṇasya | pītaye ||8.1.25||

IAST: pibā tv asya girvaṇaḥ sutasya pūrvapā iva
Griffith: So drink, thou Lover of the Song, as the first drinker, of this juice.
Devanāgarī: पिबा त्वस्य गिर्वणः सुतस्य पूर्वपा इव
pada pāṭha: piba | tu | asya | girvaṇaḥ | sutasya | pūrvapāḥ-iva || pari-kr̥tasya | rasinaḥ | iyam | ā-sutiḥ | cāruḥ | madāya | patyate ||8.1.26||

IAST: pariṣkṛtasya rasina iyam āsutiś cārur madāya patyate
Griffith: This the outpouring of the savoury sap prepared is good and meet to gladden thee.
pada pāṭha: piba | tu | asya | girvaṇaḥ | sutasya | pūrvapāḥ-iva || pari-kr̥tasya | rasinaḥ | iyam | ā-sutiḥ | cāruḥ | madāya | patyate ||8.1.26||

IAST: ya eko asti daṁsanā mahām̐ ugro abhi vrataiḥ
Griffith: He who alone by wondrous deed is Mighty, Strong by holy works,
Devanāgarī: य एको अस्ति दंसना महाँ उग्रो अभि व्रतैः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ekaḥ | asti | daṁsanā | mahān | ugraḥ | abhi | vrataiḥ || gamat | saḥ | śiprī | na | saḥ | yoṣat | ā | gamat | havam | na | pari | varjati ||8.1.27||

IAST: gamat sa śiprī na sa yoṣad ā gamad dhavaṁ na pari varjati
Griffith: May he come, fair of cheek; may he not stay afar, but come and turn not from our call.
Devanāgarī: गमत्स शिप्री न स योषदा गमद्धवं न परि वर्जति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ekaḥ | asti | daṁsanā | mahān | ugraḥ | abhi | vrataiḥ || gamat | saḥ | śiprī | na | saḥ | yoṣat | ā | gamat | havam | na | pari | varjati ||8.1.27||

IAST: tvam puraṁ cariṣṇvaṁ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya sam piṇak
Griffith: Susna's quick moving castle thou hast crushed to pieces with thy bolts.
Devanāgarī: त्वं पुरं चरिष्ण्वं वधैः शुष्णस्य सं पिणक्
pada pāṭha: tvam | puram | cariṣṇvam | vadhaiḥ | śuṣṇasya | sam | piṇak || tvam | bhāḥ | anu | caraḥ | adha | dvitā | yat | indra | havyaḥ | bhuvaḥ ||8.1.28||

IAST: tvam bhā anu caro adha dvitā yad indra havyo bhuvaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Indra, from of old, hast followed after light, since we have had thee to invoke.
Devanāgarī: त्वं भा अनु चरो अध द्विता यदिन्द्र हव्यो भुवः
pada pāṭha: tvam | puram | cariṣṇvam | vadhaiḥ | śuṣṇasya | sam | piṇak || tvam | bhāḥ | anu | caraḥ | adha | dvitā | yat | indra | havyaḥ | bhuvaḥ ||8.1.28||

IAST: mama tvā sūra udite mama madhyaṁdine divaḥ
Griffith: My praises when the Sun hath risen, my praises at the time of noon,
Devanāgarī: मम त्वा सूर उदिते मम मध्यंदिने दिवः
pada pāṭha: mama | tvā | sūre | ut-ite | mama | madhyaṁdine | divaḥ || mama | pra-pitve | api-śarvare | vaso iti | ā | stomāsaḥ | avr̥tsata ||8.1.29||

IAST: mama prapitve apiśarvare vasav ā stomāso avṛtsata
Griffith: My praises at the coming of the gloom of night, O Vasu, have gone forth to thee.
Devanāgarī: मम प्रपित्वे अपिशर्वरे वसवा स्तोमासो अवृत्सत
pada pāṭha: mama | tvā | sūre | ut-ite | mama | madhyaṁdine | divaḥ || mama | pra-pitve | api-śarvare | vaso iti | ā | stomāsaḥ | avr̥tsata ||8.1.29||

IAST: stuhi stuhīd ete ghā te maṁhiṣṭhāso maghonām
Griffith: Praise yea, praise him. Of princes these are the most liberal of their gifts,
Devanāgarī: स्तुहि स्तुहीदेते घा ते मंहिष्ठासो मघोनाम्
pada pāṭha: stuhi | stuhi | it | ete | gha | te | maṁhiṣṭhāsaḥ | maghonām || nindita-aśvaḥ | pra-pathī | parama-jyāḥ | maghasya | medhya-atithe ||8.1.30||

IAST: ninditāśvaḥ prapathī paramajyā maghasya medhyātithe
Griffith: These, Paramajya, Ninditasva, Prapathi, most bounteous, O Medhyatithi.
pada pāṭha: stuhi | stuhi | it | ete | gha | te | maṁhiṣṭhāsaḥ | maghonām || nindita-aśvaḥ | pra-pathī | parama-jyāḥ | maghasya | medhya-atithe ||8.1.30||

IAST: ā yad aśvān vananvataḥ śraddhayāhaṁ rathe ruham
Griffith: When to the car, by faith, I yoked the horses longing for the way-
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | aśvān | vanan-vataḥ | śraddhayā | aham | rathe | ruham || uta | vāmasya | vasunaḥ | ciketati | yaḥ | asti | yādvaḥ | paśuḥ ||8.1.31||

IAST: uta vāmasya vasunaś ciketati yo asti yādvaḥ paśuḥ
Griffith: For skilled is Yadu's son in dealing precious wealth, he who is rich in herds of kine.
Devanāgarī: उत वामस्य वसुनश्चिकेतति यो अस्ति याद्वः पशुः
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | aśvān | vanan-vataḥ | śraddhayā | aham | rathe | ruham || uta | vāmasya | vasunaḥ | ciketati | yaḥ | asti | yādvaḥ | paśuḥ ||8.1.31||

IAST: ya ṛjrā mahyam māmahe saha tvacā hiraṇyayā
Griffith: May he who gave me two brown steeds together with their cloths of gold,
Devanāgarī: य ऋज्रा मह्यं मामहे सह त्वचा हिरण्यया
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥jrā | mahyam | mamahe | saha | tvacā | hiraṇyayā || eṣaḥ | viśvāni | abhi | astu | saubhagā | ā-saṅgasya | svanat-rathaḥ ||8.1.32||

IAST: eṣa viśvāny abhy astu saubhagāsaṅgasya svanadrathaḥ
Griffith: May he, Asanga's son Svanadratha, obtain all joy and high felicities.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥jrā | mahyam | mamahe | saha | tvacā | hiraṇyayā || eṣaḥ | viśvāni | abhi | astu | saubhagā | ā-saṅgasya | svanat-rathaḥ ||8.1.32||

IAST: adha plāyogir ati dāsad anyān āsaṅgo agne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
Griffith: Playoga's son Asanga, by ten thousand, O Agni, hath surpassed the rest in giving.
Devanāgarī: अध प्लायोगिरति दासदन्यानासङ्गो अग्ने दशभिः सहस्रैः
pada pāṭha: adha | plāyogiḥ | ati | dāsat | anyān | ā-saṅgaḥ | agne | daśa-bhiḥ | sahasraiḥ || adha | ukṣaṇaḥ | daśa | mahyam | ruśantaḥ | naḷāḥ-iva | sarasaḥ | niḥ | atiṣṭhan ||8.1.33||

IAST: adhokṣaṇo daśa mahyaṁ ruśanto naḻā iva saraso nir atiṣṭhan
Griffith: For me ten bright-hued oxen have come forward like lotus-stalks from out a lake upstanding.
Devanāgarī: अधोक्षणो दश मह्यं रुशन्तो नळा इव सरसो निरतिष्ठन्
pada pāṭha: adha | plāyogiḥ | ati | dāsat | anyān | ā-saṅgaḥ | agne | daśa-bhiḥ | sahasraiḥ || adha | ukṣaṇaḥ | daśa | mahyam | ruśantaḥ | naḷāḥ-iva | sarasaḥ | niḥ | atiṣṭhan ||8.1.33||

IAST: anv asya sthūraṁ dadṛśe purastād anastha ūrur avarambamāṇaḥ
Griffith: What time her husband's perfect restoration to his lost strength and manhood was apparent,
pada pāṭha: anu | asya | sthūram | dadr̥śe | purastāt | anasthaḥ | ūruḥ | ava-rambamāṇaḥ || śaśvatī | nārī | abhi-cakṣya | āha | su-bhadram | arya | bhojanam | bibharṣi ||8.1.34||

IAST: śaśvatī nāry abhicakṣyāha subhadram arya bhojanam bibharṣi
Griffith: His consort Sasvati with joy addressed him, Now art thou well, my lord, and shalt be happy.
pada pāṭha: anu | asya | sthūram | dadr̥śe | purastāt | anasthaḥ | ūruḥ | ava-rambamāṇaḥ || śaśvatī | nārī | abhi-cakṣya | āha | su-bhadram | arya | bhojanam | bibharṣi ||8.1.34||

IAST: idaṁ vaso sutam andhaḥ pibā supūrṇam udaram
Griffith: HERE is the Soma juice expressed; O Vasu, drink till thou art full:
pada pāṭha: idam | vaso iti | sutam | andhaḥ | piba | su-pūrṇam | udaram || anābhayin | rarima | te ||8.2.1||

IAST: anābhayin rarimā te
Griffith: Undaunted God, we give it thee.
pada pāṭha: idam | vaso iti | sutam | andhaḥ | piba | su-pūrṇam | udaram || anābhayin | rarima | te ||8.2.1||

IAST: nṛbhir dhūtaḥ suto aśnair avyo vāraiḥ paripūtaḥ
Griffith: Washed by the men, pressed out with stones, strained through the filter made of wool,
pada pāṭha: nr̥-bhiḥ | dhūtaḥ | sutaḥ | aśnaiḥ | avyaḥ | vāraiḥ | pari-pūtaḥ || aśvaḥ | na | niktaḥ | nadīṣu ||8.2.2||

IAST: aśvo na nikto nadīṣu
Griffith: Tis like a courser bathed in stream.
pada pāṭha: nr̥-bhiḥ | dhūtaḥ | sutaḥ | aśnaiḥ | avyaḥ | vāraiḥ | pari-pūtaḥ || aśvaḥ | na | niktaḥ | nadīṣu ||8.2.2||

IAST: taṁ te yavaṁ yathā gobhiḥ svādum akarma śrīṇantaḥ
Griffith: This juice have we made sweet for thee like barley, blending it with milk.
Devanāgarī: तं ते यवं यथा गोभिः स्वादुमकर्म श्रीणन्तः
pada pāṭha: tam | te | yavam | yathā | gobhiḥ | svādum | akarma | śrīṇantaḥ || indra | tvā | asmin | sadha-māde ||8.2.3||

IAST: indra tvāsmin sadhamāde
Griffith: Indra, I call thee to our feast.
pada pāṭha: tam | te | yavam | yathā | gobhiḥ | svādum | akarma | śrīṇantaḥ || indra | tvā | asmin | sadha-māde ||8.2.3||

IAST: indra it somapā eka indraḥ sutapā viśvāyuḥ
Griffith: Beloved of all, Indra alone drinks up the flowing Soma juice
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र इत्सोमपा एक इन्द्रः सुतपा विश्वायुः
pada pāṭha: indra | it | soma-pāḥ | ekaḥ | indraḥ | suta-pāḥ | viśva-āyuḥ || antaḥ | devān | martyān | ca ||8.2.4||

IAST: antar devān martyām̐ś ca
Griffith: Among the Gods andmortal men.
pada pāṭha: indra | it | soma-pāḥ | ekaḥ | indraḥ | suta-pāḥ | viśva-āyuḥ || antaḥ | devān | martyān | ca ||8.2.4||

IAST: na yaṁ śukro na durāśīr na tṛprā uruvyacasam
Griffith: The Friend, whom not the brilliant-hued, the badly-mixt or bitter draught,
Devanāgarī: न यं शुक्रो न दुराशीर्न तृप्रा उरुव्यचसम्
pada pāṭha: na | yam | śukraḥ | na | duḥ-āśīḥ | na | tr̥prāḥ | uru-vyacasam || apa-spr̥ṇvate | su-hārdam ||8.2.5||

IAST: apaspṛṇvate suhārdam
Griffith: Repels, the far-extending God;
pada pāṭha: na | yam | śukraḥ | na | duḥ-āśīḥ | na | tr̥prāḥ | uru-vyacasam || apa-spr̥ṇvate | su-hārdam ||8.2.5||

IAST: gobhir yad īm anye asman mṛgaṁ na vrā mṛgayante
Griffith: While other men than we with milk chase him as hunters chase a deer,
pada pāṭha: gobhiḥ | yat | īm | anye | asmat | mr̥gam | na | vrāḥ | mr̥gayante || abhi-tsaranti | dhenu-bhiḥ ||8.2.6||

IAST: abhitsaranti dhenubhiḥ
Griffith: And with their kine inveigle him.
pada pāṭha: gobhiḥ | yat | īm | anye | asmat | mr̥gam | na | vrāḥ | mr̥gayante || abhi-tsaranti | dhenu-bhiḥ ||8.2.6||

IAST: traya indrasya somāḥ sutāsaḥ santu devasya
Griffith: For him, for Indra, for the God, be pressed three draughts of Soma juice
Devanāgarī: त्रय इन्द्रस्य सोमाः सुतासः सन्तु देवस्य
pada pāṭha: trayaḥ | indrasya | somāḥ | sutāsaḥ | santu | devasya || sve | kṣaye | suta-pāvnaḥ ||8.2.7||

IAST: sve kṣaye sutapāvnaḥ
Griffith: In the juice-drinker's own abode.
pada pāṭha: trayaḥ | indrasya | somāḥ | sutāsaḥ | santu | devasya || sve | kṣaye | suta-pāvnaḥ ||8.2.7||

IAST: trayaḥ kośāsaḥ ścotanti tisraś camvaḥ supūrṇāḥ
Griffith: Three reservoirs exude their drops, filled are three beakers to the brim,
pada pāṭha: trayaḥ | kośāsaḥ | ścotanti | tisraḥ | camvaḥ | su-pūrṇāḥ || samāne | adhi | bhārman ||8.2.8||

IAST: samāne adhi bhārman
Griffith: All for one offering to the God.
pada pāṭha: trayaḥ | kośāsaḥ | ścotanti | tisraḥ | camvaḥ | su-pūrṇāḥ || samāne | adhi | bhārman ||8.2.8||

IAST: śucir asi puruniḥṣṭhāḥ kṣīrair madhyata āśīrtaḥ
Griffith: Pure art thou, set in many a place, and blended in the midst with milk
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | asi | puruniḥ-sthāḥ | kṣīraiḥ | madhyataḥ | ā-śīrtaḥ || dadhnā | mandiṣṭhaḥ | śūrasya ||8.2.9||

IAST: dadhnā mandiṣṭhaḥ śūrasya
Griffith: And curd, to cheer the Hero best.
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | asi | puruniḥ-sthāḥ | kṣīraiḥ | madhyataḥ | ā-śīrtaḥ || dadhnā | mandiṣṭhaḥ | śūrasya ||8.2.9||

IAST: ime ta indra somās tīvrā asme sutāsaḥ
Griffith: Here, Indra, are thy Soma-draughts pressed out by us, the strong, the pure:
Devanāgarī: इमे त इन्द्र सोमास्तीव्रा अस्मे सुतासः
pada pāṭha: ime | te | indra | somāḥ | tīvrāḥ | asme iti | sutāsaḥ || śukrāḥ | ā-śiram | yācante ||8.2.10||

IAST: śukrā āśiraṁ yācante
Griffith: They crave admixture of the milk.
pada pāṭha: ime | te | indra | somāḥ | tīvrāḥ | asme iti | sutāsaḥ || śukrāḥ | ā-śiram | yācante ||8.2.10||

IAST: tām̐ āśiram puroḻāśam indremaṁ somaṁ śrīṇīhi
Griffith: O Indra, pour in milk, prepare the cake, and mix the Soma-draught.
pada pāṭha: tān | ā-śiram | puroḷāśam | indra | imam | somam | śrīṇīhi || revantam | hi | tvā | śr̥ṇomi ||8.2.11||

IAST: revantaṁ hi tvā śṛṇomi
Griffith: I hear them say that thou art rich.
pada pāṭha: tān | ā-śiram | puroḷāśam | indra | imam | somam | śrīṇīhi || revantam | hi | tvā | śr̥ṇomi ||8.2.11||

IAST: hṛtsu pītāso yudhyante durmadāso na surāyām
Griffith: Quaffed juices fight within the breast. The drunken praise not by their wine,
Devanāgarī: हृत्सु पीतासो युध्यन्ते दुर्मदासो न सुरायाम्
pada pāṭha: hr̥t-su | pītāsaḥ | yudhyante | duḥ-madāsaḥ | na | surāyām || ūdhaḥ | na | nagnāḥ | jarante ||8.2.12||

IAST: ūdhar na nagnā jarante
Griffith: The naked praise not when it rains.
pada pāṭha: hr̥t-su | pītāsaḥ | yudhyante | duḥ-madāsaḥ | na | surāyām || ūdhaḥ | na | nagnāḥ | jarante ||8.2.12||

IAST: revām̐ id revataḥ stotā syāt tvāvato maghonaḥ
Griffith: Rich be the praiser of one rich, munificent and famed like thee:
pada pāṭha: revān | it | revataḥ | stotā | syāt | tvā-vataḥ | maghonaḥ || pra | it | ūm̐ iti | hari-vaḥ | śrutasya ||8.2.13||

IAST: pred u harivaḥ śrutasya
Griffith: High rank be his, O Lord of Bays.
pada pāṭha: revān | it | revataḥ | stotā | syāt | tvā-vataḥ | maghonaḥ || pra | it | ūm̐ iti | hari-vaḥ | śrutasya ||8.2.13||

IAST: ukthaṁ cana śasyamānam agor arir ā ciketa
Griffith: Foe of the man who adds no milk, he heeds not any chanted hymn
pada pāṭha: uktham | cana | śasyamānam | agoḥ | ariḥ | ā | ciketa || na | gāyatram | gīyamānam ||8.2.14||

IAST: na gāyatraṁ gīyamānam
Griffith: Or holy psalm that may he sung.
pada pāṭha: uktham | cana | śasyamānam | agoḥ | ariḥ | ā | ciketa || na | gāyatram | gīyamānam ||8.2.14||

IAST: mā na indra pīyatnave mā śardhate parā dāḥ
Griffith: Give us not, Indra, as a prey unto the scornful or the proud:
Devanāgarī: मा न इन्द्र पीयत्नवे मा शर्धते परा दाः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | indra | pīyatnave | mā | śardhate | parā | dāḥ || śikṣa | śacī-vaḥ | śacībhiḥ ||8.2.15||

IAST: śikṣā śacīvaḥ śacībhiḥ
Griffith: Help, Mighty One, with power and might.
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | indra | pīyatnave | mā | śardhate | parā | dāḥ || śikṣa | śacī-vaḥ | śacībhiḥ ||8.2.15||

IAST: vayam u tvā tadidarthā indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ
Griffith: This, even this, O Indra, we implore. as thy devoted friends,
Devanāgarī: वयमु त्वा तदिदर्था इन्द्र त्वायन्तः सखायः
pada pāṭha: vayam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | tadit-arthāḥ | indra | tvā-yantaḥ | sakhāyaḥ || kaṇvāḥ | ukthebhiḥ | jarante ||8.2.16||

IAST: kaṇvā ukthebhir jarante
Griffith: The Kanvas praise thee with their hymns.
pada pāṭha: vayam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | tadit-arthāḥ | indra | tvā-yantaḥ | sakhāyaḥ || kaṇvāḥ | ukthebhiḥ | jarante ||8.2.16||

IAST: na ghem anyad ā papana vajrinn apaso naviṣṭau
Griffith: Naught else, O Thunderer, have I praised in the skilled singer's eulogy:
pada pāṭha: na | gha | īm | anyat | ā | papana | vajrin | apasaḥ | naviṣṭau || tava | it | ūm̐ iti | stomam | ciketa ||8.2.17||

IAST: taved u stomaṁ ciketa
Griffith: On thy land only have I thought.
pada pāṭha: na | gha | īm | anyat | ā | papana | vajrin | apasaḥ | naviṣṭau || tava | it | ūm̐ iti | stomam | ciketa ||8.2.17||

IAST: icchanti devāḥ sunvantaṁ na svapnāya spṛhayanti
Griffith: The Gods seek him who presses out the Soma; they desire not sleep
Devanāgarī: इच्छन्ति देवाः सुन्वन्तं न स्वप्नाय स्पृहयन्ति
pada pāṭha: icchanti | devāḥ | sunvantam | na | svapnāya | spr̥hayanti || yanti | pra-mādam | atandrāḥ ||8.2.18||

IAST: yanti pramādam atandrāḥ
Griffith: They punish sloth unweariedly.
pada pāṭha: icchanti | devāḥ | sunvantam | na | svapnāya | spr̥hayanti || yanti | pra-mādam | atandrāḥ ||8.2.18||

IAST: o ṣu pra yāhi vājebhir mā hṛṇīthā abhy asmān
Griffith: Come hither swift with gifts of wealth - be not thou angry with us-like
Devanāgarī: ओ षु प्र याहि वाजेभिर्मा हृणीथा अभ्यस्मान्
pada pāṭha: o iti | su | pra | yāhi | vājebhiḥ | mā | hr̥ṇīthāḥ | abhi | asmān || mahān-iva | yuva-jāniḥ ||8.2.19||

IAST: mahām̐ iva yuvajāniḥ
Griffith: A great man with a youthful bride.
pada pāṭha: o iti | su | pra | yāhi | vājebhiḥ | mā | hr̥ṇīthāḥ | abhi | asmān || mahān-iva | yuva-jāniḥ ||8.2.19||

IAST: mo ṣv adya durhaṇāvān sāyaṁ karad āre asmat
Griffith: Let him not, wrathful with us, spend the evening far from us to-day,
pada pāṭha: mo iti | su | adya | duḥ-hanāvān | sāyam | karat | āre | asmat || aśrīraḥ-iva | jāmātā ||8.2.20||

IAST: aśrīra iva jāmātā
Griffith: Like some unpleasant son-in-law.
pada pāṭha: mo iti | su | adya | duḥ-hanāvān | sāyam | karat | āre | asmat || aśrīraḥ-iva | jāmātā ||8.2.20||

IAST: vidmā hy asya vīrasya bhūridāvarīṁ sumatim
Griffith: For well we know this Hero's love, most liberal of the boons he gives,
pada pāṭha: vidma | hi | asya | vīrasya | bhūri-dāvārīm | su-matim || triṣu | jātasya | manāṁsi ||8.2.21||

IAST: triṣu jātasya manāṁsi
Griffith: His plans whom the three worlds display.
pada pāṭha: vidma | hi | asya | vīrasya | bhūri-dāvārīm | su-matim || triṣu | jātasya | manāṁsi ||8.2.21||

IAST: ā tū ṣiñca kaṇvamantaṁ na ghā vidma śavasānāt
Griffith: Pour forth the gift which Kanvas bring, for none more glorious do we know
Devanāgarī: आ तू षिञ्च कण्वमन्तं न घा विद्म शवसानात्
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | siñca | kaṇva-mantam | na | gha | vidma | śavasānāt || yaśaḥ-taram | śatam-ūteḥ ||8.2.22||

IAST: yaśastaraṁ śatamūteḥ
Griffith: Than the Strong Lord with countless aids.
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | siñca | kaṇva-mantam | na | gha | vidma | śavasānāt || yaśaḥ-taram | śatam-ūteḥ ||8.2.22||

IAST: jyeṣṭhena sotar indrāya somaṁ vīrāya śakrāya
Griffith: O presser, offer Soma first to Indra, Hero, Sakra, him
pada pāṭha: jyeṣṭhena | sotaḥ | indrāya | somam | vīrāya | śakrāya || bhara | pibat | naryāya ||8.2.23||

IAST: bharā piban naryāya
Griffith: The Friend of man, that he may drink;
pada pāṭha: jyeṣṭhena | sotaḥ | indrāya | somam | vīrāya | śakrāya || bhara | pibat | naryāya ||8.2.23||

IAST: yo vediṣṭho avyathiṣv aśvāvantaṁ jaritṛbhyaḥ
Griffith: Who, in untroubled ways, is best provider, for his worshippers.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vediṣṭhaḥ | avyathiṣu | aśva-vantam | jaritr̥-bhyaḥ || vājam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | go-mantam ||8.2.24||

IAST: vājaṁ stotṛbhyo gomantam
Griffith: Of strength in horses and in kine.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vediṣṭhaḥ | avyathiṣu | aśva-vantam | jaritr̥-bhyaḥ || vājam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | go-mantam ||8.2.24||

IAST: panyam-panyam it sotāra ā dhāvata madyāya
Griffith: Pressers, for him blend Soma juice, each draught most excellent, for him
pada pāṭha: panyam-panyam | it | sotāraḥ | ā | dhāvata | madyāya || somam | vīrāya | śūrāya ||8.2.25||

IAST: somaṁ vīrāya śūrāya
Griffith: The Brave, the Hero, for his joy.
pada pāṭha: panyam-panyam | it | sotāraḥ | ā | dhāvata | madyāya || somam | vīrāya | śūrāya ||8.2.25||

IAST: pātā vṛtrahā sutam ā ghā gaman nāre asmat
Griffith: The Vrtra-slayer drinks the juice. May he who gives a hundred aids
Devanāgarī: पाता वृत्रहा सुतमा घा गमन्नारे अस्मत्
pada pāṭha: pātā | vr̥tra-hā | sutam | ā | gha | gamat | na | āre | asmat || ni | yamate | śatam-ūtiḥ ||8.2.26||

IAST: ni yamate śatamūtiḥ
Griffith: Approach, nor stay afar from us.
pada pāṭha: pātā | vr̥tra-hā | sutam | ā | gha | gamat | na | āre | asmat || ni | yamate | śatam-ūtiḥ ||8.2.26||

IAST: eha harī brahmayujā śagmā vakṣataḥ sakhāyam
Griffith: May the strong Bay Steeds, yoked by prayer, bring hither unto us our Friend,
Devanāgarī: एह हरी ब्रह्मयुजा शग्मा वक्षतः सखायम्
pada pāṭha: ā | iha | harī iti | brahma-yujā | śagmā | vakṣataḥ | sakhāyam || gīḥ-bhiḥ | śrutam | girvaṇasam ||8.2.27||

IAST: gīrbhiḥ śrutaṁ girvaṇasam
Griffith: Lover of Song, renowned by songs.
pada pāṭha: ā | iha | harī iti | brahma-yujā | śagmā | vakṣataḥ | sakhāyam || gīḥ-bhiḥ | śrutam | girvaṇasam ||8.2.27||

IAST: svādavaḥ somā ā yāhi śrītāḥ somā ā yāhi
Griffith: Sweet are the Soma juices, come! Blent are the Soma juices, come!
Devanāgarī: स्वादवः सोमा आ याहि श्रीताः सोमा आ याहि
pada pāṭha: svādavaḥ | somāḥ | ā | yāhi | śrītāḥ | somāḥ | ā | yāhi || śiprin | r̥ṣi-vaḥ | śacī-vaḥ | na | ayam | accha | sadha-mādam ||8.2.28||

IAST: śiprinn ṛṣīvaḥ śacīvo nāyam acchā sadhamādam
Griffith: Rsi-like, mighty, fair of cheek, come hither quickly to the feast.
pada pāṭha: svādavaḥ | somāḥ | ā | yāhi | śrītāḥ | somāḥ | ā | yāhi || śiprin | r̥ṣi-vaḥ | śacī-vaḥ | na | ayam | accha | sadha-mādam ||8.2.28||

IAST: stutaś ca yās tvā vardhanti mahe rādhase nṛmṇāya
Griffith: And lauds which strengthen thee for great bounty and valour, and exalt
Devanāgarī: स्तुतश्च यास्त्वा वर्धन्ति महे राधसे नृम्णाय
pada pāṭha: stutaḥ | ca | yāḥ | tvā | vardhanti | mahe | rādhase | nr̥mṇāya || indra | kāriṇam | vr̥dhantaḥ ||8.2.29||

IAST: indra kāriṇaṁ vṛdhantaḥ
Griffith: Indra who doeth glorious deeds,
pada pāṭha: stutaḥ | ca | yāḥ | tvā | vardhanti | mahe | rādhase | nr̥mṇāya || indra | kāriṇam | vr̥dhantaḥ ||8.2.29||

IAST: giraś ca yās te girvāha ukthā ca tubhyaṁ tāni
Griffith: And songs to thee who lovest song, and all those hymns addressed to thee-
Devanāgarī: गिरश्च यास्ते गिर्वाह उक्था च तुभ्यं तानि
pada pāṭha: giraḥ | ca | yāḥ | te | girvāhaḥ | ukthā | ca | tubhyam | tāni || satrā | dadhire | śavāṁsi ||8.2.30||

IAST: satrā dadhire śavāṁsi
Griffith: These evermore confirm thy might.
pada pāṭha: giraḥ | ca | yāḥ | te | girvāhaḥ | ukthā | ca | tubhyam | tāni || satrā | dadhire | śavāṁsi ||8.2.30||

IAST: eved eṣa tuvikūrmir vājām̐ eko vajrahastaḥ
Griffith: Thus he, sole doer of great deeds whose hand holds thunder, gives us strength,
pada pāṭha: eva | it | eṣaḥ | tuvi-kūrmiḥ | vājān | ekaḥ | vajra-hastaḥ || sanāt | amr̥ktaḥ | dayate ||8.2.31||

IAST: sanād amṛkto dayate
Griffith: He who hath never been subdued.
pada pāṭha: eva | it | eṣaḥ | tuvi-kūrmiḥ | vājān | ekaḥ | vajra-hastaḥ || sanāt | amr̥ktaḥ | dayate ||8.2.31||

IAST: hantā vṛtraṁ dakṣiṇenendraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ
Griffith: Vrtra he slays with his right hand, even Indra, great with mighty power,
pada pāṭha: hanta | vr̥tram | dakṣiṇena | indraḥ | puru | puru-hūtaḥ || mahān | mahībhiḥ | śacībhiḥ ||8.2.32||

IAST: mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ
Griffith: And much-invoked in many a place.
pada pāṭha: hanta | vr̥tram | dakṣiṇena | indraḥ | puru | puru-hūtaḥ || mahān | mahībhiḥ | śacībhiḥ ||8.2.32||

IAST: yasmin viśvāś carṣaṇaya uta cyautnā jrayāṁsi ca
Griffith: He upon whom all men depend, all regions, all achievements, he
pada pāṭha: yasmin | viśvāḥ | carṣaṇayaḥ | uta | cyautnā | jrayāṁsi | ca || anu | gha | it | mandī | maghonaḥ ||8.2.33||

IAST: anu ghen mandī maghonaḥ
Griffith: Takes pleasure in our wealthy chiefs.
pada pāṭha: yasmin | viśvāḥ | carṣaṇayaḥ | uta | cyautnā | jrayāṁsi | ca || anu | gha | it | mandī | maghonaḥ ||8.2.33||

IAST: eṣa etāni cakārendro viśvā yo 'ti śṛṇve
Griffith: All this hath he accomplished, yea, Indra, most gloriously renowned,
Devanāgarī: एष एतानि चकारेन्द्रो विश्वा योऽति शृण्वे
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | etāni | cakāra | indraḥ | viśvā | yaḥ | ati | śr̥ṇve || vāja-dāvā | maghonām ||8.2.34||

IAST: vājadāvā maghonām
Griffith: Who gives our wealthy princes strength.
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | etāni | cakāra | indraḥ | viśvā | yaḥ | ati | śr̥ṇve || vāja-dāvā | maghonām ||8.2.34||

IAST: prabhartā rathaṁ gavyantam apākāc cid yam avati
Griffith: Who drives his chariot seeking spoil, from afar, to him he loves:
pada pāṭha: pra-bhartā | ratham | gavyantam | apākāt | cit | yam | avati || inaḥ | vasu | saḥ | hi | voḷhā ||8.2.35||

IAST: ino vasu sa hi voḻhā
Griffith: For swift is he to bring men wealth.
pada pāṭha: pra-bhartā | ratham | gavyantam | apākāt | cit | yam | avati || inaḥ | vasu | saḥ | hi | voḷhā ||8.2.35||

IAST: sanitā vipro arvadbhir hantā vṛtraṁ nṛbhiḥ śūraḥ
Griffith: The Sage who, winning spoil with steeds, slays Vrtra, Hero with the men,
Devanāgarī: सनिता विप्रो अर्वद्भिर्हन्ता वृत्रं नृभिः शूरः
pada pāṭha: sanitā | vipraḥ | arvat-bhiḥ | hantā | vr̥tram | nr̥-bhiḥ | śūraḥ || satyaḥ | avitā | vidhantam ||8.2.36||

IAST: satyo 'vitā vidhantam
Griffith: His servant's faithful succourer.
pada pāṭha: sanitā | vipraḥ | arvat-bhiḥ | hantā | vr̥tram | nr̥-bhiḥ | śūraḥ || satyaḥ | avitā | vidhantam ||8.2.36||

IAST: yajadhvainam priyamedhā indraṁ satrācā manasā
Griffith: O Priyamedhas, worship with collected mind this Indra whom
pada pāṭha: yajadhva | enam | priya-medhāḥ | indram | satrācā | manasā || yaḥ | bhūt | somaiḥ | satya-madvā ||8.2.37||

IAST: yo bhūt somaiḥ satyamadvā
Griffith: The Soma hath full well inspired.
pada pāṭha: yajadhva | enam | priya-medhāḥ | indram | satrācā | manasā || yaḥ | bhūt | somaiḥ | satya-madvā ||8.2.37||

IAST: gāthaśravasaṁ satpatiṁ śravaskāmam purutmānam
Griffith: Ye Kanvas, sing the Mighty One, Lord of the Brave, who loves renown,
pada pāṭha: gātha-śravasam | sat-patim | śravaḥ-kāmam | puru-tmānam || kaṇvāsaḥ | gāta | vājinam ||8.2.38||

IAST: kaṇvāso gāta vājinam
Griffith: All-present, glorified by song.
pada pāṭha: gātha-śravasam | sat-patim | śravaḥ-kāmam | puru-tmānam || kaṇvāsaḥ | gāta | vājinam ||8.2.38||

IAST: ya ṛte cid gās padebhyo dāt sakhā nṛbhyaḥ śacīvān
Griffith: Strong Friend, who, with no trace of feet, restores the cattle to the men,
Devanāgarī: य ऋते चिद्गास्पदेभ्यो दात्सखा नृभ्यः शचीवान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥te | cit | gāḥ | padebhyaḥ | dāt | sakhā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | śacī-vān || ye | asmin | kāmam | aśriyan ||8.2.39||

IAST: ye asmin kāmam aśriyan
Griffith: Who rest their wish and hope on him.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥te | cit | gāḥ | padebhyaḥ | dāt | sakhā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | śacī-vān || ye | asmin | kāmam | aśriyan ||8.2.39||

IAST: itthā dhīvantam adrivaḥ kāṇvam medhyātithim
Griffith: Shaped as a Ram, Stone-hurler I once thou camest hither to the son
pada pāṭha: itthā | dhī-vantam | adri-vaḥ | kāṇvam | medhya-atithim || meṣaḥ | bhūtaḥ | abhi | yan | ayaḥ ||8.2.40||

IAST: meṣo bhūto 'bhi yann ayaḥ
Griffith: Of Kanva, wise Medhyatithi.
pada pāṭha: itthā | dhī-vantam | adri-vaḥ | kāṇvam | medhya-atithim || meṣaḥ | bhūtaḥ | abhi | yan | ayaḥ ||8.2.40||

IAST: śikṣā vibhindo asmai catvāry ayutā dadat
Griffith: Vibhindu, thou hast helped this man, giving him thousands four times ten,
pada pāṭha: śikṣa | vibhindo iti vi-bhindo | asmai | catvāri | ayutā | dadat || aṣṭa | paraḥ | sahasrā ||8.2.41||

IAST: aṣṭā paraḥ sahasrā
Griffith: And afterward eight thousand more.
pada pāṭha: śikṣa | vibhindo iti vi-bhindo | asmai | catvāri | ayutā | dadat || aṣṭa | paraḥ | sahasrā ||8.2.41||

IAST: uta su tye payovṛdhā mākī raṇasya naptyā
Griffith: And these twain pouring streams of milk, creative, daughters of delight,
Devanāgarī: उत सु त्ये पयोवृधा माकी रणस्य नप्त्या
pada pāṭha: uta | su | tye iti | payaḥ-vr̥dhā | mākī iti | raṇasya | naptyā || jani-tvanāya | mamahe ||8.2.42||

IAST: janitvanāya māmahe
Griffith: For wedlock sake I glorify.
pada pāṭha: uta | su | tye iti | payaḥ-vr̥dhā | mākī iti | raṇasya | naptyā || jani-tvanāya | mamahe ||8.2.42||

IAST: pibā sutasya rasino matsvā na indra gomataḥ
Griffith: DRINK, Indra, of the savoury juice, and cheer thee with our milky draught.
Devanāgarī: पिबा सुतस्य रसिनो मत्स्वा न इन्द्र गोमतः
pada pāṭha: piba | sutasya | rasinaḥ | matsva | naḥ | indra | go-mataḥ || āpiḥ | naḥ | bodhi | sadha-mādyaḥ | vr̥dhe | asmān | avantu | te | dhiyaḥ ||8.3.1||

IAST: āpir no bodhi sadhamādyo vṛdhe 'smām̐ avantu te dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Be, for our weal, our Friend and sharer of the feast, and let thy wisdom guard us well.
Devanāgarī: आपिर्नो बोधि सधमाद्यो वृधेऽस्माँ अवन्तु ते धियः
pada pāṭha: piba | sutasya | rasinaḥ | matsva | naḥ | indra | go-mataḥ || āpiḥ | naḥ | bodhi | sadha-mādyaḥ | vr̥dhe | asmān | avantu | te | dhiyaḥ ||8.3.1||

IAST: bhūyāma te sumatau vājino vayam mā naḥ star abhimātaye
Griffith: In thy kind grace and favour may we still be strong: expose us not to foe's attack.
Devanāgarī: भूयाम ते सुमतौ वाजिनो वयं मा नः स्तरभिमातये
pada pāṭha: bhūyāma | te | su-matau | vājinaḥ | vayam | mā | naḥ | staḥ | abhi-mātaye || asmān | citrābhiḥ | avatāt | abhiṣṭi-bhiḥ | ā | naḥ | sumneṣu | yamaya ||8.3.2||

IAST: asmāñ citrābhir avatād abhiṣṭibhir ā naḥ sumneṣu yāmaya
Griffith: With manifold assistance guard and succour us, and bring us to felicity.
pada pāṭha: bhūyāma | te | su-matau | vājinaḥ | vayam | mā | naḥ | staḥ | abhi-mātaye || asmān | citrābhiḥ | avatāt | abhiṣṭi-bhiḥ | ā | naḥ | sumneṣu | yamaya ||8.3.2||

IAST: imā u tvā purūvaso giro vardhantu yā mama
Griffith: May these my songs of praise exalt thee, Lord, who hast abundant wealth.
Devanāgarī: इमा उ त्वा पुरूवसो गिरो वर्धन्तु या मम
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | puruvaso iti puru-vaso | giraḥ | vardhantu | yāḥ | mama || pāvaka-varṇāḥ | śucayaḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ | abhi | stomaiḥ | anūṣata ||8.3.3||

IAST: pāvakavarṇāḥ śucayo vipaścito 'bhi stomair anūṣata
Griffith: Men skilled in holy hymns, pure, with the hues of fire, have sung them with their lauds to thee.
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | puruvaso iti puru-vaso | giraḥ | vardhantu | yāḥ | mama || pāvaka-varṇāḥ | śucayaḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ | abhi | stomaiḥ | anūṣata ||8.3.3||

IAST: ayaṁ sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudra iva paprathe
Griffith: He, with his might enhanced by Rsis thousandfold, hath like an ocean spread himself.
Devanāgarī: अयं सहस्रमृषिभिः सहस्कृतः समुद्र इव पप्रथे
pada pāṭha: ayam | sahasram | r̥ṣi-bhiḥ | sahaḥ-kr̥taḥ | samudraḥ-iva | paprathe || satyaḥ | saḥ | asya | mahimā | gr̥ṇe | śavaḥ | yajñeṣu | vipra-rājye ||8.3.4||

IAST: satyaḥ so asya mahimā gṛṇe śavo yajñeṣu viprarājye
Griffith: His majesty is praised as true at solemn rites, his power where holy singers rule.
Devanāgarī: सत्यः सो अस्य महिमा गृणे शवो यज्ञेषु विप्रराज्ये
pada pāṭha: ayam | sahasram | r̥ṣi-bhiḥ | sahaḥ-kr̥taḥ | samudraḥ-iva | paprathe || satyaḥ | saḥ | asya | mahimā | gr̥ṇe | śavaḥ | yajñeṣu | vipra-rājye ||8.3.4||

IAST: indram id devatātaya indram prayaty adhvare
Griffith: Indra for worship of the Gods, Indra while sacrifice proceeds,
pada pāṭha: indram | it | deva-tātaye | indram | pra-yati | adhvare || indram | sam-īke | vaninaḥ | havāmahe | indram | dhanasya | sātaye ||8.3.5||

IAST: indraṁ samīke vanino havāmaha indraṁ dhanasya sātaye
Griffith: Indra, as worshippers in battle-shock, we call, Indra that we may win the spoil.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं समीके वनिनो हवामह इन्द्रं धनस्य सातये
pada pāṭha: indram | it | deva-tātaye | indram | pra-yati | adhvare || indram | sam-īke | vaninaḥ | havāmahe | indram | dhanasya | sātaye ||8.3.5||

IAST: indro mahnā rodasī paprathac chava indraḥ sūryam arocayat
Griffith: With might hath Indra spread out heaven and earth, with power hath Indra lighted up the Sun.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो मह्ना रोदसी पप्रथच्छव इन्द्रः सूर्यमरोचयत्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | mahnā | rodasī iti | paprathat | śavaḥ | indraḥ | sūryam | arocayat || indre | ha | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire | indre | suvānāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||8.3.6||

IAST: indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemira indre suvānāsa indavaḥ
Griffith: In Indra are all creatures closely held; in him meet the distilling Soma-drops.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रे ह विश्वा भुवनानि येमिर इन्द्रे सुवानास इन्दवः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | mahnā | rodasī iti | paprathat | śavaḥ | indraḥ | sūryam | arocayat || indre | ha | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire | indre | suvānāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||8.3.6||

IAST: abhi tvā pūrvapītaya indra stomebhir āyavaḥ
Griffith: Men with their lauds are urging thee, Indra, to drink the Soma first.
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | pūrva-pītaye | indra | stomebhiḥ | āyavaḥ || sam-īcīnāsaḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | sam | asvaran | rudrāḥ | gr̥ṇanta | pūrvyam ||8.3.7||

IAST: samīcīnāsa ṛbhavaḥ sam asvaran rudrā gṛṇanta pūrvyam
Griffith: The Rbhus in accord have lifted up their voice, and Rudras sung thee as the first.
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | pūrva-pītaye | indra | stomebhiḥ | āyavaḥ || sam-īcīnāsaḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | sam | asvaran | rudrāḥ | gr̥ṇanta | pūrvyam ||8.3.7||

IAST: asyed indro vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyaṁ śavo made sutasya viṣṇavi
Griffith: Indra increased his manly strength at sacrifice, in the wild rapture of this juice.
Devanāgarī: अस्येदिन्द्रो वावृधे वृष्ण्यं शवो मदे सुतस्य विष्णवि
pada pāṭha: asya | it | indraḥ | vavr̥dhe | vr̥ṣṇyam | śavaḥ | made | sutasya | viṣṇavi || adya | tam | asya | mahimānam | āyavaḥ | anu | stuvanti | pūrva-thā ||8.3.8||

IAST: adyā tam asya mahimānam āyavo 'nu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā
Griffith: And living men to-day, even as of old, sing forth their praises to his majesty.
pada pāṭha: asya | it | indraḥ | vavr̥dhe | vr̥ṣṇyam | śavaḥ | made | sutasya | viṣṇavi || adya | tam | asya | mahimānam | āyavaḥ | anu | stuvanti | pūrva-thā ||8.3.8||

IAST: tat tvā yāmi suvīryaṁ tad brahma pūrvacittaye
Griffith: I crave of thee that hero strength, that thou mayst first regard this prayer,
pada pāṭha: tat | tva | yāmi | su-vīryam | tat | brahma | pūrva-cittaye || yena | yati-bhyaḥ | bhr̥gave | dhane | hite | yena | praskaṇvam | āvitha ||8.3.9||

IAST: yenā yatibhyo bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha
Griffith: Wherewith thou holpest Bhrgu and the Yatis and Praskanva when the prize was staked.
Devanāgarī: येना यतिभ्यो भृगवे धने हिते येन प्रस्कण्वमाविथ
pada pāṭha: tat | tva | yāmi | su-vīryam | tat | brahma | pūrva-cittaye || yena | yati-bhyaḥ | bhr̥gave | dhane | hite | yena | praskaṇvam | āvitha ||8.3.9||

IAST: yenā samudram asṛjo mahīr apas tad indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ
Griffith: Wherewith thou sentest mighty waters to the sea, that, Indra, is thy manly strength.
Devanāgarī: येना समुद्रमसृजो महीरपस्तदिन्द्र वृष्णि ते शवः
pada pāṭha: yena | samudram | asr̥jaḥ | mahīḥ | apaḥ | tat | indra | vr̥ṣṇi | te | śavaḥ || sadyaḥ | saḥ | asya | mahimā | na | sam-naśe | yam | kṣoṇīḥ | anu-cakrade ||8.3.10||

IAST: sadyaḥ so asya mahimā na saṁnaśe yaṁ kṣoṇīr anucakrade
Griffith: For ever unattainable is this power of him to whom the worlds have cried aloud.
Devanāgarī: सद्यः सो अस्य महिमा न संनशे यं क्षोणीरनुचक्रदे
pada pāṭha: yena | samudram | asr̥jaḥ | mahīḥ | apaḥ | tat | indra | vr̥ṣṇi | te | śavaḥ || sadyaḥ | saḥ | asya | mahimā | na | sam-naśe | yam | kṣoṇīḥ | anu-cakrade ||8.3.10||

IAST: śagdhī na indra yat tvā rayiṁ yāmi suvīryam
Griffith: Help us, O Indra, when we pray to thee for wealth and hero might.
Devanāgarī: शग्धी न इन्द्र यत्त्वा रयिं यामि सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: śagdhi | naḥ | indra | yat | tvā | rayim | yāmi | su-vīryam || śagdhi | vājāya | prathamam | sisāsate | śagdhi | stomāya | pūrvya ||8.3.11||

IAST: śagdhi vājāya prathamaṁ siṣāsate śagdhi stomāya pūrvya
Griffith: First help thou on to strength the man who strives to win, and aid our laud, O Ancient One.
Devanāgarī: शग्धि वाजाय प्रथमं सिषासते शग्धि स्तोमाय पूर्व्य
pada pāṭha: śagdhi | naḥ | indra | yat | tvā | rayim | yāmi | su-vīryam || śagdhi | vājāya | prathamam | sisāsate | śagdhi | stomāya | pūrvya ||8.3.11||

IAST: śagdhī no asya yad dha pauram āvitha dhiya indra siṣāsataḥ
Griffith: Help for us, Indra, as thou holpest Paura once, this man's devotions bent on gain.
Devanāgarī: शग्धी नो अस्य यद्ध पौरमाविथ धिय इन्द्र सिषासतः
pada pāṭha: śagdhi | naḥ | asya | yat | ha | pauram | āvitha | dhiyaḥ | indra | sisāsataḥ || śagdhi | yathā | ruśamam | śyāvakam | kr̥pam | indra | pra | āvaḥ | svaḥ-naram ||8.3.12||

IAST: śagdhi yathā ruśamaṁ śyāvakaṁ kṛpam indra prāvaḥ svarṇaram
Griffith: Help, as thou gavest Rugama and Syavaka and Svarnara and Krpa aid.
Devanāgarī: शग्धि यथा रुशमं श्यावकं कृपमिन्द्र प्रावः स्वर्णरम्
pada pāṭha: śagdhi | naḥ | asya | yat | ha | pauram | āvitha | dhiyaḥ | indra | sisāsataḥ || śagdhi | yathā | ruśamam | śyāvakam | kr̥pam | indra | pra | āvaḥ | svaḥ-naram ||8.3.12||

IAST: kan navyo atasīnāṁ turo gṛṇīta martyaḥ
Griffith: What newest of imploring prayers shall, then, the zealous mortal sing?
pada pāṭha: kat | navyaḥ | atasīnām | turaḥ | gr̥ṇīta | martyaḥ || nahi | nu | asya | mahimānam | indriyam | svaḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ | ānaśuḥ ||8.3.13||

IAST: nahī nv asya mahimānam indriyaṁ svar gṛṇanta ānaśuḥ
Griffith: For have not they who laud his might, and Indra-power won for themselves the light of heaven?
pada pāṭha: kat | navyaḥ | atasīnām | turaḥ | gr̥ṇīta | martyaḥ || nahi | nu | asya | mahimānam | indriyam | svaḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ | ānaśuḥ ||8.3.13||

IAST: kad u stuvanta ṛtayanta devata ṛṣiḥ ko vipra ohate
Griffith: When shall they keep the Law and praise thee mid the Gods? Who counts as Rsi and as sage?
Devanāgarī: कदु स्तुवन्त ऋतयन्त देवत ऋषिः को विप्र ओहते
pada pāṭha: kat | ūm̐ iti | stuvantaḥ | r̥ta-yanta | devatā | r̥ṣiḥ | kaḥ | vipraḥ | ohate || kadā | havam | magha-van | indra | sunvataḥ | kat | ūm̐ iti | stuvataḥ | ā | gamaḥ ||8.3.14||

IAST: kadā havam maghavann indra sunvataḥ kad u stuvata ā gamaḥ
Griffith: When ever wilt thou, Indra Maghavan, come nigh to presser's or to praiser's call?
Devanāgarī: कदा हवं मघवन्निन्द्र सुन्वतः कदु स्तुवत आ गमः
pada pāṭha: kat | ūm̐ iti | stuvantaḥ | r̥ta-yanta | devatā | r̥ṣiḥ | kaḥ | vipraḥ | ohate || kadā | havam | magha-van | indra | sunvataḥ | kat | ūm̐ iti | stuvataḥ | ā | gamaḥ ||8.3.14||

IAST: ud u tye madhumattamā giraḥ stomāsa īrate
Griffith: These songs of ours exceeding sweet, these hymns of praise ascend to thee,
Devanāgarī: उदु त्ये मधुमत्तमा गिरः स्तोमास ईरते
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tye | madhumat-tamāḥ | giraḥ | stomāsaḥ | īrate || satrā-jitaḥ | dhana-sāḥ | akṣita-ūtayaḥ | vāja-yantaḥ | rathāḥ-iva ||8.3.15||

IAST: satrājito dhanasā akṣitotayo vājayanto rathā iva
Griffith: Like ever-conquering chariots that display their strength, gain wealth, and give unfailing aid.
Devanāgarī: सत्राजितो धनसा अक्षितोतयो वाजयन्तो रथा इव
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tye | madhumat-tamāḥ | giraḥ | stomāsaḥ | īrate || satrā-jitaḥ | dhana-sāḥ | akṣita-ūtayaḥ | vāja-yantaḥ | rathāḥ-iva ||8.3.15||

IAST: kaṇvā iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryā iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ
Griffith: The Bhrgus are like Suns, like Kanvas, and have gained all that their thoughts were bent upon.
Devanāgarī: कण्वा इव भृगवः सूर्या इव विश्वमिद्धीतमानशुः
pada pāṭha: kaṇvāḥ-iva | bhr̥gavaḥ | sūryāḥ-iva | viśvam | it | dhītam | ānaśuḥ || indram | stomebhiḥ | mahayantaḥ | āyavaḥ | priya-medhāsaḥ | asvaran ||8.3.16||

IAST: indraṁ stomebhir mahayanta āyavaḥ priyamedhāso asvaran
Griffith: The living men of Priyamedha's race have sung exalting Indra with their lauds.
pada pāṭha: kaṇvāḥ-iva | bhr̥gavaḥ | sūryāḥ-iva | viśvam | it | dhītam | ānaśuḥ || indram | stomebhiḥ | mahayantaḥ | āyavaḥ | priya-medhāsaḥ | asvaran ||8.3.16||

IAST: yukṣvā hi vṛtrahantama harī indra parāvataḥ
Griffith: Best slayer of the Vrtras, yoke thy Bay Steeds, Indra, from afar.
Devanāgarī: युक्ष्वा हि वृत्रहन्तम हरी इन्द्र परावतः
pada pāṭha: yukṣva | hi | vr̥trahan-tama | harī iti | indra | parā-vataḥ || arvācīnaḥ | magha-van | soma-pītaye | ugraḥ | r̥ṣvebhiḥ | ā | gahi ||8.3.17||

IAST: arvācīno maghavan somapītaya ugra ṛṣvebhir ā gahi
Griffith: Come with the High Ones hither, Maghavan, to us, Mighty, to drink the Soma juice.
pada pāṭha: yukṣva | hi | vr̥trahan-tama | harī iti | indra | parā-vataḥ || arvācīnaḥ | magha-van | soma-pītaye | ugraḥ | r̥ṣvebhiḥ | ā | gahi ||8.3.17||

IAST: ime hi te kāravo vāvaśur dhiyā viprāso medhasātaye
Griffith: For these, the bards and singers, have cried out to thee with prayer, to gain the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: इमे हि ते कारवो वावशुर्धिया विप्रासो मेधसातये
pada pāṭha: ime | hi | te | kāravaḥ | vāvaśuḥ | dhiyā | viprāsaḥ | medha-sātaye || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | magha-van | indra | girvaṇaḥ | venaḥ | na | śr̥ṇudhi | havam ||8.3.18||

IAST: sa tvaṁ no maghavann indra girvaṇo veno na śṛṇudhī havam
Griffith: As such, O Maghavan, Indra, who lovest song, even as a lover bear my call.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणो वेनो न शृणुधी हवम्
pada pāṭha: ime | hi | te | kāravaḥ | vāvaśuḥ | dhiyā | viprāsaḥ | medha-sātaye || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | magha-van | indra | girvaṇaḥ | venaḥ | na | śr̥ṇudhi | havam ||8.3.18||

IAST: nir indra bṛhatībhyo vṛtraṁ dhanubhyo asphuraḥ
Griffith: Thou from the lofty plains above, O Indra, hurledst Vrtra down.
pada pāṭha: niḥ | indra | br̥hatībhyaḥ | vr̥tram | dhanu-bhyaḥ | asphuraḥ || niḥ | arbudasya | mr̥gayasya | māyinaḥ | niḥ | parvatasya | gāḥ | ājaḥ ||8.3.19||

IAST: nir arbudasya mṛgayasya māyino niḥ parvatasya gā ājaḥ
Griffith: Thou dravest forth the kine of guileful Mrgaya and Arbuda from the mountain's hold.
Devanāgarī: निरर्बुदस्य मृगयस्य मायिनो निः पर्वतस्य गा आजः
pada pāṭha: niḥ | indra | br̥hatībhyaḥ | vr̥tram | dhanu-bhyaḥ | asphuraḥ || niḥ | arbudasya | mr̥gayasya | māyinaḥ | niḥ | parvatasya | gāḥ | ājaḥ ||8.3.19||

IAST: nir agnayo rurucur nir u sūryo niḥ soma indriyo rasaḥ
Griffith: Bright were the flaming fires, the Sun gave forth his shine, and Soma, Indra's juice, shone clear.
Devanāgarī: निरग्नयो रुरुचुर्निरु सूर्यो निः सोम इन्द्रियो रसः
pada pāṭha: niḥ | agnayaḥ | rurucuḥ | niḥ | ūm̐ iti | sūryaḥ | niḥ | somaḥ | indriyaḥ | rasaḥ || niḥ | antarikṣāt | adhamaḥ | mahām | ahim | kr̥ṣe | tat | indra | pauṁsyam ||8.3.20||

IAST: nir antarikṣād adhamo mahām ahiṁ kṛṣe tad indra pauṁsyam
Griffith: Indra, thou blewest the great Dragon from the air -. men must regard that valorous deed.
pada pāṭha: niḥ | agnayaḥ | rurucuḥ | niḥ | ūm̐ iti | sūryaḥ | niḥ | somaḥ | indriyaḥ | rasaḥ || niḥ | antarikṣāt | adhamaḥ | mahām | ahim | kr̥ṣe | tat | indra | pauṁsyam ||8.3.20||

IAST: yam me dur indro marutaḥ pākasthāmā kaurayāṇaḥ
Griffith: The fairest courser of them all, who runneth on as 'twere to heaven.
Devanāgarī: यं मे दुरिन्द्रो मरुतः पाकस्थामा कौरयाणः
pada pāṭha: yam | me | duḥ | indraḥ | marutaḥ | pāka-sthāmā | kaurayāṇaḥ || viśveṣām | tmanā | śobhiṣṭham | upa-iva | divi | dhāvamānam ||8.3.21||

IAST: viśveṣāṁ tmanā śobhiṣṭham upeva divi dhāvamānam
Griffith: Which Indra and the Maruts gave, and Pakasthaman Kaurayan.
pada pāṭha: yam | me | duḥ | indraḥ | marutaḥ | pāka-sthāmā | kaurayāṇaḥ || viśveṣām | tmanā | śobhiṣṭham | upa-iva | divi | dhāvamānam ||8.3.21||

IAST: rohitam me pākasthāmā sudhuraṁ kakṣyaprām
Griffith: To me hath Pakasthaman given, a ruddy horse,good at the pole,
pada pāṭha: rohitam | me | pāka-sthāmā | su-dhuram | kakṣya-prām || adāt | rāyaḥ | vi-bodhanam ||8.3.22||

IAST: adād rāyo vibodhanam
Griffith: Filling is girth and rousing wealth;
pada pāṭha: rohitam | me | pāka-sthāmā | su-dhuram | kakṣya-prām || adāt | rāyaḥ | vi-bodhanam ||8.3.22||

IAST: yasmā anye daśa prati dhuraṁ vahanti vahnayaḥ
Griffith: Compared with whom no other ten strong coursers, harnessed to the pole,
Devanāgarī: यस्मा अन्ये दश प्रति धुरं वहन्ति वह्नयः
pada pāṭha: yasmai | anye | daśa | prati | dhuram | vahanti | vahnayaḥ || astam | vayaḥ | na | tugryam ||8.3.23||

IAST: astaṁ vayo na tugryam
Griffith: Bear Tugrya to his dwelling place.
pada pāṭha: yasmai | anye | daśa | prati | dhuram | vahanti | vahnayaḥ || astam | vayaḥ | na | tugryam ||8.3.23||

IAST: ātmā pitus tanūr vāsa ojodā abhyañjanam
Griffith: Raiment is body, food is life, and healing ointment giveth strength.
pada pāṭha: ātmā | pituḥ | tanūḥ | vāsaḥ | ojaḥ-dāḥ | abhi-añjanam || turīyam | it | rohitasya | pāka-sthāmānam | bhojam | dātāram | abravam ||8.3.24||

IAST: turīyam id rohitasya pākasthāmānam bhojaṁ dātāram abravam
Griffith: As the free-handed giver of the ruddy steed, I have named Pakasthaman fourth.
pada pāṭha: ātmā | pituḥ | tanūḥ | vāsaḥ | ojaḥ-dāḥ | abhi-añjanam || turīyam | it | rohitasya | pāka-sthāmānam | bhojam | dātāram | abravam ||8.3.24||

IAST: yad indra prāg apāg udaṅ nyag vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ
Griffith: THOUGH, Indra, thou art called by men eastward and westward, north and south,
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | prāk | apāk | udak | nyak | vā | hūyase | nr̥-bhiḥ || sima | puru | nr̥-sūtaḥ | asi | ānave | asi | pra-śardha | turvaśe ||8.4.1||

IAST: simā purū nṛṣūto asy ānave 'si praśardha turvaśe
Griffith: Thou chiefly art with Anava and Turvasa, brave Champion I urged by men to Come.
Devanāgarī: सिमा पुरू नृषूतो अस्यानवेऽसि प्रशर्ध तुर्वशे
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | prāk | apāk | udak | nyak | vā | hūyase | nr̥-bhiḥ || sima | puru | nr̥-sūtaḥ | asi | ānave | asi | pra-śardha | turvaśe ||8.4.1||

IAST: yad vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpa indra mādayase sacā
Griffith: Or, Indra, when with Ruma, Rusama, Syavaka, and Krpa thou rejoicest thee,
Devanāgarī: यद्वा रुमे रुशमे श्यावके कृप इन्द्र मादयसे सचा
pada pāṭha: yat | vā | rume | ruśame | śyāvake | kr̥pe | indra | mādayase | sacā || kaṇvāsaḥ | tvā | brahma-bhiḥ | stoma-vāhasaḥ | indra | ā | yacchanti | ā | gahi ||8.4.2||

IAST: kaṇvāsas tvā brahmabhiḥ stomavāhasa indrā yacchanty ā gahi
Griffith: Still do the Kanvas, bringing praises, with their prayers, O Indra, draw thee hither: come.
Devanāgarī: कण्वासस्त्वा ब्रह्मभिः स्तोमवाहस इन्द्रा यच्छन्त्या गहि
pada pāṭha: yat | vā | rume | ruśame | śyāvake | kr̥pe | indra | mādayase | sacā || kaṇvāsaḥ | tvā | brahma-bhiḥ | stoma-vāhasaḥ | indra | ā | yacchanti | ā | gahi ||8.4.2||

IAST: yathā gauro apā kṛtaṁ tṛṣyann ety averiṇam
Griffith: Even as the wild-bull, when he thirsts, goes to the desert's watery pool,
pada pāṭha: yathā | gauraḥ | apā | kr̥tam | tr̥ṣyan | eti | ava | iriṇam || ā-pitve | naḥ | pra-pitve | tūyam | ā | gahi | kaṇveṣu | su | sacā | piba ||8.4.3||

IAST: āpitve naḥ prapitve tūyam ā gahi kaṇveṣu su sacā piba
Griffith: Come hither quickly both at morning and at eve, and with the Kanvas drink thy fill.
Devanāgarī: आपित्वे नः प्रपित्वे तूयमा गहि कण्वेषु सु सचा पिब
pada pāṭha: yathā | gauraḥ | apā | kr̥tam | tr̥ṣyan | eti | ava | iriṇam || ā-pitve | naḥ | pra-pitve | tūyam | ā | gahi | kaṇveṣu | su | sacā | piba ||8.4.3||

IAST: mandantu tvā maghavann indrendavo rādhodeyāya sunvate
Griffith: May the drops gladden thee, rich Indra, and obtain bounty for him who pours the juice.
pada pāṭha: mandantu | tvā | magha-van | indra | indavaḥ | rādhaḥ-deyāya | sunvate || ā-muṣya | somam | apibaḥ | camū iti | sutam | jyeṣṭham | tat | dadhiṣe | sahaḥ ||8.4.4||

IAST: āmuṣyā somam apibaś camū sutaṁ jyeṣṭhaṁ tad dadhiṣe sahaḥ
Griffith: Soma pressed in the mortar didst thou take and drink, and hence hast won surpassing might.
Devanāgarī: आमुष्या सोममपिबश्चमू सुतं ज्येष्ठं तद्दधिषे सहः
pada pāṭha: mandantu | tvā | magha-van | indra | indavaḥ | rādhaḥ-deyāya | sunvate || ā-muṣya | somam | apibaḥ | camū iti | sutam | jyeṣṭham | tat | dadhiṣe | sahaḥ ||8.4.4||

IAST: pra cakre sahasā saho babhañja manyum ojasā
Griffith: With mightier strength he conquered strength, with energy he crushed their wrath.
Devanāgarī: प्र चक्रे सहसा सहो बभञ्ज मन्युमोजसा
pada pāṭha: pra | cakre | sahasā | sahaḥ | babhañja | manyum | ojasā || viśve | te | indra | pr̥tanā-yavaḥ | yaho iti | ni | vr̥kṣāḥ-iva | yemire ||8.4.5||

IAST: viśve ta indra pṛtanāyavo yaho ni vṛkṣā iva yemire
Griffith: O Indra, Strong in youth, all those who sought the fray bent and bowed down to thee like trees.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे त इन्द्र पृतनायवो यहो नि वृक्षा इव येमिरे
pada pāṭha: pra | cakre | sahasā | sahaḥ | babhañja | manyum | ojasā || viśve | te | indra | pr̥tanā-yavaḥ | yaho iti | ni | vr̥kṣāḥ-iva | yemire ||8.4.5||

IAST: sahasreṇeva sacate yavīyudhā yas ta ānaḻ upastutim
Griffith: He who wins promise of thine aid goes girt as with a thousand mighty men of war.
pada pāṭha: sahasreṇa-iva | sacate | yavi-yudhā | yaḥ | te | ānaṭ | upa-stutim || putram | prāvargam | kr̥ṇute | su-vīrye | dāśnoti | namaukti-bhiḥ ||8.4.6||

IAST: putram prāvargaṁ kṛṇute suvīrye dāśnoti namaüktibhiḥ
Griffith: He makes his son preeminent in hero might - he serves with reverential prayer.
Devanāgarī: पुत्रं प्रावर्गं कृणुते सुवीर्ये दाश्नोति नम‍उक्तिभिः
pada pāṭha: sahasreṇa-iva | sacate | yavi-yudhā | yaḥ | te | ānaṭ | upa-stutim || putram | prāvargam | kr̥ṇute | su-vīrye | dāśnoti | namaukti-bhiḥ ||8.4.6||

IAST: mā bhema mā śramiṣmograsya sakhye tava
Griffith: With thee, the Mighty, for our Friend, we will riot fear or feel fatigue.
Devanāgarī: मा भेम मा श्रमिष्मोग्रस्य सख्ये तव
pada pāṭha: mā | bhema | mā | śramiṣma | ugrasya | sakhye | tava || mahat | te | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | abhi-cakṣyam | kr̥tam | paśyema | turvaśam | yadum ||8.4.7||

IAST: mahat te vṛṣṇo abhicakṣyaṁ kṛtam paśyema turvaśaṁ yadum
Griffith: May we see Turvasa and Yadu: thy great deed, O Hero, must be glorified.
Devanāgarī: महत्ते वृष्णो अभिचक्ष्यं कृतं पश्येम तुर्वशं यदुम्
pada pāṭha: mā | bhema | mā | śramiṣma | ugrasya | sakhye | tava || mahat | te | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | abhi-cakṣyam | kr̥tam | paśyema | turvaśam | yadum ||8.4.7||

IAST: savyām anu sphigyaṁ vāvase vṛṣā na dāno asya roṣati
Griffith: On his left hip the Hero hath reclined himself: the proffered feast offends him not.
Devanāgarī: सव्यामनु स्फिग्यं वावसे वृषा न दानो अस्य रोषति
pada pāṭha: savyām | anu | sphigyam | vavase | vr̥ṣā | na | dānaḥ | asya | roṣati || madhvā | sam-pr̥ktāḥ | sāragheṇa | dhenavaḥ | tūyam | ā | ihi | drava | piba ||8.4.8||

IAST: madhvā sampṛktāḥ sāragheṇa dhenavas tūyam ehi dravā piba
Griffith: The milk is blended with the honey of the bee: quickly come hither, baste, and drink.
Devanāgarī: मध्वा सम्पृक्ताः सारघेण धेनवस्तूयमेहि द्रवा पिब
pada pāṭha: savyām | anu | sphigyam | vavase | vr̥ṣā | na | dānaḥ | asya | roṣati || madhvā | sam-pr̥ktāḥ | sāragheṇa | dhenavaḥ | tūyam | ā | ihi | drava | piba ||8.4.8||

IAST: aśvī rathī surūpa id gomām̐ id indra te sakhā
Griffith: Indra, thy friend is fair of form and rich in horses, cars, and kine.
Devanāgarī: अश्वी रथी सुरूप इद्गोमाँ इदिन्द्र ते सखा
pada pāṭha: aśvī | rathī | su-rūpaḥ | it | go-mān | it | indra | te | sakhā || śvātra-bhājā | vayasā | sacate | sadā | candraḥ | yāti | sabhām | upa ||8.4.9||

IAST: śvātrabhājā vayasā sacate sadā candro yāti sabhām upa
Griffith: He evermore hath food accompanied by wealth, and radiant joins the company.
Devanāgarī: श्वात्रभाजा वयसा सचते सदा चन्द्रो याति सभामुप
pada pāṭha: aśvī | rathī | su-rūpaḥ | it | go-mān | it | indra | te | sakhā || śvātra-bhājā | vayasā | sacate | sadā | candraḥ | yāti | sabhām | upa ||8.4.9||

IAST: ṛśyo na tṛṣyann avapānam ā gahi pibā somaṁ vaśām̐ anu
Griffith: Come like a thirsty antelope to the drinking-place: drink Soma to thy heart's desire.
Devanāgarī: ऋश्यो न तृष्यन्नवपानमा गहि पिबा सोमं वशाँ अनु
pada pāṭha: r̥śyaḥ | na | tr̥ṣyan | ava-pānam | ā | gahi | piba | somam | vaśān | anu || ni-meghamānaḥ | magha-van | dive-dive | ojiṣṭham | dadhiṣe | sahaḥ ||8.4.10||

IAST: nimeghamāno maghavan dive-diva ojiṣṭhaṁ dadhiṣe sahaḥ
Griffith: Raining it down, O Maghavan, day after day, thou gainest thy surpassing might.
pada pāṭha: r̥śyaḥ | na | tr̥ṣyan | ava-pānam | ā | gahi | piba | somam | vaśān | anu || ni-meghamānaḥ | magha-van | dive-dive | ojiṣṭham | dadhiṣe | sahaḥ ||8.4.10||

IAST: adhvaryo drāvayā tvaṁ somam indraḥ pipāsati
Griffith: Priest, let the Soma juice flow forth, for Indra longs to drink thereof.
pada pāṭha: adhvaryo iti | dravaya | tvam | somam | indraḥ | pipāsati || upa | nūnam | yuyuje | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti | ā | ca | jagāma | vr̥tra-hā ||8.4.11||

IAST: upa nūnaṁ yuyuje vṛṣaṇā harī ā ca jagāma vṛtrahā
Griffith: He even now hath yoked his vigorous Bay Steeds: the Vrtra-slayer hath come near.
Devanāgarī: उप नूनं युयुजे वृषणा हरी आ च जगाम वृत्रहा
pada pāṭha: adhvaryo iti | dravaya | tvam | somam | indraḥ | pipāsati || upa | nūnam | yuyuje | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti | ā | ca | jagāma | vr̥tra-hā ||8.4.11||

IAST: svayaṁ cit sa manyate dāśurir jano yatrā somasya tṛmpasi
Griffith: The man with whom thou fillcst thee with Soma deems himself a pious worshipper.
Devanāgarī: स्वयं चित्स मन्यते दाशुरिर्जनो यत्रा सोमस्य तृम्पसि
pada pāṭha: svayam | cit | saḥ | manyate | dāśuriḥ | janaḥ | yatra | somasya | tr̥mpasi || idam | te | annam | yujyam | sam-ukṣitam | tasya | ā | ihi | pra | drava | piba ||8.4.12||

IAST: idaṁ te annaṁ yujyaṁ samukṣitaṁ tasyehi pra dravā piba
Griffith: This thine appropriate food is here poured out for thee: come, hasten forward. drink of it,
Devanāgarī: इदं ते अन्नं युज्यं समुक्षितं तस्येहि प्र द्रवा पिब
pada pāṭha: svayam | cit | saḥ | manyate | dāśuriḥ | janaḥ | yatra | somasya | tr̥mpasi || idam | te | annam | yujyam | sam-ukṣitam | tasya | ā | ihi | pra | drava | piba ||8.4.12||

IAST: ratheṣṭhāyādhvaryavaḥ somam indrāya sotana
Griffith: Press out the Soma juice, ye priests, for Indra borne upon his car.
pada pāṭha: rathe-sthāya | adhvaryavaḥ | somam | indrāya | sotana || adhi | bradhnasya | adrayaḥ | vi | cakṣate | sunvantaḥ | dāśu-adhvaram ||8.4.13||

IAST: adhi bradhnasyādrayo vi cakṣate sunvanto dāśvadhvaram
Griffith: The pressing-stones speak loud of Indra, while they shed the juice which, offered, honours him.
Devanāgarī: अधि ब्रध्नस्याद्रयो वि चक्षते सुन्वन्तो दाश्वध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: rathe-sthāya | adhvaryavaḥ | somam | indrāya | sotana || adhi | bradhnasya | adrayaḥ | vi | cakṣate | sunvantaḥ | dāśu-adhvaram ||8.4.13||

IAST: upa bradhnaṁ vāvātā vṛṣaṇā harī indram apasu vakṣataḥ
Griffith: To the brown juice may his dear vigorous Bay Steeds bring Indra, to our holy task.
Devanāgarī: उप ब्रध्नं वावाता वृषणा हरी इन्द्रमपसु वक्षतः
pada pāṭha: upa | bradhnam | vavātā | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti | indram | apa-su | vakṣataḥ || arvāñcam | tvā | saptayaḥ | adhvara-śriyaḥ | vahantu | savanā | it | upa ||8.4.14||

IAST: arvāñcaṁ tvā saptayo 'dhvaraśriyo vahantu savaned upa
Griffith: Hither let thy Car-steeds who seek the sacrifice bring thee to our drink-offerings.
pada pāṭha: upa | bradhnam | vavātā | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti | indram | apa-su | vakṣataḥ || arvāñcam | tvā | saptayaḥ | adhvara-śriyaḥ | vahantu | savanā | it | upa ||8.4.14||

IAST: pra pūṣaṇaṁ vṛṇīmahe yujyāya purūvasum
Griffith: Pusan, the Lord of ample wealth, for firm alliance we elect.
pada pāṭha: pra | pūṣaṇam | vr̥ṇīmahe | yujyāya | puru-vasum || saḥ | śakra | śikṣa | puru-hūta | naḥ | dhiyā | tuje | rāye | vi-mocana ||8.4.15||

IAST: sa śakra śikṣa puruhūta no dhiyā tuje rāye vimocana
Griffith: May he with wisdom, Sakra! Looser! Much-invoked! aid us to riches and to seed.
Devanāgarī: स शक्र शिक्ष पुरुहूत नो धिया तुजे राये विमोचन
pada pāṭha: pra | pūṣaṇam | vr̥ṇīmahe | yujyāya | puru-vasum || saḥ | śakra | śikṣa | puru-hūta | naḥ | dhiyā | tuje | rāye | vi-mocana ||8.4.15||

IAST: saṁ naḥ śiśīhi bhurijor iva kṣuraṁ rāsva rāyo vimocana
Griffith: Sharpen us like a razor in the barber's hands: send riches thou who settest free.
Devanāgarī: सं नः शिशीहि भुरिजोरिव क्षुरं रास्व रायो विमोचन
pada pāṭha: sam | naḥ | śiśīhi | bhurijoḥ-iva | kṣuram | rāsva | rāyaḥ | vi-mocana || tve iti | tat | naḥ | su-vedam | usriyam | vasu | yam | tvam | hinoṣi | martyam ||8.4.16||

IAST: tve tan naḥ suvedam usriyaṁ vasu yaṁ tvaṁ hinoṣi martyam
Griffith: Easy to find with thee are treasures of the Dawn for mortal man whom thou dost speed.
Devanāgarī: त्वे तन्नः सुवेदमुस्रियं वसु यं त्वं हिनोषि मर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: sam | naḥ | śiśīhi | bhurijoḥ-iva | kṣuram | rāsva | rāyaḥ | vi-mocana || tve iti | tat | naḥ | su-vedam | usriyam | vasu | yam | tvam | hinoṣi | martyam ||8.4.16||

IAST: vemi tvā pūṣann ṛñjase vemi stotava āghṛṇe
Griffith: Pusan, I long to win thy love, I long to praise thee, Radiant God.
Devanāgarī: वेमि त्वा पूषन्नृञ्जसे वेमि स्तोतव आघृणे
pada pāṭha: vemi | tvā | pūṣan | r̥ñjase | vemi | stotave | āghr̥ṇe || na | tasya | vemi | araṇam | hi | tat | vaso iti | stuṣe | pajrāya | sāmne ||8.4.17||

IAST: na tasya vemy araṇaṁ hi tad vaso stuṣe pajrāya sāmne
Griffith: Excellent Lord, 'tis strange tome, no wish have I to sing the psalm that Pajra sings.
Devanāgarī: न तस्य वेम्यरणं हि तद्वसो स्तुषे पज्राय साम्ने
pada pāṭha: vemi | tvā | pūṣan | r̥ñjase | vemi | stotave | āghr̥ṇe || na | tasya | vemi | araṇam | hi | tat | vaso iti | stuṣe | pajrāya | sāmne ||8.4.17||

IAST: parā gāvo yavasaṁ kac cid āghṛṇe nityaṁ rekṇo amartya
Griffith: My kine, O Radiant God, seek pasture where they will, my during wealth, Immortal One.
Devanāgarī: परा गावो यवसं कच्चिदाघृणे नित्यं रेक्णो अमर्त्य
pada pāṭha: parā | gāvaḥ | yavasam | kat | cit | āghr̥ṇe | nityam | rekṇaḥ | amartya || asmākam | pūṣan | avitā | śivaḥ | bhava | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | vāja-sātaye ||8.4.18||

IAST: asmākam pūṣann avitā śivo bhava maṁhiṣṭho vājasātaye
Griffith: Be our protector, Pusan! be, most liberal Lord, propitious to our gathering strength.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं पूषन्नविता शिवो भव मंहिष्ठो वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: parā | gāvaḥ | yavasam | kat | cit | āghr̥ṇe | nityam | rekṇaḥ | amartya || asmākam | pūṣan | avitā | śivaḥ | bhava | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | vāja-sātaye ||8.4.18||

IAST: sthūraṁ rādhaḥ śatāśvaṁ kuruṅgasya diviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: Rich was the gift Kurunga gave, a hundred steeds at morning rites.
pada pāṭha: sthūram | rādhaḥ | śata-aśvam | kuruṅgasya | diviṣṭiṣu || rājñaḥ | tveṣasya | su-bhagasya | rātiṣu | turvaśeṣu | amanmahi ||8.4.19||

IAST: rājñas tveṣasya subhagasya rātiṣu turvaśeṣv amanmahi
Griffith: Among the gifts of Turvasas we thought of him, the opulent, the splendid King.
pada pāṭha: sthūram | rādhaḥ | śata-aśvam | kuruṅgasya | diviṣṭiṣu || rājñaḥ | tveṣasya | su-bhagasya | rātiṣu | turvaśeṣu | amanmahi ||8.4.19||

IAST: dhībhiḥ sātāni kāṇvasya vājinaḥ priyamedhair abhidyubhiḥ
Griffith: What by his morning songs Kanva, the powerful, hath, with the Priyamedhas, gained-
pada pāṭha: dhībhiḥ | sātāni | kāṇvasya | vājinaḥ | priya-medhaiḥ | abhidyu-bhiḥ || ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | anu | niḥ-majām | aje | niḥ | yūthāni | gavām | r̥ṣiḥ ||8.4.20||

IAST: ṣaṣṭiṁ sahasrānu nirmajām aje nir yūthāni gavām ṛṣiḥ
Griffith: The herds of sixty thousand pure and spotless kine, have I, the Rsi, driven away.
pada pāṭha: dhībhiḥ | sātāni | kāṇvasya | vājinaḥ | priya-medhaiḥ | abhidyu-bhiḥ || ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | anu | niḥ-majām | aje | niḥ | yūthāni | gavām | r̥ṣiḥ ||8.4.20||

IAST: vṛkṣāś cin me abhipitve arāraṇuḥ
Griffith: The very trees were joyful at my coming:
pada pāṭha: vr̥kṣāḥ | cit | me | abhi-pitve | araraṇuḥ || gām | bhajanta | mehanā | aśvam | bhajanta | mehanā ||8.4.21||

IAST: gām bhajanta mehanāśvam bhajanta mehanā
Griffith: kine they obtained in plenty, steeds in plenty.
pada pāṭha: vr̥kṣāḥ | cit | me | abhi-pitve | araraṇuḥ || gām | bhajanta | mehanā | aśvam | bhajanta | mehanā ||8.4.21||

IAST: dūrād iheva yat saty aruṇapsur aśiśvitat
Griffith: WHEN, even as she were present here, red Dawn hath shone from far away,
pada pāṭha: dūrāt | iha-iva | yat | satī | aruṇa-psuḥ | aśiśvitat || vi | bhānum | viśvadhā | atanat ||8.5.1||

IAST: vi bhānuṁ viśvadhātanat
Griffith: She spreadeth light on every side.
pada pāṭha: dūrāt | iha-iva | yat | satī | aruṇa-psuḥ | aśiśvitat || vi | bhānum | viśvadhā | atanat ||8.5.1||

IAST: nṛvad dasrā manoyujā rathena pṛthupājasā
Griffith: Like Heroes on your will-yoked car farshining, Wonder-Workers! ye
pada pāṭha: nr̥-vat | dasrā | manaḥ-yujā | rathena | pr̥thu-pājasā || sacethe iti | aśvinā | uṣasam ||8.5.2||

IAST: sacethe aśvinoṣasam
Griffith: Attend, O Asvins, on the Dawn.
pada pāṭha: nr̥-vat | dasrā | manaḥ-yujā | rathena | pr̥thu-pājasā || sacethe iti | aśvinā | uṣasam ||8.5.2||

IAST: yuvābhyāṁ vājinīvasū prati stomā adṛkṣata
Griffith: By you, O Lords of ample wealth our songs of praise have been observed:
pada pāṭha: yuvābhyām | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | prati | stomāḥ | adr̥kṣata || vācam | dūtaḥ | yathā | ohiṣe ||8.5.3||

IAST: vācaṁ dūto yathohiṣe
Griffith: As envoy have I brought the prayer.
pada pāṭha: yuvābhyām | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | prati | stomāḥ | adr̥kṣata || vācam | dūtaḥ | yathā | ohiṣe ||8.5.3||

IAST: purupriyā ṇa ūtaye purumandrā purūvasū
Griffith: Kanvas must praise the Asvins dear to many, making many glad,
pada pāṭha: puru-priyā | naḥ | ūtaye | puru-mandrā | puruvasū iti puru-vasū || stuṣe | kaṇvāsaḥ | aśvinā ||8.5.4||

IAST: stuṣe kaṇvāso aśvinā
Griffith: Most rich, that they may succour us.
pada pāṭha: puru-priyā | naḥ | ūtaye | puru-mandrā | puruvasū iti puru-vasū || stuṣe | kaṇvāsaḥ | aśvinā ||8.5.4||

IAST: maṁhiṣṭhā vājasātameṣayantā śubhas patī
Griffith: Most liberal, best at winning strength, inciters, Lords of splendour who
pada pāṭha: maṁhiṣṭhā | vāja-sātamā | iṣayantā | śubhaḥ | patī iti || gantārā | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham ||8.5.5||

IAST: gantārā dāśuṣo gṛham
Griffith: Visit the worshipper's abode.
pada pāṭha: maṁhiṣṭhā | vāja-sātamā | iṣayantā | śubhaḥ | patī iti || gantārā | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham ||8.5.5||

IAST: tā sudevāya dāśuṣe sumedhām avitāriṇīm
Griffith: So for devout Sudeva dew with fatness his unfailing mead,
pada pāṭha: tā | su-devāya | dāśuṣe | su-medhām | avi-tāriṇīm || ghr̥taiḥ | gavyūtim | ukṣatam ||8.5.6||

IAST: ghṛtair gavyūtim ukṣatam
Griffith: And make it rich for sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: tā | su-devāya | dāśuṣe | su-medhām | avi-tāriṇīm || ghr̥taiḥ | gavyūtim | ukṣatam ||8.5.6||

IAST: ā naḥ stomam upa dravat tūyaṁ śyenebhir āśubhiḥ
Griffith: Hitherward running speedily with horses, as with rapid hawks,
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | stomam | upa | dravat | tūyam | śyenebhiḥ | āśu-bhiḥ || yātam | aśvebhiḥ | aśvinā ||8.5.7||

IAST: yātam aśvebhir aśvinā
Griffith: Come, Asvins, to our song of praise
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | stomam | upa | dravat | tūyam | śyenebhiḥ | āśu-bhiḥ || yātam | aśvebhiḥ | aśvinā ||8.5.7||

IAST: yebhis tisraḥ parāvato divo viśvāni rocanā
Griffith: Wherewith the three wide distances, and all the lights that are in heaven.
pada pāṭha: yebhiḥ | tisraḥ | parā-vataḥ | divaḥ | viśvāni | rocanā || trīn | aktūn | pari-dīyathaḥ ||8.5.8||

IAST: trīm̐r aktūn paridīyathaḥ
Griffith: Ye traverse, and three times of night.
pada pāṭha: yebhiḥ | tisraḥ | parā-vataḥ | divaḥ | viśvāni | rocanā || trīn | aktūn | pari-dīyathaḥ ||8.5.8||

IAST: uta no gomatīr iṣa uta sātīr aharvidā
Griffith: O Finders of the Day, that we may win us food of kine and wealth,
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | go-matīḥ | iṣaḥ | uta | sātīḥ | ahaḥ-vidā || vi | pathaḥ | sātaye | sitam ||8.5.9||

IAST: vi pathaḥ sātaye sitam
Griffith: Open the paths for us to tread.
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | go-matīḥ | iṣaḥ | uta | sātīḥ | ahaḥ-vidā || vi | pathaḥ | sātaye | sitam ||8.5.9||

IAST: ā no gomantam aśvinā suvīraṁ surathaṁ rayim
Griffith: O Asvins, bring us wealth in kine, in noble heroes, and in cars:
Devanāgarī: आ नो गोमन्तमश्विना सुवीरं सुरथं रयिम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | go-mantam | aśvinā | su-vīram | su-ratham | rayim || voḷham | aśva-vatīḥ | iṣaḥ ||8.5.10||

IAST: voḻham aśvāvatīr iṣaḥ
Griffith: Bring us the strength that horses give.
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | go-mantam | aśvinā | su-vīram | su-ratham | rayim || voḷham | aśva-vatīḥ | iṣaḥ ||8.5.10||

IAST: vāvṛdhānā śubhas patī dasrā hiraṇyavartanī
Griffith: Ye Lords of splendour, glorified, ye Wonder-Workers borne on paths
pada pāṭha: vavr̥dhānā | śubhaḥ | patī iti | dasrā | hiraṇyavartanī iti hiraṇya-vartanī || pibatam | somyam | madhu ||8.5.11||

IAST: pibataṁ somyam madhu
Griffith: Of gold, drink sweets with Somajuice.
pada pāṭha: vavr̥dhānā | śubhaḥ | patī iti | dasrā | hiraṇyavartanī iti hiraṇya-vartanī || pibatam | somyam | madhu ||8.5.11||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ vājinīvasū maghavadbhyaś ca saprathaḥ
Griffith: To us, ye Lords of ample wealth, and to our wealth chiefs extend
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ca | sa-prathaḥ || chardiḥ | yantam | adābhyam ||8.5.12||

IAST: chardir yantam adābhyam
Griffith: Wide shelter, ne'er to be assailed.
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ca | sa-prathaḥ || chardiḥ | yantam | adābhyam ||8.5.12||

IAST: ni ṣu brahma janānāṁ yāviṣṭaṁ tūyam ā gatam
Griffith: Come quickly downward to the prayer of people whom ye favour most:
Devanāgarī: नि षु ब्रह्म जनानां याविष्टं तूयमा गतम्
pada pāṭha: ni | su | brahma | janānām | yā | aviṣṭam | tūyam | ā | gatam || mo iti | su | anyān | upa | aratam ||8.5.13||

IAST: mo ṣv anyām̐ upāratam
Griffith: Approach not unto other folk.
pada pāṭha: ni | su | brahma | janānām | yā | aviṣṭam | tūyam | ā | gatam || mo iti | su | anyān | upa | aratam ||8.5.13||

IAST: asya pibatam aśvinā yuvam madasya cāruṇaḥ
Griffith: Ye Asvins whom our minds perceive, drink of this lovely gladdening draught,
pada pāṭha: asya | pibatam | aśvinā | yuvam | madasya | cāruṇaḥ || madhvaḥ | rātasya | dhiṣṇyā ||8.5.14||

IAST: madhvo rātasya dhiṣṇyā
Griffith: The mcath which we present to you.
pada pāṭha: asya | pibatam | aśvinā | yuvam | madasya | cāruṇaḥ || madhvaḥ | rātasya | dhiṣṇyā ||8.5.14||

IAST: asme ā vahataṁ rayiṁ śatavantaṁ sahasriṇam
Griffith: Bring riches hither unto us in hundreds and in thousands, source
Devanāgarī: अस्मे आ वहतं रयिं शतवन्तं सहस्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: asme iti | ā | vahatam | rayim | śata-vantam | sahasriṇam || puru-kṣum | viśva-dhāyasam ||8.5.15||

IAST: purukṣuṁ viśvadhāyasam
Griffith: Of plenteous food, sustaining all.
pada pāṭha: asme iti | ā | vahatam | rayim | śata-vantam | sahasriṇam || puru-kṣum | viśva-dhāyasam ||8.5.15||

IAST: purutrā cid dhi vāṁ narā vihvayante manīṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: Verily sages call on you, ye Heroes, in full many a place.
