pada pāṭha: yajñebhiḥ | yajña-vāhasam | somebhiḥ | soma-pātamam || hotrābhiḥ | indram | vavr̥dhuḥ | vi | ānaśuḥ ||8.12.20||

IAST: mahīr asya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīr uta praśastayaḥ
Griffith: His leadings are with power and might and his instructions manifold:
pada pāṭha: mahīḥ | asya | pra-nītayaḥ | pūrvīḥ | uta | pra-śastayaḥ || viśvā | vasūni | dāśuṣe | vi | ānaśuḥ ||8.12.21||

IAST: viśvā vasūni dāśuṣe vy ānaśuḥ
Griffith: He gives the worshipper all wealth: this have they gained.
pada pāṭha: mahīḥ | asya | pra-nītayaḥ | pūrvīḥ | uta | pra-śastayaḥ || viśvā | vasūni | dāśuṣe | vi | ānaśuḥ ||8.12.21||

IAST: indraṁ vṛtrāya hantave devāso dadhire puraḥ
Griffith: For slaying Vrtra have the Gods set Indra in the foremost place.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं वृत्राय हन्तवे देवासो दधिरे पुरः
pada pāṭha: indram | vr̥trāya | hantave | devāsaḥ | dadhire | puraḥ || indram | vāṇīḥ | anūṣata | sam | ojase ||8.12.22||

IAST: indraṁ vāṇīr anūṣatā sam ojase
Griffith: Indra the choral bands have sung, for vigorous strength.
pada pāṭha: indram | vr̥trāya | hantave | devāsaḥ | dadhire | puraḥ || indram | vāṇīḥ | anūṣata | sam | ojase ||8.12.22||

IAST: mahāntam mahinā vayaṁ stomebhir havanaśrutam
Griffith: We to the Mighty with our might, with lauds to him who hears our call,
pada pāṭha: mahāntam | mahinā | vayam | stomebhiḥ | havana-śrutam || arkaiḥ | abhi | pra | nonumaḥ | sam | ojase ||8.12.23||

IAST: arkair abhi pra ṇonumaḥ sam ojase
Griffith: With holy hymns have sung aloud, for vigorous strength.
pada pāṭha: mahāntam | mahinā | vayam | stomebhiḥ | havana-śrutam || arkaiḥ | abhi | pra | nonumaḥ | sam | ojase ||8.12.23||

IAST: na yaṁ vivikto rodasī nāntarikṣāṇi vajriṇam
Griffith: Not earth, nor heaven, nor firmaments contain the Thunder-wielding God:
Devanāgarī: न यं विविक्तो रोदसी नान्तरिक्षाणि वज्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: na | yam | viviktaḥ | rodasī iti | na | antarikṣāṇi | vajriṇam || amāt | it | asya | titviṣe | sam | ojasaḥ ||8.12.24||

IAST: amād id asya titviṣe sam ojasaḥ
Griffith: They shake before his violent rush and vigorous strength.
pada pāṭha: na | yam | viviktaḥ | rodasī iti | na | antarikṣāṇi | vajriṇam || amāt | it | asya | titviṣe | sam | ojasaḥ ||8.12.24||

IAST: yad indra pṛtanājye devās tvā dadhire puraḥ
Griffith: What time the Gods, O Indra, get thee foremost in the furious fight,
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | pr̥tanājye | devāḥ | tvā | dadhire | puraḥ || āt | it | te | haryatā | harī iti | vavakṣatuḥ ||8.12.25||

IAST: ād it te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ
Griffith: Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | pr̥tanājye | devāḥ | tvā | dadhire | puraḥ || āt | it | te | haryatā | harī iti | vavakṣatuḥ ||8.12.25||

IAST: yadā vṛtraṁ nadīvṛtaṁ śavasā vajrinn avadhīḥ
Griffith: When Vrtra, stayer of the floods, thou si"est, Thundeicr with might,
pada pāṭha: yadā | vr̥tram | nadī-vr̥tam | śavasā | vajrin | avadhīḥ || āt | it | te | haryatā | harī iti | vavakṣatuḥ ||8.12.26||

IAST: ād it te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ
Griffith: Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.
pada pāṭha: yadā | vr̥tram | nadī-vr̥tam | śavasā | vajrin | avadhīḥ || āt | it | te | haryatā | harī iti | vavakṣatuḥ ||8.12.26||

IAST: yadā te viṣṇur ojasā trīṇi padā vicakrame
Griffith: When Visnu, through thine energy, strode wide those three great steps of his,
Devanāgarī: यदा ते विष्णुरोजसा त्रीणि पदा विचक्रमे
pada pāṭha: yadā | te | viṣṇuḥ | ojasā | trīṇi | padā | vi-cakrame || āt | it | te | haryatā | harī iti | vavakṣatuḥ ||8.12.27||

IAST: ād it te haryatā harī vavakṣatuḥ
Griffith: Then thy two beautiful Bay Steeds carried thee on.
pada pāṭha: yadā | te | viṣṇuḥ | ojasā | trīṇi | padā | vi-cakrame || āt | it | te | haryatā | harī iti | vavakṣatuḥ ||8.12.27||

IAST: yadā te haryatā harī vāvṛdhāte dive-dive
Griffith: When thy two beautiful Bay Steeds grew great and greater day by day,
Devanāgarī: यदा ते हर्यता हरी वावृधाते दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: yadā | te | haryatā | harī iti | vavr̥dhāte iti | dive-dive || āt | it | te | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire ||8.12.28||

IAST: ād it te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire
Griffith: Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.
pada pāṭha: yadā | te | haryatā | harī iti | vavr̥dhāte iti | dive-dive || āt | it | te | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire ||8.12.28||

IAST: yadā te mārutīr viśas tubhyam indra niyemire
Griffith: When, Indra, all the Marut folk humbly submitted them to thee,
pada pāṭha: yadā | te | mārutīḥ | viśaḥ | tubhyam | indra | ni-yemire || āt | it | te | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire ||8.12.29||

IAST: ād it te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire
Griffith: Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.
pada pāṭha: yadā | te | mārutīḥ | viśaḥ | tubhyam | indra | ni-yemire || āt | it | te | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire ||8.12.29||

IAST: yadā sūryam amuṁ divi śukraṁ jyotir adhārayaḥ
Griffith: When yonder Sun, that brilliant light, thou settest in the heaven above,
pada pāṭha: yadā | sūryam | amum | divi | śukram | jyotiḥ | adhārayaḥ || āt | it | te | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire ||8.12.30||

IAST: ād it te viśvā bhuvanāni yemire
Griffith: Even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee.
pada pāṭha: yadā | sūryam | amum | divi | śukram | jyotiḥ | adhārayaḥ || āt | it | te | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yemire ||8.12.30||

IAST: imāṁ ta indra suṣṭutiṁ vipra iyarti dhītibhiḥ
Griffith: To thee, O Indra, with this thought the sage lifts up this eulogy,
Devanāgarī: इमां त इन्द्र सुष्टुतिं विप्र इयर्ति धीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: imām | te | indra | su-stutim | vipraḥ | iyarti | dhīti-bhiḥ || jāmim | padā-iva | pipratīm | pra | adhvare ||8.12.31||

IAST: jāmim padeva pipratīm prādhvare
Griffith: Akin and leading as on foot to sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: imām | te | indra | su-stutim | vipraḥ | iyarti | dhīti-bhiḥ || jāmim | padā-iva | pipratīm | pra | adhvare ||8.12.31||

IAST: yad asya dhāmani priye samīcīnāso asvaran
Griffith: When in thine own dear dwelling all gathered have lifted up the voice
pada pāṭha: yat | asya | dhāmani | priye | sam-īcīnāsaḥ | asvaran || nābhā | yajñasya | dohanā | pra | adhvare ||8.12.32||

IAST: nābhā yajñasya dohanā prādhvare
Griffith: Milk-streams at worship's central spot, for sacrifice,
pada pāṭha: yat | asya | dhāmani | priye | sam-īcīnāsaḥ | asvaran || nābhā | yajñasya | dohanā | pra | adhvare ||8.12.32||

IAST: suvīryaṁ svaśvyaṁ sugavyam indra daddhi naḥ
Griffith: As Priest, O Indra, give us wealth in brave men and good steeds ana kine
pada pāṭha: su-vīryam | su-aśvyam | su-gavyam | indra | daddhi | naḥ || hotā-iva | pūrva-cittaye | pra | adhvare ||8.12.33||

IAST: hoteva pūrvacittaye prādhvare
Griffith: That we may first remember thee for sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: su-vīryam | su-aśvyam | su-gavyam | indra | daddhi | naḥ || hotā-iva | pūrva-cittaye | pra | adhvare ||8.12.33||

IAST: indraḥ suteṣu someṣu kratum punīta ukthyam
Griffith: INDRA, when Soma juices flow, makes his mind pure and meet for lauds.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः सुतेषु सोमेषु क्रतुं पुनीत उक्थ्यम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | suteṣu | someṣu | kratum | punīte | ukthyam || vide | vr̥dhasya | dakṣasaḥ | mahān | hi | saḥ ||8.13.1||

IAST: vide vṛdhasya dakṣaso mahān hi ṣaḥ
Griffith: He gains the power that brings success, for great is he.
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | suteṣu | someṣu | kratum | punīte | ukthyam || vide | vr̥dhasya | dakṣasaḥ | mahān | hi | saḥ ||8.13.1||

IAST: sa prathame vyomani devānāṁ sadane vṛdhaḥ
Griffith: In heaven's first region, in the seat of Gods, is he who brings success,
Devanāgarī: स प्रथमे व्योमनि देवानां सदने वृधः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | prathame | vi-omani | devānām | sadane | vr̥dhaḥ || su-pāraḥ | suśravaḥ-tamaḥ | sam | apsu-jit ||8.13.2||

IAST: supāraḥ suśravastamaḥ sam apsujit
Griffith: Most glorious, prompt to save, who wins the water-floods.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | prathame | vi-omani | devānām | sadane | vr̥dhaḥ || su-pāraḥ | suśravaḥ-tamaḥ | sam | apsu-jit ||8.13.2||

IAST: tam ahve vājasātaya indram bharāya śuṣmiṇam
Griffith: Him, to win strength, have I invoked, even Indra mighty for the fray.
pada pāṭha: tam | ahve | vāja-sātaye | indram | bharāya | śuṣmiṇam || bhava | naḥ | sumne | antamaḥ | sakhā | vr̥dhe ||8.13.3||

IAST: bhavā naḥ sumne antamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe
Griffith: Be thou most near to us for bliss, a Friend to aid.
Devanāgarī: भवा नः सुम्ने अन्तमः सखा वृधे
pada pāṭha: tam | ahve | vāja-sātaye | indram | bharāya | śuṣmiṇam || bhava | naḥ | sumne | antamaḥ | sakhā | vr̥dhe ||8.13.3||

IAST: iyaṁ ta indra girvaṇo rātiḥ kṣarati sunvataḥ
Griffith: Indra, Song -lover, here for thee the worshipper's libation flows.
Devanāgarī: इयं त इन्द्र गिर्वणो रातिः क्षरति सुन्वतः
pada pāṭha: iyam | te | indra | girvaṇaḥ | rātiḥ | kṣarati | sunvataḥ || mandānaḥ | asya | barhiṣaḥ | vi | rājasi ||8.13.4||

IAST: mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi
Griffith: Rejoicing in this sacred grass thou shinest forth.
pada pāṭha: iyam | te | indra | girvaṇaḥ | rātiḥ | kṣarati | sunvataḥ || mandānaḥ | asya | barhiṣaḥ | vi | rājasi ||8.13.4||

IAST: nūnaṁ tad indra daddhi no yat tvā sunvanta īmahe
Griffith: Even now, O Indra, give us that which, pressing juice, we crave of thee.
Devanāgarī: नूनं तदिन्द्र दद्धि नो यत्त्वा सुन्वन्त ईमहे
pada pāṭha: nūnam | tat | indra | daddhi | naḥ | yat | tvā | sunvantaḥ | īmahe || rayim | naḥ | citram | ā | bhara | svaḥ-vidam ||8.13.5||

IAST: rayiṁ naś citram ā bharā svarvidam
Griffith: Bring us wealth manifold which finds the light of heaven.
pada pāṭha: nūnam | tat | indra | daddhi | naḥ | yat | tvā | sunvantaḥ | īmahe || rayim | naḥ | citram | ā | bhara | svaḥ-vidam ||8.13.5||

IAST: stotā yat te vicarṣaṇir atipraśardhayad giraḥ
Griffith: What time the zealous worshipper hath boldly sung his songs to thee,
pada pāṭha: stotā | yat | te | vi-carṣaṇiḥ | ati-praśardhayat | giraḥ || vayāḥ-iva | anu | rohate | juṣanta | yat ||8.13.6||

IAST: vayā ivānu rohate juṣanta yat
Griffith: Like branches of a tree up-grows what they desire.
pada pāṭha: stotā | yat | te | vi-carṣaṇiḥ | ati-praśardhayat | giraḥ || vayāḥ-iva | anu | rohate | juṣanta | yat ||8.13.6||

IAST: pratnavaj janayā giraḥ śṛṇudhī jaritur havam
Griffith: Generate songs even as of old, give car unto the singer's call.
pada pāṭha: pratna-vat | janaya | giraḥ | śr̥ṇudhi | jarituḥ | havam || made-made | vavakṣitha | su-kr̥tvane ||8.13.7||

IAST: made-made vavakṣithā sukṛtvane
Griffith: Thou for the pious hast grown great at each carouse.
pada pāṭha: pratna-vat | janaya | giraḥ | śr̥ṇudhi | jarituḥ | havam || made-made | vavakṣitha | su-kr̥tvane ||8.13.7||

IAST: krīḻanty asya sūnṛtā āpo na pravatā yatīḥ
Griffith: Sweet strains that glorify him play like waters speeding down a slope,
Devanāgarī: क्रीळन्त्यस्य सूनृता आपो न प्रवता यतीः
pada pāṭha: krīḷanti | asya | sūnr̥tāḥ | āpaḥ | na | pra-vatā | yatīḥ || ayā | dhiyā | yaḥ | ucyate | patiḥ | divaḥ ||8.13.8||

IAST: ayā dhiyā ya ucyate patir divaḥ
Griffith: Yea, him who in this song is called the Lord of Heaven;
pada pāṭha: krīḷanti | asya | sūnr̥tāḥ | āpaḥ | na | pra-vatā | yatīḥ || ayā | dhiyā | yaḥ | ucyate | patiḥ | divaḥ ||8.13.8||

IAST: uto patir ya ucyate kṛṣṭīnām eka id vaśī
Griffith: Yea, who alone is called the Lord, the single Ruler of the folk,
pada pāṭha: uto iti | patiḥ | yaḥ | ucyate | kr̥ṣṭīnām | ekaḥ | it | vaśī || namaḥ-vr̥dhaiḥ | avasyu-bhiḥ | sute | raṇa ||8.13.9||

IAST: namovṛdhair avasyubhiḥ sute raṇa
Griffith: By worshippers seeking aid: may he joy in the draught.
pada pāṭha: uto iti | patiḥ | yaḥ | ucyate | kr̥ṣṭīnām | ekaḥ | it | vaśī || namaḥ-vr̥dhaiḥ | avasyu-bhiḥ | sute | raṇa ||8.13.9||

IAST: stuhi śrutaṁ vipaścitaṁ harī yasya prasakṣiṇā
Griffith: Praise him, the Glorious, skilled in song, Lord of the two victorious Bays:
Devanāgarī: स्तुहि श्रुतं विपश्चितं हरी यस्य प्रसक्षिणा
pada pāṭha: stuhi | śrutam | vipaḥ-citam | harī iti | yasya | pra-sakṣiṇā || gantārā | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham | namasvinaḥ ||8.13.10||

IAST: gantārā dāśuṣo gṛhaṁ namasvinaḥ
Griffith: They seek the worshipper's abode who bows in prayer.
pada pāṭha: stuhi | śrutam | vipaḥ-citam | harī iti | yasya | pra-sakṣiṇā || gantārā | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham | namasvinaḥ ||8.13.10||

IAST: tūtujāno mahemate 'śvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ
Griffith: Put forth thy strength: with dappled Steeds come, thou of mighty intellect,
pada pāṭha: tūtujānaḥ | mahe-mate | aśvebhiḥ | pruṣitapsu-bhiḥ || ā | yāhi | yajñam | āśu-bhiḥ | śam | it | hi | te ||8.13.11||

IAST: ā yāhi yajñam āśubhiḥ śam id dhi te
Griffith: With swift Steeds to the sacrifice, for 'tis thy joy.
pada pāṭha: tūtujānaḥ | mahe-mate | aśvebhiḥ | pruṣitapsu-bhiḥ || ā | yāhi | yajñam | āśu-bhiḥ | śam | it | hi | te ||8.13.11||

IAST: indra śaviṣṭha satpate rayiṁ gṛṇatsu dhāraya
Griffith: Grant wealth to those who praise thee, Lord of Heroes, Mightiest Indra: give
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र शविष्ठ सत्पते रयिं गृणत्सु धारय
pada pāṭha: indra | śaviṣṭha | sat-pate | rayim | gr̥ṇat-su | dhāraya || śravaḥ | sūri-bhyaḥ | amr̥tam | vasu-tvanam ||8.13.12||

IAST: śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṁ vasutvanam
Griffith: Our princes everlasting fame and opulence.
pada pāṭha: indra | śaviṣṭha | sat-pate | rayim | gr̥ṇat-su | dhāraya || śravaḥ | sūri-bhyaḥ | amr̥tam | vasu-tvanam ||8.13.12||

IAST: have tvā sūra udite have madhyaṁdine divaḥ
Griffith: I call thee when the Sun is risen, I call thee at the noon of day:
Devanāgarī: हवे त्वा सूर उदिते हवे मध्यंदिने दिवः
pada pāṭha: have | tvā | sūre | ut-ite | have | madhyaṁdine | divaḥ || juṣāṇaḥ | indra | sapti-bhiḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi ||8.13.13||

IAST: juṣāṇa indra saptibhir na ā gahi
Griffith: With thy car-horses, Indra, come wellpleased to us.
pada pāṭha: have | tvā | sūre | ut-ite | have | madhyaṁdine | divaḥ || juṣāṇaḥ | indra | sapti-bhiḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi ||8.13.13||

IAST: ā tū gahi pra tu drava matsvā sutasya gomataḥ
Griffith: Speed forward hither, come to us, rejoice thee in the milky draught:
Devanāgarī: आ तू गहि प्र तु द्रव मत्स्वा सुतस्य गोमतः
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | gahi | pra | tu | drava | matsva | sutasya | go-mataḥ || tantum | tanuṣva | pūrvyam | yathā | vide ||8.13.14||

IAST: tantuṁ tanuṣva pūrvyaṁ yathā vide
Griffith: Spin out the thread of ancient time, as well is known.
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | gahi | pra | tu | drava | matsva | sutasya | go-mataḥ || tantum | tanuṣva | pūrvyam | yathā | vide ||8.13.14||

IAST: yac chakrāsi parāvati yad arvāvati vṛtrahan
Griffith: If, Sakra, Vrtra-slayer, thou be far away or near to us.
pada pāṭha: yat | śakra | asi | parā-vati | yat | arvā-vati | vr̥tra-han || yat | vā | samudre | andhasaḥ | avitā | it | asi ||8.13.15||

IAST: yad vā samudre andhaso 'vited asi
Griffith: Or in the sea, thou art the guard of Soma juice.
pada pāṭha: yat | śakra | asi | parā-vati | yat | arvā-vati | vr̥tra-han || yat | vā | samudre | andhasaḥ | avitā | it | asi ||8.13.15||

IAST: indraṁ vardhantu no gira indraṁ sutāsa indavaḥ
Griffith: Let songs we sing and Soma-drops expressed by us make Indra strong:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तु नो गिर इन्द्रं सुतास इन्दवः
pada pāṭha: indram | vardhantu | naḥ | giraḥ | indram | sutāsaḥ | indavaḥ || indre | haviṣmatīḥ | viśaḥ | arāṇiṣuḥ ||8.13.16||

IAST: indre haviṣmatīr viśo arāṇiṣuḥ
Griffith: The tribes who bring oblations find delight in him.
pada pāṭha: indram | vardhantu | naḥ | giraḥ | indram | sutāsaḥ | indavaḥ || indre | haviṣmatīḥ | viśaḥ | arāṇiṣuḥ ||8.13.16||

IAST: tam id viprā avasyavaḥ pravatvatībhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: Him sages longing for his aid, with offerings brought in eager haste,
pada pāṭha: tam | it | viprāḥ | avasyavaḥ | pravatvatībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || indram | kṣoṇīḥ | avardhayan | vayāḥ-iva ||8.13.17||

IAST: indraṁ kṣoṇīr avardhayan vayā iva
Griffith: Him. even as branches, all mankind have made to grow.
pada pāṭha: tam | it | viprāḥ | avasyavaḥ | pravatvatībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || indram | kṣoṇīḥ | avardhayan | vayāḥ-iva ||8.13.17||

IAST: trikadrukeṣu cetanaṁ devāso yajñam atnata
Griffith: At the Trkadrukas the Gods span sacrifice that stirred the mind:
pada pāṭha: tri-kadrukeṣu | cetanam | devāsaḥ | yajñam | atnata || tam | it | vardhantu | naḥ | giraḥ | sadā-vr̥dham ||8.13.18||

IAST: tam id vardhantu no giraḥ sadāvṛdham
Griffith: May our songs strengthen him who still hath strengthened us.
pada pāṭha: tri-kadrukeṣu | cetanam | devāsaḥ | yajñam | atnata || tam | it | vardhantu | naḥ | giraḥ | sadā-vr̥dham ||8.13.18||

IAST: stotā yat te anuvrata ukthāny ṛtuthā dadhe
Griffith: When, true to duty, at due times the worshipper offers lauds to thee,
pada pāṭha: stotā | yat | te | anu-vrataḥ | ukthāni | r̥tu-thā | dadhe || śuciḥ | pāvakaḥ | ucyate | saḥ | adbhutaḥ ||8.13.19||

IAST: śuciḥ pāvaka ucyate so adbhutaḥ
Griffith: They call him Purifier, Pure, and Wonderful.
pada pāṭha: stotā | yat | te | anu-vrataḥ | ukthāni | r̥tu-thā | dadhe || śuciḥ | pāvakaḥ | ucyate | saḥ | adbhutaḥ ||8.13.19||

IAST: tad id rudrasya cetati yahvam pratneṣu dhāmasu
Griffith: That mind of Rudra, fresh and strong, moves conscious in the ancient ways,
pada pāṭha: tat | it | rudrasya | cetati | yahvam | pratneṣu | dhāma-su || manaḥ | yatra | vi | tat | dadhuḥ | vi-cetasaḥ ||8.13.20||

IAST: mano yatrā vi tad dadhur vicetasaḥ
Griffith: With reference whereto the wise have ordered this.
pada pāṭha: tat | it | rudrasya | cetati | yahvam | pratneṣu | dhāma-su || manaḥ | yatra | vi | tat | dadhuḥ | vi-cetasaḥ ||8.13.20||

IAST: yadi me sakhyam āvara imasya pāhy andhasaḥ
Griffith: If thou elect to be my Friend drink of this sacrificial juice,
pada pāṭha: yadi | me | sakhyam | ā-varaḥ | imasya | pāhi | andhasaḥ || yena | viśvāḥ | ati | dviṣaḥ | atārima ||8.13.21||

IAST: yena viśvā ati dviṣo atārima
Griffith: By help whereof we may subdue all enemies.
pada pāṭha: yadi | me | sakhyam | ā-varaḥ | imasya | pāhi | andhasaḥ || yena | viśvāḥ | ati | dviṣaḥ | atārima ||8.13.21||

IAST: kadā ta indra girvaṇaḥ stotā bhavāti śaṁtamaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, Lover of the song, when shall thy praiser be most blest?
Devanāgarī: कदा त इन्द्र गिर्वणः स्तोता भवाति शंतमः
pada pāṭha: kadā | te | indra | girvaṇaḥ | stotā | bhavāti | śam-tamaḥ || kadā | naḥ | gavye | aśvye | vasau | dadhaḥ ||8.13.22||

IAST: kadā no gavye aśvye vasau dadhaḥ
Griffith: When wilt thou grant us wealth in herds of kine and steeds?
Devanāgarī: कदा नो गव्ये अश्व्ये वसौ दधः
pada pāṭha: kadā | te | indra | girvaṇaḥ | stotā | bhavāti | śam-tamaḥ || kadā | naḥ | gavye | aśvye | vasau | dadhaḥ ||8.13.22||

IAST: uta te suṣṭutā harī vṛṣaṇā vahato ratham
Griffith: And thy two highIy-lauded Bays, strong stallions, draw thy car who art
Devanāgarī: उत ते सुष्टुता हरी वृषणा वहतो रथम्
pada pāṭha: uta | te | su-stutā | harī iti | vr̥ṣaṇā | vahataḥ | ratham || ajuryasya | madin-tamam | yam | īmahe ||8.13.23||

IAST: ajuryasya madintamaṁ yam īmahe
Griffith: Untouched by age, most gladdening car for which we pray.
pada pāṭha: uta | te | su-stutā | harī iti | vr̥ṣaṇā | vahataḥ | ratham || ajuryasya | madin-tamam | yam | īmahe ||8.13.23||

IAST: tam īmahe puruṣṭutaṁ yahvam pratnābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: With ancient offerings we implore the Young and Strong whom many praise.
pada pāṭha: tam | īmahe | puru-stutam | yahvam | pratnābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || ni | barhiṣi | priye | sadat | adha | dvitā ||8.13.24||

IAST: ni barhiṣi priye sadad adha dvitā
Griffith: He from of old hath sat upon dear sacred grass.
pada pāṭha: tam | īmahe | puru-stutam | yahvam | pratnābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || ni | barhiṣi | priye | sadat | adha | dvitā ||8.13.24||

IAST: vardhasvā su puruṣṭuta ṛṣiṣṭutābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: Wax miglity, thou whom many laud for aids which Rsis have extolled.
pada pāṭha: vardhasva | su | puru-stuta | r̥ṣi-stutābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || dhukṣasva | pipyuṣīm | iṣam | ava | ca | naḥ ||8.13.25||

IAST: dhukṣasva pipyuṣīm iṣam avā ca naḥ
Griffith: Pour down for us abundant food and guard us well.
pada pāṭha: vardhasva | su | puru-stuta | r̥ṣi-stutābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || dhukṣasva | pipyuṣīm | iṣam | ava | ca | naḥ ||8.13.25||

IAST: indra tvam avited asītthā stuvato adrivaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, Caster of the Stone, thou helpest him who praises thee:
pada pāṭha: indra | tvam | avitā | it | asi | itthā | stuvataḥ | adri-vaḥ || r̥tāt | iyarmi | te | dhiyam | manaḥ-yujam ||8.13.26||

IAST: ṛtād iyarmi te dhiyam manoyujam
Griffith: From sacrifice I send to thee a mindyoked hymn.
pada pāṭha: indra | tvam | avitā | it | asi | itthā | stuvataḥ | adri-vaḥ || r̥tāt | iyarmi | te | dhiyam | manaḥ-yujam ||8.13.26||

IAST: iha tyā sadhamādyā yujānaḥ somapītaye
Griffith: Here, yoking for the Soma-draught these Horses, sharers of thy feast,
pada pāṭha: iha | tyā | sadha-mādyā | yujānaḥ | soma-pītaye || harī iti | indra | pratadvasū iti pratat-vasū | abhi | svara ||8.13.27||

IAST: harī indra pratadvasū abhi svara
Griffith: Thy Bay Steeds, Indra, fraught with weal tb, consent to come.
pada pāṭha: iha | tyā | sadha-mādyā | yujānaḥ | soma-pītaye || harī iti | indra | pratadvasū iti pratat-vasū | abhi | svara ||8.13.27||

IAST: abhi svarantu ye tava rudrāsaḥ sakṣata śriyam
Griffith: Attendants on thy glory, let the Rudras roar assent to thee,
Devanāgarī: अभि स्वरन्तु ये तव रुद्रासः सक्षत श्रियम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | svarantu | ye | tava | rudrāsaḥ | sakṣata | śriyam || uto iti | marutvatīḥ | viśaḥ | abhi | prayaḥ ||8.13.28||

IAST: uto marutvatīr viśo abhi prayaḥ
Griffith: And all the Marut companies come to the feast.
pada pāṭha: abhi | svarantu | ye | tava | rudrāsaḥ | sakṣata | śriyam || uto iti | marutvatīḥ | viśaḥ | abhi | prayaḥ ||8.13.28||

IAST: imā asya pratūrtayaḥ padaṁ juṣanta yad divi
Griffith: These his victorious followers bold in the heavens the place they love,
Devanāgarī: इमा अस्य प्रतूर्तयः पदं जुषन्त यद्दिवि
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | asya | pra-tūrtayaḥ | padam | juṣanta | yat | divi || nābhā | yajñasya | sam | dadhuḥ | yathā | vide ||8.13.29||

IAST: nābhā yajñasya saṁ dadhur yathā vide
Griffith: Leagued in the heart of sacrifice, as well we know.
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | asya | pra-tūrtayaḥ | padam | juṣanta | yat | divi || nābhā | yajñasya | sam | dadhuḥ | yathā | vide ||8.13.29||

IAST: ayaṁ dīrghāya cakṣase prāci prayaty adhvare
Griffith: That we may long behold the light, what time the ordered rite proceeds,
pada pāṭha: ayam | dīrghāya | cakṣase | prāci | pra-yati | adhvare || mimīte | yajñam | ānuṣak | vi-cakṣya ||8.13.30||

IAST: mimīte yajñam ānuṣag vicakṣya
Griffith: He duly measures, as he views, the sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: ayam | dīrghāya | cakṣase | prāci | pra-yati | adhvare || mimīte | yajñam | ānuṣak | vi-cakṣya ||8.13.30||

IAST: vṛṣāyam indra te ratha uto te vṛṣaṇā harī
Griffith: O Indra, strong is this thy car, and strong are these Bay Steeds of thine:
Devanāgarī: वृषायमिन्द्र ते रथ उतो ते वृषणा हरी
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | ayam | indra | te | rathaḥ | uto iti | te | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti || vr̥ṣā | tvam | śatakrato iti śata-krato | vr̥ṣā | havaḥ ||8.13.31||

IAST: vṛṣā tvaṁ śatakrato vṛṣā havaḥ
Griffith: O Satakratu, thou art strong, strong is our call.
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | ayam | indra | te | rathaḥ | uto iti | te | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti || vr̥ṣā | tvam | śatakrato iti śata-krato | vr̥ṣā | havaḥ ||8.13.31||

IAST: vṛṣā grāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṁ sutaḥ
Griffith: Strong is the press-stone, strong thy joy, strong is the flowing Soma juice:
Devanāgarī: वृषा ग्रावा वृषा मदो वृषा सोमो अयं सुतः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | grāvā | vr̥ṣā | madaḥ | vr̥ṣā | somaḥ | ayam | sutaḥ || vr̥ṣā | yajñaḥ | yam | invasi | vr̥ṣā | havaḥ ||8.13.32||

IAST: vṛṣā yajño yam invasi vṛṣā havaḥ
Griffith: Strong is the rite thou furtherest, strong is our call.
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | grāvā | vr̥ṣā | madaḥ | vr̥ṣā | somaḥ | ayam | sutaḥ || vr̥ṣā | yajñaḥ | yam | invasi | vr̥ṣā | havaḥ ||8.13.32||

IAST: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṁ huve vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunderer with thy thousand aids:
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | tvā | vr̥ṣaṇam | huve | vajrin | citrābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || vavantha | hi | prati-stutim | vr̥ṣā | havaḥ ||8.13.33||

IAST: vāvantha hi pratiṣṭutiṁ vṛṣā havaḥ
Griffith: For thou hast won the hymn of praise. Strong is our call.
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | tvā | vr̥ṣaṇam | huve | vajrin | citrābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || vavantha | hi | prati-stutim | vr̥ṣā | havaḥ ||8.13.33||

IAST: yad indrāhaṁ yathā tvam īśīya vasva eka it
Griffith: IF I, O Indra, were, like thee, the single Sovran of all wealth,
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्राहं यथा त्वमीशीय वस्व एक इत्
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | aham | yathā | tvam | īśīya | vasvaḥ | ekaḥ | it || stotā | me | go-sakhā | syāt ||8.14.1||

IAST: stotā me goṣakhā syāt
Griffith: My worshipper should be rich in kine.
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | aham | yathā | tvam | īśīya | vasvaḥ | ekaḥ | it || stotā | me | go-sakhā | syāt ||8.14.1||

IAST: śikṣeyam asmai ditseyaṁ śacīpate manīṣiṇe
Griffith: I should be fain, O Lord of Power, to strengthen and enrich the sage,
pada pāṭha: śikṣeyam | asmai | ditseyam | śacī-pate | manīṣiṇe || yat | aham | go-patiḥ | syām ||8.14.2||

IAST: yad ahaṁ gopatiḥ syām
Griffith: Were I the Lord of herds of kine.
pada pāṭha: śikṣeyam | asmai | ditseyam | śacī-pate | manīṣiṇe || yat | aham | go-patiḥ | syām ||8.14.2||

IAST: dhenuṣ ṭa indra sūnṛtā yajamānāya sunvate
Griffith: To worshippers who press the juice thy goodness, Indra, is a cow
pada pāṭha: dhenuḥ | te | indra | sūnr̥tā | yajamānāya | sunvate || gām | aśvam | pipyuṣī | duhe ||8.14.3||

IAST: gām aśvam pipyuṣī duhe
Griffith: Yielding in plenty kine and steeds.
pada pāṭha: dhenuḥ | te | indra | sūnr̥tā | yajamānāya | sunvate || gām | aśvam | pipyuṣī | duhe ||8.14.3||

IAST: na te vartāsti rādhasa indra devo na martyaḥ
Griffith: None is there, Indra, God or man, to hinder thy munificence,
Devanāgarī: न ते वर्तास्ति राधस इन्द्र देवो न मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: na | te | vartā | asti | rādhasaḥ | indra | devaḥ | na | martyaḥ || yat | ditsasi | stutaḥ | magham ||8.14.4||

IAST: yad ditsasi stuto magham
Griffith: The wealth which, lauded, thou wilt give.
pada pāṭha: na | te | vartā | asti | rādhasaḥ | indra | devaḥ | na | martyaḥ || yat | ditsasi | stutaḥ | magham ||8.14.4||

IAST: yajña indram avardhayad yad bhūmiṁ vy avartayat
Griffith: The sacrifice made Indra strong when he unrolled the earth, and made
pada pāṭha: yajñaḥ | indram | avardhayat | yat | bhūmim | vi | avartayat || cakrāṇaḥ | opaśam | divi ||8.14.5||

IAST: cakrāṇa opaśaṁ divi
Griffith: Himself a diadem in heaven.
pada pāṭha: yajñaḥ | indram | avardhayat | yat | bhūmim | vi | avartayat || cakrāṇaḥ | opaśam | divi ||8.14.5||

IAST: vāvṛdhānasya te vayaṁ viśvā dhanāni jigyuṣaḥ
Griffith: Thine aid we claim, O Indra, thine who after thou hast waxen great
Devanāgarī: वावृधानस्य ते वयं विश्वा धनानि जिग्युषः
pada pāṭha: vāvr̥dhānasya | te | vayam | viśvā | dhanāni | jigyuṣaḥ || ūtim | indra | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe ||8.14.6||

IAST: ūtim indrā vṛṇīmahe
Griffith: Hast won all treasures for thine own.
pada pāṭha: vāvr̥dhānasya | te | vayam | viśvā | dhanāni | jigyuṣaḥ || ūtim | indra | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe ||8.14.6||

IAST: vy antarikṣam atiran made somasya rocanā
Griffith: In Soma's ecstasy Indra spread the firmament and realms of light,
pada pāṭha: vi | antarikṣam | atirat | made | somasya | rocanā || indraḥ | yat | abhinat | valam ||8.14.7||

IAST: indro yad abhinad valam
Griffith: When he cleft Vala limb from limb.
pada pāṭha: vi | antarikṣam | atirat | made | somasya | rocanā || indraḥ | yat | abhinat | valam ||8.14.7||

IAST: ud gā ājad aṅgirobhya āviṣ kṛṇvan guhā satīḥ
Griffith: Showing the hidden he drave forth the cows for the Angirases,
pada pāṭha: ut | gāḥ | ājat | aṅgiraḥ-bhyaḥ | āviḥ | kr̥ṇvan | guhā | satīḥ || arvāñcam | nunude | valam ||8.14.8||

IAST: arvāñcaṁ nunude valam
Griffith: And Vala he cast headlong down.
pada pāṭha: ut | gāḥ | ājat | aṅgiraḥ-bhyaḥ | āviḥ | kr̥ṇvan | guhā | satīḥ || arvāñcam | nunude | valam ||8.14.8||

IAST: indreṇa rocanā divo dṛḻhāni dṛṁhitāni ca
Griffith: By Indra were the lumirious realms of heaven established and secured,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेण रोचना दिवो दृळ्हानि दृंहितानि च
pada pāṭha: indreṇa | rocanā | divaḥ | dr̥ḷhāni | dr̥ṁhitāni | ca || sthirāṇi | na | parā-nude ||8.14.9||

IAST: sthirāṇi na parāṇude
Griffith: Firm and immovable from their place.
pada pāṭha: indreṇa | rocanā | divaḥ | dr̥ḷhāni | dr̥ṁhitāni | ca || sthirāṇi | na | parā-nude ||8.14.9||

IAST: apām ūrmir madann iva stoma indrājirāyate
Griffith: Indra, thy laud moves quickly like a joyous wave of water-floods:
pada pāṭha: apām | ūrmiḥ | madan-iva | stomaḥ | indra | ajira-yate || vi | te | madāḥ | arājiṣuḥ ||8.14.10||

IAST: vi te madā arājiṣuḥ
Griffith: Bright shine the drops that gladden thee.
pada pāṭha: apām | ūrmiḥ | madan-iva | stomaḥ | indra | ajira-yate || vi | te | madāḥ | arājiṣuḥ ||8.14.10||

IAST: tvaṁ hi stomavardhana indrāsy ukthavardhanaḥ
Griffith: For thou, O Indra, art the God whom hymns and praises magnify:
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | stoma-vardhanaḥ | indra | asi | uktha-vardhanaḥ || stotr̥̄ṇām | uta | bhadra-kr̥t ||8.14.11||

IAST: stotṝṇām uta bhadrakṛt
Griffith: Thou blessest those who worship thee.
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | stoma-vardhanaḥ | indra | asi | uktha-vardhanaḥ || stotr̥̄ṇām | uta | bhadra-kr̥t ||8.14.11||

IAST: indram it keśinā harī somapeyāya vakṣataḥ
Griffith: Let the two long-maned Bay Steeds bring Indra to drink the Soma juice,
pada pāṭha: indram | it | keśinā | harī iti | soma-peyāya | vakṣataḥ || upa | yajñam | su-rādhasam ||8.14.12||

IAST: upa yajñaṁ surādhasam
Griffith: The Bountiful to our sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: indram | it | keśinā | harī iti | soma-peyāya | vakṣataḥ || upa | yajñam | su-rādhasam ||8.14.12||

IAST: apām phenena namuceḥ śira indrod avartayaḥ
Griffith: With waters' foam thou torest off, Indra, the head of Namuci,
pada pāṭha: apām | phenena | namuceḥ | śiraḥ | indra | ut | avartaycaḥ || viśvāḥ | yat | ajayaḥ | spr̥dhaḥ ||8.14.13||

IAST: viśvā yad ajayaḥ spṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Subduing all contending hosts.
pada pāṭha: apām | phenena | namuceḥ | śiraḥ | indra | ut | avartaycaḥ || viśvāḥ | yat | ajayaḥ | spr̥dhaḥ ||8.14.13||

IAST: māyābhir utsisṛpsata indra dyām ārurukṣataḥ
Griffith: The Dasyus, when they fain would climb by magic arts and mount to heaven,
pada pāṭha: māyābhiḥ | ut-sisr̥psataḥ | indra | dyām | ā-rurukṣataḥ || ava | dasyūn | adhūnuthāḥ ||8.14.14||

IAST: ava dasyūm̐r adhūnuthāḥ
Griffith: Thou, Indra, castest down to earth.
pada pāṭha: māyābhiḥ | ut-sisr̥psataḥ | indra | dyām | ā-rurukṣataḥ || ava | dasyūn | adhūnuthāḥ ||8.14.14||

IAST: asunvām indra saṁsadaṁ viṣūcīṁ vy anāśayaḥ
Griffith: As Soma-drinker conquering all, thou scatteredst to every side
pada pāṭha: asunvām | indra | sam-sadam | viṣūcīm | vi | anāśayaḥ || soma-pāḥ | ut-taraḥ | bhavan ||8.14.15||

IAST: somapā uttaro bhavan
Griffith: Their settlement who poured no gifts.
pada pāṭha: asunvām | indra | sam-sadam | viṣūcīm | vi | anāśayaḥ || soma-pāḥ | ut-taraḥ | bhavan ||8.14.15||

IAST: tam v abhi pra gāyata puruhūtam puruṣṭutam
Griffith: SING forth to him whom many men invoke, to him whom many laud.
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | abhi | pra | gāyata | puru-hūtam | puru-stutam || indram | gīḥ-bhiḥ | taviṣam | ā | vivāsata ||8.15.1||

IAST: indraṁ gīrbhis taviṣam ā vivāsata
Griffith: Invite the powerful Indra with your songs of praise.
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | abhi | pra | gāyata | puru-hūtam | puru-stutam || indram | gīḥ-bhiḥ | taviṣam | ā | vivāsata ||8.15.1||

IAST: yasya dvibarhaso bṛhat saho dādhāra rodasī
Griffith: Whose lofty might-for doubly strong is he-supports the heavens and earth,
pada pāṭha: yasya | dvi-barhasaḥ | br̥hat | sahaḥ | dādhāra | rodasī iti || girīn | ajrān | apaḥ | svaḥ | vr̥ṣa-tvanā ||8.15.2||

IAST: girīm̐r ajrām̐ apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā
Griffith: And hills and plains and floods and light with manly power.
pada pāṭha: yasya | dvi-barhasaḥ | br̥hat | sahaḥ | dādhāra | rodasī iti || girīn | ajrān | apaḥ | svaḥ | vr̥ṣa-tvanā ||8.15.2||

IAST: sa rājasi puruṣṭutam̐ eko vṛtrāṇi jighnase
Griffith: Such, Praised by many! thou art King alone thou smitest Vrtras dead,
Devanāgarī: स राजसि पुरुष्टुतँ एको वृत्राणि जिघ्नसे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | rājasi | puru-stuta | ekaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jighnase || indra | jaitrā | śravasyā | ca | yantave ||8.15.3||

IAST: indra jaitrā śravasyā ca yantave
Griffith: To gain, O Indra, spoils of war and high renown.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | rājasi | puru-stuta | ekaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jighnase || indra | jaitrā | śravasyā | ca | yantave ||8.15.3||

IAST: taṁ te madaṁ gṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇam pṛtsu sāsahim
Griffith: We sing this strong and wild delight of thine which conquers in the fray,
Devanāgarī: तं ते मदं गृणीमसि वृषणं पृत्सु सासहिम्
pada pāṭha: tam | te | madam | gr̥ṇīmasi | vr̥ṣaṇam | pr̥t-su | sasahim || ūm̐ iti | loka-kr̥tnum | adri-vaḥ | hari-śriyam ||8.15.4||

IAST: u lokakṛtnum adrivo hariśriyam
Griffith: Which, Caster of the Stone! gives room and shines like gold.
pada pāṭha: tam | te | madam | gr̥ṇīmasi | vr̥ṣaṇam | pr̥t-su | sasahim || ūm̐ iti | loka-kr̥tnum | adri-vaḥ | hari-śriyam ||8.15.4||

IAST: yena jyotīṁṣy āyave manave ca viveditha
Griffith: Wherewith thou also foundest lights for Ayu and for Manu's sake:
pada pāṭha: yena | jyotīṁṣi | āyave | manave | ca | viveditha || mandānaḥ | asya | barhiṣaḥ | vi | rājasi ||8.15.5||

IAST: mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi
Griffith: Now joying in this sacred grass thou beamest forth.
pada pāṭha: yena | jyotīṁṣi | āyave | manave | ca | viveditha || mandānaḥ | asya | barhiṣaḥ | vi | rājasi ||8.15.5||

IAST: tad adyā cit ta ukthino 'nu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā
Griffith: This day too singers of the hymn praise, as of old, this might of thine:
pada pāṭha: tat | adya | cit | te | ukthinaḥ | anu | stuvanti | pūrva-thā || vr̥ṣa-patnīḥ | apaḥ | jaya | dive-dive ||8.15.6||

IAST: vṛṣapatnīr apo jayā dive-dive
Griffith: Win thou the waters day by day, thralls of the strong.
pada pāṭha: tat | adya | cit | te | ukthinaḥ | anu | stuvanti | pūrva-thā || vr̥ṣa-patnīḥ | apaḥ | jaya | dive-dive ||8.15.6||

IAST: tava tyad indriyam bṛhat tava śuṣmam uta kratum
Griffith: That lofty Indra-power of thine, thy strength and thine intelligence,
pada pāṭha: tava | tyat | indriyam | br̥hat | tava | śuṣmam | uta | kratum || vajram | śiśāti | dhiṣaṇā | vareṇyam ||8.15.7||

IAST: vajraṁ śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam
Griffith: Thy thunderbolt for which we long, the wish makes keen.
pada pāṭha: tava | tyat | indriyam | br̥hat | tava | śuṣmam | uta | kratum || vajram | śiśāti | dhiṣaṇā | vareṇyam ||8.15.7||

IAST: tava dyaur indra pauṁsyam pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, Heaven and Earth augment thy manly power and thy renown;
Devanāgarī: तव द्यौरिन्द्र पौंस्यं पृथिवी वर्धति श्रवः
pada pāṭha: tava | dyauḥ | indra | pauṁsyam | pr̥thivī | vardhati | śravaḥ || tvām | āpaḥ | parvatāsaḥ | ca | hinvire ||8.15.8||

IAST: tvām āpaḥ parvatāsaś ca hinvire
Griffith: The waters and thy mountains stir and urge thee on.
pada pāṭha: tava | dyauḥ | indra | pauṁsyam | pr̥thivī | vardhati | śravaḥ || tvām | āpaḥ | parvatāsaḥ | ca | hinvire ||8.15.8||

IAST: tvāṁ viṣṇur bṛhan kṣayo mitro gṛṇāti varuṇaḥ
Griffith: Visnu the lofty ruling Power, Varuna, Mitra sing thy praise:
pada pāṭha: tvām | viṣṇuḥ | br̥han | kṣayaḥ | mitraḥ | gr̥ṇāti | varuṇaḥ || tvām | śardhaḥ | madati | anu | mārutam ||8.15.9||

IAST: tvāṁ śardho madaty anu mārutam
Griffith: In thee the Marut' company have great delight.
pada pāṭha: tvām | viṣṇuḥ | br̥han | kṣayaḥ | mitraḥ | gr̥ṇāti | varuṇaḥ || tvām | śardhaḥ | madati | anu | mārutam ||8.15.9||

IAST: tvaṁ vṛṣā janānām maṁhiṣṭha indra jajñiṣe
Griffith: O Indra, thou wast born the Lord of men, most liberal of thy gifts:
Devanāgarī: त्वं वृषा जनानां मंहिष्ठ इन्द्र जज्ञिषे
pada pāṭha: tvam | vr̥ṣā | janānām | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | indra | jajñiṣe || satrā | viśvā | su-apatyāni | dadhiṣe ||8.15.10||

IAST: satrā viśvā svapatyāni dadhiṣe
Griffith: Excellent deeds for evermore are all thine own.
pada pāṭha: tvam | vr̥ṣā | janānām | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | indra | jajñiṣe || satrā | viśvā | su-apatyāni | dadhiṣe ||8.15.10||

IAST: satrā tvam puruṣṭutam̐ eko vṛtrāṇi tośase
Griffith: Ever, alone, O highly-praised, thou sendest Vrtras to their rest:
Devanāgarī: सत्रा त्वं पुरुष्टुतँ एको वृत्राणि तोशसे
pada pāṭha: satrā | tvam | puru-stuta | ekaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | tośase || na | anyaḥ | indrāt | karaṇam | bhūyaḥ | invati ||8.15.11||

IAST: nānya indrāt karaṇam bhūya invati
Griffith: None else than Indra executes the mighty deed.
pada pāṭha: satrā | tvam | puru-stuta | ekaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | tośase || na | anyaḥ | indrāt | karaṇam | bhūyaḥ | invati ||8.15.11||

IAST: yad indra manmaśas tvā nānā havanta ūtaye
Griffith: Though here and there, in varied hymns, Indra, men call on thee for aid,
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | manma-śaḥ | tvā | nānā | havante | ūtaye || asmākebhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | atra | svaḥ | jaya ||8.15.12||

IAST: asmākebhir nṛbhir atrā svar jaya
Griffith: Still with our heroes fight and win the light of heaven.
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | manma-śaḥ | tvā | nānā | havante | ūtaye || asmākebhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | atra | svaḥ | jaya ||8.15.12||

IAST: araṁ kṣayāya no mahe viśvā rūpāṇy āviśan
Griffith: Already have all forms of him entered our spacious dwelling-place:
Devanāgarī: अरं क्षयाय नो महे विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन्
pada pāṭha: aram | kṣayāya | naḥ | mahe | viśvā | rūpāṇi | ā-viśan || indram | jaitrāya | harṣaya | śacī-patim ||8.15.13||

IAST: indraṁ jaitrāya harṣayā śacīpatim
Griffith: For victory stir thou Indra, up, the Lord of Might.
pada pāṭha: aram | kṣayāya | naḥ | mahe | viśvā | rūpāṇi | ā-viśan || indram | jaitrāya | harṣaya | śacī-patim ||8.15.13||

IAST: pra samrājaṁ carṣaṇīnām indraṁ stotā navyaṁ gīrbhiḥ
Griffith: PRAISE Indra whom our songs must laud, sole Sovran of mankind, the Chief
Devanāgarī: प्र सम्राजं चर्षणीनामिन्द्रं स्तोता नव्यं गीर्भिः
pada pāṭha: pra | sam-rājam | carṣaṇīnām | indram | stotā | navyam | gīḥ-bhiḥ || naram | nr̥-saham | maṁhiṣṭham ||8.16.1||

IAST: naraṁ nṛṣāham maṁhiṣṭham
Griffith: Most liberal who controlleth men.
pada pāṭha: pra | sam-rājam | carṣaṇīnām | indram | stotā | navyam | gīḥ-bhiḥ || naram | nr̥-saham | maṁhiṣṭham ||8.16.1||

IAST: yasminn ukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasyā
Griffith: In whom the hymns of praise delight, and all the glory-giving songs.
pada pāṭha: yasmin | ukthāni | raṇyanti | viśvāni | ca | śravasyā || apām | avaḥ | na | samudre ||8.16.2||

IAST: apām avo na samudre
Griffith: Like the floods' longing for the sea.
pada pāṭha: yasmin | ukthāni | raṇyanti | viśvāni | ca | śravasyā || apām | avaḥ | na | samudre ||8.16.2||

IAST: taṁ suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭharājam bhare kṛtnum
Griffith: Him I invite with eulogy, best King, effective in the fight,
Devanāgarī: तं सुष्टुत्या विवासे ज्येष्ठराजं भरे कृत्नुम्
pada pāṭha: tam | su-stutyā | ā | vivāse | jyeṣṭha-rājam | bhare | kr̥tnum || mahaḥ | vājinam | sani-bhyaḥ ||8.16.3||

IAST: maho vājinaṁ sanibhyaḥ
Griffith: Strong for the gain of mighty spoil.
pada pāṭha: tam | su-stutyā | ā | vivāse | jyeṣṭha-rājam | bhare | kr̥tnum || mahaḥ | vājinam | sani-bhyaḥ ||8.16.3||

IAST: yasyānūnā gabhīrā madā uravas tarutrāḥ
Griffith: Whose perfect ecstasies are wide, profound, victorious, and give
pada pāṭha: yasya | anūnāḥ | gabhīrāḥ | madāḥ | uravaḥ | tarutrāḥ || harṣu-mantaḥ | śūra-sātau ||8.16.4||

IAST: harṣumantaḥ śūrasātau
Griffith: joy in the field where heroes win.
pada pāṭha: yasya | anūnāḥ | gabhīrāḥ | madāḥ | uravaḥ | tarutrāḥ || harṣu-mantaḥ | śūra-sātau ||8.16.4||

IAST: tam id dhaneṣu hiteṣv adhivākāya havante
Griffith: Him, when the spoils of war are staked, men call to be their advocate:
pada pāṭha: tam | it | dhaneṣu | hiteṣu | adhi-vākāya | havante || yeṣām | indraḥ | te | jayanti ||8.16.5||

IAST: yeṣām indras te jayanti
Griffith: They who have Indra win the day.
pada pāṭha: tam | it | dhaneṣu | hiteṣu | adhi-vākāya | havante || yeṣām | indraḥ | te | jayanti ||8.16.5||

IAST: tam ic cyautnair āryanti taṁ kṛtebhiś carṣaṇayaḥ
Griffith: Men honour him with stirring songs and magnify with solemn rites:
pada pāṭha: tam | it | cyautnaiḥ | āryanti | tam | kr̥tebhiḥ | carṣaṇayaḥ || eṣaḥ | indraḥ | varivaḥ-kr̥t ||8.16.6||

IAST: eṣa indro varivaskṛt
Griffith: Indra is he who giveth case.
pada pāṭha: tam | it | cyautnaiḥ | āryanti | tam | kr̥tebhiḥ | carṣaṇayaḥ || eṣaḥ | indraḥ | varivaḥ-kr̥t ||8.16.6||

IAST: indro brahmendra ṛṣir indraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ
Griffith: ndra is priest and Rsi, he is much invoked by many men,
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | brahmā | indraḥ | r̥ṣiḥ | indraḥ | puru | puru-hūtaḥ || mahān | mahībhiḥ | śacībhiḥ ||8.16.7||

IAST: mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ
Griffith: And mighty by his mighty powers.
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | brahmā | indraḥ | r̥ṣiḥ | indraḥ | puru | puru-hūtaḥ || mahān | mahībhiḥ | śacībhiḥ ||8.16.7||

IAST: sa stomyaḥ sa havyaḥ satyaḥ satvā tuvikūrmiḥ
Griffith: Meet to be lauded and invoked, true Hero with his deeds of might,
Devanāgarī: स स्तोम्यः स हव्यः सत्यः सत्वा तुविकूर्मिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | stomyaḥ | saḥ | havyaḥ | satyaḥ | satvā | tuvi-kūrmiḥ || ekaḥ | cit | san | abhi-bhūtiḥ ||8.16.8||

IAST: ekaś cit sann abhibhūtiḥ
Griffith: Victorious even when alone.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | stomyaḥ | saḥ | havyaḥ | satyaḥ | satvā | tuvi-kūrmiḥ || ekaḥ | cit | san | abhi-bhūtiḥ ||8.16.8||

IAST: tam arkebhis taṁ sāmabhis taṁ gāyatraiś carṣaṇayaḥ
Griffith: The men, the people magnify that Indra with their Slina. songs,
pada pāṭha: tam | arkebhiḥ | tam | sāma-bhiḥ | tam | gāyatraiḥ | carṣaṇayaḥ || indram | vardhanti | kṣitayaḥ ||8.16.9||

IAST: indraṁ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ
Griffith: With hymns and sacred eulogies
pada pāṭha: tam | arkebhiḥ | tam | sāma-bhiḥ | tam | gāyatraiḥ | carṣaṇayaḥ || indram | vardhanti | kṣitayaḥ ||8.16.9||

IAST: praṇetāraṁ vasyo acchā kartāraṁ jyotiḥ samatsu
Griffith: Him who advances them to wealth, sends light to lead them in the war,
Devanāgarī: प्रणेतारं वस्यो अच्छा कर्तारं ज्योतिः समत्सु
pada pāṭha: pra-netāram | vasyaḥ | accha | kartāram | jyotiḥ | samat-su || sasahvāṁsam | yudhā | amitrān ||8.16.10||

IAST: sāsahvāṁsaṁ yudhāmitrān
Griffith: And quells their foemen in the fray.
pada pāṭha: pra-netāram | vasyaḥ | accha | kartāram | jyotiḥ | samat-su || sasahvāṁsam | yudhā | amitrān ||8.16.10||

IAST: sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ
Griffith: May he, the saviour much-invoked, may Indra bear us in a ship
Devanāgarī: स नः पप्रिः पारयाति स्वस्ति नावा पुरुहूतः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | papriḥ | pārayāti | svasti | nāvā | puru-hūtaḥ || indraḥ | viśvāḥ | ati | dviṣaḥ ||8.16.11||

IAST: indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: Safely beyond all enemies.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | papriḥ | pārayāti | svasti | nāvā | puru-hūtaḥ || indraḥ | viśvāḥ | ati | dviṣaḥ ||8.16.11||

IAST: sa tvaṁ na indra vājebhir daśasyā ca gātuyā ca
Griffith: As such, O Indra, honour us with gifts of booty, further us,
Devanāgarī: स त्वं न इन्द्र वाजेभिर्दशस्या च गातुया च
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | indra | vājebhiḥ | daśasya | ca | gātu-ya | ca || accha | ca | naḥ | sumnam | neṣi ||8.16.12||

IAST: acchā ca naḥ sumnaṁ neṣi
Griffith: And lead us to felicity.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | indra | vājebhiḥ | daśasya | ca | gātu-ya | ca || accha | ca | naḥ | sumnam | neṣi ||8.16.12||

IAST: ā yāhi suṣumā hi ta indra somam pibā imam
Griffith: COME, we have pressed the juice for thee; O Indra, drink this Soma here
Devanāgarī: आ याहि सुषुमा हि त इन्द्र सोमं पिबा इमम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | susuma | hi | te | indra | somam | piba | imam || ā | idam | barhiḥ | sadaḥ | mama ||8.17.1||

IAST: edam barhiḥ sado mama
Griffith: Sit thou on this my sacred grass.
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | susuma | hi | te | indra | somam | piba | imam || ā | idam | barhiḥ | sadaḥ | mama ||8.17.1||

IAST: ā tvā brahmayujā harī vahatām indra keśinā
Griffith: O Indra, let thy long-maned Bays, yoked by prayer, bring thee hitherward
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा ब्रह्मयुजा हरी वहतामिन्द्र केशिना
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | brahma-yujā | harī iti | vahatām | indra | keśinā || upa | brahmāṇi | naḥ | śr̥ṇu ||8.17.2||

IAST: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu
Griffith: Give car and listen to our prayers.
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | brahma-yujā | harī iti | vahatām | indra | keśinā || upa | brahmāṇi | naḥ | śr̥ṇu ||8.17.2||

IAST: brahmāṇas tvā vayaṁ yujā somapām indra sominaḥ
Griffith: We Soma-bearing Brahmans call thee Soma-drinker with thy friend,
pada pāṭha: brahmāṇaḥ | tvā | vayam | yujā | soma-pām | indra | sominaḥ || suta-vantaḥ | havāmahe ||8.17.3||

IAST: sutāvanto havāmahe
Griffith: We, Indra, bringing Soma juice.
pada pāṭha: brahmāṇaḥ | tvā | vayam | yujā | soma-pām | indra | sominaḥ || suta-vantaḥ | havāmahe ||8.17.3||

IAST: ā no yāhi sutāvato 'smākaṁ suṣṭutīr upa
Griffith: Come unto us who bring the juice, come unto this our eulogy,
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yāhi | suta-vataḥ | asmākam | su-stutīḥ | upa || piba | su | śiprin | andhasaḥ ||8.17.4||

IAST: pibā su śiprinn andhasaḥ
Griffith: Fair-visored! drink thou of the juice.
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yāhi | suta-vataḥ | asmākam | su-stutīḥ | upa || piba | su | śiprin | andhasaḥ ||8.17.4||

IAST: ā te siñcāmi kukṣyor anu gātrā vi dhāvatu
Griffith: I pour it down within thee, so through all thy members let it spread:
Devanāgarī: आ ते सिञ्चामि कुक्ष्योरनु गात्रा वि धावतु
pada pāṭha: ā | te | siñcāmi | kukṣyoḥ | anu | gātrā | vi | dhāvatu || gr̥bhāya | jihvayā | madhu ||8.17.5||

IAST: gṛbhāya jihvayā madhu
Griffith: Take with. thy tongue the pleasant drink.
pada pāṭha: ā | te | siñcāmi | kukṣyoḥ | anu | gātrā | vi | dhāvatu || gr̥bhāya | jihvayā | madhu ||8.17.5||

IAST: svāduṣ ṭe astu saṁsude madhumān tanve tava
Griffith: Sweet to thy body let it be, delicious be the savoury juice:
pada pāṭha: svāduḥ | te | astu | sam-sude | madhu-mān | tanve | tava || somaḥ | śam | astu | te | hr̥de ||8.17.6||

IAST: somaḥ śam astu te hṛde
Griffith: Sweet be the Soma to thine heart.
pada pāṭha: svāduḥ | te | astu | sam-sude | madhu-mān | tanve | tava || somaḥ | śam | astu | te | hr̥de ||8.17.6||

IAST: ayam u tvā vicarṣaṇe janīr ivābhi saṁvṛtaḥ
Griffith: Like women, let this Soma-draught, invested with its robe, approach,
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | vi-carṣaṇe | janīḥ-iva | abhi | sam-vr̥taḥ || pra | somaḥ | indra | sarpatu ||8.17.7||

IAST: pra soma indra sarpatu
Griffith: O active Indra, close to thee.
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | vi-carṣaṇe | janīḥ-iva | abhi | sam-vr̥taḥ || pra | somaḥ | indra | sarpatu ||8.17.7||

IAST: tuvigrīvo vapodaraḥ subāhur andhaso made
Griffith: Indra, transported with the juice, vast in his bulk, strong in his neck
pada pāṭha: tuvi-grīvaḥ | vapā-udaraḥ | su-bāhuḥ | andhasaḥ | made || indraḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jighnate ||8.17.8||

IAST: indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate
Griffith: And stout arms, smites the Vrtras down.
pada pāṭha: tuvi-grīvaḥ | vapā-udaraḥ | su-bāhuḥ | andhasaḥ | made || indraḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jighnate ||8.17.8||

IAST: indra prehi puras tvaṁ viśvasyeśāna ojasā
Griffith: O Indra, go thou forward, thou who rulest over all by might:
pada pāṭha: indra | pra | ihi | puraḥ | tvam | viśvasya | īśānaḥ | ojasā || vr̥trāṇi | vr̥tra-han | jahi ||8.17.9||

IAST: vṛtrāṇi vṛtrahañ jahi
Griffith: Thou Vrtra-slayer slay the fiends,
pada pāṭha: indra | pra | ihi | puraḥ | tvam | viśvasya | īśānaḥ | ojasā || vr̥trāṇi | vr̥tra-han | jahi ||8.17.9||

IAST: dīrghas te astv aṅkuśo yenā vasu prayacchasi
Griffith: Long be thy grasping-hook wherewith thou givest ample wealth to him
pada pāṭha: dīrghaḥ | te | astu | aṅkuśaḥ | yena | vasu | pra-yacchasi || yajamānāya | sunvate ||8.17.10||

IAST: yajamānāya sunvate
Griffith: Who sheds the juice and worships thee.
pada pāṭha: dīrghaḥ | te | astu | aṅkuśaḥ | yena | vasu | pra-yacchasi || yajamānāya | sunvate ||8.17.10||

IAST: ayaṁ ta indra somo nipūto adhi barhiṣi
Griffith: Here, Indra, is thy Soma-draught, made pure upon the sacred grass:
Devanāgarī: अयं त इन्द्र सोमो निपूतो अधि बर्हिषि
pada pāṭha: ayam | te | indra | somaḥ | ni-pūtaḥ | adhi | barhiṣi || ā | ihi | īm | asya | drava | piba ||8.17.11||

IAST: ehīm asya dravā piba
Griffith: Run hither, come and drink thereof.
pada pāṭha: ayam | te | indra | somaḥ | ni-pūtaḥ | adhi | barhiṣi || ā | ihi | īm | asya | drava | piba ||8.17.11||

IAST: śācigo śācipūjanāyaṁ raṇāya te sutaḥ
Griffith: Famed for thy radiance, worshipped well this juice is shed for thy delight
pada pāṭha: śācigo iti śāci-go | śāci-pūjana | ayam | raṇāya | te | sutaḥ || ākhaṇḍala | pra | hūyase ||8.17.12||

IAST: ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase
Griffith: Thou art invoked, Akhandala!
pada pāṭha: śācigo iti śāci-go | śāci-pūjana | ayam | raṇāya | te | sutaḥ || ākhaṇḍala | pra | hūyase ||8.17.12||

IAST: yas te śṛṅgavṛṣo napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ
Griffith: To Kundapayya, grandson's son, grandson of Srngavrs! to thee,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | śr̥ṅga-vr̥ṣaḥ | napāt | pranapāditi pra-napāt | kuṇḍa-pāyyaḥ || ni | asmin | dadhre | ā | manaḥ ||8.17.13||

IAST: ny asmin dadhra ā manaḥ
Griffith: To him have I addressed my thought.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | śr̥ṅga-vr̥ṣaḥ | napāt | pranapāditi pra-napāt | kuṇḍa-pāyyaḥ || ni | asmin | dadhre | ā | manaḥ ||8.17.13||

IAST: vāstoṣ pate dhruvā sthūṇāṁsatraṁ somyānām
Griffith: Strong pillar thou, Lord of the home armour of Soma-offerers:
pada pāṭha: vāstoḥ | pate | dhruvā | sthūṇā | aṁsatram | somyānām || drapsaḥ | bhettā | purām | śaśvatīnām | indraḥ | munīnām | sakhā ||8.17.14||

IAST: drapso bhettā purāṁ śaśvatīnām indro munīnāṁ sakhā
Griffith: The drop of Soma breaketh all the strongholds down, and Indra is the Rsis' Friend.
Devanāgarī: द्रप्सो भेत्ता पुरां शश्वतीनामिन्द्रो मुनीनां सखा
pada pāṭha: vāstoḥ | pate | dhruvā | sthūṇā | aṁsatram | somyānām || drapsaḥ | bhettā | purām | śaśvatīnām | indraḥ | munīnām | sakhā ||8.17.14||

IAST: pṛdākusānur yajato gaveṣaṇa ekaḥ sann abhi bhūyasaḥ
Griffith: Holy Prdikusanu, winner of the spoil, one eminent o'er many men,
pada pāṭha: pr̥dāku-sānuḥ | yajataḥ | go-eṣaṇaḥ | ekaḥ | san | abhi | bhūyasaḥ || bhūrṇim | aśvam | nayat | tujā | puraḥ | gr̥bhā | indram | somasya | pītaye ||8.17.15||

IAST: bhūrṇim aśvaṁ nayat tujā puro gṛbhendraṁ somasya pītaye
Griffith: Lead on the wild horse Indra with his vigorous grasp forward to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: भूर्णिमश्वं नयत्तुजा पुरो गृभेन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: pr̥dāku-sānuḥ | yajataḥ | go-eṣaṇaḥ | ekaḥ | san | abhi | bhūyasaḥ || bhūrṇim | aśvam | nayat | tujā | puraḥ | gr̥bhā | indram | somasya | pītaye ||8.17.15||

IAST: idaṁ ha nūnam eṣāṁ sumnam bhikṣeta martyaḥ
Griffith: Now let the mortal offer prayer to win the unexampled grace
Devanāgarī: इदं ह नूनमेषां सुम्नं भिक्षेत मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: idam | ha | nūnam | eṣām | sumnam | bhikṣeta | martyaḥ || ādityānām | apūrvyam | savīmani ||8.18.1||

IAST: ādityānām apūrvyaṁ savīmani
Griffith: Of these Adityas and their aid to cherish life.
pada pāṭha: idam | ha | nūnam | eṣām | sumnam | bhikṣeta | martyaḥ || ādityānām | apūrvyam | savīmani ||8.18.1||

IAST: anarvāṇo hy eṣām panthā ādityānām
Griffith: For not an enemy molests the paths which these Adityas tread:
pada pāṭha: anarvāṇaḥ | hi | eṣām | panthā | ādityānām || adabdhāḥ | santi | pāyavaḥ | suge-vr̥dhaḥ ||8.18.2||

IAST: adabdhāḥ santi pāyavaḥ sugevṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Infallible guards, they strengthen us in happiness.
pada pāṭha: anarvāṇaḥ | hi | eṣām | panthā | ādityānām || adabdhāḥ | santi | pāyavaḥ | suge-vr̥dhaḥ ||8.18.2||

IAST: tat su naḥ savitā bhago varuṇo mitro aryamā
Griffith: Now soon may Bhaga, Savitar, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman
Devanāgarī: तत्सु नः सविता भगो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | savitā | bhagaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || śarma | yacchantu | sa-prathaḥ | yat | īmahe ||8.18.3||

IAST: śarma yacchantu sapratho yad īmahe
Griffith: Give us the shelter widely spread which we implore.
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | savitā | bhagaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || śarma | yacchantu | sa-prathaḥ | yat | īmahe ||8.18.3||

IAST: devebhir devy adite 'riṣṭabharmann ā gahi
Griffith: With Gods come thou whose fostering care none checks, O Goddesss Aditi:
pada pāṭha: devebhiḥ | devi | adite | ariṣṭa-bharman | ā | gahi || smat | sūri-bhiḥ | puru-priye | suśarma-bhiḥ ||8.18.4||

IAST: smat sūribhiḥ purupriye suśarmabhiḥ
Griffith: Come, dear to many, with the Lords who guard us well.
pada pāṭha: devebhiḥ | devi | adite | ariṣṭa-bharman | ā | gahi || smat | sūri-bhiḥ | puru-priye | suśarma-bhiḥ ||8.18.4||

IAST: te hi putrāso aditer vidur dveṣāṁsi yotave
Griffith: For well these Sons of Aditi know to keep enmities aloof,
pada pāṭha: te | hi | putrāsaḥ | aditeḥ | viduḥ | dveṣāṁsi | yotave || aṁhoḥ | cit | uru-cakrayaḥ | anehasaḥ ||8.18.5||

IAST: aṁhoś cid urucakrayo 'nehasaḥ
Griffith: Unrivalled, giving ample room, they save from woe.
pada pāṭha: te | hi | putrāsaḥ | aditeḥ | viduḥ | dveṣāṁsi | yotave || aṁhoḥ | cit | uru-cakrayaḥ | anehasaḥ ||8.18.5||

IAST: aditir no divā paśum aditir naktam advayāḥ
Griffith: Aditi guard our herd by day, Aditi, free from guile, by night,
pada pāṭha: aditiḥ | naḥ | divā | paśum | aditiḥ | naktam | advayāḥ || aditiḥ | pātu | aṁhasaḥ | sadā-vr̥dhā ||8.18.6||

IAST: aditiḥ pātv aṁhasaḥ sadāvṛdhā
Griffith: Aditi, ever strengthening, save us from grief!
pada pāṭha: aditiḥ | naḥ | divā | paśum | aditiḥ | naktam | advayāḥ || aditiḥ | pātu | aṁhasaḥ | sadā-vr̥dhā ||8.18.6||

IAST: uta syā no divā matir aditir ūtyā gamat
Griffith: And in the day our hymn is this: May Aditi come nigh to help,
Devanāgarī: उत स्या नो दिवा मतिरदितिरूत्या गमत्
pada pāṭha: uta | syā | naḥ | divā | matiḥ | aditiḥ | ūtyā | ā | gamat || sā | śam-tāti | mayaḥ | karat | apa | sridhaḥ ||8.18.7||

IAST: sā śaṁtāti mayas karad apa sridhaḥ
Griffith: With loving-kindness bring us weal and chase our foes.
pada pāṭha: uta | syā | naḥ | divā | matiḥ | aditiḥ | ūtyā | ā | gamat || sā | śam-tāti | mayaḥ | karat | apa | sridhaḥ ||8.18.7||

IAST: uta tyā daivyā bhiṣajā śaṁ naḥ karato aśvinā
Griffith: And may the Asvins, the divine Pair of Physicians, send us health:
Devanāgarī: उत त्या दैव्या भिषजा शं नः करतो अश्विना
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | daivyā | bhiṣajā | śam | naḥ | karataḥ | aśvinā || yuyuyātām | itaḥ | rapaḥ | apa | sridhaḥ ||8.18.8||

IAST: yuyuyātām ito rapo apa sridhaḥ
Griffith: May they remove iniquity and chase our foes.
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | daivyā | bhiṣajā | śam | naḥ | karataḥ | aśvinā || yuyuyātām | itaḥ | rapaḥ | apa | sridhaḥ ||8.18.8||

IAST: śam agnir agnibhiḥ karac chaṁ nas tapatu sūryaḥ
Griffith: May Agni bless us with his fires, and Surya warm us pleasantly:
pada pāṭha: śam | agniḥ | agni-bhiḥ | karat | śam | naḥ | tapatu | sūryaḥ || śam | vātaḥ | vātu | arapāḥ | apa | sridhaḥ ||8.18.9||

IAST: śaṁ vāto vātv arapā apa sridhaḥ
Griffith: May the pure Wind breathe sweet on us, and chase our foes.
pada pāṭha: śam | agniḥ | agni-bhiḥ | karat | śam | naḥ | tapatu | sūryaḥ || śam | vātaḥ | vātu | arapāḥ | apa | sridhaḥ ||8.18.9||

IAST: apāmīvām apa sridham apa sedhata durmatim
Griffith: Drive ye disease and strife away, drive ye away malignity:
pada pāṭha: apa | amīvām | apa | sridham | apa | sedhata | duḥ-matim || ādityāsaḥ | yuyotana | naḥ | aṁhasaḥ ||8.18.10||

IAST: ādityāso yuyotanā no aṁhasaḥ
Griffith: Adityas, keep us ever far from sore distress.
pada pāṭha: apa | amīvām | apa | sridham | apa | sedhata | duḥ-matim || ādityāsaḥ | yuyotana | naḥ | aṁhasaḥ ||8.18.10||

IAST: yuyotā śarum asmad ām̐ ādityāsa utāmatim
Griffith: Remove from us the arrow, keep famine, Adityas! far away:
pada pāṭha: yuyota | śarum | asmat | ā | ādityāsaḥ | uta | amatim || r̥dhak | dveṣaḥ | kr̥ṇuta | viśva-vedasaḥ ||8.18.11||

IAST: ṛdhag dveṣaḥ kṛṇuta viśvavedasaḥ
Griffith: Keep enmities afar from us, Lords of all wealth!
pada pāṭha: yuyota | śarum | asmat | ā | ādityāsaḥ | uta | amatim || r̥dhak | dveṣaḥ | kr̥ṇuta | viśva-vedasaḥ ||8.18.11||

IAST: tat su naḥ śarma yacchatādityā yan mumocati
Griffith: Now, O Adityas, grant to us the shelter that lets man go free,
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | śarma | yacchata | ādityāḥ | yat | mumocati || enasvantam | cit | enasaḥ | su-dānavaḥ ||8.18.12||

IAST: enasvantaṁ cid enasaḥ sudānavaḥ
Griffith: Yea, even the sinner from his sin, ye Bounteous Gods
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | śarma | yacchata | ādityāḥ | yat | mumocati || enasvantam | cit | enasaḥ | su-dānavaḥ ||8.18.12||

IAST: yo naḥ kaś cid ririkṣati rakṣastvena martyaḥ
Griffith: Whatever mortal with the powe r of demons fain would injure us,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | kaḥ | cit | ririkṣati | rakṣaḥ-tvena | martyaḥ || svaiḥ | saḥ | evaiḥ | ririṣīṣṭa | yuḥ | janaḥ ||8.18.13||

IAST: svaiḥ ṣa evai ririṣīṣṭa yur janaḥ
Griffith: May he, impetuous, suffer harm by his own deeds.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | kaḥ | cit | ririkṣati | rakṣaḥ-tvena | martyaḥ || svaiḥ | saḥ | evaiḥ | ririṣīṣṭa | yuḥ | janaḥ ||8.18.13||

IAST: sam it tam agham aśnavad duḥśaṁsam martyaṁ ripum
Griffith: May sin o'ertake our human foe, the man who speaketh evil thing,
pada pāṭha: sam | it | tam | agham | aśnavat | duḥ-śaṁsam | martyam | ripum || yaḥ | asma-trā | duḥ-hanāvān | upa | dvayuḥ ||8.18.14||

IAST: yo asmatrā durhaṇāvām̐ upa dvayuḥ
Griffith: Him who would cause our misery, whose heart is false.
pada pāṭha: sam | it | tam | agham | aśnavat | duḥ-śaṁsam | martyam | ripum || yaḥ | asma-trā | duḥ-hanāvān | upa | dvayuḥ ||8.18.14||

IAST: pākatrā sthana devā hṛtsu jānītha martyam
Griffith: Gods, ye are with the simple ones, ye know each mortal in your hearts;
Devanāgarī: पाकत्रा स्थन देवा हृत्सु जानीथ मर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: pāka-trā | sthana | devāḥ | hr̥t-su | jānītha | martyam || upa | dvayum | ca | advayum | ca | vasavaḥ ||8.18.15||

IAST: upa dvayuṁ cādvayuṁ ca vasavaḥ
Griffith: Ye, Vasus, well discriminate the false and true.
pada pāṭha: pāka-trā | sthana | devāḥ | hr̥t-su | jānītha | martyam || upa | dvayum | ca | advayum | ca | vasavaḥ ||8.18.15||

IAST: ā śarma parvatānām otāpāṁ vṛṇīmahe
Griffith: Fain would we have the sheltering aid of mountains and of water-floods:
pada pāṭha: ā | śarma | parvatānām | ā | uta | apām | vr̥ṇīmahe || dyāvākṣāmā | āre | asmat | rapaḥ | kr̥tam ||8.18.16||

IAST: dyāvākṣāmāre asmad rapas kṛtam
Griffith: Keep far from us iniquity, O Heaven and Earth.
pada pāṭha: ā | śarma | parvatānām | ā | uta | apām | vr̥ṇīmahe || dyāvākṣāmā | āre | asmat | rapaḥ | kr̥tam ||8.18.16||

IAST: te no bhadreṇa śarmaṇā yuṣmākaṁ nāvā vasavaḥ
Griffith: So with auspicious sheltering aid do ye, O Vasus, carry us
Devanāgarī: ते नो भद्रेण शर्मणा युष्माकं नावा वसवः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | bhadreṇa | śarmaṇā | yuṣmākam | nāvā | vasavaḥ || ati | viśvāni | duḥ-itā | pipartana ||8.18.17||

IAST: ati viśvāni duritā pipartana
Griffith: Beyond all trouble and distress, borne in your ship.
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | bhadreṇa | śarmaṇā | yuṣmākam | nāvā | vasavaḥ || ati | viśvāni | duḥ-itā | pipartana ||8.18.17||

IAST: tuce tanāya tat su no drāghīya āyur jīvase
Griffith: Adityas, ye Most Mighty Ones, grant to our children and their seed
Devanāgarī: तुचे तनाय तत्सु नो द्राघीय आयुर्जीवसे
pada pāṭha: tuce | tanāya | tat | su | naḥ | drāghīyaḥ | āyuḥ | jīvase || ādityāsaḥ | su-mahasaḥ | kr̥ṇotana ||8.18.18||

IAST: ādityāsaḥ sumahasaḥ kṛṇotana
Griffith: Extended term of life that they may live long days.
pada pāṭha: tuce | tanāya | tat | su | naḥ | drāghīyaḥ | āyuḥ | jīvase || ādityāsaḥ | su-mahasaḥ | kr̥ṇotana ||8.18.18||

IAST: yajño hīḻo vo antara ādityā asti mṛḻata
Griffith: Sacrifice, O Adityas, is your inward monitor: be kind,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञो हीळो वो अन्तर आदित्या अस्ति मृळत
pada pāṭha: yajñaḥ | hīḷaḥ | vaḥ | antaraḥ | ādityāḥ | asti | mr̥ḷata || yuṣme iti | it | vaḥ | api | smasi | sa-jātye ||8.18.19||

IAST: yuṣme id vo api ṣmasi sajātye
Griffith: For in the bond of kindred we are bound to you.
pada pāṭha: yajñaḥ | hīḷaḥ | vaḥ | antaraḥ | ādityāḥ | asti | mr̥ḷata || yuṣme iti | it | vaḥ | api | smasi | sa-jātye ||8.18.19||

IAST: bṛhad varūtham marutāṁ devaṁ trātāram aśvinā
Griffith: The Maruts' high protecting aid, the Asvins, and the God who saves,
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | varūtham | marutām | devam | trātaram | aśvinā || mitram | īmahe | varuṇam | svastaye ||8.18.20||

IAST: mitram īmahe varuṇaṁ svastaye
Griffith: Mitra and Varuna for weal we supplicate.
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | varūtham | marutām | devam | trātaram | aśvinā || mitram | īmahe | varuṇam | svastaye ||8.18.20||

IAST: aneho mitrāryaman nṛvad varuṇa śaṁsyam
Griffith: Grant us a home with triple guard, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna!
pada pāṭha: anehaḥ | mitra | aryaman | nr̥-vat | varuṇa | śaṁsyam || tri-varūtham | marutaḥ | yanta | naḥ | chardiḥ ||8.18.21||

IAST: trivarūtham maruto yanta naś chardiḥ
Griffith: Unthreatened, Maruts! meet for praise, and filled with men.
pada pāṭha: anehaḥ | mitra | aryaman | nr̥-vat | varuṇa | śaṁsyam || tri-varūtham | marutaḥ | yanta | naḥ | chardiḥ ||8.18.21||

IAST: ye cid dhi mṛtyubandhava ādityā manavaḥ smasi
Griffith: And as we human beings, O Adityas, are akin to death,
Devanāgarī: ये चिद्धि मृत्युबन्धव आदित्या मनवः स्मसि
pada pāṭha: ye | cit | hi | mr̥tyu-bandhavaḥ | ādityāḥ | manavaḥ | smasi || pra | su | naḥ | āyuḥ | jīvase | tiretana ||8.18.22||

IAST: pra sū na āyur jīvase tiretana
Griffith: Graciously lengthen ye our lives that we may live.
pada pāṭha: ye | cit | hi | mr̥tyu-bandhavaḥ | ādityāḥ | manavaḥ | smasi || pra | su | naḥ | āyuḥ | jīvase | tiretana ||8.18.22||

IAST: taṁ gūrdhayā svarṇaraṁ devāso devam aratiṁ dadhanvire
Griffith: SING praise to hiin, the Lord of Light. The Gods have made the God to be their messenger,
Devanāgarī: तं गूर्धया स्वर्णरं देवासो देवमरतिं दधन्विरे
pada pāṭha: tam | gūrdhaya | svaḥ-naram | devāsaḥ | devam | aratim | dadhanvire || deva-trā | havyam | ā | ūhire ||8.19.1||

IAST: devatrā havyam ohire
Griffith: And sent oblation to Gods.
pada pāṭha: tam | gūrdhaya | svaḥ-naram | devāsaḥ | devam | aratim | dadhanvire || deva-trā | havyam | ā | ūhire ||8.19.1||

IAST: vibhūtarātiṁ vipra citraśociṣam agnim īḻiṣva yanturam
Griffith: Agni, the Bounteous Giver, bright with varied flames, laud thou, O singer Sobhari-
pada pāṭha: vibhūta-rātim | vipra | citra-śociṣam | agnim | īḷiṣva | yanturam || asya | meghasya | somyasya | sobhare | pra | īm | adhvarāya | pūrvyam ||8.19.2||

IAST: asya medhasya somyasya sobhare prem adhvarāya pūrvyam
Griffith: Him who controls this sacred food with Soma blent, who hath first claim to sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: अस्य मेधस्य सोम्यस्य सोभरे प्रेमध्वराय पूर्व्यम्
pada pāṭha: vibhūta-rātim | vipra | citra-śociṣam | agnim | īḷiṣva | yanturam || asya | meghasya | somyasya | sobhare | pra | īm | adhvarāya | pūrvyam ||8.19.2||

IAST: yajiṣṭhaṁ tvā vavṛmahe devaṁ devatrā hotāram amartyam
Griffith: Thee have we chosen skilftillest in sacrifice, Immortal Priest among the Gods,
Devanāgarī: यजिष्ठं त्वा ववृमहे देवं देवत्रा होतारममर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: yajiṣṭham | tvā | vavr̥mahe | devam | deva-trā | hotāram | amartyam || asya | yajñasya | su-kratum ||8.19.3||

IAST: asya yajñasya sukratum
Griffith: Wise finisher of this holy rite:
pada pāṭha: yajiṣṭham | tvā | vavr̥mahe | devam | deva-trā | hotāram | amartyam || asya | yajñasya | su-kratum ||8.19.3||

IAST: ūrjo napātaṁ subhagaṁ sudīditim agniṁ śreṣṭhaśociṣam
Griffith: The Son of Strength, the blessed, brightly shining One, Agni whose light is excellent.
pada pāṭha: ūrjaḥ | napātam | su-bhagam | su-dīditim | agnim | śreṣṭha-śociṣam || saḥ | naḥ | mitrasya | varuṇasya | saḥ | apām | ā | sumnam | yakṣate | divi ||8.19.4||

IAST: sa no mitrasya varuṇasya so apām ā sumnaṁ yakṣate divi
Griffith: May be by sacrifice win us in heaven the grace of Mitra, Varuna, and the Floods.
Devanāgarī: स नो मित्रस्य वरुणस्य सो अपामा सुम्नं यक्षते दिवि
pada pāṭha: ūrjaḥ | napātam | su-bhagam | su-dīditim | agnim | śreṣṭha-śociṣam || saḥ | naḥ | mitrasya | varuṇasya | saḥ | apām | ā | sumnam | yakṣate | divi ||8.19.4||

IAST: yaḥ samidhā ya āhutī yo vedena dadāśa marto agnaye
Griffith: The mortal who hath ministered to Agni with oblation, fuel, ritual lore,
Devanāgarī: यः समिधा य आहुती यो वेदेन ददाश मर्तो अग्नये
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sam-idhā | yaḥ | ā-hutī | yaḥ | vedena | dadāśa | martaḥ | agnaye || yaḥ | namasā | su-adhvaraḥ ||8.19.5||

IAST: yo namasā svadhvaraḥ
Griffith: And reverence, skilled in sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sam-idhā | yaḥ | ā-hutī | yaḥ | vedena | dadāśa | martaḥ | agnaye || yaḥ | namasā | su-adhvaraḥ ||8.19.5||

IAST: tasyed arvanto raṁhayanta āśavas tasya dyumnitamaṁ yaśaḥ
Griffith: Verily swift to run are his fleet-footed steeds, and most resplendent fame is his.
pada pāṭha: tasya | it | arvantaḥ | raṁhayante | āśavaḥ | tasya | dyumni-tamam | yaśaḥ || na | tam | aṁhaḥ | deva-kr̥tam | kutaḥ | cana | na | martya-kr̥tam | naśat ||8.19.6||

IAST: na tam aṁho devakṛtaṁ kutaś cana na martyakṛtaṁ naśat
Griffith: No trouble caused by Gods or wrought by mortal man from any side o'ertaketh him.
Devanāgarī: न तमंहो देवकृतं कुतश्चन न मर्त्यकृतं नशत्
pada pāṭha: tasya | it | arvantaḥ | raṁhayante | āśavaḥ | tasya | dyumni-tamam | yaśaḥ || na | tam | aṁhaḥ | deva-kr̥tam | kutaḥ | cana | na | martya-kr̥tam | naśat ||8.19.6||

IAST: svagnayo vo agnibhiḥ syāma sūno sahasa ūrjām pate
Griffith: May we by thine own fires be well supplied with fire, O Son of Strength, O Lord of Might:
Devanāgarī: स्वग्नयो वो अग्निभिः स्याम सूनो सहस ऊर्जां पते
pada pāṭha: su-agnayaḥ | vaḥ | agni-bhiḥ | syāma | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | ūrjām | pate || su-vīraḥ | tvam | asma-yuḥ ||8.19.7||

IAST: suvīras tvam asmayuḥ
Griffith: Thou as our Friend hast worthy men.
pada pāṭha: su-agnayaḥ | vaḥ | agni-bhiḥ | syāma | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | ūrjām | pate || su-vīraḥ | tvam | asma-yuḥ ||8.19.7||

IAST: praśaṁsamāno atithir na mitriyo 'gnī ratho na vedyaḥ
Griffith: Agni, who praises like a guest of friendly mind, is as a car that brings us gear.
Devanāgarī: प्रशंसमानो अतिथिर्न मित्रियोऽग्नी रथो न वेद्यः
pada pāṭha: pra-śaṁsamānaḥ | atithiḥ | na | mitriyaḥ | agniḥ | rathaḥ | na | vedyaḥ || tve iti | kṣemāsaḥ | api | santi | sādhavaḥ | tvam | rājā | rayīṇām ||8.19.8||

IAST: tve kṣemāso api santi sādhavas tvaṁ rājā rayīṇām
Griffith: Also in thee is found perfect security thou art the Sovran Lord of wealth.
Devanāgarī: त्वे क्षेमासो अपि सन्ति साधवस्त्वं राजा रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: pra-śaṁsamānaḥ | atithiḥ | na | mitriyaḥ | agniḥ | rathaḥ | na | vedyaḥ || tve iti | kṣemāsaḥ | api | santi | sādhavaḥ | tvam | rājā | rayīṇām ||8.19.8||

IAST: so addhā dāśvadhvaro 'gne martaḥ subhaga sa praśaṁsyaḥ
Griffith: That man, moreover, merits praise who brings, auspicious Agni, sacrificial gifts
Devanāgarī: सो अद्धा दाश्वध्वरोऽग्ने मर्तः सुभग स प्रशंस्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | addhā | dāśu-adhvaraḥ | agne | martaḥ | su-bhaga | saḥ | pra-śaṁsyaḥ || saḥ | dhībhiḥ | astu | sanitā ||8.19.9||

IAST: sa dhībhir astu sanitā
Griffith: May he win riches by his thoughts.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | addhā | dāśu-adhvaraḥ | agne | martaḥ | su-bhaga | saḥ | pra-śaṁsyaḥ || saḥ | dhībhiḥ | astu | sanitā ||8.19.9||

IAST: yasya tvam ūrdhvo adhvarāya tiṣṭhasi kṣayadvīraḥ sa sādhate
Griffith: He for whose sacrifice thou standest up erect is prosperous and rules o'er men.
Devanāgarī: यस्य त्वमूर्ध्वो अध्वराय तिष्ठसि क्षयद्वीरः स साधते
pada pāṭha: yasya | tvam | ūrdhvaḥ | adhvarāya | tiṣṭhasi | kṣayat-vīraḥ | saḥ | sādhate || saḥ | arvat-bhiḥ | sanitā | saḥ | vipanyu-bhiḥ | saḥ | śūraiḥ | sanitā | kr̥tam ||8.19.10||

IAST: so arvadbhiḥ sanitā sa vipanyubhiḥ sa śūraiḥ sanitā kṛtam
Griffith: He wins with coursers and with singers killed in song: with heroes he obtains the prize.
Devanāgarī: सो अर्वद्भिः सनिता स विपन्युभिः स शूरैः सनिता कृतम्
pada pāṭha: yasya | tvam | ūrdhvaḥ | adhvarāya | tiṣṭhasi | kṣayat-vīraḥ | saḥ | sādhate || saḥ | arvat-bhiḥ | sanitā | saḥ | vipanyu-bhiḥ | saḥ | śūraiḥ | sanitā | kr̥tam ||8.19.10||

IAST: yasyāgnir vapur gṛhe stomaṁ cano dadhīta viśvavāryaḥ
Griffith: He in whose dwelling Agni is chief ornament, and, all-desired, loves his laud well,
pada pāṭha: yasya | agniḥ | vapuḥ | gr̥he | stomam | canaḥ | dadhīta | viśva-vāryaḥ || havyā | vā | veviṣat | viṣaḥ ||8.19.11||

IAST: havyā vā veviṣad viṣaḥ
Griffith: And zealously tends his offerings-
pada pāṭha: yasya | agniḥ | vapuḥ | gr̥he | stomam | canaḥ | dadhīta | viśva-vāryaḥ || havyā | vā | veviṣat | viṣaḥ ||8.19.11||

IAST: viprasya vā stuvataḥ sahaso yaho makṣūtamasya rātiṣu
Griffith: His, or the lauding sage's word, his, Son of Strength! who Is most prompt with sacred gifts,
Devanāgarī: विप्रस्य वा स्तुवतः सहसो यहो मक्षूतमस्य रातिषु
pada pāṭha: viprasya | vā | stuvataḥ | sahasaḥ | yaho iti | makṣu-tamasya | rātiṣu || avaḥ-devam | upari-martyam | kr̥dhi | vaso iti | vividuṣaḥ | vacaḥ ||8.19.12||

IAST: avodevam uparimartyaṁ kṛdhi vaso vividuṣo vacaḥ
Griffith: Set thou beneath the Gods, Vasu, above mankind, the speech of the intelligent.
pada pāṭha: viprasya | vā | stuvataḥ | sahasaḥ | yaho iti | makṣu-tamasya | rātiṣu || avaḥ-devam | upari-martyam | kr̥dhi | vaso iti | vividuṣaḥ | vacaḥ ||8.19.12||

IAST: yo agniṁ havyadātibhir namobhir vā sudakṣam āvivāsati
Griffith: He who with sacrificial gifts or homage bringeth very skilful Agni nigh,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | agnim | havyadāti-bhiḥ | namaḥ-bhiḥ | vā | su-dakṣam | ā-vivāsati || girā | vā | ajira-śociṣam ||8.19.13||

IAST: girā vājiraśociṣam
Griffith: Or him who flashes fast with song,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | agnim | havyadāti-bhiḥ | namaḥ-bhiḥ | vā | su-dakṣam | ā-vivāsati || girā | vā | ajira-śociṣam ||8.19.13||

IAST: samidhā yo niśitī dāśad aditiṁ dhāmabhir asya martyaḥ
Griffith: The mortal who with blazing fuel, as his laws command, adores the Perfect God,
Devanāgarī: समिधा यो निशिती दाशददितिं धामभिरस्य मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: sam-idhā | yaḥ | ni-śitī | dāśat | aditim | dhāma-bhiḥ | asya | martyaḥ || viśvā | it | saḥ | dhībhiḥ | su-bhagaḥ | janān | ati | dyumnaiḥ | udgaḥ-iva | tāriṣat ||8.19.14||

IAST: viśvet sa dhībhiḥ subhago janām̐ ati dyumnair udna iva tāriṣat
Griffith: Blest with his thoughts in splendour shall exceed all men, as though he overpassed the floods.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेत्स धीभिः सुभगो जनाँ अति द्युम्नैरुद्न इव तारिषत्
pada pāṭha: sam-idhā | yaḥ | ni-śitī | dāśat | aditim | dhāma-bhiḥ | asya | martyaḥ || viśvā | it | saḥ | dhībhiḥ | su-bhagaḥ | janān | ati | dyumnaiḥ | udgaḥ-iva | tāriṣat ||8.19.14||

IAST: tad agne dyumnam ā bhara yat sāsahat sadane kaṁ cid atriṇam
Griffith: Give us the splendour, Agni, which may overcome each greedy fiend in our abode,
Devanāgarī: तदग्ने द्युम्नमा भर यत्सासहत्सदने कं चिदत्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: tat | agne | dyumnam | ā | bhara | yat | sasahat | sadane | kam | cit | atriṇam || manyum | janasya | duḥ-dhyaḥ ||8.19.15||

IAST: manyuṁ janasya dūḍhyaḥ
Griffith: The wrath of evil-hearted folk.
pada pāṭha: tat | agne | dyumnam | ā | bhara | yat | sasahat | sadane | kam | cit | atriṇam || manyum | janasya | duḥ-dhyaḥ ||8.19.15||

IAST: yena caṣṭe varuṇo mitro aryamā yena nāsatyā bhagaḥ
Griffith: That, wherewith Mitra, Varuna, and Aryaman, the Asvins, Bhaga give us light,
Devanāgarī: येन चष्टे वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा येन नासत्या भगः
pada pāṭha: yena | caṣṭe | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | yena | nāsatyā | bhagaḥ || vayam | tat | te | śavasā | gātuvit-tamāḥ | indratvā-ūtāḥ | vidhemahi ||8.19.16||

IAST: vayaṁ tat te śavasā gātuvittamā indratvotā vidhemahi
Griffith: That may we, by thy power finding best furtherance, worship, O Indra, helped by thee.
Devanāgarī: वयं तत्ते शवसा गातुवित्तमा इन्द्रत्वोता विधेमहि
pada pāṭha: yena | caṣṭe | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | yena | nāsatyā | bhagaḥ || vayam | tat | te | śavasā | gātuvit-tamāḥ | indratvā-ūtāḥ | vidhemahi ||8.19.16||

IAST: te ghed agne svādhyo ye tvā vipra nidadhire nṛcakṣasam
Griffith: O Agni, most devout are they, the sages who have set thee Sage exceeding wise,
Devanāgarī: ते घेदग्ने स्वाध्यो ये त्वा विप्र निदधिरे नृचक्षसम्
pada pāṭha: te | gha | it | agne | su-ādhyaḥ | ye | tvā | vipra | ni-dadhire | nr̥-cakṣasam || viprāsaḥ | deva | su-kratum ||8.19.17||

IAST: viprāso deva sukratum
Griffith: O God, for men to look upon:
pada pāṭha: te | gha | it | agne | su-ādhyaḥ | ye | tvā | vipra | ni-dadhire | nr̥-cakṣasam || viprāsaḥ | deva | su-kratum ||8.19.17||

IAST: ta id vediṁ subhaga ta āhutiṁ te sotuṁ cakrire divi
Griffith: Who have arranged thine altar Blessed God, at morn brought thine oblation, pressed the juice.
Devanāgarī: त इद्वेदिं सुभग त आहुतिं ते सोतुं चक्रिरे दिवि
pada pāṭha: te | it | vedim | su-bhaga | te | ā-hutim | te | sotum | cakrire | divi || te | it | vājebhiḥ | jigyuḥ | mahat | dhanam | ye | tve iti | kāmam | ni-erire ||8.19.18||

IAST: ta id vājebhir jigyur mahad dhanaṁ ye tve kāmaṁ nyerire
Griffith: They by their deeds of strength have won diem, mighty wealth, who have set all their hope in thee.
Devanāgarī: त इद्वाजेभिर्जिग्युर्महद्धनं ये त्वे कामं न्येरिरे
pada pāṭha: te | it | vedim | su-bhaga | te | ā-hutim | te | sotum | cakrire | divi || te | it | vājebhiḥ | jigyuḥ | mahat | dhanam | ye | tve iti | kāmam | ni-erire ||8.19.18||

IAST: bhadro no agnir āhuto bhadrā rātiḥ subhaga bhadro adhvaraḥ
Griffith: May Agni worshipped bring us bliss, may the gift, Blessed One, and sacrifice bring bliss;
Devanāgarī: भद्रो नो अग्निराहुतो भद्रा रातिः सुभग भद्रो अध्वरः
pada pāṭha: bhadraḥ | naḥ | agniḥ | ā-hutaḥ | bhadrā | rātiḥ | su-bhaga | bhadraḥ | adhvaraḥ || bhadrāḥ | uta | pra-śastayaḥ ||8.19.19||

IAST: bhadrā uta praśastayaḥ
Griffith: Yea, may our praises bring us bliss.
pada pāṭha: bhadraḥ | naḥ | agniḥ | ā-hutaḥ | bhadrā | rātiḥ | su-bhaga | bhadraḥ | adhvaraḥ || bhadrāḥ | uta | pra-śastayaḥ ||8.19.19||

IAST: bhadram manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye yenā samatsu sāsahaḥ
Griffith: Show forth the mind that brings success in war with fiends, wherewith thou conquerest in fight.
Devanāgarī: भद्रं मनः कृणुष्व वृत्रतूर्ये येना समत्सु सासहः
pada pāṭha: bhadram | manaḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | vr̥tra-tūrye | yena | samat-su | sasahaḥ || ava | sthirā | tanuhi | bhūri | śardhatām | vanema | te | abhiṣṭi-bhiḥ ||8.19.20||

IAST: ava sthirā tanuhi bhūri śardhatāṁ vanemā te abhiṣṭibhiḥ
Griffith: Bring down the many firm hopes of our enemies, and let us vanquish with thine aid.
Devanāgarī: अव स्थिरा तनुहि भूरि शर्धतां वनेमा ते अभिष्टिभिः
pada pāṭha: bhadram | manaḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | vr̥tra-tūrye | yena | samat-su | sasahaḥ || ava | sthirā | tanuhi | bhūri | śardhatām | vanema | te | abhiṣṭi-bhiḥ ||8.19.20||

IAST: īḻe girā manurhitaṁ yaṁ devā dūtam aratiṁ nyerire
Griffith: I praise with song the Friend of man, whom Gods sent down to be herald and messenger,
Devanāgarī: ईळे गिरा मनुर्हितं यं देवा दूतमरतिं न्येरिरे
pada pāṭha: īḷe | girā | manuḥ-hitam | yam | devāḥ | dūtam | aratim | ni-erire || yajiṣṭham | havya-vāhanam ||8.19.21||

IAST: yajiṣṭhaṁ havyavāhanam
Griffith: Best worshipper, bearer of our gifts.
pada pāṭha: īḷe | girā | manuḥ-hitam | yam | devāḥ | dūtam | aratim | ni-erire || yajiṣṭham | havya-vāhanam ||8.19.21||

IAST: tigmajambhāya taruṇāya rājate prayo gāyasy agnaye
Griffith: Thou unto sharp-toothed Agni, Young and Radiant God, proclaimest with thy song the feast-
pada pāṭha: tigma-jambhāya | taruṇāya | rājate | prayaḥ | gāyasi | agnaye || yaḥ | piṁśate | sūnr̥tābhiḥ | su-vīryam | agniḥ | ghr̥tebhiḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||8.19.22||

IAST: yaḥ piṁśate sūnṛtābhiḥ suvīryam agnir ghṛtebhir āhutaḥ
Griffith: Agni, who for our sweet strains moulds heroic strength when sacred oil is offered him,
pada pāṭha: tigma-jambhāya | taruṇāya | rājate | prayaḥ | gāyasi | agnaye || yaḥ | piṁśate | sūnr̥tābhiḥ | su-vīryam | agniḥ | ghr̥tebhiḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||8.19.22||

IAST: yadī ghṛtebhir āhuto vāśīm agnir bharata uc cāva ca
Griffith: While, served with sacrificial oil, now upward and now downward Agni moves his sword,
pada pāṭha: yadi | ghr̥tebhiḥ | ā-hutaḥ | vāśīm | agniḥ | bharate | ut | ca | ava | ca || asuraḥ-iva | niḥ-nijam ||8.19.23||

IAST: asura iva nirṇijam
Griffith: As doth the Asura his robe.
pada pāṭha: yadi | ghr̥tebhiḥ | ā-hutaḥ | vāśīm | agniḥ | bharate | ut | ca | ava | ca || asuraḥ-iva | niḥ-nijam ||8.19.23||

IAST: yo havyāny airayatā manurhito deva āsā sugandhinā
Griffith: The God, the Friend of man, who bears our gifts to heaven, the God with his sweet-smelling mouth,
Devanāgarī: यो हव्यान्यैरयता मनुर्हितो देव आसा सुगन्धिना
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | havyāni | airayata | manuḥ-hitaḥ | devaḥ | āsā | su-gandhinā || vivāsate | vāryāṇi | su-adhvaraḥ | hotā | devaḥ | amartyaḥ ||8.19.24||

IAST: vivāsate vāryāṇi svadhvaro hotā devo amartyaḥ
Griffith: Distributes, skilled in sacrifice, his precious things, Invoking Priest, Immortal God.
Devanāgarī: विवासते वार्याणि स्वध्वरो होता देवो अमर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | havyāni | airayata | manuḥ-hitaḥ | devaḥ | āsā | su-gandhinā || vivāsate | vāryāṇi | su-adhvaraḥ | hotā | devaḥ | amartyaḥ ||8.19.24||

IAST: yad agne martyas tvaṁ syām aham mitramaho amartyaḥ
Griffith: Son of Strength, Agni, if thou wert the mortal, bright as Mitra, I worshipped with our gifts!
pada pāṭha: yat | agne | martyaḥ | tvam | syām | aham | mitra-mahaḥ | amartyaḥ || sahasaḥ | sūno iti | ā-huta ||8.19.25||

IAST: sahasaḥ sūnav āhuta
Griffith: And I were the Immortal God
pada pāṭha: yat | agne | martyaḥ | tvam | syām | aham | mitra-mahaḥ | amartyaḥ || sahasaḥ | sūno iti | ā-huta ||8.19.25||

IAST: na tvā rāsīyābhiśastaye vaso na pāpatvāya santya
Griffith: I would not give thee up, Vasu, to calumny, or misery, O Bounteous One.
Devanāgarī: न त्वा रासीयाभिशस्तये वसो न पापत्वाय सन्त्य
pada pāṭha: na | tvā | rāsīya | abhi-śastaye | vaso iti | na | pāpa-tvāya | santya || na | me | stotā | amati-vā | na | duḥ-hitaḥ | syāt | agne | na | pāpayā ||8.19.26||

IAST: na me stotāmatīvā na durhitaḥ syād agne na pāpayā
Griffith: My worshipper should feel no hunger or distress, nor, Agni, should he live in sin.
Devanāgarī: न मे स्तोतामतीवा न दुर्हितः स्यादग्ने न पापया
pada pāṭha: na | tvā | rāsīya | abhi-śastaye | vaso iti | na | pāpa-tvāya | santya || na | me | stotā | amati-vā | na | duḥ-hitaḥ | syāt | agne | na | pāpayā ||8.19.26||

IAST: pitur na putraḥ subhṛto duroṇa ā devām̐ etu pra ṇo haviḥ
Griffith: Like a son cherished in his father's houi§e, let our oblation rise unto the Gods.
Devanāgarī: पितुर्न पुत्रः सुभृतो दुरोण आ देवाँ एतु प्र णो हविः
pada pāṭha: pituḥ | na | putraḥ | su-bhr̥taḥ | duroṇe | ā | devān | etu | pra | naḥ | haviḥ ||8.19.27||

IAST: tavāham agna ūtibhir nediṣṭhābhiḥ saceya joṣam ā vaso
Griffith: With thine immediate aid may I, excellent Agni, ever gain my wish
pada pāṭha: tava | aham | agne | ūti-bhiḥ | nediṣṭhābhiḥ | saceya | joṣam | ā | vaso iti || sadā | devasya | martyaḥ ||8.19.28||

IAST: sadā devasya martyaḥ
Griffith: A mortal with a God to help.
pada pāṭha: tava | aham | agne | ūti-bhiḥ | nediṣṭhābhiḥ | saceya | joṣam | ā | vaso iti || sadā | devasya | martyaḥ ||8.19.28||

IAST: tava kratvā saneyaṁ tava rātibhir agne tava praśastibhiḥ
Griffith: O Agni, by thy wisdom, by thy bounties, by thy leading may I gather wealth.
Devanāgarī: तव क्रत्वा सनेयं तव रातिभिरग्ने तव प्रशस्तिभिः
pada pāṭha: tava | kratvā | saneyam | tava | rāti-bhiḥ | agne | tava | praśasti-bhiḥ || tvām | it | āhuḥ | pra-matim | vaso iti | mama | agne | harṣasva | dātave ||8.19.29||

IAST: tvām id āhuḥ pramatiṁ vaso mamāgne harṣasva dātave
Griffith: Excellent Agni, thou art called my Providence: delight thou to be liberal.
Devanāgarī: त्वामिदाहुः प्रमतिं वसो ममाग्ने हर्षस्व दातवे
pada pāṭha: tava | kratvā | saneyam | tava | rāti-bhiḥ | agne | tava | praśasti-bhiḥ || tvām | it | āhuḥ | pra-matim | vaso iti | mama | agne | harṣasva | dātave ||8.19.29||

IAST: pra so agne tavotibhiḥ suvīrābhis tirate vājabharmabhiḥ
Griffith: Agni, he conquers by thine aid that brings him store of noble heroes and great strength,
Devanāgarī: प्र सो अग्ने तवोतिभिः सुवीराभिस्तिरते वाजभर्मभिः
pada pāṭha: pra | saḥ | agne | tava | ūti-bhiḥ | su-vīrābhiḥ | tirate | vājabharma-bhiḥ || yasya | tvam | sakhyam | ā-varaḥ ||8.19.30||

IAST: yasya tvaṁ sakhyam āvaraḥ
Griffith: Whose bond of friendship is thy choice.
pada pāṭha: pra | saḥ | agne | tava | ūti-bhiḥ | su-vīrābhiḥ | tirate | vājabharma-bhiḥ || yasya | tvam | sakhyam | ā-varaḥ ||8.19.30||

IAST: tava drapso nīlavān vāśa ṛtviya indhānaḥ siṣṇav ā dade
Griffith: Thy spark is black and crackling, kindled in due time, O Bounteous, it is taken up.
Devanāgarī: तव द्रप्सो नीलवान्वाश ऋत्विय इन्धानः सिष्णवा ददे
pada pāṭha: tava | drapsaḥ | nīla-vān | vāśaḥ | r̥tviyaḥ | indhānaḥ | siṣṇo iti | ā | dade || tvam | mahīnām | uṣasām | asi | priyaḥ | kṣapaḥ | vastuṣu | rājasi ||8.19.31||

IAST: tvam mahīnām uṣasām asi priyaḥ kṣapo vastuṣu rājasi
Griffith: Thou art the dear Friend of the mighty Mornings: thou shinest in glimmerings of the night.
Devanāgarī: त्वं महीनामुषसामसि प्रियः क्षपो वस्तुषु राजसि
pada pāṭha: tava | drapsaḥ | nīla-vān | vāśaḥ | r̥tviyaḥ | indhānaḥ | siṣṇo iti | ā | dade || tvam | mahīnām | uṣasām | asi | priyaḥ | kṣapaḥ | vastuṣu | rājasi ||8.19.31||
