IAST: tam āganma sobharayaḥ sahasramuṣkaṁ svabhiṣṭim avase
Griffith: We Sobharis have come to him, for succour, who is good to help with thousand powers,
pada pāṭha: tam | ā | aganma | sobharayaḥ | sahasra-muṣkam | su-abhiṣṭim | avase || sam-rājam | trāsadasyavam ||8.19.32||

IAST: samrājaṁ trāsadasyavam
Griffith: The Sovran, Trasadasyu's Friend.
pada pāṭha: tam | ā | aganma | sobharayaḥ | sahasra-muṣkam | su-abhiṣṭim | avase || sam-rājam | trāsadasyavam ||8.19.32||

IAST: yasya te agne anye agnaya upakṣito vayā iva
Griffith: O Agni, thou on whom all other fires depend, as branches on the parent stem,
Devanāgarī: यस्य ते अग्ने अन्ये अग्नय उपक्षितो वया इव
pada pāṭha: yasya | te | agne | anye | agnayaḥ | upa-kṣitaḥ | vayāḥ-iva || vipaḥ | na | dyumnā | ni | yuve | janānām | tava | kṣatrāṇi | vardhayan ||8.19.33||

IAST: vipo na dyumnā ni yuve janānāṁ tava kṣatrāṇi vardhayan
Griffith: I make the treasures of the folk, like songs, mine own, while I exalt thy sovran might.
Devanāgarī: विपो न द्युम्ना नि युवे जनानां तव क्षत्राणि वर्धयन्
pada pāṭha: yasya | te | agne | anye | agnayaḥ | upa-kṣitaḥ | vayāḥ-iva || vipaḥ | na | dyumnā | ni | yuve | janānām | tava | kṣatrāṇi | vardhayan ||8.19.33||

IAST: yam ādityāso adruhaḥ pāraṁ nayatha martyam
Griffith: The mortal whom, Adityas, ye, Guilelew, lead to the farther bank
pada pāṭha: yam | ādityāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | pāram | nayatha | martyam || maghonām | viśveṣām | su-dānavaḥ ||8.19.34||

IAST: maghonāṁ viśveṣāṁ sudānavaḥ
Griffith: Of all the princes, Bounteous Ones
pada pāṭha: yam | ādityāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | pāram | nayatha | martyam || maghonām | viśveṣām | su-dānavaḥ ||8.19.34||

IAST: yūyaṁ rājānaḥ kaṁ cic carṣaṇīsahaḥ kṣayantam mānuṣām̐ anu
Griffith: Whoe'er he be, Man-ruling Kings! the Regent of the race of men-
Devanāgarī: यूयं राजानः कं चिच्चर्षणीसहः क्षयन्तं मानुषाँ अनु
pada pāṭha: yūyam | rājānaḥ | kam | cit | carṣaṇi-sahaḥ | kṣayantam | mānuṣān | anu || vayam | te | vaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | aryaman | syāma | it | r̥tasya | rathyaḥ ||8.19.35||

IAST: vayaṁ te vo varuṇa mitrāryaman syāmed ṛtasya rathyaḥ
Griffith: May we, O Mitra, Varuna, and Aryaman, like him be furtherers of your law.
Devanāgarī: वयं ते वो वरुण मित्रार्यमन्स्यामेदृतस्य रथ्यः
pada pāṭha: yūyam | rājānaḥ | kam | cit | carṣaṇi-sahaḥ | kṣayantam | mānuṣān | anu || vayam | te | vaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | aryaman | syāma | it | r̥tasya | rathyaḥ ||8.19.35||

IAST: adān me paurukutsyaḥ pañcāśataṁ trasadasyur vadhūnām
Griffith: A gift of fifty female slaves hath Trasadasyu given me, Purukutsa's son,
pada pāṭha: adāt | me | pauru-kutsyaḥ | pañcāśatam | trasadasyuḥ | vadhūnām || maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | aryaḥ | sat-patiḥ ||8.19.36||

IAST: maṁhiṣṭho aryaḥ satpatiḥ
Griffith: Most liberal, kind, lord of the brave.
pada pāṭha: adāt | me | pauru-kutsyaḥ | pañcāśatam | trasadasyuḥ | vadhūnām || maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | aryaḥ | sat-patiḥ ||8.19.36||

IAST: uta me prayiyor vayiyoḥ suvāstvā adhi tugvani
Griffith: And Syava too for me led forth a strong steed at Suvastu's ford:
Devanāgarī: उत मे प्रयियोर्वयियोः सुवास्त्वा अधि तुग्वनि
pada pāṭha: uta | me | prayiyoḥ | vayiyoḥ | su-vāstvāḥ | adhi | tugvani || tisr̥̄ṇām | saptatīnām | śyāvaḥ | pra-netā | bhuvat | vasuḥ | diyānām | patiḥ ||8.19.37||

IAST: tisṝṇāṁ saptatīnāṁ śyāvaḥ praṇetā bhuvad vasur diyānām patiḥ
Griffith: A herd of three times seventy kine, good lord of gifts, he gave to me.
Devanāgarī: तिसॄणां सप्ततीनां श्यावः प्रणेता भुवद्वसुर्दियानां पतिः
pada pāṭha: uta | me | prayiyoḥ | vayiyoḥ | su-vāstvāḥ | adhi | tugvani || tisr̥̄ṇām | saptatīnām | śyāvaḥ | pra-netā | bhuvat | vasuḥ | diyānām | patiḥ ||8.19.37||

IAST: ā gantā mā riṣaṇyata prasthāvāno māpa sthātā samanyavaḥ
Griffith: LET none, Swift Travellers! check you: come hither, like-spirited, stay not far away,
Devanāgarī: आ गन्ता मा रिषण्यत प्रस्थावानो माप स्थाता समन्यवः
pada pāṭha: ā | ganta | mā | riṣaṇyata | pra-sthāvānaḥ | mā | apa | sthāta | sa-manyavaḥ || sthirā | cit | namayiṣṇavaḥ ||8.20.1||

IAST: sthirā cin namayiṣṇavaḥ
Griffith: Ye benders even of what is firm.
pada pāṭha: ā | ganta | mā | riṣaṇyata | pra-sthāvānaḥ | mā | apa | sthāta | sa-manyavaḥ || sthirā | cit | namayiṣṇavaḥ ||8.20.1||

IAST: vīḻupavibhir maruta ṛbhukṣaṇa ā rudrāsaḥ sudītibhiḥ
Griffith: Maruts, Rbhuksans, Rudras come ye with your cars strong-fellied and exceeding bright.
pada pāṭha: vīḷupavi-bhiḥ | marutaḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | ā | rudrāsaḥ | sudīti-bhiḥ || iṣā | naḥ | adya | ā | gata | puru-spr̥haḥ | yajñam | ā | sobharī-yavaḥ ||8.20.2||

IAST: iṣā no adyā gatā puruspṛho yajñam ā sobharīyavaḥ
Griffith: Come, ye for whom we long, with food, to sacrifice, come ye with love to Sobbari.
Devanāgarī: इषा नो अद्या गता पुरुस्पृहो यज्ञमा सोभरीयवः
pada pāṭha: vīḷupavi-bhiḥ | marutaḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | ā | rudrāsaḥ | sudīti-bhiḥ || iṣā | naḥ | adya | ā | gata | puru-spr̥haḥ | yajñam | ā | sobharī-yavaḥ ||8.20.2||

IAST: vidmā hi rudriyāṇāṁ śuṣmam ugram marutāṁ śimīvatām
Griffith: For well we know the vigorous might of Rudra's Sons, the Martits, who are passing strong,
Devanāgarī: विद्मा हि रुद्रियाणां शुष्ममुग्रं मरुतां शिमीवताम्
pada pāṭha: vidma | hi | rudriyāṇām | śuṣmam | ugram | marutām | śimī-vatām || viṣṇoḥ | eṣasya | mīḷhuṣām ||8.20.3||

IAST: viṣṇor eṣasya mīḻhuṣām
Griffith: Swift Visnu's band, who send the rain.,
pada pāṭha: vidma | hi | rudriyāṇām | śuṣmam | ugram | marutām | śimī-vatām || viṣṇoḥ | eṣasya | mīḷhuṣām ||8.20.3||

IAST: vi dvīpāni pāpatan tiṣṭhad ducchunobhe yujanta rodasī
Griffith: Islands are bursting forth and misery is stayed: the heaven and earth are joined in one.
pada pāṭha: vi | dvīpāni | pāpatan | tiṣṭhat | ducchunā | ubhe iti | yujanta | rodasī iti || pra | dhanvāni | airata | śubhra-khādayaḥ | yat | ejatha | sva-bhānavaḥ ||8.20.4||

IAST: pra dhanvāny airata śubhrakhādayo yad ejatha svabhānavaḥ
Griffith: Decked with bright rings, ye spread the broad expanses out, when ye, Self. luminous, stirred yourselves
pada pāṭha: vi | dvīpāni | pāpatan | tiṣṭhat | ducchunā | ubhe iti | yujanta | rodasī iti || pra | dhanvāni | airata | śubhra-khādayaḥ | yat | ejatha | sva-bhānavaḥ ||8.20.4||

IAST: acyutā cid vo ajmann ā nānadati parvatāso vanaspatiḥ
Griffith: Even things immovable shake and reel, the mountains and the forest trees at your approach,
Devanāgarī: अच्युता चिद्वो अज्मन्ना नानदति पर्वतासो वनस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: acyutā | cit | vaḥ | ajman | ā | nānadati | parvatāsaḥ | vanaspatiḥ || bhūmiḥ | yāmeṣu | rejate ||8.20.5||

IAST: bhūmir yāmeṣu rejate
Griffith: And the earth trembles as ye come.
pada pāṭha: acyutā | cit | vaḥ | ajman | ā | nānadati | parvatāsaḥ | vanaspatiḥ || bhūmiḥ | yāmeṣu | rejate ||8.20.5||

IAST: amāya vo maruto yātave dyaur jihīta uttarā bṛhat
Griffith: To lend free course, O Maruts, to your furious rush, heaven high and higher still gives way,
Devanāgarī: अमाय वो मरुतो यातवे द्यौर्जिहीत उत्तरा बृहत्
pada pāṭha: amāya | vaḥ | marutaḥ | yātave | dyauḥ | jihīte | ut-tarā | br̥hat || yatra | naraḥ | dediśate | tanūṣu | ā | tvakṣāṁsi | bahu-ojasaḥ ||8.20.6||

IAST: yatrā naro dediśate tanūṣv ā tvakṣāṁsi bāhvojasaḥ
Griffith: Where they, the Heroes mighty with their arms, display their gleaming omaments on their forms.
Devanāgarī: यत्रा नरो देदिशते तनूष्वा त्वक्षांसि बाह्वोजसः
pada pāṭha: amāya | vaḥ | marutaḥ | yātave | dyauḥ | jihīte | ut-tarā | br̥hat || yatra | naraḥ | dediśate | tanūṣu | ā | tvakṣāṁsi | bahu-ojasaḥ ||8.20.6||

IAST: svadhām anu śriyaṁ naro mahi tveṣā amavanto vṛṣapsavaḥ
Griffith: After their Godlike nature they, the bull. like Heroes, dazzling and impetuous, wear
Devanāgarī: स्वधामनु श्रियं नरो महि त्वेषा अमवन्तो वृषप्सवः
pada pāṭha: svadhām | anu | śriyam | naraḥ | mahi | tveṣāḥ | ama-vantaḥ | vr̥ṣa-psavaḥ || vahante | ahruta-psavaḥ ||8.20.7||

IAST: vahante ahrutapsavaḥ
Griffith: Great splendour as they show erect.
pada pāṭha: svadhām | anu | śriyam | naraḥ | mahi | tveṣāḥ | ama-vantaḥ | vr̥ṣa-psavaḥ || vahante | ahruta-psavaḥ ||8.20.7||

IAST: gobhir vāṇo ajyate sobharīṇāṁ rathe kośe hiraṇyaye
Griffith: The pivot of the Sobharis' chariot within the golden box is balmed with milk.
Devanāgarī: गोभिर्वाणो अज्यते सोभरीणां रथे कोशे हिरण्यये
pada pāṭha: gobhiḥ | vāṇaḥ | ajyate | sobharīṇām | rathe | kośe | hiraṇyaye || go-bandhavaḥ | su-jātāsaḥ | iṣe | bhuje | mahāntaḥ | naḥ | sparase | nu ||8.20.8||

IAST: gobandhavaḥ sujātāsa iṣe bhuje mahānto naḥ sparase nu
Griffith: May they the Well-born, Mighty, kindred of the Cow, aid us to food and to delight.
Devanāgarī: गोबन्धवः सुजातास इषे भुजे महान्तो नः स्परसे नु
pada pāṭha: gobhiḥ | vāṇaḥ | ajyate | sobharīṇām | rathe | kośe | hiraṇyaye || go-bandhavaḥ | su-jātāsaḥ | iṣe | bhuje | mahāntaḥ | naḥ | sparase | nu ||8.20.8||

IAST: prati vo vṛṣadañjayo vṛṣṇe śardhāya mārutāya bharadhvam
Griffith: Bring, ye who sprinkle balmy drops. oblations to your vigorous Marut company,
Devanāgarī: प्रति वो वृषदञ्जयो वृष्णे शर्धाय मारुताय भरध्वम्
pada pāṭha: prati | vaḥ | vr̥ṣat-añjayaḥ | vr̥ṣṇe | śardhāya | mārutāya | bharadhvam || havyā | vr̥ṣa-prayāvne ||8.20.9||

IAST: havyā vṛṣaprayāvṇe
Griffith: To those whose leader is the Bull.
pada pāṭha: prati | vaḥ | vr̥ṣat-añjayaḥ | vr̥ṣṇe | śardhāya | mārutāya | bharadhvam || havyā | vr̥ṣa-prayāvne ||8.20.9||

IAST: vṛṣaṇaśvena maruto vṛṣapsunā rathena vṛṣanābhinā
Griffith: Come hither, O ye Mares, on your stronghorsed car, solid in look, with solid naves.
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣaṇaśvena | marutaḥ | vr̥ṣa-psunā | rathena | vr̥ṣa-nābhinā || ā | śyenāsaḥ | na | pakṣiṇaḥ | vr̥thā | naraḥ | havyā | naḥ | vītaye | gata ||8.20.10||

IAST: ā śyenāso na pakṣiṇo vṛthā naro havyā no vītaye gata
Griffith: Lightly like winged falcons, O ye Heroes, come, come to enjoy our ofrerings.
Devanāgarī: आ श्येनासो न पक्षिणो वृथा नरो हव्या नो वीतये गत
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣaṇaśvena | marutaḥ | vr̥ṣa-psunā | rathena | vr̥ṣa-nābhinā || ā | śyenāsaḥ | na | pakṣiṇaḥ | vr̥thā | naraḥ | havyā | naḥ | vītaye | gata ||8.20.10||

IAST: samānam añjy eṣāṁ vi bhrājante rukmāso adhi bāhuṣu
Griffith: Their decoration is the same: their omaments of gold are bright upon their arms;
Devanāgarī: समानमञ्ज्येषां वि भ्राजन्ते रुक्मासो अधि बाहुषु
pada pāṭha: samānam | añji | eṣām | vi | bhrājante | rukmāsaḥ | adhi | bāhuṣu || davidyutati | r̥ṣṭayaḥ ||8.20.11||

IAST: davidyutaty ṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: Their lances glitter splendidly.
pada pāṭha: samānam | añji | eṣām | vi | bhrājante | rukmāsaḥ | adhi | bāhuṣu || davidyutati | r̥ṣṭayaḥ ||8.20.11||

IAST: ta ugrāso vṛṣaṇa ugrabāhavo nakiṣ ṭanūṣu yetire
Griffith: They toil not to defend their bodies from attack, strong Heroes with their mighty arms.
Devanāgarī: त उग्रासो वृषण उग्रबाहवो नकिष्टनूषु येतिरे
pada pāṭha: te | ugrāsaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | ugra-bāhavaḥ | nakiḥ | tanūṣu | yetire || sthirā | dhanvāni | āyudhā | ratheṣu | vaḥ | anīkeṣu | adhi | śriyaḥ ||8.20.12||

IAST: sthirā dhanvāny āyudhā ratheṣu vo 'nīkeṣv adhi śriyaḥ
Griffith: Strong are your bows and strong the weapons in your cars, and glory sits on every face.
pada pāṭha: te | ugrāsaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | ugra-bāhavaḥ | nakiḥ | tanūṣu | yetire || sthirā | dhanvāni | āyudhā | ratheṣu | vaḥ | anīkeṣu | adhi | śriyaḥ ||8.20.12||

IAST: yeṣām arṇo na sapratho nāma tveṣaṁ śaśvatām ekam id bhuje
Griffith: Whose name extendeth like a sea, alone, resplendent, so that all have joy in it,
Devanāgarī: येषामर्णो न सप्रथो नाम त्वेषं शश्वतामेकमिद्भुजे
pada pāṭha: yeṣām | arṇaḥ | na | sa-prathaḥ | nāma | tveṣam | śaśvatām | ekam | it | bhuje || vayaḥ | na | pitryam | sahaḥ ||8.20.13||

IAST: vayo na pitryaṁ sahaḥ
Griffith: And life-power like ancestral might.
pada pāṭha: yeṣām | arṇaḥ | na | sa-prathaḥ | nāma | tveṣam | śaśvatām | ekam | it | bhuje || vayaḥ | na | pitryam | sahaḥ ||8.20.13||

IAST: tān vandasva marutas tām̐ upa stuhi teṣāṁ hi dhunīnām
Griffith: Pay honour to these Maruts and sing praise to them, for of the wheel-spokes of the car
Devanāgarī: तान्वन्दस्व मरुतस्ताँ उप स्तुहि तेषां हि धुनीनाम्
pada pāṭha: tān | vandasva | marutaḥ | tān | upa | stuhi | teṣām | hi | dhunīnām || arāṇām | na | caramaḥ | tat | eṣām | dānā | mahnā | tat | eṣām ||8.20.14||

IAST: arāṇāṁ na caramas tad eṣāṁ dānā mahnā tad eṣām
Griffith: Of these loud roarers none is last: this is their power, this moves them to give mighty gifts.
Devanāgarī: अराणां न चरमस्तदेषां दाना मह्ना तदेषाम्
pada pāṭha: tān | vandasva | marutaḥ | tān | upa | stuhi | teṣām | hi | dhunīnām || arāṇām | na | caramaḥ | tat | eṣām | dānā | mahnā | tat | eṣām ||8.20.14||

IAST: subhagaḥ sa va ūtiṣv āsa pūrvāsu maruto vyuṣṭiṣu
Griffith: Blest by your favouring help was he, O Maruts, at the earlier flushings of the morn,
Devanāgarī: सुभगः स व ऊतिष्वास पूर्वासु मरुतो व्युष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: su-bhagaḥ | saḥ | vaḥ | ūtiṣu | āsa | pūrvāsu | marutaḥ | vi-uṣṭiṣu || yaḥ | vā | nūnam | uta | asati ||8.20.15||

IAST: yo vā nūnam utāsati
Griffith: And even now shall he be blest.
pada pāṭha: su-bhagaḥ | saḥ | vaḥ | ūtiṣu | āsa | pūrvāsu | marutaḥ | vi-uṣṭiṣu || yaḥ | vā | nūnam | uta | asati ||8.20.15||

IAST: yasya vā yūyam prati vājino nara ā havyā vītaye gatha
Griffith: The strong man to whose sacrifice, O Heroes, ye approach that ye may taste thereof,
Devanāgarī: यस्य वा यूयं प्रति वाजिनो नर आ हव्या वीतये गथ
pada pāṭha: yasya | vā | yūyam | prati | vājinaḥ | naraḥ | ā | havyā | vītaye | gatha || abhi | saḥ | dyumnaiḥ | uta | vājasāti-bhiḥ | sumnā | vaḥ | dhūtayaḥ | naśat ||8.20.16||

IAST: abhi ṣa dyumnair uta vājasātibhiḥ sumnā vo dhūtayo naśat
Griffith: With glories and with war that winneth spoil shall gain great bliss, ye Shakers of the world.
Devanāgarī: अभि ष द्युम्नैरुत वाजसातिभिः सुम्ना वो धूतयो नशत्
pada pāṭha: yasya | vā | yūyam | prati | vājinaḥ | naraḥ | ā | havyā | vītaye | gatha || abhi | saḥ | dyumnaiḥ | uta | vājasāti-bhiḥ | sumnā | vaḥ | dhūtayaḥ | naśat ||8.20.16||

IAST: yathā rudrasya sūnavo divo vaśanty asurasya vedhasaḥ
Griffith: Even as Rudra's Sons, the brood of the Creator Dyaus, the Asura, desire,
Devanāgarī: यथा रुद्रस्य सूनवो दिवो वशन्त्यसुरस्य वेधसः
pada pāṭha: yathā | rudrasya | sūnavaḥ | divaḥ | vaśanti | asurasya | vedhasaḥ || yuvānaḥ | tathā | it | asat ||8.20.17||

IAST: yuvānas tathed asat
Griffith: O Youthful Ones, so shall it be:
pada pāṭha: yathā | rudrasya | sūnavaḥ | divaḥ | vaśanti | asurasya | vedhasaḥ || yuvānaḥ | tathā | it | asat ||8.20.17||

IAST: ye cārhanti marutaḥ sudānavaḥ sman mīḻhuṣaś caranti ye
Griffith: And these the bounteous, worthy of the Maruts who move onward pouring down the rain-
Devanāgarī: ये चार्हन्ति मरुतः सुदानवः स्मन्मीळ्हुषश्चरन्ति ये
pada pāṭha: ye | ca | arhanti | marutaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | smat | mīḷhuṣaḥ | caranti | ye || ataḥ | cit | ā | naḥ | upa | vasyasā | hr̥dā | yuvānaḥ | ā | vavr̥dhvam ||8.20.18||

IAST: ataś cid ā na upa vasyasā hṛdā yuvāna ā vavṛdhvam
Griffith: Even for their sake, O Youthful Ones, with kindest heart take us to you to be your own.
Devanāgarī: अतश्चिदा न उप वस्यसा हृदा युवान आ ववृध्वम्
pada pāṭha: ye | ca | arhanti | marutaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | smat | mīḷhuṣaḥ | caranti | ye || ataḥ | cit | ā | naḥ | upa | vasyasā | hr̥dā | yuvānaḥ | ā | vavr̥dhvam ||8.20.18||

IAST: yūna ū ṣu naviṣṭhayā vṛṣṇaḥ pāvakām̐ abhi sobhare girā
Griffith: O Sobhari, with newest song sing out unto the youthful purifying Bulls,
Devanāgarī: यून ऊ षु नविष्ठया वृष्णः पावकाँ अभि सोभरे गिरा
pada pāṭha: yūnaḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | naviṣṭhayā | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | pāvakān | abhi | sobhare | girā || gāya | gāḥ-iva | carkr̥ṣat ||8.20.19||

IAST: gāya gā iva carkṛṣat
Griffith: Even as a plougher to his steers.
pada pāṭha: yūnaḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | naviṣṭhayā | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | pāvakān | abhi | sobhare | girā || gāya | gāḥ-iva | carkr̥ṣat ||8.20.19||

IAST: sāhā ye santi muṣṭiheva havyo viśvāsu pṛtsu hotṛṣu
Griffith: Who, like a celebrated boxer, overcome the challengers in every fight:
Devanāgarī: साहा ये सन्ति मुष्टिहेव हव्यो विश्वासु पृत्सु होतृषु
pada pāṭha: sahāḥ | ye | santi | muṣṭihā-iva | havyaḥ | viśvāsu | pr̥t-su | hotr̥ṣu || vr̥ṣṇaḥ | candrān | na | suśravaḥ-tamān | girā | vandasva | marutaḥ | aha ||8.20.20||

IAST: vṛṣṇaś candrān na suśravastamān girā vandasva maruto aha
Griffith: They who, like shining bulls, are most illustrious-honour those Maruts with thy song.
pada pāṭha: sahāḥ | ye | santi | muṣṭihā-iva | havyaḥ | viśvāsu | pr̥t-su | hotr̥ṣu || vr̥ṣṇaḥ | candrān | na | suśravaḥ-tamān | girā | vandasva | marutaḥ | aha ||8.20.20||

IAST: gāvaś cid ghā samanyavaḥ sajātyena marutaḥ sabandhavaḥ
Griffith: Allied by common ancestry, ye Maruts, even the Cows, alike in energy,
pada pāṭha: gāvaḥ | cit | gha | sa-manyavaḥ | sa-jātyena | marutaḥ | sa-bandhavaḥ || rihate | kakubhaḥ | mithaḥ ||8.20.21||

IAST: rihate kakubho mithaḥ
Griffith: Lick, all by turns, each other's head.
pada pāṭha: gāvaḥ | cit | gha | sa-manyavaḥ | sa-jātyena | marutaḥ | sa-bandhavaḥ || rihate | kakubhaḥ | mithaḥ ||8.20.21||

IAST: martaś cid vo nṛtavo rukmavakṣasa upa bhrātṛtvam āyati
Griffith: Even mortal man, ye Dancers breast adorned with gold, attains to brotherhood with you.
pada pāṭha: martaḥ | cit | vaḥ | nr̥tavaḥ | rukma-vakṣasaḥ | upa | bhrātr̥-tvam | ā | ayati || adhi | naḥ | gāta | marutaḥ | sadā | hi | vaḥ | āpi-tvam | asti | ni-dhruvi ||8.20.22||

IAST: adhi no gāta marutaḥ sadā hi va āpitvam asti nidhruvi
Griffith: Mark ye and notice us, O Maruts; evermore your friendship is secured to us.
Devanāgarī: अधि नो गात मरुतः सदा हि व आपित्वमस्ति निध्रुवि
pada pāṭha: martaḥ | cit | vaḥ | nr̥tavaḥ | rukma-vakṣasaḥ | upa | bhrātr̥-tvam | ā | ayati || adhi | naḥ | gāta | marutaḥ | sadā | hi | vaḥ | āpi-tvam | asti | ni-dhruvi ||8.20.22||

IAST: maruto mārutasya na ā bheṣajasya vahatā sudānavaḥ
Griffith: O Maruts, rich in noble gifts, bring us a portion of the Maruts' medicine,
Devanāgarī: मरुतो मारुतस्य न आ भेषजस्य वहता सुदानवः
pada pāṭha: marutaḥ | mārutasya | naḥ | ā | bheṣajasya | vahata | su-dānavaḥ || yūyam | sakhāyaḥ | saptayaḥ ||8.20.23||

IAST: yūyaṁ sakhāyaḥ saptayaḥ
Griffith: Ye Coursers who are Friends to us.
pada pāṭha: marutaḥ | mārutasya | naḥ | ā | bheṣajasya | vahata | su-dānavaḥ || yūyam | sakhāyaḥ | saptayaḥ ||8.20.23||

IAST: yābhiḥ sindhum avatha yābhis tūrvatha yābhir daśasyathā krivim
Griffith: Haters of those who serve you not, bliss-bringers, bring us bliss with those auspicious aids
pada pāṭha: yābhiḥ | sindhum | avatha | yābhiḥ | tūrvatha | yābhiḥ | daśasyatha | krivim || mayaḥ | naḥ | bhūta | ūti-bhiḥ | mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | śivābhiḥ | asaca-dviṣaḥ ||8.20.24||

IAST: mayo no bhūtotibhir mayobhuvaḥ śivābhir asacadviṣaḥ
Griffith: Wherewith ye are victorious and guard Sindhu well, and succour Krvi in his need.
pada pāṭha: yābhiḥ | sindhum | avatha | yābhiḥ | tūrvatha | yābhiḥ | daśasyatha | krivim || mayaḥ | naḥ | bhūta | ūti-bhiḥ | mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | śivābhiḥ | asaca-dviṣaḥ ||8.20.24||

IAST: yat sindhau yad asiknyāṁ yat samudreṣu marutaḥ subarhiṣaḥ
Griffith: Maruts, who rest on fair trimmed grass, what balm soever Sindhu or Asikni hath,
pada pāṭha: yat | sindhau | yat | asiknyām | yat | samudreṣu | marutaḥ | su-barhiṣaḥ || yat | parvateṣu | bheṣajam ||8.20.25||

IAST: yat parvateṣu bheṣajam
Griffith: Or mountains or the seas contain.
pada pāṭha: yat | sindhau | yat | asiknyām | yat | samudreṣu | marutaḥ | su-barhiṣaḥ || yat | parvateṣu | bheṣajam ||8.20.25||

IAST: viśvam paśyanto bibhṛthā tanūṣv ā tenā no adhi vocata
Griffith: Ye carry on your bodies, ye who see it all: so bless us graciously therewith.
Devanāgarī: विश्वं पश्यन्तो बिभृथा तनूष्वा तेना नो अधि वोचत
pada pāṭha: viśvam | paśyantaḥ | vibhr̥tha | tanūṣu | ā | tena | naḥ | adhi | vocata || kṣamā | rapaḥ | marutaḥ | āturasya | naḥ | iṣkarta | vi-hrutam | punariti ||8.20.26||

IAST: kṣamā rapo maruta āturasya na iṣkartā vihrutam punaḥ
Griffith: Cast, Maruts, to the ground our sick man's malady: replace the dislocated limb.
Devanāgarī: क्षमा रपो मरुत आतुरस्य न इष्कर्ता विह्रुतं पुनः
pada pāṭha: viśvam | paśyantaḥ | vibhr̥tha | tanūṣu | ā | tena | naḥ | adhi | vocata || kṣamā | rapaḥ | marutaḥ | āturasya | naḥ | iṣkarta | vi-hrutam | punariti ||8.20.26||

IAST: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūraṁ na kac cid bharanto 'vasyavaḥ
Griffith: WE call on thee, O Matchless One! We seeking help, possessing nothing firm ourselves,
pada pāṭha: vayam | ūm̐ iti | tvām | apūrvya | sthūram | na | kat | cit | bharantaḥ | avasyavaḥ || vāje | citram | havāmahe ||8.21.1||

IAST: vāje citraṁ havāmahe
Griffith: Call on thee wonderful in fight
pada pāṭha: vayam | ūm̐ iti | tvām | apūrvya | sthūram | na | kat | cit | bharantaḥ | avasyavaḥ || vāje | citram | havāmahe ||8.21.1||

IAST: upa tvā karmann ūtaye sa no yuvograś cakrāma yo dhṛṣat
Griffith: On thee for aid in sacrifice. This youth of ours, the bold, the mighty, hath gonse forth.
Devanāgarī: उप त्वा कर्मन्नूतये स नो युवोग्रश्चक्राम यो धृषत्
pada pāṭha: upa | tvā | karman | ūtaye | saḥ | naḥ | yuvā | ugraḥ | cakrāma | yaḥ | dhr̥ṣat || tvām | it | hi | avitāram | vavr̥mahe | sakhāyaḥ | indra | sānasim ||8.21.2||

IAST: tvām id dhy avitāraṁ vavṛmahe sakhāya indra sānasim
Griffith: We therefore, we thy friends, Indra, havie chosen thee, free-giver, as our Guardian God.
pada pāṭha: upa | tvā | karman | ūtaye | saḥ | naḥ | yuvā | ugraḥ | cakrāma | yaḥ | dhr̥ṣat || tvām | it | hi | avitāram | vavr̥mahe | sakhāyaḥ | indra | sānasim ||8.21.2||

IAST: ā yāhīma indavo 'śvapate gopata urvarāpate
Griffith: Come hither, for the drops are here, O Lord of corn-lands. Lord of horses, Lord of kine:
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | ime | indavaḥ | aśva-pate | go-pate | urvarā-pate || somam | soma-pate | piba ||8.21.3||

IAST: somaṁ somapate piba
Griffith: Drink thou the Soma, Soma's Lord!
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | ime | indavaḥ | aśva-pate | go-pate | urvarā-pate || somam | soma-pate | piba ||8.21.3||

IAST: vayaṁ hi tvā bandhumantam abandhavo viprāsa indra yemima
Griffith: For we the kinless singers have drawn hither thee, O Indra, who hast numerous kin.
Devanāgarī: वयं हि त्वा बन्धुमन्तमबन्धवो विप्रास इन्द्र येमिम
pada pāṭha: vayam | hi | tvā | bandhu-mantam | abandhavaḥ | viprāsaḥ | indra | yemima || yā | te | dhāmāni | vr̥ṣabha | tebhiḥ | ā | gahi | viśvebhiḥ | soma-pītaye ||8.21.4||

IAST: yā te dhāmāni vṛṣabha tebhir ā gahi viśvebhiḥ somapītaye
Griffith: With all the forms thou hast, comic thou of bull-like strength, come near to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: या ते धामानि वृषभ तेभिरा गहि विश्वेभिः सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: vayam | hi | tvā | bandhu-mantam | abandhavaḥ | viprāsaḥ | indra | yemima || yā | te | dhāmāni | vr̥ṣabha | tebhiḥ | ā | gahi | viśvebhiḥ | soma-pītaye ||8.21.4||

IAST: sīdantas te vayo yathā gośrīte madhau madire vivakṣaṇe
Griffith: Sitting like birds beside thy meath., mingled with milk, that gladdeneth and exalteth thee,
Devanāgarī: सीदन्तस्ते वयो यथा गोश्रीते मधौ मदिरे विवक्षणे
pada pāṭha: sīdantaḥ | te | vayaḥ | yathā | go-śrīte | madhau | madire | vivakṣaṇe || abhi | tvām | indra | nonumaḥ ||8.21.5||

IAST: abhi tvām indra nonumaḥ
Griffith: Indra, to thee we sing aloud.
pada pāṭha: sīdantaḥ | te | vayaḥ | yathā | go-śrīte | madhau | madire | vivakṣaṇe || abhi | tvām | indra | nonumaḥ ||8.21.5||

IAST: acchā ca tvainā namasā vadāmasi kim muhuś cid vi dīdhayaḥ
Griffith: We speak to thee with this our reverential prayer. Why art thou pondering yet awhile?
Devanāgarī: अच्छा च त्वैना नमसा वदामसि किं मुहुश्चिद्वि दीधयः
pada pāṭha: accha | ca | tvā | enā | namasā | vadāmasi | kim | muhuḥ | cit | vi | dīdhayaḥ || santi | kāmāsaḥ | hari-vaḥ | dadiḥ | tvam | smaḥ | vayam | santi | naḥ | dhiyaḥ ||8.21.6||

IAST: santi kāmāso harivo dadiṣ ṭvaṁ smo vayaṁ santi no dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Here are our wishes; thou art liberal, Lord of Bays: we and our hymns are present here.
Devanāgarī: सन्ति कामासो हरिवो ददिष्ट्वं स्मो वयं सन्ति नो धियः
pada pāṭha: accha | ca | tvā | enā | namasā | vadāmasi | kim | muhuḥ | cit | vi | dīdhayaḥ || santi | kāmāsaḥ | hari-vaḥ | dadiḥ | tvam | smaḥ | vayam | santi | naḥ | dhiyaḥ ||8.21.6||

IAST: nūtnā id indra te vayam ūtī abhūma nahi nū te adrivaḥ
Griffith: For not in recent times alone, O Indra, Thunder-armed, have we obtained thine aid.
Devanāgarī: नूत्ना इदिन्द्र ते वयमूती अभूम नहि नू ते अद्रिवः
pada pāṭha: nūtnāḥ | it | indra | te | vayam | ūtī | abhūma | nahi | nu | te | adri-vaḥ || vidma | purā | parīṇasaḥ ||8.21.7||

IAST: vidmā purā parīṇasaḥ
Griffith: Of old we knew thy plenteous wealth.
pada pāṭha: nūtnāḥ | it | indra | te | vayam | ūtī | abhūma | nahi | nu | te | adri-vaḥ || vidma | purā | parīṇasaḥ ||8.21.7||

IAST: vidmā sakhitvam uta śūra bhojyam ā te tā vajrinn īmahe
Griffith: Hero, we knew thy friendship and thy rich rewards: these, Thunderer, now we crave of thee.
Devanāgarī: विद्मा सखित्वमुत शूर भोज्यमा ते ता वज्रिन्नीमहे
pada pāṭha: vidma | sakhi-tvam | uta | śūra | bhojyam | ā | te | tā | vajrin | īmahe || uto iti | samasmin | ā | śiśīhi | naḥ | vaso iti | vāje | su-śipra | go-mati ||8.21.8||

IAST: uto samasminn ā śiśīhi no vaso vāje suśipra gomati
Griffith: O Vasu, for all wealth that cometh of the kine, sharpen our powers, fair-visored God.
Devanāgarī: उतो समस्मिन्ना शिशीहि नो वसो वाजे सुशिप्र गोमति
pada pāṭha: vidma | sakhi-tvam | uta | śūra | bhojyam | ā | te | tā | vajrin | īmahe || uto iti | samasmin | ā | śiśīhi | naḥ | vaso iti | vāje | su-śipra | go-mati ||8.21.8||

IAST: yo na idam-idam purā pra vasya ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe
Griffith: Him who of old hath brought to us this and that blessing, him I magnify for you,
Devanāgarī: यो न इदमिदं पुरा प्र वस्य आनिनाय तमु वः स्तुषे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | idam-idam | purā | pra | vasyaḥ | ā-nināya | tam | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | stuṣe || sakhāyaḥ | indram | ūtaye ||8.21.9||

IAST: sakhāya indram ūtaye
Griffith: Even Indra, O my friends, for help
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | idam-idam | purā | pra | vasyaḥ | ā-nināya | tam | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | stuṣe || sakhāyaḥ | indram | ūtaye ||8.21.9||

IAST: haryaśvaṁ satpatiṁ carṣaṇīsahaṁ sa hi ṣmā yo amandata
Griffith: Borne by Bay Steeds, the Lord of heroes, ruling men, for it is he who takes; delight.
Devanāgarī: हर्यश्वं सत्पतिं चर्षणीसहं स हि ष्मा यो अमन्दत
pada pāṭha: hari-aśvam | sat-patim | carṣaṇi-saham | saḥ | hi | sma | yaḥ | amandata || ā | tu | naḥ | saḥ | vayati | gavyam | aśvyam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | magha-vā | śatam ||8.21.10||

IAST: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyaṁ stotṛbhyo maghavā śatam
Griffith: May Maghavan bestow on us his worshippers hundreds of cattle and of steeds.
Devanāgarī: आ तु नः स वयति गव्यमश्व्यं स्तोतृभ्यो मघवा शतम्
pada pāṭha: hari-aśvam | sat-patim | carṣaṇi-saham | saḥ | hi | sma | yaḥ | amandata || ā | tu | naḥ | saḥ | vayati | gavyam | aśvyam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | magha-vā | śatam ||8.21.10||

IAST: tvayā ha svid yujā vayam prati śvasantaṁ vṛṣabha bruvīmahi
Griffith: Hero, may we, with thee for Friend, withstand the man who pants against us in his wrath,
Devanāgarī: त्वया ह स्विद्युजा वयं प्रति श्वसन्तं वृषभ ब्रुवीमहि
pada pāṭha: tvayā | ha | svit | yujā | vayam | prati | śvasantam | vr̥ṣabha | bruvīmahi || sam-sthe | janasya | go-mataḥ ||8.21.11||

IAST: saṁsthe janasya gomataḥ
Griffith: In fight with people rich in kine.
pada pāṭha: tvayā | ha | svit | yujā | vayam | prati | śvasantam | vr̥ṣabha | bruvīmahi || sam-sthe | janasya | go-mataḥ ||8.21.11||

IAST: jayema kāre puruhūta kāriṇo 'bhi tiṣṭhema dūḍhyaḥ
Griffith: May we be victors in the singer's battlesong, and meet the wicked, Much invoked!
Devanāgarī: जयेम कारे पुरुहूत कारिणोऽभि तिष्ठेम दूढ्यः
pada pāṭha: jayema | kāre | puru-hūta | kāriṇaḥ | abhi | tiṣṭhema | duḥ-dhyaḥ || nr̥-bhiḥ | vr̥tram | hanyāma | śūśuyāma | ca | aveḥ | indra | pra | naḥ | dhiyaḥ ||8.21.12||

IAST: nṛbhir vṛtraṁ hanyāma śūśuyāma cāver indra pra ṇo dhiyaḥ
Griffith: With heroes smite the foeman and show forth our strength. O Indra, further thou our thoughts.
Devanāgarī: नृभिर्वृत्रं हन्याम शूशुयाम चावेरिन्द्र प्र णो धियः
pada pāṭha: jayema | kāre | puru-hūta | kāriṇaḥ | abhi | tiṣṭhema | duḥ-dhyaḥ || nr̥-bhiḥ | vr̥tram | hanyāma | śūśuyāma | ca | aveḥ | indra | pra | naḥ | dhiyaḥ ||8.21.12||

IAST: abhrātṛvyo anā tvam anāpir indra januṣā sanād asi
Griffith: O Indra, from all ancient time rivalless ever and companionless art thou:
pada pāṭha: abhrātr̥vyaḥ | anā | tvam | anāpiḥ | indra | januṣā | sanāt | asi || yudhā | it | āpi-tvam | icchase ||8.21.13||

IAST: yudhed āpitvam icchase
Griffith: Thou seekest comradeship in war.
pada pāṭha: abhrātr̥vyaḥ | anā | tvam | anāpiḥ | indra | januṣā | sanāt | asi || yudhā | it | āpi-tvam | icchase ||8.21.13||

IAST: nakī revantaṁ sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ
Griffith: Thou findest not the wealthy man to be thy friend: those scorn thee who are flown with wine.
Devanāgarī: नकी रेवन्तं सख्याय विन्दसे पीयन्ति ते सुराश्वः
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | revantam | sakhyāya | vindase | pīyanti | te | surāśvaḥ || yadā | kr̥ṇoṣi | nadanum | sam | ūhasi | āt | it | pitā-iva | hūyase ||8.21.14||

IAST: yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanuṁ sam ūhasy ād it piteva hūyase
Griffith: What time thou thunderest and gatherest, then thou, even as a Father, art invoked.
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | revantam | sakhyāya | vindase | pīyanti | te | surāśvaḥ || yadā | kr̥ṇoṣi | nadanum | sam | ūhasi | āt | it | pitā-iva | hūyase ||8.21.14||

IAST: mā te amājuro yathā mūrāsa indra sakhye tvāvataḥ
Griffith: O Indra, let us not, like fools who waste their lives at home, with friendship such as thine
Devanāgarī: मा ते अमाजुरो यथा मूरास इन्द्र सख्ये त्वावतः
pada pāṭha: mā | te | amā-juraḥ | yathā | mūrāsaḥ | indra | sakhye | tvā-vataḥ || ni | sadāma | sacā | sute ||8.21.15||

IAST: ni ṣadāma sacā sute
Griffith: Sit idly by the poured-out juice.
pada pāṭha: mā | te | amā-juraḥ | yathā | mūrāsaḥ | indra | sakhye | tvā-vataḥ || ni | sadāma | sacā | sute ||8.21.15||

IAST: mā te godatra nir arāma rādhasa indra mā te gṛhāmahi
Griffith: Giver of kine, may we not miss thy gracious gifts: let us not rob thee of thine own.
Devanāgarī: मा ते गोदत्र निरराम राधस इन्द्र मा ते गृहामहि
pada pāṭha: mā | te | go-datra | niḥ | arāma | rādhasaḥ | indra | mā | te | gr̥hāmahi || dr̥ḷhā | cit | aryaḥ | pra | mr̥śa | abhi | ā | bhara | na | te | dāmānaḥ | ā-dabhe ||8.21.16||

IAST: dṛḻhā cid aryaḥ pra mṛśābhy ā bhara na te dāmāna ādabhe
Griffith: Strip even the strong places of the foe, and bring: thy gifts can never be made vain.
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हा चिदर्यः प्र मृशाभ्या भर न ते दामान आदभे
pada pāṭha: mā | te | go-datra | niḥ | arāma | rādhasaḥ | indra | mā | te | gr̥hāmahi || dr̥ḷhā | cit | aryaḥ | pra | mr̥śa | abhi | ā | bhara | na | te | dāmānaḥ | ā-dabhe ||8.21.16||

IAST: indro vā ghed iyan maghaṁ sarasvatī vā subhagā dadir vasu
Griffith: Indra or blest Sarasvati alone bestows such wealth, treasure so great, or thou,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो वा घेदियन्मघं सरस्वती वा सुभगा ददिर्वसु
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | vā | gha | it | iyat | magham | sarasvatī | vā | su-bhagā | dadiḥ | vasu || tvam | vā | citra | dāśuṣe ||8.21.17||

IAST: tvaṁ vā citra dāśuṣe
Griffith: O Citra, on the worshipper.
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | vā | gha | it | iyat | magham | sarasvatī | vā | su-bhagā | dadiḥ | vasu || tvam | vā | citra | dāśuṣe ||8.21.17||

IAST: citra id rājā rājakā id anyake yake sarasvatīm anu
Griffith: Citra is King, and only kinglings are the rest who dwell beside Sarasvati.
Devanāgarī: चित्र इद्राजा राजका इदन्यके यके सरस्वतीमनु
pada pāṭha: citraḥ | it | rājā | rājakāḥ | it | anyake | yake | sarasvatīm | anu || parjanyaḥ-iva | tatanat | hi | vr̥ṣṭyā | sahasram | ayutā | dadat ||8.21.18||

IAST: parjanya iva tatanad dhi vṛṣṭyā sahasram ayutā dadat
Griffith: He, like Parjanya with his rain, hath spread himself with thousand, yea, with myriad gifts.
Devanāgarī: पर्जन्य इव ततनद्धि वृष्ट्या सहस्रमयुता ददत्
pada pāṭha: citraḥ | it | rājā | rājakāḥ | it | anyake | yake | sarasvatīm | anu || parjanyaḥ-iva | tatanat | hi | vr̥ṣṭyā | sahasram | ayutā | dadat ||8.21.18||

IAST: o tyam ahva ā ratham adyā daṁsiṣṭham ūtaye
Griffith: HITHERWARD have I called to-day, for succour, that most wondrous car
pada pāṭha: o iti | tyam | ahve | ā | ratham | adya | daṁsiṣṭham | ūtaye || yam | aśvinā | su-havā | rudravartanī iti rudra-vartanī | ā | sūryāyai | tasthathuḥ ||8.22.1||

IAST: yam aśvinā suhavā rudravartanī ā sūryāyai tasthathuḥ
Griffith: Which ye ascended, Asvins, ye whose paths are red, swift to give Car, for Surya's sake.
Devanāgarī: यमश्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी आ सूर्यायै तस्थथुः
pada pāṭha: o iti | tyam | ahve | ā | ratham | adya | daṁsiṣṭham | ūtaye || yam | aśvinā | su-havā | rudravartanī iti rudra-vartanī | ā | sūryāyai | tasthathuḥ ||8.22.1||

IAST: pūrvāyuṣaṁ suhavam puruspṛham bhujyuṁ vājeṣu pūrvyam
Griffith: Car ever young, much longed-for, easily invoked, soon guided, first in deeds of might,
Devanāgarī: पूर्वायुषं सुहवं पुरुस्पृहं भुज्युं वाजेषु पूर्व्यम्
pada pāṭha: pūrva-āpuṣam | su-havam | puru-spr̥ham | bhujyum | vājeṣu | pūrvyam || sacanā-vantam | sumati-bhiḥ | sobhare | vi-dveṣasam | anehasam ||8.22.2||

IAST: sacanāvantaṁ sumatibhiḥ sobhare vidveṣasam anehasam
Griffith: Which waits and serves, O Sobhari, with benevolence, without a rival or a foe.
pada pāṭha: pūrva-āpuṣam | su-havam | puru-spr̥ham | bhujyum | vājeṣu | pūrvyam || sacanā-vantam | sumati-bhiḥ | sobhare | vi-dveṣasam | anehasam ||8.22.2||

IAST: iha tyā purubhūtamā devā namobhir aśvinā
Griffith: These Asvins with our homage, these Two Omnipresent Deities
pada pāṭha: iha | tyā | puru-bhūtamā | devā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | aśvinā || arvācīnā | su | avase | karāmahe | gantārā | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham ||8.22.3||

IAST: arvācīnā sv avase karāmahe gantārā dāśuṣo gṛham
Griffith: Hitherward will we bring for kind help, these who seek the dwelling of the worshipper.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाचीना स्ववसे करामहे गन्तारा दाशुषो गृहम्
pada pāṭha: iha | tyā | puru-bhūtamā | devā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | aśvinā || arvācīnā | su | avase | karāmahe | gantārā | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham ||8.22.3||

IAST: yuvo rathasya pari cakram īyata īrmānyad vām iṣaṇyati
Griffith: One of your chariot wheels is moving swiftly round, one speeds for you its onward course.
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | rathasya | pari | cakram | īyate | īrmā | anyat | vām | iṣaṇyati || asmān | accha | su-matiḥ | vām | śubhaḥ | patī iti | ā | dhenuḥ-iva | dhāvatu ||8.22.4||

IAST: asmām̐ acchā sumatir vāṁ śubhas patī ā dhenur iva dhāvatu
Griffith: Like a milch-cow, O Lords of splendour, and with haste let your benevolence come to us.
Devanāgarī: अस्माँ अच्छा सुमतिर्वां शुभस्पती आ धेनुरिव धावतु
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | rathasya | pari | cakram | īyate | īrmā | anyat | vām | iṣaṇyati || asmān | accha | su-matiḥ | vām | śubhaḥ | patī iti | ā | dhenuḥ-iva | dhāvatu ||8.22.4||

IAST: ratho yo vāṁ trivandhuro hiraṇyābhīśur aśvinā
Griffith: That chariot of yours which hath a triple seat and reins of gold,
pada pāṭha: rathaḥ | yaḥ | vām | tri-vandhuraḥ | hiraṇya-abhīśuḥ | aśvinā || pari | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | bhūṣati | śrutaḥ | tena | nāsatyā | ā | gatam ||8.22.5||

IAST: pari dyāvāpṛthivī bhūṣati śrutas tena nāsatyā gatam
Griffith: The famous car that traverseth the heaven and earth, thereon Nasatyas, Asvins, come.
Devanāgarī: परि द्यावापृथिवी भूषति श्रुतस्तेन नासत्या गतम्
pada pāṭha: rathaḥ | yaḥ | vām | tri-vandhuraḥ | hiraṇya-abhīśuḥ | aśvinā || pari | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | bhūṣati | śrutaḥ | tena | nāsatyā | ā | gatam ||8.22.5||

IAST: daśasyantā manave pūrvyaṁ divi yavaṁ vṛkeṇa karṣathaḥ
Griffith: Ye with your plough, when favouring Manu with your help, ploughed the first harvest in the sky.
Devanāgarī: दशस्यन्ता मनवे पूर्व्यं दिवि यवं वृकेण कर्षथः
pada pāṭha: daśasyantā | manave | pūrvyam | divi | yavam | vr̥keṇa | karṣathaḥ || tā | vām | adya | sumati-bhiḥ | śubhaḥ | patī iti | aśvinā | pra | stuvīmahi ||8.22.6||

IAST: tā vām adya sumatibhiḥ śubhas patī aśvinā pra stuvīmahi
Griffith: As such will we exalt you, Lords of splendour, now, O Asvins, with our prayer and praise.
Devanāgarī: ता वामद्य सुमतिभिः शुभस्पती अश्विना प्र स्तुवीमहि
pada pāṭha: daśasyantā | manave | pūrvyam | divi | yavam | vr̥keṇa | karṣathaḥ || tā | vām | adya | sumati-bhiḥ | śubhaḥ | patī iti | aśvinā | pra | stuvīmahi ||8.22.6||

IAST: upa no vājinīvasū yātam ṛtasya pathibhiḥ
Griffith: Come to us, Lords of ample wealth, by paths of everlasting Law,
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | yātam | r̥tasya | pathi-bhiḥ || yebhiḥ | tr̥kṣim | vr̥ṣaṇā | trāsadasyavam | mahe | kṣatrāya | jinvathaḥ ||8.22.7||

IAST: yebhis tṛkṣiṁ vṛṣaṇā trāsadasyavam mahe kṣatrāya jinvathaḥ
Griffith: Whereby to high dominion ye with mighty strength raised Trksi, Trasadasyu's son.
Devanāgarī: येभिस्तृक्षिं वृषणा त्रासदस्यवं महे क्षत्राय जिन्वथः
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | yātam | r̥tasya | pathi-bhiḥ || yebhiḥ | tr̥kṣim | vr̥ṣaṇā | trāsadasyavam | mahe | kṣatrāya | jinvathaḥ ||8.22.7||

IAST: ayaṁ vām adribhiḥ sutaḥ somo narā vṛṣaṇvasū
Griffith: This Soma pressed with stones is yours, ye Heroes, Lords of plenteous wealth.
Devanāgarī: अयं वामद्रिभिः सुतः सोमो नरा वृषण्वसू
pada pāṭha: ayam | vām | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | somaḥ | narā | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || ā | yātam | soma-pītaye | pibatam | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he ||8.22.8||

IAST: ā yātaṁ somapītaye pibataṁ dāśuṣo gṛhe
Griffith: Approach to drink the Soma, come, drink in the worshipper's abode.
Devanāgarī: आ यातं सोमपीतये पिबतं दाशुषो गृहे
pada pāṭha: ayam | vām | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | somaḥ | narā | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || ā | yātam | soma-pītaye | pibatam | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he ||8.22.8||

IAST: ā hi ruhatam aśvinā rathe kośe hiraṇyaye vṛṣaṇvasū
Griffith: O Asvins, mount the chariot, mount the golden seat, ye who are Lords of plenteous wealth,
Devanāgarī: आ हि रुहतमश्विना रथे कोशे हिरण्यये वृषण्वसू
pada pāṭha: ā | hi | ruhatam | aśvinā | rathe | kośe | hiraṇyaye | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || yuñjāthām | pīvarīḥ | iṣaḥ ||8.22.9||

IAST: yuñjāthām pīvarīr iṣaḥ
Griffith: And bring to us abundant food.
pada pāṭha: ā | hi | ruhatam | aśvinā | rathe | kośe | hiraṇyaye | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || yuñjāthām | pīvarīḥ | iṣaḥ ||8.22.9||

IAST: yābhiḥ paktham avatho yābhir adhriguṁ yābhir babhruṁ vijoṣasam
Griffith: The aids wherewith ye helped Paktha and Adhrigt;, and Babhru severed from his friends,-
pada pāṭha: yābhiḥ | paktham | avathaḥ | yābhiḥ | adhri-gum | yābhiḥ | babhrum | vi-joṣasam || tābhiḥ | naḥ | makṣu | tūyam | aśvinā | ā | gatam | bhiṣajyatam | yat | āturam ||8.22.10||

IAST: tābhir no makṣū tūyam aśvinā gatam bhiṣajyataṁ yad āturam
Griffith: With those, O Asvins, come hither with speed and soon, and heal whatever is diseased.
Devanāgarī: ताभिर्नो मक्षू तूयमश्विना गतं भिषज्यतं यदातुरम्
pada pāṭha: yābhiḥ | paktham | avathaḥ | yābhiḥ | adhri-gum | yābhiḥ | babhrum | vi-joṣasam || tābhiḥ | naḥ | makṣu | tūyam | aśvinā | ā | gatam | bhiṣajyatam | yat | āturam ||8.22.10||

IAST: yad adhrigāvo adhrigū idā cid ahno aśvinā havāmahe
Griffith: When we continually invoke the Asvins, the resistless, at this time of day,
Devanāgarī: यदध्रिगावो अध्रिगू इदा चिदह्नो अश्विना हवामहे
pada pāṭha: yat | adhri-gāvaḥ | adhrigū ityadhri-gū | idā | cit | ahnaḥ | aśvinā | havāmahe || vayam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vipanyavaḥ ||8.22.11||

IAST: vayaṁ gīrbhir vipanyavaḥ
Griffith: We lovers of the song, with songs.
pada pāṭha: yat | adhri-gāvaḥ | adhrigū ityadhri-gū | idā | cit | ahnaḥ | aśvinā | havāmahe || vayam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vipanyavaḥ ||8.22.11||

IAST: tābhir ā yātaṁ vṛṣaṇopa me havaṁ viśvapsuṁ viśvavāryam
Griffith: Through these, ye Mighty Ones, come hither to my call which brings all blessings, wears all forms,-
Devanāgarī: ताभिरा यातं वृषणोप मे हवं विश्वप्सुं विश्ववार्यम्
pada pāṭha: tābhiḥ | ā | yātam | vr̥ṣaṇā | upa | me | havam | viśva-psum | viśva-vāryam || iṣā | maṁhiṣṭhā | puru-bhūtamā | narā | yābhiḥ | krivim | vavr̥dhuḥ | tābhiḥ | ā | gatam ||8.22.12||

IAST: iṣā maṁhiṣṭhā purubhūtamā narā yābhiḥ kriviṁ vāvṛdhus tābhir ā gatam
Griffith: Tlirough which, All-present Heroes, lavishest of food ye strengthened Krvi, come through these.
Devanāgarī: इषा मंहिष्ठा पुरुभूतमा नरा याभिः क्रिविं वावृधुस्ताभिरा गतम्
pada pāṭha: tābhiḥ | ā | yātam | vr̥ṣaṇā | upa | me | havam | viśva-psum | viśva-vāryam || iṣā | maṁhiṣṭhā | puru-bhūtamā | narā | yābhiḥ | krivim | vavr̥dhuḥ | tābhiḥ | ā | gatam ||8.22.12||

IAST: tāv idā cid ahānāṁ tāv aśvinā vandamāna upa bruve
Griffith: I speak to both of these as such, these Asvins whom I reverence at this time of day:
Devanāgarī: ताविदा चिदहानां तावश्विना वन्दमान उप ब्रुवे
pada pāṭha: tau | idā | cit | ahānām | tau | aśvinā | vandamānaḥ | upa | bruve || tau | ūm̐ iti | namaḥ-bhiḥ | īmahe ||8.22.13||

IAST: tā u namobhir īmahe
Griffith: With homage we entreat them both.
pada pāṭha: tau | idā | cit | ahānām | tau | aśvinā | vandamānaḥ | upa | bruve || tau | ūm̐ iti | namaḥ-bhiḥ | īmahe ||8.22.13||

IAST: tāv id doṣā tā uṣasi śubhas patī tā yāman rudravartanī
Griffith: Ye who are Lords of splendour, ye whose paths are red, at eve, at mom, at sacrifice,
Devanāgarī: ताविद्दोषा ता उषसि शुभस्पती ता यामन्रुद्रवर्तनी
pada pāṭha: tau | it | doṣā | tau | uṣasi | śubhaḥ | patī iti | tā | yāman | rudravartanī iti rudra-vartanī || mā | naḥ | martāya | ripave | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | paraḥ | rudrau | ati | khyatam ||8.22.14||

IAST: mā no martāya ripave vājinīvasū paro rudrāv ati khyatam
Griffith: Give us not utterly as prey to mortal foe, ye Rudras, Lords of ample wealth.
Devanāgarī: मा नो मर्ताय रिपवे वाजिनीवसू परो रुद्रावति ख्यतम्
pada pāṭha: tau | it | doṣā | tau | uṣasi | śubhaḥ | patī iti | tā | yāman | rudravartanī iti rudra-vartanī || mā | naḥ | martāya | ripave | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | paraḥ | rudrau | ati | khyatam ||8.22.14||

IAST: ā sugmyāya sugmyam prātā rathenāśvinā vā sakṣaṇī
Griffith: For bliss I call. the blissful car, at morn the inseparable Asvins with their car
Devanāgarī: आ सुग्म्याय सुग्म्यं प्राता रथेनाश्विना वा सक्षणी
pada pāṭha: ā | sugmyāya | sugmyam | prātariti | rathena | aśvinā | vā | sakṣaṇī iti || huve | pitā-iva | sobharī ||8.22.15||

IAST: huve piteva sobharī
Griffith: I call, like Sobhari our sire.
pada pāṭha: ā | sugmyāya | sugmyam | prātariti | rathena | aśvinā | vā | sakṣaṇī iti || huve | pitā-iva | sobharī ||8.22.15||

IAST: manojavasā vṛṣaṇā madacyutā makṣuṁgamābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: Rapid as thought, and strong, and speeding to thejoy, bringing.your swiftly-coming help,
pada pāṭha: manaḥ-javasā | vr̥ṣaṇā | mada-cyutā | makṣum-gamābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || ārāttāt | cit | bhūtam | asme iti | avase | pūrvī-bhīḥ | puru-bhojasā ||8.22.16||

IAST: ārāttāc cid bhūtam asme avase pūrvībhiḥ purubhojasā
Griffith: Be to us a protection even from far away Lords of great wealth, with many aids.'
pada pāṭha: manaḥ-javasā | vr̥ṣaṇā | mada-cyutā | makṣum-gamābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || ārāttāt | cit | bhūtam | asme iti | avase | pūrvī-bhīḥ | puru-bhojasā ||8.22.16||

IAST: ā no aśvāvad aśvinā vartir yāsiṣṭam madhupātamā narā
Griffith: Come, Wonder-Workers, to our home, our home, O Asvins, rich in cattle, steeds, and gold,
Devanāgarī: आ नो अश्वावदश्विना वर्तिर्यासिष्टं मधुपातमा नरा
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | aśva-vat | aśvinā | vartiḥ | yāsiṣṭam | madhu-pātamā | narā || go-mat | dasrā | hiraṇya-vat ||8.22.17||

IAST: gomad dasrā hiraṇyavat
Griffith: Chief drinkers of the Soma's juice
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | aśva-vat | aśvinā | vartiḥ | yāsiṣṭam | madhu-pātamā | narā || go-mat | dasrā | hiraṇya-vat ||8.22.17||

IAST: suprāvargaṁ suvīryaṁ suṣṭhu vāryam anādhṛṣṭaṁ rakṣasvinā
Griffith: Choice-worthy strength, heroic, firm and excellent, uninjured by the Raksas foe,
pada pāṭha: su-prāvargam | su-vīryam | suṣṭhu | vāryam | anādhr̥ṣṭam | rakṣasvinā || asmin | ā | vām | ā-yāne | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | viśvā | vāmāni | dhīmahi ||8.22.18||

IAST: asminn ā vām āyāne vājinīvasū viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi
Griffith: At this your coming nigh, ye Lords of ample wealth and all good things, may we obtain.
Devanāgarī: अस्मिन्ना वामायाने वाजिनीवसू विश्वा वामानि धीमहि
pada pāṭha: su-prāvargam | su-vīryam | suṣṭhu | vāryam | anādhr̥ṣṭam | rakṣasvinā || asmin | ā | vām | ā-yāne | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū | viśvā | vāmāni | dhīmahi ||8.22.18||

IAST: īḻiṣvā hi pratīvyaṁ yajasva jātavedasam
Griffith: WORSHIP thou Jatavedas, pray to him who willingly accepts,
pada pāṭha: īḷiṣva | hi | pratīvyam | yajasva | jāta-vedasam || cariṣṇu-dhūmam | agr̥bhīta-śociṣam ||8.23.1||

IAST: cariṣṇudhūmam agṛbhītaśociṣam
Griffith: Whose smoke wanders at will, and none may grasp his flame.
pada pāṭha: īḷiṣva | hi | pratīvyam | yajasva | jāta-vedasam || cariṣṇu-dhūmam | agr̥bhīta-śociṣam ||8.23.1||

IAST: dāmānaṁ viśvacarṣaṇe 'gniṁ viśvamano girā
Griffith: Thou, all men's friend, Visvamanas, exaltest Agni with thy song,
pada pāṭha: dāmānam | viśva-carṣaṇe | agnim | viśva-manaḥ | girā || uta | stuṣe | vi-spardhasaḥ | rathānām ||8.23.2||

IAST: uta stuṣe viṣpardhaso rathānām
Griffith: The Giver, and his flames with which no cars contend.
pada pāṭha: dāmānam | viśva-carṣaṇe | agnim | viśva-manaḥ | girā || uta | stuṣe | vi-spardhasaḥ | rathānām ||8.23.2||

IAST: yeṣām ābādha ṛgmiya iṣaḥ pṛkṣaś ca nigrabhe
Griffith: Whose resolute assault, to win vigour and food, deserves our praise,-
pada pāṭha: yeṣām | ā-bādhaḥ | r̥gmiyaḥ | iṣaḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | ca | ni-grabhe || upa-vidā | vahniḥ | vindate | vasu ||8.23.3||

IAST: upavidā vahnir vindate vasu
Griffith: Through whose discovering power the priest obtaineth wealth.
pada pāṭha: yeṣām | ā-bādhaḥ | r̥gmiyaḥ | iṣaḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | ca | ni-grabhe || upa-vidā | vahniḥ | vindate | vasu ||8.23.3||

IAST: ud asya śocir asthād dīdiyuṣo vy ajaram
Griffith: Up springs the imperishable flame, the flame of the Refulgent One
pada pāṭha: ut | asya | śociḥ | asthāt | dīdiyuṣaḥ | vi | ajaram || tapuḥ-jambhasya | su-dyutaḥ | gaṇa-śriyaḥ ||8.23.4||

IAST: tapurjambhasya sudyuto gaṇaśriyaḥ
Griffith: Most bright, with glowing jaws and glory in his train.
pada pāṭha: ut | asya | śociḥ | asthāt | dīdiyuṣaḥ | vi | ajaram || tapuḥ-jambhasya | su-dyutaḥ | gaṇa-śriyaḥ ||8.23.4||

IAST: ud u tiṣṭha svadhvara stavāno devyā kṛpā
Griffith: Skilled in fair sacrifice, extolled, arise in Godlike loveliness,
Devanāgarī: उदु तिष्ठ स्वध्वर स्तवानो देव्या कृपा
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tiṣṭha | su-adhvara | stavānaḥ | devyā | kr̥pā || abhi-khyā | bhāsā | br̥hatā | śuśukvaniḥ ||8.23.5||

IAST: abhikhyā bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvaniḥ
Griffith: Shining with lofty splendour, with effulgent light.
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tiṣṭha | su-adhvara | stavānaḥ | devyā | kr̥pā || abhi-khyā | bhāsā | br̥hatā | śuśukvaniḥ ||8.23.5||

IAST: agne yāhi suśastibhir havyā juhvāna ānuṣak
Griffith: Called straight to our oblations, come, O Agni, through our eulogies,
pada pāṭha: agne | yāhi | suśasti-bhiḥ | havyā | juhvānaḥ | ānuṣak || yathā | dūtaḥ | babhūtha | havya-vāhanaḥ ||8.23.6||

IAST: yathā dūto babhūtha havyavāhanaḥ
Griffith: As thou hast been our envoy bearing up our gifts.
pada pāṭha: agne | yāhi | suśasti-bhiḥ | havyā | juhvānaḥ | ānuṣak || yathā | dūtaḥ | babhūtha | havya-vāhanaḥ ||8.23.6||

IAST: agniṁ vaḥ pūrvyaṁ huve hotāraṁ carṣaṇīnām
Griffith: I call your Agni, from of old Invoking Priest of living men:
Devanāgarī: अग्निं वः पूर्व्यं हुवे होतारं चर्षणीनाम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | vaḥ | pūrvyam | huve | hotāram | carṣaṇīnām || tam | ayā | vācā | gr̥ṇe | tam | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | stuṣe ||8.23.7||

IAST: tam ayā vācā gṛṇe tam u vaḥ stuṣe
Griffith: Him with this song I laud and magnify for you.
Devanāgarī: तमया वाचा गृणे तमु वः स्तुषे
pada pāṭha: agnim | vaḥ | pūrvyam | huve | hotāram | carṣaṇīnām || tam | ayā | vācā | gr̥ṇe | tam | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | stuṣe ||8.23.7||

IAST: yajñebhir adbhutakratuṁ yaṁ kṛpā sūdayanta it
Griffith: Whom, wondrous wise, they animate with solemn rites and his fair form,
pada pāṭha: yajñebhiḥ | adbhuta-kratum | yam | kr̥pā | sūdayante | it || mitram | na | jane | su-dhitam | r̥ta-vani ||8.23.8||

IAST: mitraṁ na jane sudhitam ṛtāvani
Griffith: Kind as a friend to men who keep the holy Law.
pada pāṭha: yajñebhiḥ | adbhuta-kratum | yam | kr̥pā | sūdayante | it || mitram | na | jane | su-dhitam | r̥ta-vani ||8.23.8||

IAST: ṛtāvānam ṛtāyavo yajñasya sādhanaṁ girā
Griffith: Him, true to Law, who perfecteth the sacrifice,. Law-loving ones!
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānam | r̥ta-yavaḥ | yajñasya | sādhanam | girā || upo iti | enam | jujuṣuḥ | namasaḥ | pade ||8.23.9||

IAST: upo enaṁ jujuṣur namasas pade
Griffith: Ye with your song have gratified in the place of prayer.
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānam | r̥ta-yavaḥ | yajñasya | sādhanam | girā || upo iti | enam | jujuṣuḥ | namasaḥ | pade ||8.23.9||

IAST: acchā no aṅgirastamaṁ yajñāso yantu saṁyataḥ
Griffith: May all our sacrifices go to him the truest Angiras,
Devanāgarī: अच्छा नो अङ्गिरस्तमं यज्ञासो यन्तु संयतः
pada pāṭha: accha | naḥ | aṅgiraḥ-tamam | yajñāsaḥ | yantu | sam-yataḥ || hotā | yaḥ | asti | vikṣu | ā | yaśaḥ-tamaḥ ||8.23.10||

IAST: hotā yo asti vikṣv ā yaśastamaḥ
Griffith: Who is among mankind the most illustrious Priest.
pada pāṭha: accha | naḥ | aṅgiraḥ-tamam | yajñāsaḥ | yantu | sam-yataḥ || hotā | yaḥ | asti | vikṣu | ā | yaśaḥ-tamaḥ ||8.23.10||

IAST: agne tava tye ajarendhānāso bṛhad bhāḥ
Griffith: Imperishable Agni, thine are all these high enkindled lights,
pada pāṭha: agne | tava | tye | ajara | indhānāsaḥ | br̥hat | bhāḥ || aśvāḥ-iva | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | taviṣī-yavaḥ ||8.23.11||

IAST: aśvā iva vṛṣaṇas taviṣīyavaḥ
Griffith: Like horses and like stallions showing forth their strength.
pada pāṭha: agne | tava | tye | ajara | indhānāsaḥ | br̥hat | bhāḥ || aśvāḥ-iva | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | taviṣī-yavaḥ ||8.23.11||

IAST: sa tvaṁ na ūrjām pate rayiṁ rāsva suvīryam
Griffith: So give us, Lord of Power and Might, riches combined with hero strength,
Devanāgarī: स त्वं न ऊर्जां पते रयिं रास्व सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | ūrjām | pate | rayim | rāsva | su-vīryam || pra | ava | naḥ | toke | tanaye | samat-su | ā ||8.23.12||

IAST: prāva nas toke tanaye samatsv ā
Griffith: And guard us with our sons and grand. sons in our frays.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | ūrjām | pate | rayim | rāsva | su-vīryam || pra | ava | naḥ | toke | tanaye | samat-su | ā ||8.23.12||

IAST: yad vā u viśpatiḥ śitaḥ suprīto manuṣo viśi
Griffith: Soon as the eager Lord of men is friendly unto Manti's race,
Devanāgarī: यद्वा उ विश्पतिः शितः सुप्रीतो मनुषो विशि
pada pāṭha: yat | vai | ūm̐ iti | viśpatiḥ | śitaḥ | su-prītaḥ | manuṣaḥ | viśi || viśvā | it | agniḥ | prati | rakṣāṁsi | sedhati ||8.23.13||

IAST: viśved agniḥ prati rakṣāṁsi sedhati
Griffith: Agni averteth from us all the demon host.
pada pāṭha: yat | vai | ūm̐ iti | viśpatiḥ | śitaḥ | su-prītaḥ | manuṣaḥ | viśi || viśvā | it | agniḥ | prati | rakṣāṁsi | sedhati ||8.23.13||

IAST: śruṣṭy agne navasya me stomasya vīra viśpate
Griffith: O Hero Agni, Lord of men, on hearing this new laud of mine,
Devanāgarī: श्रुष्ट्यग्ने नवस्य मे स्तोमस्य वीर विश्पते
pada pāṭha: śruṣṭī | agne | navasya | me | stomasya | vīra | viśpate || ni | māyinaḥ | tapuṣā | rakṣasaḥ | daha ||8.23.14||

IAST: ni māyinas tapuṣā rakṣaso daha
Griffith: Burn down the Raksasas, enchanters, with thy flame.
pada pāṭha: śruṣṭī | agne | navasya | me | stomasya | vīra | viśpate || ni | māyinaḥ | tapuṣā | rakṣasaḥ | daha ||8.23.14||

IAST: na tasya māyayā cana ripur īśīta martyaḥ
Griffith: No mortal foe can e'er prevail by arts of magic over him
Devanāgarī: न तस्य मायया चन रिपुरीशीत मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: na | tasya | māyayā | cana | ripuḥ | īśīta | martyaḥ || yaḥ | agnaye | dadāśa | havyadāti-bhiḥ ||8.23.15||

IAST: yo agnaye dadāśa havyadātibhiḥ
Griffith: Who serveth Agni well with sacrificial gifts.
pada pāṭha: na | tasya | māyayā | cana | ripuḥ | īśīta | martyaḥ || yaḥ | agnaye | dadāśa | havyadāti-bhiḥ ||8.23.15||

IAST: vyaśvas tvā vasuvidam ukṣaṇyur aprīṇād ṛṣiḥ
Griffith: Vyasva the sage, who sought the Bull, hath won thee, finder of good things:
pada pāṭha: vi-aśvaḥ | tvā | vasu-vidam | ukṣaṇyuḥ | aprīṇāt | r̥ṣiḥ || mahaḥ | rāye | tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | sam | idhīmahi ||8.23.16||

IAST: maho rāye tam u tvā sam idhīmahi
Griffith: As such may we enkindle thee for ample wealth.
pada pāṭha: vi-aśvaḥ | tvā | vasu-vidam | ukṣaṇyuḥ | aprīṇāt | r̥ṣiḥ || mahaḥ | rāye | tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | sam | idhīmahi ||8.23.16||

IAST: uśanā kāvyas tvā ni hotāram asādayat
Griffith: Usana Kavya stablished thee, O Agni, as Invoking Priest:
pada pāṭha: uśanā | kāvyaḥ | tvā | ni | hotāram | asādayat || ā-yajim | tvā | manave | jāta-vedasam ||8.23.17||

IAST: āyajiṁ tvā manave jātavedasam
Griffith: Thee, Jatavedas, Sacrificing Priest for man.
pada pāṭha: uśanā | kāvyaḥ | tvā | ni | hotāram | asādayat || ā-yajim | tvā | manave | jāta-vedasam ||8.23.17||

IAST: viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso devāso dūtam akrata
Griffith: All Deities of one accord appointed thee their messenger:
Devanāgarī: विश्वे हि त्वा सजोषसो देवासो दूतमक्रत
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | tvā | sa-joṣasaḥ | devāsaḥ | dūtam | akrata || śruṣṭī | deva | prathamaḥ | yajñiyaḥ | bhuvaḥ ||8.23.18||

IAST: śruṣṭī deva prathamo yajñiyo bhuvaḥ
Griffith: Thou, God, through hearing, hadst first claim to sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | tvā | sa-joṣasaḥ | devāsaḥ | dūtam | akrata || śruṣṭī | deva | prathamaḥ | yajñiyaḥ | bhuvaḥ ||8.23.18||

IAST: imaṁ ghā vīro amṛtaṁ dūtaṁ kṛṇvīta martyaḥ
Griffith: Him may the mortal hero make his own immortal messenger.
Devanāgarī: इमं घा वीरो अमृतं दूतं कृण्वीत मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: imam | gha | vīraḥ | amr̥tam | dūtam | kr̥ṇvīta | martyaḥ || pāvakam | kr̥ṣṇa-vartanim | vi-hāyasam ||8.23.19||

IAST: pāvakaṁ kṛṣṇavartaniṁ vihāyasam
Griffith: Far-spreading, Purifier, him whose path is black.
pada pāṭha: imam | gha | vīraḥ | amr̥tam | dūtam | kr̥ṇvīta | martyaḥ || pāvakam | kr̥ṣṇa-vartanim | vi-hāyasam ||8.23.19||

IAST: taṁ huvema yatasrucaḥ subhāsaṁ śukraśociṣam
Griffith: With lifted ladles let us call him splendid with his brilliant flame,
pada pāṭha: tam | huvema | yata-srucaḥ | su-bhāsam | śukra-śociṣam || viśām | agnim | ajaram | pratnam | īḍyam ||8.23.20||

IAST: viśām agnim ajaram pratnam īḍyam
Griffith: Men's ancient Agni, wasting not, adorable.
pada pāṭha: tam | huvema | yata-srucaḥ | su-bhāsam | śukra-śociṣam || viśām | agnim | ajaram | pratnam | īḍyam ||8.23.20||

IAST: yo asmai havyadātibhir āhutim marto 'vidhat
Griffith: The man who pays the worship due to him with sacrificial gifts
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asmai | havyadāti-bhiḥ | ā-hutim | martaḥ | avidhat || bhūri | poṣam | saḥ | dhatte | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ ||8.23.21||

IAST: bhūri poṣaṁ sa dhatte vīravad yaśaḥ
Griffith: Obtains both plenteous nourishment and hero fame.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asmai | havyadāti-bhiḥ | ā-hutim | martaḥ | avidhat || bhūri | poṣam | saḥ | dhatte | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ ||8.23.21||

IAST: prathamaṁ jātavedasam agniṁ yajñeṣu pūrvyam
Griffith: To Jatavedas Agni, chief in sacrifices, first of all
pada pāṭha: prathamam | jāta-vedasam | agnim | yajñeṣu | pūrvyam || prati | sruk | eti | namasā | haviṣmatī ||8.23.22||

IAST: prati srug eti namasā haviṣmatī
Griffith: With homage goes the ladle rich with sacred gifts.
pada pāṭha: prathamam | jāta-vedasam | agnim | yajñeṣu | pūrvyam || prati | sruk | eti | namasā | haviṣmatī ||8.23.22||

IAST: ābhir vidhemāgnaye jyeṣṭhābhir vyaśvavat
Griffith: Even as Vyatya did, may we with these most high and liberal hymns
pada pāṭha: ābhiḥ | vidhema | agnaye | jyeṣṭhābhiḥ | vyaśva-vat || maṁhiṣṭhābhiḥ | mati-bhiḥ | śukra-śociṣe ||8.23.23||

IAST: maṁhiṣṭhābhir matibhiḥ śukraśociṣe
Griffith: Pay worship unto Agni of the splendid flame.
pada pāṭha: ābhiḥ | vidhema | agnaye | jyeṣṭhābhiḥ | vyaśva-vat || maṁhiṣṭhābhiḥ | mati-bhiḥ | śukra-śociṣe ||8.23.23||

IAST: nūnam arca vihāyase stomebhiḥ sthūrayūpavat
Griffith: Now sing, as Sthurayupa sang, with lands to him who spreadeth far,
pada pāṭha: nūnam | arca | vi-hāyase | stomebhiḥ | sthūrayūpa-vat || r̥ṣe | vaiyaśva | damyāya | agnaye ||8.23.24||

IAST: ṛṣe vaiyaśva damyāyāgnaye
Griffith: To Agni of the home, O Rsi, Vyasva's son.
pada pāṭha: nūnam | arca | vi-hāyase | stomebhiḥ | sthūrayūpa-vat || r̥ṣe | vaiyaśva | damyāya | agnaye ||8.23.24||

IAST: atithim mānuṣāṇāṁ sūnuṁ vanaspatīnām
Griffith: As welcome guest of human kind, as offspring of the forest kings,
pada pāṭha: atithim | mānuṣāṇām | sūnum | vanaspatīnām || viprāḥ | agnim | avase | pratnam | īḷate ||8.23.25||

IAST: viprā agnim avase pratnam īḻate
Griffith: The sages worship ancient Agni for his aid.
pada pāṭha: atithim | mānuṣāṇām | sūnum | vanaspatīnām || viprāḥ | agnim | avase | pratnam | īḷate ||8.23.25||

IAST: maho viśvām̐ abhi ṣato 'bhi havyāni mānuṣā
Griffith: For men's oblations brought to him who is the mighty Lord of all,
Devanāgarī: महो विश्वाँ अभि षतोऽभि हव्यानि मानुषा
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | viśvān | abhi | sataḥ | abhi | havyāni | mānuṣā || agne | ni | satsi | namasā | adhi | barhiṣi ||8.23.26||

IAST: agne ni ṣatsi namasādhi barhiṣi
Griffith: Sit, Agni, mid our homage, on the sacred grass.
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | viśvān | abhi | sataḥ | abhi | havyāni | mānuṣā || agne | ni | satsi | namasā | adhi | barhiṣi ||8.23.26||

IAST: vaṁsvā no vāryā puru vaṁsva rāyaḥ puruspṛhaḥ
Griffith: Grant us abundant. treasures, grant the opulence which many crave,
Devanāgarī: वंस्वा नो वार्या पुरु वंस्व रायः पुरुस्पृहः
pada pāṭha: vaṁsva | naḥ | vāryā | puru | vaṁsva | rāyaḥ | puru-spr̥haḥ || su-vīryasya | prajā-vataḥ | yaśasvataḥ ||8.23.27||

IAST: suvīryasya prajāvato yaśasvataḥ
Griffith: With store of heroes, progeny, and high renown.
pada pāṭha: vaṁsva | naḥ | vāryā | puru | vaṁsva | rāyaḥ | puru-spr̥haḥ || su-vīryasya | prajā-vataḥ | yaśasvataḥ ||8.23.27||

IAST: tvaṁ varo suṣāmṇe 'gne janāya codaya
Griffith: Agni, Most Youthful of the Gods, send evermore the gift of wealth
pada pāṭha: tvam | varo iti | su-sāmne | agne | janāya | codaya || sadā | vaso iti | rātim | yaviṣṭha | śaśvate ||8.23.28||

IAST: sadā vaso rātiṁ yaviṣṭha śaśvate
Griffith: Unto Varosusaman and to all his folk.
pada pāṭha: tvam | varo iti | su-sāmne | agne | janāya | codaya || sadā | vaso iti | rātim | yaviṣṭha | śaśvate ||8.23.28||

IAST: tvaṁ hi supratūr asi tvaṁ no gomatīr iṣaḥ
Griffith: A mighty Conqueror art thou, O Agni, so disclose to us
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि सुप्रतूरसि त्वं नो गोमतीरिषः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | su-pratūḥ | asi | tvam | naḥ | go-matīḥ | iṣaḥ || mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | sātim | agne | apa | vr̥dhi ||8.23.29||

IAST: maho rāyaḥ sātim agne apā vṛdhi
Griffith: Food in our herds of kine and gain of ample wealth.
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | su-pratūḥ | asi | tvam | naḥ | go-matīḥ | iṣaḥ || mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | sātim | agne | apa | vr̥dhi ||8.23.29||

IAST: agne tvaṁ yaśā asy ā mitrāvaruṇā vaha
Griffith: Thou, Agni, art a glorious God: bring hither Mitra, Varuna,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने त्वं यशा अस्या मित्रावरुणा वह
pada pāṭha: agne | tvam | yaśāḥ | asi | ā | mitrāvaruṇā | vaha || r̥ta-vānā | sam-rājā | pūta-dakṣasā ||8.23.30||

IAST: ṛtāvānā samrājā pūtadakṣasā
Griffith: Imperial Sovrans, holy-minded, true to Law.
pada pāṭha: agne | tvam | yaśāḥ | asi | ā | mitrāvaruṇā | vaha || r̥ta-vānā | sam-rājā | pūta-dakṣasā ||8.23.30||

IAST: sakhāya ā śiṣāmahi brahmendrāya vajriṇe
Griffith: COMPANIONS, let us learn a prayer to Indra. whom the thunder arms,
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | ā | śiṣāmahi | brahma | indrāya | vajriṇe || stuṣe | ūm̐ iti | su | vaḥ | nr̥-tamāya | dhr̥ṣṇave ||8.24.1||

IAST: stuṣa ū ṣu vo nṛtamāya dhṛṣṇave
Griffith: To glorify your bold and most heroic Friend.
Devanāgarī: स्तुष ऊ षु वो नृतमाय धृष्णवे
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | ā | śiṣāmahi | brahma | indrāya | vajriṇe || stuṣe | ūm̐ iti | su | vaḥ | nr̥-tamāya | dhr̥ṣṇave ||8.24.1||

IAST: śavasā hy asi śruto vṛtrahatyena vṛtrahā
Griffith: For thou by slaying Vrtra art the Vrtra-slayer, famed for might.
pada pāṭha: śavasā | hi | asi | śrutaḥ | vr̥tra-hatyena | vr̥tra-hā || maghaiḥ | maghonaḥ | ati | śūra | dāśasi ||8.24.2||

IAST: maghair maghono ati śūra dāśasi
Griffith: Thou, Hero, in rich gifts surpassest wealthy chiefs.
pada pāṭha: śavasā | hi | asi | śrutaḥ | vr̥tra-hatyena | vr̥tra-hā || maghaiḥ | maghonaḥ | ati | śūra | dāśasi ||8.24.2||

IAST: sa naḥ stavāna ā bhara rayiṁ citraśravastamam
Griffith: As such, when glorified, bring us riches of very wondrous fame,
Devanāgarī: स नः स्तवान आ भर रयिं चित्रश्रवस्तमम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | stavānaḥ | ā | bhara | rayim | citraśravaḥ-tamam || nireke | cit | yaḥ | hari-vaḥ | vasuḥ | dadiḥ ||8.24.3||

IAST: nireke cid yo harivo vasur dadiḥ
Griffith: Set in the highest rank, Wealth-giver, Lord of Bays!
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | stavānaḥ | ā | bhara | rayim | citraśravaḥ-tamam || nireke | cit | yaḥ | hari-vaḥ | vasuḥ | dadiḥ ||8.24.3||

IAST: ā nirekam uta priyam indra darṣi janānām
Griffith: Yea, Indra, thou disclosest that preeminent dear wealth of men:
pada pāṭha: ā | nirekam | uta | priyam | indra | darṣi | janānām || dhr̥ṣatā | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | stavamānaḥ | ā | bhara ||8.24.4||

IAST: dhṛṣatā dhṛṣṇo stavamāna ā bhara
Griffith: Boldly, O Bold One, glorified, bring it to us.
pada pāṭha: ā | nirekam | uta | priyam | indra | darṣi | janānām || dhr̥ṣatā | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | stavamānaḥ | ā | bhara ||8.24.4||

IAST: na te savyaṁ na dakṣiṇaṁ hastaṁ varanta āmuraḥ
Griffith: The workers of destruction stay neither thy right hand nor thy left:
Devanāgarī: न ते सव्यं न दक्षिणं हस्तं वरन्त आमुरः
pada pāṭha: na | te | savyam | na | dakṣiṇam | hastam | varante | ā-muraḥ || na | pari-bādhaḥ | hari-vaḥ | go-iṣṭiṣu ||8.24.5||

IAST: na paribādho harivo gaviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: Nor hosts that press about thee, Lord of Bays, in fight.
pada pāṭha: na | te | savyam | na | dakṣiṇam | hastam | varante | ā-muraḥ || na | pari-bādhaḥ | hari-vaḥ | go-iṣṭiṣu ||8.24.5||

IAST: ā tvā gobhir iva vrajaṁ gīrbhir ṛṇomy adrivaḥ
Griffith: O Thunder-armed, I come with songs to thee as to a stall with kine:
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | gobhiḥ-iva | vrajam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | r̥ṇomi | adri-vaḥ || ā | sma | kāmam | jarituḥ | ā | manaḥ | pr̥ṇa ||8.24.6||

IAST: ā smā kāmaṁ jaritur ā manaḥ pṛṇa
Griffith: Fulfil the wish and thought of him who sings thy praise.
Devanāgarī: आ स्मा कामं जरितुरा मनः पृण
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | gobhiḥ-iva | vrajam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | r̥ṇomi | adri-vaḥ || ā | sma | kāmam | jarituḥ | ā | manaḥ | pr̥ṇa ||8.24.6||

IAST: viśvāni viśvamanaso dhiyā no vṛtrahantama
Griffith: Chief Vrtra-slayer, through the hymn of Visvamanas think of all,
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | viśva-manasaḥ | dhiyā | naḥ | vr̥trahan-tama || ugra | pranetariti pra-netaḥ | adhi | su | vaso iti | gahi ||8.24.7||

IAST: ugra praṇetar adhi ṣū vaso gahi
Griffith: All that concerneth us, Excellent, Mighty Guide.
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | viśva-manasaḥ | dhiyā | naḥ | vr̥trahan-tama || ugra | pranetariti pra-netaḥ | adhi | su | vaso iti | gahi ||8.24.7||

IAST: vayaṁ te asya vṛtrahan vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ
Griffith: May we, O Vrtra-slayer, O Hero, find this thy newest boon,
Devanāgarī: वयं ते अस्य वृत्रहन्विद्याम शूर नव्यसः
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | asya | vr̥tra-han | vidyāma | śūra | navyasaḥ || vasoḥ | spārhasya | puru-hūta | rādhasaḥ ||8.24.8||

IAST: vasoḥ spārhasya puruhūta rādhasaḥ
Griffith: Longed-for, and excellent, thou who art much invoked!
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | asya | vr̥tra-han | vidyāma | śūra | navyasaḥ || vasoḥ | spārhasya | puru-hūta | rādhasaḥ ||8.24.8||

IAST: indra yathā hy asti te 'parītaṁ nṛto śavaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, Dancer, Much-invoked! as thy great power is unsurpassed,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र यथा ह्यस्ति तेऽपरीतं नृतो शवः
pada pāṭha: indra | yathā | hi | asti | te | apari-itam | nr̥to iti | śavaḥ || amr̥ktā | rātiḥ | puru-hūta | dāśuṣe ||8.24.9||

IAST: amṛktā rātiḥ puruhūta dāśuṣe
Griffith: So be thy bounty to the worshipper unchecked.
pada pāṭha: indra | yathā | hi | asti | te | apari-itam | nr̥to iti | śavaḥ || amr̥ktā | rātiḥ | puru-hūta | dāśuṣe ||8.24.9||

IAST: ā vṛṣasva mahāmaha mahe nṛtama rādhase
Griffith: Most Mighty, most heroic One, for mighty bounty fill thee full.
Devanāgarī: आ वृषस्व महामह महे नृतम राधसे
pada pāṭha: ā | vr̥ṣasva | mahā-maha | mahe | nr̥-tama | rādhase || dr̥ḷhaḥ | cit | dr̥hya | magha-van | maghattaye ||8.24.10||

IAST: dṛḻhaś cid dṛhya maghavan maghattaye
Griffith: Though strong, strengthen thyself to win wealth, Maghavan!
pada pāṭha: ā | vr̥ṣasva | mahā-maha | mahe | nr̥-tama | rādhase || dr̥ḷhaḥ | cit | dr̥hya | magha-van | maghattaye ||8.24.10||

IAST: nū anyatrā cid adrivas tvan no jagmur āśasaḥ
Griffith: O Thunderer, never have our prayers gone forth to any God but thee:
pada pāṭha: nu | anyatra | cit | adri-vaḥ | tvat | naḥ | jagmuḥ | ā-śasaḥ || magha-van | śagdhi | tava | tat | naḥ | ūti-bhiḥ ||8.24.11||

IAST: maghavañ chagdhi tava tan na ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: So help us, Maghavan, with thine assistance now.
pada pāṭha: nu | anyatra | cit | adri-vaḥ | tvat | naḥ | jagmuḥ | ā-śasaḥ || magha-van | śagdhi | tava | tat | naḥ | ūti-bhiḥ ||8.24.11||

IAST: nahy aṅga nṛto tvad anyaṁ vindāmi rādhase
Griffith: For, Dancer, verily I find none else for bounty, saving thee,
pada pāṭha: nahi | aṅga | nr̥to iti | tvat | anyam | vindāmi | rādhase || rāye | dyumnāya | śavase | ca | girvaṇaḥ ||8.24.12||

IAST: rāye dyumnāya śavase ca girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: For splendid wealth and power, thou Lover of the Song.
pada pāṭha: nahi | aṅga | nr̥to iti | tvat | anyam | vindāmi | rādhase || rāye | dyumnāya | śavase | ca | girvaṇaḥ ||8.24.12||

IAST: endum indrāya siñcata pibāti somyam madhu
Griffith: For Indra pour ye out the drops meath blent with Soma let him drink
pada pāṭha: ā | indum | indrāya | siñcata | pibāti | somyam | madhu || pra | rādhasā | codayāte | mahi-tvanā ||8.24.13||

IAST: pra rādhasā codayāte mahitvanā
Griffith: With bounty and with majesty will he further us.
pada pāṭha: ā | indum | indrāya | siñcata | pibāti | somyam | madhu || pra | rādhasā | codayāte | mahi-tvanā ||8.24.13||

IAST: upo harīṇām patiṁ dakṣam pṛñcantam abravam
Griffith: I spake to the Bay Coursers' Lord, to him who gives ability:
pada pāṭha: upo iti | harīṇām | patim | dakṣam | pr̥ñcantam | abravam || nūnam | śrudhi | stuvataḥ | aśvyasya ||8.24.14||

IAST: nūnaṁ śrudhi stuvato aśvyasya
Griffith: Now hear the son of Asva as he praises thee.
pada pāṭha: upo iti | harīṇām | patim | dakṣam | pr̥ñcantam | abravam || nūnam | śrudhi | stuvataḥ | aśvyasya ||8.24.14||

IAST: nahy aṅga purā cana jajñe vīrataras tvat
Griffith: Never was any Hero born before thee mightier than thou:
pada pāṭha: nahi | aṅga | purā | cana | jajñe | vīra-taraḥ | tvat || nakiḥ | rāyā | na | eva-thā | na | bhandanā ||8.24.15||

IAST: nakī rāyā naivathā na bhandanā
Griffith: None certairdy like thee in goodness and in wealth.
pada pāṭha: nahi | aṅga | purā | cana | jajñe | vīra-taraḥ | tvat || nakiḥ | rāyā | na | eva-thā | na | bhandanā ||8.24.15||

IAST: ed u madhvo madintaraṁ siñca vādhvaryo andhasaḥ
Griffith: O ministering priest, pour out of the sweet juice what gladdens most:
Devanāgarī: एदु मध्वो मदिन्तरं सिञ्च वाध्वर्यो अन्धसः
pada pāṭha: ā | it | ūm̐ iti | madhvaḥ | madin-taram | siñca | vā | adhvaryo iti | andhasaḥ || eva | hi | vīraḥ | stavate | sadā-vr̥dhaḥ ||8.24.16||

IAST: evā hi vīraḥ stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ
Griffith: So is the Hero praised who ever prospers us.
pada pāṭha: ā | it | ūm̐ iti | madhvaḥ | madin-taram | siñca | vā | adhvaryo iti | andhasaḥ || eva | hi | vīraḥ | stavate | sadā-vr̥dhaḥ ||8.24.16||

IAST: indra sthātar harīṇāṁ nakiṣ ṭe pūrvyastutim
Griffith: Indra, whom Tawny Coursers bear, praise such as thine, preeminent,
pada pāṭha: indra | sthātaḥ | harīṇām | nakiḥ | te | pūrvya-stutim || ut | ānaṁśa | śavasā | na | bhandanā ||8.24.17||

IAST: ud ānaṁśa śavasā na bhandanā
Griffith: None by his power or by his goodness hath attained.
pada pāṭha: indra | sthātaḥ | harīṇām | nakiḥ | te | pūrvya-stutim || ut | ānaṁśa | śavasā | na | bhandanā ||8.24.17||

IAST: taṁ vo vājānām patim ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ
Griffith: We, seeking glory, have invoked this Master of all power and might
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | vājānām | patim | ahūmahi | śravasyavaḥ || aprāyu-bhiḥ | yajñebhiḥ | vavr̥dhenyam ||8.24.18||

IAST: aprāyubhir yajñebhir vāvṛdhenyam
Griffith: Who must be glorified by constant sacri fice.
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | vājānām | patim | ahūmahi | śravasyavaḥ || aprāyu-bhiḥ | yajñebhiḥ | vavr̥dhenyam ||8.24.18||

IAST: eto nv indraṁ stavāma sakhāyaḥ stomyaṁ naram
Griffith: Come, sing we praise to Indra, friends, the Hero who deserves the laud,
Devanāgarī: एतो न्विन्द्रं स्तवाम सखायः स्तोम्यं नरम्
pada pāṭha: eto iti | nu | indram | stavāma | sakhāyaḥ | stomyam | naram || kr̥ṣṭīḥ | yaḥ | viśvāḥ | abhi | asti | ekaḥ | it ||8.24.19||

IAST: kṛṣṭīr yo viśvā abhy asty eka it
Griffith: Him who with none to aid o'ercomes all tribes of men.
pada pāṭha: eto iti | nu | indram | stavāma | sakhāyaḥ | stomyam | naram || kr̥ṣṭīḥ | yaḥ | viśvāḥ | abhi | asti | ekaḥ | it ||8.24.19||

IAST: agorudhāya gaviṣe dyukṣāya dasmyaṁ vacaḥ
Griffith: To him who wins the kine, who keeps no cattle back, Celestial God,
pada pāṭha: ago-rudhāya | go-iṣe | dyukṣāya | dasmyam | vacaḥ || ghr̥tāt | svādīyaḥ | madhunaḥ | ca | vocata ||8.24.20||

IAST: ghṛtāt svādīyo madhunaś ca vocata
Griffith: Speak wondrous speech more sweet than butter and than meath.
pada pāṭha: ago-rudhāya | go-iṣe | dyukṣāya | dasmyam | vacaḥ || ghr̥tāt | svādīyaḥ | madhunaḥ | ca | vocata ||8.24.20||

IAST: yasyāmitāni vīryā na rādhaḥ paryetave
Griffith: Whose hero powers are measureless, whose bounty ne'er may be surpassed,
pada pāṭha: yasya | amitāni | vīryā | na | rādhaḥ | pari-etave || jyotiḥ | na | viśvam | abhi | asti | dakṣiṇā ||8.24.21||

IAST: jyotir na viśvam abhy asti dakṣiṇā
Griffith: Whose liberality, like light, is over all.
pada pāṭha: yasya | amitāni | vīryā | na | rādhaḥ | pari-etave || jyotiḥ | na | viśvam | abhi | asti | dakṣiṇā ||8.24.21||

IAST: stuhīndraṁ vyaśvavad anūrmiṁ vājinaṁ yamam
Griffith: As Vyasva did, praise Indra, praise the Strong unfluctuating Guide,
pada pāṭha: stuhi | indram | vyaśva-vat | anūrmim | vājinam | yamam || aryaḥ | gayam | maṁhamānam | vi | dāśuṣe ||8.24.22||

IAST: aryo gayam maṁhamānaṁ vi dāśuṣe
Griffith: Who gives the foe's possessions to the worshipper.
pada pāṭha: stuhi | indram | vyaśva-vat | anūrmim | vājinam | yamam || aryaḥ | gayam | maṁhamānam | vi | dāśuṣe ||8.24.22||

IAST: evā nūnam upa stuhi vaiyaśva daśamaṁ navam
Griffith: Now, son of Vyasva, praise thou him who to the tenth time still is new,
Devanāgarī: एवा नूनमुप स्तुहि वैयश्व दशमं नवम्
pada pāṭha: eva | nūnam | upa | stuhi | vaiyaśva | daśamam | navam || su-vidvāṁsam | carkr̥tyam | caraṇīnām ||8.24.23||

IAST: suvidvāṁsaṁ carkṛtyaṁ caraṇīnām
Griffith: The very Wise, whom living men must glorify
pada pāṭha: eva | nūnam | upa | stuhi | vaiyaśva | daśamam | navam || su-vidvāṁsam | carkr̥tyam | caraṇīnām ||8.24.23||

IAST: vetthā hi nirṛtīnāṁ vajrahasta parivṛjam
Griffith: Thou knowest, Indra, Thunder-armed, how to avoid destructive powers,
pada pāṭha: vettha | hi | niḥ-r̥tīnām | vajra-hasta | pari-vr̥jam || ahaḥ-ahaḥ | śundhyuḥ | paripadām-iva ||8.24.24||

IAST: ahar-ahaḥ śundhyuḥ paripadām iva
Griffith: As one secure from pitfalls each returning day.
pada pāṭha: vettha | hi | niḥ-r̥tīnām | vajra-hasta | pari-vr̥jam || ahaḥ-ahaḥ | śundhyuḥ | paripadām-iva ||8.24.24||

IAST: tad indrāva ā bhara yenā daṁsiṣṭha kṛtvane
Griffith: O Indra, bring that aid wherewith of old, Most Wondrous! thou didst slay
Devanāgarī: तदिन्द्राव आ भर येना दंसिष्ठ कृत्वने
pada pāṭha: tat | indra | avaḥ | ā | bhara | yena | daṁsiṣṭha | kr̥tvane || dvitā | kutsāya | śiśnathaḥ | ni | codaya ||8.24.25||

IAST: dvitā kutsāya śiśnatho ni codaya
Griffith: His foes for active Kutsa: send it down to us.
pada pāṭha: tat | indra | avaḥ | ā | bhara | yena | daṁsiṣṭha | kr̥tvane || dvitā | kutsāya | śiśnathaḥ | ni | codaya ||8.24.25||

IAST: tam u tvā nūnam īmahe navyaṁ daṁsiṣṭha sanyase
Griffith: So now we seek thee fresh in might, Most Wonderful in act! for gain:
Devanāgarī: तमु त्वा नूनमीमहे नव्यं दंसिष्ठ सन्यसे
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | nūnam | īmahe | navyam | daṁsiṣṭha | sanyase || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | viśvāḥ | abhi-mātīḥ | sakṣaṇiḥ ||8.24.26||

IAST: sa tvaṁ no viśvā abhimātīḥ sakṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: For thou art he who conquers all our foes for us.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नो विश्वा अभिमातीः सक्षणिः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | nūnam | īmahe | navyam | daṁsiṣṭha | sanyase || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | viśvāḥ | abhi-mātīḥ | sakṣaṇiḥ ||8.24.26||

IAST: ya ṛkṣād aṁhaso mucad yo vāryāt sapta sindhuṣu
Griffith: Who will set free from ruinous woe, or Arya on the Seven Streams:
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥kṣāt | aṁhasaḥ | mucat | yaḥ | vā | āryāt | sapta | sindhuṣu || vadhaḥ | dāsasya | tuvi-nr̥mṇa | nīnamaḥ ||8.24.27||

IAST: vadhar dāsasya tuvinṛmṇa nīnamaḥ
Griffith: O valiant Hero, bend the Dasa's weapon down.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥kṣāt | aṁhasaḥ | mucat | yaḥ | vā | āryāt | sapta | sindhuṣu || vadhaḥ | dāsasya | tuvi-nr̥mṇa | nīnamaḥ ||8.24.27||

IAST: yathā varo suṣāmṇe sanibhya āvaho rayim
Griffith: As to Varosusaman thou broughtest great riches, for their gain,
Devanāgarī: यथा वरो सुषाम्णे सनिभ्य आवहो रयिम्
pada pāṭha: yathā | varo iti | su-sāmne | sani-bhyaḥ | ā | avahaḥ | rayim || vi-aśvebhyaḥ | su-bhage | vājinī-vati ||8.24.28||

IAST: vyaśvebhyaḥ subhage vājinīvati
Griffith: To Vyasva's sons, Blest Lady, rich in ample wealth!
pada pāṭha: yathā | varo iti | su-sāmne | sani-bhyaḥ | ā | avahaḥ | rayim || vi-aśvebhyaḥ | su-bhage | vājinī-vati ||8.24.28||

IAST: ā nāryasya dakṣiṇā vyaśvām̐ etu sominaḥ
Griffith: Let Narya's sacrificial meed reach Vyasva's Soma-bearing sons:
Devanāgarī: आ नार्यस्य दक्षिणा व्यश्वाँ एतु सोमिनः
pada pāṭha: ā | nāryasya | dakṣiṇā | vi-aśvān | etu | sominaḥ || sthūram | ca | rādhaḥ | śata-vat | sahasra-vat ||8.24.29||

IAST: sthūraṁ ca rādhaḥ śatavat sahasravat
Griffith: In hundreds and in thousands be the great reward.
pada pāṭha: ā | nāryasya | dakṣiṇā | vi-aśvān | etu | sominaḥ || sthūram | ca | rādhaḥ | śata-vat | sahasra-vat ||8.24.29||

IAST: yat tvā pṛcchād ījānaḥ kuhayā kuhayākṛte
Griffith: If one should ask thee, Where is he who sacrificed? Whither lookest thou?
pada pāṭha: yat | tvā | pr̥cchāt | ījānaḥ | kuhayā | kuhayā-kr̥te || eṣaḥ | apa-śritaḥ | valaḥ | go-matīm | ava | tiṣṭhati ||8.24.30||

IAST: eṣo apaśrito valo gomatīm ava tiṣṭhati
Griffith: Like Vala he hath passed away and dwelleth now on Gomati.
pada pāṭha: yat | tvā | pr̥cchāt | ījānaḥ | kuhayā | kuhayā-kr̥te || eṣaḥ | apa-śritaḥ | valaḥ | go-matīm | ava | tiṣṭhati ||8.24.30||

IAST: tā vāṁ viśvasya gopā devā deveṣu yajñiyā
Griffith: I WORSHIP you who guard this All, Gods, holiest among the Gods,
Devanāgarī: ता वां विश्वस्य गोपा देवा देवेषु यज्ञिया
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | viśvasya | gopā | devā | deveṣu | yajñiyā || r̥ta-vānā | yajase | pūta-dakṣasā ||8.25.1||

IAST: ṛtāvānā yajase pūtadakṣasā
Griffith: You, faithful to the Law, whose power is sanctified.
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | viśvasya | gopā | devā | deveṣu | yajñiyā || r̥ta-vānā | yajase | pūta-dakṣasā ||8.25.1||

IAST: mitrā tanā na rathyā varuṇo yaś ca sukratuḥ
Griffith: So, too, like charioteers are they, Mitra and sapient Varuna,
Devanāgarī: मित्रा तना न रथ्या वरुणो यश्च सुक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: mitrā | tanā | na | rathyā | varuṇaḥ | yaḥ | ca | su-kratuḥ || sanāt | su-jātā | tanayā | dhr̥ta-vratā ||8.25.2||

IAST: sanāt sujātā tanayā dhṛtavratā
Griffith: Sons high-born from of old, whose holy laws stand fast.
pada pāṭha: mitrā | tanā | na | rathyā | varuṇaḥ | yaḥ | ca | su-kratuḥ || sanāt | su-jātā | tanayā | dhr̥ta-vratā ||8.25.2||

IAST: tā mātā viśvavedasāsuryāya pramahasā
Griffith: These Twain, possessors of all wealth, most glorious, for supremest sway
pada pāṭha: tā | mātā | viśva-vedasā | asuryāya | pra-mahasā || mahī | jajāna | aditiḥ | r̥ta-varī ||8.25.3||

IAST: mahī jajānāditir ṛtāvarī
Griffith: Aditi, Mighty Mother, true to Law, brought forth.
pada pāṭha: tā | mātā | viśva-vedasā | asuryāya | pra-mahasā || mahī | jajāna | aditiḥ | r̥ta-varī ||8.25.3||

IAST: mahāntā mitrāvaruṇā samrājā devāv asurā
Griffith: Great Varuna and Mitra, Gods, Asuras and imperial Lords,
pada pāṭha: mahāntā | mitrāvaruṇā | sam-rājā | devau | asurā || r̥ta-vānau | r̥tam | ā | ghoṣataḥ | br̥hat ||8.25.4||

IAST: ṛtāvānāv ṛtam ā ghoṣato bṛhat
Griffith: True to Eternal Law proclaim the high decree.
pada pāṭha: mahāntā | mitrāvaruṇā | sam-rājā | devau | asurā || r̥ta-vānau | r̥tam | ā | ghoṣataḥ | br̥hat ||8.25.4||

IAST: napātā śavaso mahaḥ sūnū dakṣasya sukratū
Griffith: The offspring of a lofty Power, Daksa's Two Sons exceeding strong,
Devanāgarī: नपाता शवसो महः सूनू दक्षस्य सुक्रतू
pada pāṭha: napātā | śavasaḥ | mahaḥ | sūnū iti | dakṣasya | sukratū iti su-kratū || sr̥pradānū iti sr̥pra-dānū | iṣaḥ | vāstu | adhi | kṣitaḥ ||8.25.5||

IAST: sṛpradānū iṣo vāstv adhi kṣitaḥ
Griffith: Who, Lords of flowing rain, dwell in the place of food.
pada pāṭha: napātā | śavasaḥ | mahaḥ | sūnū iti | dakṣasya | sukratū iti su-kratū || sr̥pradānū iti sr̥pra-dānū | iṣaḥ | vāstu | adhi | kṣitaḥ ||8.25.5||

IAST: saṁ yā dānūni yemathur divyāḥ pārthivīr iṣaḥ
Griffith: Ye who have gathered up your gifts, celestial and terrestrial food,
pada pāṭha: sam | yā | dānūni | yemathuḥ | divyāḥ | pārthivīḥ | iṣaḥ || nabhasvatīḥ | ā | vām | carantu | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||8.25.6||

IAST: nabhasvatīr ā vāṁ carantu vṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: Let your rain come to us fraught with the mist of heaven.
pada pāṭha: sam | yā | dānūni | yemathuḥ | divyāḥ | pārthivīḥ | iṣaḥ || nabhasvatīḥ | ā | vām | carantu | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||8.25.6||

IAST: adhi yā bṛhato divo 'bhi yūtheva paśyataḥ
Griffith: The Twain, who from the lofty sky seem to look down on herds below,
Devanāgarī: अधि या बृहतो दिवोऽभि यूथेव पश्यतः
pada pāṭha: adhi | yā | br̥hataḥ | divaḥ | abhi | yūthā-iva | paśyataḥ || r̥ta-vānā | sam-rājā | namase | hitā ||8.25.7||

IAST: ṛtāvānā samrājā namase hitā
Griffith: Holy, imperial Lords, are set to be revered.
pada pāṭha: adhi | yā | br̥hataḥ | divaḥ | abhi | yūthā-iva | paśyataḥ || r̥ta-vānā | sam-rājā | namase | hitā ||8.25.7||

IAST: ṛtāvānā ni ṣedatuḥ sāmrājyāya sukratū
Griffith: They, true to Law, exceeding strong, have sat them down for savran rule:
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānā | ni | sedatuḥ | sām-rājyāya | sukratū iti su-kratū || dhr̥ta-vratā | kṣatriyā | kṣatram | āśatuḥ ||8.25.8||

IAST: dhṛtavratā kṣatriyā kṣatram āśatuḥ
Griffith: Princes whose laws stand fast, they have obtained their sway.
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānā | ni | sedatuḥ | sām-rājyāya | sukratū iti su-kratū || dhr̥ta-vratā | kṣatriyā | kṣatram | āśatuḥ ||8.25.8||

IAST: akṣṇaś cid gātuvittarānulbaṇena cakṣasā
Griffith: Pathfinders even better than the eye, with unobstructed sight,
pada pāṭha: akṣṇaḥ | cit | gātuvit-tarā | anulbaṇena | cakṣasā || ni | cit | miṣantā | ni-cirā | ni | cikyatuḥ ||8.25.9||

IAST: ni cin miṣantā nicirā ni cikyatuḥ
Griffith: Even when they close their lids, observant, they perceive.
pada pāṭha: akṣṇaḥ | cit | gātuvit-tarā | anulbaṇena | cakṣasā || ni | cit | miṣantā | ni-cirā | ni | cikyatuḥ ||8.25.9||

IAST: uta no devy aditir uruṣyatāṁ nāsatyā
Griffith: So may the Goddess Aditi, may the Nasatyas guard us well,
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | devī | aditiḥ | uruṣyatām | nāsatyā || uruṣyantu | marutaḥ | vr̥ddha-śavasaḥ ||8.25.10||

IAST: uruṣyantu maruto vṛddhaśavasaḥ
Griffith: The Martits guard us well,.endowed with mighty strength.
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | devī | aditiḥ | uruṣyatām | nāsatyā || uruṣyantu | marutaḥ | vr̥ddha-śavasaḥ ||8.25.10||

IAST: te no nāvam uruṣyata divā naktaṁ sudānavaḥ
Griffith: Do ye, O Bounteous Gods, protect our dwelling lace by day and night:
Devanāgarī: ते नो नावमुरुष्यत दिवा नक्तं सुदानवः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | nāvam | uruṣyata | divā | naktam | su-dānavaḥ || ariṣyantaḥ | ni | pāyu-bhiḥ | sacemahi ||8.25.11||

IAST: ariṣyanto ni pāyubhiḥ sacemahi
Griffith: With you for our defenders may we go unharmed.
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | nāvam | uruṣyata | divā | naktam | su-dānavaḥ || ariṣyantaḥ | ni | pāyu-bhiḥ | sacemahi ||8.25.11||

IAST: aghnate viṣṇave vayam ariṣyantaḥ sudānave
Griffith: May we, unharmed, serve bountiful Visnu, the God who slayeth none:
pada pāṭha: aghnate | viṣṇave | vayam | ariṣyantaḥ | su-dānave || śrudhi | sva-yāvan | sindho iti | pūrva-cittaye ||8.25.12||

IAST: śrudhi svayāvan sindho pūrvacittaye
Griffith: Self-moving Sindhu hear and be the first to mark.
pada pāṭha: aghnate | viṣṇave | vayam | ariṣyantaḥ | su-dānave || śrudhi | sva-yāvan | sindho iti | pūrva-cittaye ||8.25.12||

IAST: tad vāryaṁ vṛṇīmahe variṣṭhaṁ gopayatyam
Griffith: This sure protection we elect, desirable and reaching far,
pada pāṭha: tat | vāryam | vr̥ṇīmahe | variṣṭham | gopayatyam || mitraḥ | yat | pānti | varuṇaḥ | yat | aryamā ||8.25.13||

IAST: mitro yat pānti varuṇo yad aryamā
Griffith: Which Mitra, Varuna, and Aryaman afford.
