pada pāṭha: tat | vāryam | vr̥ṇīmahe | variṣṭham | gopayatyam || mitraḥ | yat | pānti | varuṇaḥ | yat | aryamā ||8.25.13||

IAST: uta naḥ sindhur apāṁ tan marutas tad aśvinā
Griffith: And may the Sindhu of the floods, the Maruts, and the ASvin Pair,
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | sindhuḥ | apām | tat | marutaḥ | tat | aśvinā || indraḥ | viṣṇuḥ | mīḍhvāṁsaḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ ||8.25.14||

IAST: indro viṣṇur mīḍhvāṁsaḥ sajoṣasaḥ
Griffith: Boon Indra, and boon Visnu have one mind with us.
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | sindhuḥ | apām | tat | marutaḥ | tat | aśvinā || indraḥ | viṣṇuḥ | mīḍhvāṁsaḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ ||8.25.14||

IAST: te hi ṣmā vanuṣo naro 'bhimātiṁ kayasya cit
Griffith: Because these warring Heroes stay the enmity of every foe,
Devanāgarī: ते हि ष्मा वनुषो नरोऽभिमातिं कयस्य चित्
pada pāṭha: te | hi | sma | vanuṣaḥ | naraḥ | abhi-mātim | kayasya | cit || tigmam | na | kṣodaḥ | prati-ghnanti | bhūrṇayaḥ ||8.25.15||

IAST: tigmaṁ na kṣodaḥ pratighnanti bhūrṇayaḥ
Griffith: As the fierce water-flood repels the furious ones.
pada pāṭha: te | hi | sma | vanuṣaḥ | naraḥ | abhi-mātim | kayasya | cit || tigmam | na | kṣodaḥ | prati-ghnanti | bhūrṇayaḥ ||8.25.15||

IAST: ayam eka itthā purūru caṣṭe vi viśpatiḥ
Griffith: Here this one God, the Lord of men, looks forth exceeding far and wide:
Devanāgarī: अयमेक इत्था पुरूरु चष्टे वि विश्पतिः
pada pāṭha: ayam | ekaḥ | itthā | puru | uru | caṣṭe | vi | viśpatiḥ || tasya | vratāni | anu | vaḥ | carāmasi ||8.25.16||

IAST: tasya vratāny anu vaś carāmasi
Griffith: And we, for your advantage, keep his holy laws.
pada pāṭha: ayam | ekaḥ | itthā | puru | uru | caṣṭe | vi | viśpatiḥ || tasya | vratāni | anu | vaḥ | carāmasi ||8.25.16||

IAST: anu pūrvāṇy okyā sāmrājyasya saścima
Griffith: We keep the old accustomed laws, the statutes of supremacy,
pada pāṭha: anu | pūrvāṇi | okyā | sām-rājyasya | saścima || mitrasya | vratā | varuṇasya | dīrgha-śrut ||8.25.17||

IAST: mitrasya vratā varuṇasya dīrghaśrut
Griffith: The Iong-known laws of Mitra and of Varuna.
pada pāṭha: anu | pūrvāṇi | okyā | sām-rājyasya | saścima || mitrasya | vratā | varuṇasya | dīrgha-śrut ||8.25.17||

IAST: pari yo raśminā divo 'ntān mame pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: He who hath measured with his ray the boundaries of heaven and earth,
pada pāṭha: pari | yaḥ | raśminā | divaḥ | antān | mame | pr̥thivyāḥ || ubhe iti | ā | paprau | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā ||8.25.18||

IAST: ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
Griffith: And with his majesty hath filled the two worlds full,
pada pāṭha: pari | yaḥ | raśminā | divaḥ | antān | mame | pr̥thivyāḥ || ubhe iti | ā | paprau | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā ||8.25.18||

IAST: ud u ṣya śaraṇe divo jyotir ayaṁsta sūryaḥ
Griffith: Surya hath spread his light aloft up to the region of the sky,
Devanāgarī: उदु ष्य शरणे दिवो ज्योतिरयंस्त सूर्यः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | śaraṇe | divaḥ | jyotiḥ | ayaṁsta | sūryaḥ || agniḥ | na | śukraḥ | sam-idhānaḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||8.25.19||

IAST: agnir na śukraḥ samidhāna āhutaḥ
Griffith: Like Agni all aflame when gifts are offered him.
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | śaraṇe | divaḥ | jyotiḥ | ayaṁsta | sūryaḥ || agniḥ | na | śukraḥ | sam-idhānaḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||8.25.19||

IAST: vaco dīrghaprasadmanīśe vājasya gomataḥ
Griffith: With him who sits afar the word is lord of food that comes from kine,
pada pāṭha: vacaḥ | dīrgha-prasadmani | īśe | vājasya | go-mataḥ || īśe | hi | pitvaḥ | aviṣasya | dāvane ||8.25.20||

IAST: īśe hi pitvo 'viṣasya dāvane
Griffith: Controller of the gift of unempoisoned food.
pada pāṭha: vacaḥ | dīrgha-prasadmani | īśe | vājasya | go-mataḥ || īśe | hi | pitvaḥ | aviṣasya | dāvane ||8.25.20||

IAST: tat sūryaṁ rodasī ubhe doṣā vastor upa bruve
Griffith: So unto Surya, Heaven, and Earth at morning and at eve I speak.
Devanāgarī: तत्सूर्यं रोदसी उभे दोषा वस्तोरुप ब्रुवे
pada pāṭha: tat | sūryam | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | doṣā | vastoḥ | upa | bruve || bhojeṣu | asmān | abhi | ut | cara | sadā ||8.25.21||

IAST: bhojeṣv asmām̐ abhy uc carā sadā
Griffith: Bringing enjoyments ever rise thou up for us.
pada pāṭha: tat | sūryam | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | doṣā | vastoḥ | upa | bruve || bhojeṣu | asmān | abhi | ut | cara | sadā ||8.25.21||

IAST: ṛjram ukṣaṇyāyane rajataṁ harayāṇe
Griffith: From Uksanyayana a bay, from Harayana a white steed,
pada pāṭha: r̥jram | ukṣaṇyāyane | rajatam | harayāṇe || ratham | yuktam | asanāma | su-sāmani ||8.25.22||

IAST: rathaṁ yuktam asanāma suṣāmaṇi
Griffith: And from Susaman we obtained a hamessed car.
pada pāṭha: r̥jram | ukṣaṇyāyane | rajatam | harayāṇe || ratham | yuktam | asanāma | su-sāmani ||8.25.22||

IAST: tā me aśvyānāṁ harīṇāṁ nitośanā
Griffith: These two shall bring me further gain of troops of tawny-coloured steeds,
pada pāṭha: tā | me | aśvyānām | harīṇām | ni-tośanā || uto iti | nu | kr̥tvyānām | nr̥-vāhasā ||8.25.23||

IAST: uto nu kṛtvyānāṁ nṛvāhasā
Griffith: The carriers shall they be of active men of war.
pada pāṭha: tā | me | aśvyānām | harīṇām | ni-tośanā || uto iti | nu | kr̥tvyānām | nr̥-vāhasā ||8.25.23||

IAST: smadabhīśū kaśāvantā viprā naviṣṭhayā matī
Griffith: And the two sages have I gained who hold the reins and bear the whip,
pada pāṭha: smadabhīśū iti smat-abhīśū | kaśā-vantā | viprā | naviṣṭhayā | matī || mahaḥ | vājinau | arvantā | sacā | asanam ||8.25.24||

IAST: maho vājināv arvantā sacāsanam
Griffith: And the two great strong coursers, with my newest song.
pada pāṭha: smadabhīśū iti smat-abhīśū | kaśā-vantā | viprā | naviṣṭhayā | matī || mahaḥ | vājinau | arvantā | sacā | asanam ||8.25.24||

IAST: yuvor u ṣū rathaṁ huve sadhastutyāya sūriṣu
Griffith: I CALL your chariot to receive united praise mid princely men,
Devanāgarī: युवोरु षू रथं हुवे सधस्तुत्याय सूरिषु
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | ratham | huve | sadha-stutyāya | sūriṣu || atūrta-dakṣā | vr̥ṣaṇā | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū ||8.26.1||

IAST: atūrtadakṣā vṛṣaṇā vṛṣaṇvasū
Griffith: Strong Gods who pour down wealth, of never vanquished might!
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | ratham | huve | sadha-stutyāya | sūriṣu || atūrta-dakṣā | vr̥ṣaṇā | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū ||8.26.1||

IAST: yuvaṁ varo suṣāmṇe mahe tane nāsatyā
Griffith: Ye to Varosusaman come, Nasatyas, for this glorious rite.
Devanāgarī: युवं वरो सुषाम्णे महे तने नासत्या
pada pāṭha: yuvam | varo iti | su-sāmne | mahe | tane | nāsatyā || avaḥ-bhiḥ | yāthaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū ||8.26.2||

IAST: avobhir yātho vṛṣaṇā vṛṣaṇvasū
Griffith: With your protecting aid. Strong Gods, who pour down wealth.
pada pāṭha: yuvam | varo iti | su-sāmne | mahe | tane | nāsatyā || avaḥ-bhiḥ | yāthaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū ||8.26.2||

IAST: tā vām adya havāmahe havyebhir vājinīvasū
Griffith: So with oblations we invoke you, rich in ample wealth, to-day,
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | adya | havāmahe | havyebhiḥ | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū || pūrvīḥ | iṣaḥ | iṣayantau | ati | kṣapaḥ ||8.26.3||

IAST: pūrvīr iṣa iṣayantāv ati kṣapaḥ
Griffith: When night hath passed, O ye who send us plenteous food.
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | adya | havāmahe | havyebhiḥ | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū || pūrvīḥ | iṣaḥ | iṣayantau | ati | kṣapaḥ ||8.26.3||

IAST: ā vāṁ vāhiṣṭho aśvinā ratho yātu śruto narā
Griffith: O Asvins, Heroes, let your car, famed, best to travel, come to us,
Devanāgarī: आ वां वाहिष्ठो अश्विना रथो यातु श्रुतो नरा
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | vāhiṣṭhaḥ | aśvinā | rathaḥ | yātu | śrutaḥ | narā || upa | stomān | turasya | darśathaḥ | śriye ||8.26.4||

IAST: upa stomān turasya darśathaḥ śriye
Griffith: And, for his glory, mark your zealous servant's lauds.
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | vāhiṣṭhaḥ | aśvinā | rathaḥ | yātu | śrutaḥ | narā || upa | stomān | turasya | darśathaḥ | śriye ||8.26.4||

IAST: juhurāṇā cid aśvinā manyethāṁ vṛṣaṇvasū
Griffith: Asvins, who send us precious gifts, even when offended, think of him:
pada pāṭha: juhurāṇā | cit | aśvinā | ā | manyethām | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || yuvam | hi | rudrā | parṣathaḥ | ati | dviṣaḥ ||8.26.5||

IAST: yuvaṁ hi rudrā parṣatho ati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: For ye, O Rudras, lead us safe beyond our foes.
Devanāgarī: युवं हि रुद्रा पर्षथो अति द्विषः
pada pāṭha: juhurāṇā | cit | aśvinā | ā | manyethām | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || yuvam | hi | rudrā | parṣathaḥ | ati | dviṣaḥ ||8.26.5||

IAST: dasrā hi viśvam ānuṣaṅ makṣūbhiḥ paridīyathaḥ
Griffith: For, Wonder-Workers, with fleet steeds ye fly completely round this All,
pada pāṭha: dasrā | hi | viśvam | ānuṣak | makṣu-bhiḥ | pari-dīyathaḥ || dhiyam-jinvā | madhu-varṇā | śubhaḥ | patī iti ||8.26.6||

IAST: dhiyaṁjinvā madhuvarṇā śubhas patī
Griffith: Stirring our thoughts, ye Lords of splendour, honey-hued.
pada pāṭha: dasrā | hi | viśvam | ānuṣak | makṣu-bhiḥ | pari-dīyathaḥ || dhiyam-jinvā | madhu-varṇā | śubhaḥ | patī iti ||8.26.6||

IAST: upa no yātam aśvinā rāyā viśvapuṣā saha
Griffith: With all-sustaining opulence, Asvins, come hitherward to us,
Devanāgarī: उप नो यातमश्विना राया विश्वपुषा सह
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | yātam | aśvinā | rāyā | viśva-puṣā | saha || magha-vānā | su-vīrau | anapa-cyutā ||8.26.7||

IAST: maghavānā suvīrāv anapacyutā
Griffith: Ye rich and noble Heroes, ne'er to be o'erthrown.
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | yātam | aśvinā | rāyā | viśva-puṣā | saha || magha-vānā | su-vīrau | anapa-cyutā ||8.26.7||

IAST: ā me asya pratīvyam indranāsatyā gatam
Griffith: To welcome this mine offering, O ye Indra-like Nasatyas, come
pada pāṭha: ā | me | asya | pratīvyam | indranāsatyā | gatam || devā | devebhiḥ | adya | sacanaḥ-tamā ||8.26.8||

IAST: devā devebhir adya sacanastamā
Griffith: As Gods of best accord this day with other Gods.
pada pāṭha: ā | me | asya | pratīvyam | indranāsatyā | gatam || devā | devebhiḥ | adya | sacanaḥ-tamā ||8.26.8||

IAST: vayaṁ hi vāṁ havāmaha ukṣaṇyanto vyaśvavat
Griffith: For we, like Vyasva, lifting up our voice like oxen, call on you:
Devanāgarī: वयं हि वां हवामह उक्षण्यन्तो व्यश्ववत्
pada pāṭha: vayam | hi | vām | havāmahe | ukṣaṇyantaḥ | vyaśva-vat || sumati-bhiḥ | upa | viprau | iha | ā | gatam ||8.26.9||

IAST: sumatibhir upa viprāv ihā gatam
Griffith: With all your loving kindness, Sages, come to us.
pada pāṭha: vayam | hi | vām | havāmahe | ukṣaṇyantaḥ | vyaśva-vat || sumati-bhiḥ | upa | viprau | iha | ā | gatam ||8.26.9||

IAST: aśvinā sv ṛṣe stuhi kuvit te śravato havam
Griffith: O Rsi, laud the Asvins well. Will they not listen to thy call?
Devanāgarī: अश्विना स्वृषे स्तुहि कुवित्ते श्रवतो हवम्
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | su | r̥ṣe | stuhi | kuvit | te | śravataḥ | havam || nedīyasaḥ | kūḷayātaḥ | paṇīn | uta ||8.26.10||

IAST: nedīyasaḥ kūḻayātaḥ paṇīm̐r uta
Griffith: Will they not burn the Panis who are nearer them?
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | su | r̥ṣe | stuhi | kuvit | te | śravataḥ | havam || nedīyasaḥ | kūḷayātaḥ | paṇīn | uta ||8.26.10||

IAST: vaiyaśvasya śrutaṁ naroto me asya vedathaḥ
Griffith: O Heroes, listen to the son of Vyasva, and regard me here,
Devanāgarī: वैयश्वस्य श्रुतं नरोतो मे अस्य वेदथः
pada pāṭha: vaiyaśvasya | śrutam | narā | uto iti | me | asya | vedathaḥ || sa-joṣasā | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā ||8.26.11||

IAST: sajoṣasā varuṇo mitro aryamā
Griffith: Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, of one accord.
pada pāṭha: vaiyaśvasya | śrutam | narā | uto iti | me | asya | vedathaḥ || sa-joṣasā | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā ||8.26.11||

IAST: yuvādattasya dhiṣṇyā yuvānītasya sūribhiḥ
Griffith: Gods whom we yearn for, of your gifts, of what ye bring to us, bestow
pada pāṭha: yuvā-dattasya | dhiṣṇyā | yuvā-nītasya | sūri-bhiḥ || ahaḥ-ahaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | mahyam | śikṣatam ||8.26.12||

IAST: ahar-ahar vṛṣaṇa mahyaṁ śikṣatam
Griffith: By princes' hands on me, ye Mighty, day by day.
pada pāṭha: yuvā-dattasya | dhiṣṇyā | yuvā-nītasya | sūri-bhiḥ || ahaḥ-ahaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | mahyam | śikṣatam ||8.26.12||

IAST: yo vāṁ yajñebhir āvṛto 'dhivastrā vadhūr iva
Griffith: Him whom your sacrifices clothe, even as a woman with her robe,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | yajñebhiḥ | ā-vr̥taḥ | adhi-vastrā | vadhūḥ-iva || saparyantā | śubhe | cakrāte iti | aśvinā ||8.26.13||

IAST: saparyantā śubhe cakrāte aśvinā
Griffith: The Asvins help to glory honouring him well.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | yajñebhiḥ | ā-vr̥taḥ | adhi-vastrā | vadhūḥ-iva || saparyantā | śubhe | cakrāte iti | aśvinā ||8.26.13||

IAST: yo vām uruvyacastamaṁ ciketati nṛpāyyam
Griffith: Whoso regards your care of men as succour widest in its reach,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | uruvyacaḥ-tamam | ciketati | nr̥-pāyyam || vartiḥ | aśvinā | pari | yātam | asmayū ityasma-yū ||8.26.14||

IAST: vartir aśvinā pari yātam asmayū
Griffith: About his dwelling go, ye Asvins, loving us.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | uruvyacaḥ-tamam | ciketati | nr̥-pāyyam || vartiḥ | aśvinā | pari | yātam | asmayū ityasma-yū ||8.26.14||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ su vṛṣaṇvasū yātaṁ vartir nṛpāyyam
Griffith: Come to us ye who pour down wealth, come to the home which men must guard:
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | su | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū | yātam | vartiḥ | nr̥-pāyyam || viṣudruhā-iva | yajñam | ūhathuḥ | girā ||8.26.15||

IAST: viṣudruheva yajñam ūhathur girā
Griffith: Like shafts, ye are made meet for sacrifice by song.
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | su | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū | yātam | vartiḥ | nr̥-pāyyam || viṣudruhā-iva | yajñam | ūhathuḥ | girā ||8.26.15||

IAST: vāhiṣṭho vāṁ havānāṁ stomo dūto huvan narā
Griffith: Most fetching of all calls, the laud, as envoy, Heroes, called to you
Devanāgarī: वाहिष्ठो वां हवानां स्तोमो दूतो हुवन्नरा
pada pāṭha: vāhiṣṭhaḥ | vām | havānām | stomaḥ | dūtaḥ | huvat | narā || yuvābhyām | bhūtu | aśvinā ||8.26.16||

IAST: yuvābhyām bhūtv aśvinā
Griffith: Be it your own, O Asvin Pair.
pada pāṭha: vāhiṣṭhaḥ | vām | havānām | stomaḥ | dūtaḥ | huvat | narā || yuvābhyām | bhūtu | aśvinā ||8.26.16||

IAST: yad ado divo arṇava iṣo vā madatho gṛhe
Griffith: Be ye in yonder sea of heaven, or joying in the home of food,
Devanāgarī: यददो दिवो अर्णव इषो वा मदथो गृहे
pada pāṭha: yat | adaḥ | divaḥ | arṇave | iṣaḥ | vā | madathaḥ | gr̥he || śrutam | it | me | amartyā ||8.26.17||

IAST: śrutam in me amartyā
Griffith: Listen to me, Immortal Ones.
pada pāṭha: yat | adaḥ | divaḥ | arṇave | iṣaḥ | vā | madathaḥ | gr̥he || śrutam | it | me | amartyā ||8.26.17||

IAST: uta syā śvetayāvarī vāhiṣṭhā vāṁ nadīnām
Griffith: This river with his lucid flow attracts you, more than all the streams,-
Devanāgarī: उत स्या श्वेतयावरी वाहिष्ठा वां नदीनाम्
pada pāṭha: uta | syā | śveta-yāvarī | vāhiṣṭhā | vām | nadīnām || sindhuḥ | hiraṇya-vartaniḥ ||8.26.18||

IAST: sindhur hiraṇyavartaniḥ
Griffith: Even Sindhu with his path of gold.
pada pāṭha: uta | syā | śveta-yāvarī | vāhiṣṭhā | vām | nadīnām || sindhuḥ | hiraṇya-vartaniḥ ||8.26.18||

IAST: smad etayā sukīrtyāśvinā śvetayā dhiyā
Griffith: O Asvins, with that glorious fame come hither, through our brilliant song,
pada pāṭha: smat | etayā | su-kīrtyā | aśvinā | śvetayā | dhiyā || vahethe iti | śubhra-yāvānā ||8.26.19||

IAST: vahethe śubhrayāvānā
Griffith: Come ye whose ways are marked with light.
pada pāṭha: smat | etayā | su-kīrtyā | aśvinā | śvetayā | dhiyā || vahethe iti | śubhra-yāvānā ||8.26.19||

IAST: yukṣvā hi tvaṁ rathāsahā yuvasva poṣyā vaso
Griffith: Harness the steeds who draw the car, O Vasu, bring the well-fed pair.
Devanāgarī: युक्ष्वा हि त्वं रथासहा युवस्व पोष्या वसो
pada pāṭha: yukṣva | hi | tvam | ratha-sahā | yuvasva | poṣyā | vaso iti || āt | naḥ | vāyo iti | madhu | piba | asmākam | savanā | ā | gahi ||8.26.20||

IAST: ān no vāyo madhu pibāsmākaṁ savanā gahi
Griffith: O Vayu, drink thou of our meath: come unto our drink-offerings.
Devanāgarī: आन्नो वायो मधु पिबास्माकं सवना गहि
pada pāṭha: yukṣva | hi | tvam | ratha-sahā | yuvasva | poṣyā | vaso iti || āt | naḥ | vāyo iti | madhu | piba | asmākam | savanā | ā | gahi ||8.26.20||

IAST: tava vāyav ṛtaspate tvaṣṭur jāmātar adbhuta
Griffith: Wonderful Vayu, Lord of Right, thou who art Tvastar's son-in-law,
pada pāṭha: tava | vāyo iti | r̥taḥpate | tvaṣṭuḥ | jāmātaḥ | adbhuta || avāṁsi | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe ||8.26.21||

IAST: avāṁsy ā vṛṇīmahe
Griffith: Thy saving succour we elect.
pada pāṭha: tava | vāyo iti | r̥taḥpate | tvaṣṭuḥ | jāmātaḥ | adbhuta || avāṁsi | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe ||8.26.21||

IAST: tvaṣṭur jāmātaraṁ vayam īśānaṁ rāya īmahe
Griffith: To Tvastar's son-in-law we pray for wealth whereof he hath control:
pada pāṭha: tvaṣṭuḥ | jāmātaram | vayam | īśānam | rāyaḥ | īmahe || suta-vantaḥ | vāyum | dyumnā | janāsaḥ ||8.26.22||

IAST: sutāvanto vāyuṁ dyumnā janāsaḥ
Griffith: For glory we seek vayu, men with juice effused.
pada pāṭha: tvaṣṭuḥ | jāmātaram | vayam | īśānam | rāyaḥ | īmahe || suta-vantaḥ | vāyum | dyumnā | janāsaḥ ||8.26.22||

IAST: vāyo yāhi śivā divo vahasvā su svaśvyam
Griffith: From heaven, auspicious Vayu, come drive hither with thy noble steeds:
Devanāgarī: वायो याहि शिवा दिवो वहस्वा सु स्वश्व्यम्
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | yāhi | śiva | ā | divaḥ | vahasva | su | su-aśvyam || vahasva | mahaḥ | pr̥thu-pakṣasā | rathe ||8.26.23||

IAST: vahasva mahaḥ pṛthupakṣasā rathe
Griffith: Come on thy mighty car with wide-extending seat.
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | yāhi | śiva | ā | divaḥ | vahasva | su | su-aśvyam || vahasva | mahaḥ | pr̥thu-pakṣasā | rathe ||8.26.23||

IAST: tvāṁ hi supsarastamaṁ nṛṣadaneṣu hūmahe
Griffith: We call thee to the homes of men, thee wealthiest in noble food,
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | supsaraḥ-tamam | nr̥-sadaneṣu | hūmahe || grāvāṇam | na | aśva-pr̥ṣṭham | maṁhanā ||8.26.24||

IAST: grāvāṇaṁ nāśvapṛṣṭham maṁhanā
Griffith: And liberal as a press-stone with a horse's back.
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | supsaraḥ-tamam | nr̥-sadaneṣu | hūmahe || grāvāṇam | na | aśva-pr̥ṣṭham | maṁhanā ||8.26.24||

IAST: sa tvaṁ no deva manasā vāyo mandāno agriyaḥ
Griffith: So, glad and joyful in thine heart, do thou, God, Vayu, first of all
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नो देव मनसा वायो मन्दानो अग्रियः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | deva | manasā | vāyo iti | mandānaḥ | agriyaḥ || kr̥dhi | vājān | apaḥ | dhiyaḥ ||8.26.25||

IAST: kṛdhi vājām̐ apo dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Vouchsafe us water, strength, and thought.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | deva | manasā | vāyo iti | mandānaḥ | agriyaḥ || kr̥dhi | vājān | apaḥ | dhiyaḥ ||8.26.25||

IAST: agnir ukthe purohito grāvāṇo barhir adhvare
Griffith: CHEIF Priest is Agni at the laud, as stones and grass at sacrifice:
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | ukthe | puraḥ-hitaḥ | grāvāṇaḥ | barhiḥ | adhvare || r̥cā | yāmi | marutaḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | devān | avaḥ | vareṇyam ||8.27.1||

IAST: ṛcā yāmi maruto brahmaṇas patiṁ devām̐ avo vareṇyam
Griffith: With song I seek the Maruts, Brahmanaspati, Gods for help much to be desired.
Devanāgarī: ऋचा यामि मरुतो ब्रह्मणस्पतिं देवाँ अवो वरेण्यम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | ukthe | puraḥ-hitaḥ | grāvāṇaḥ | barhiḥ | adhvare || r̥cā | yāmi | marutaḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | devān | avaḥ | vareṇyam ||8.27.1||

IAST: ā paśuṁ gāsi pṛthivīṁ vanaspatīn uṣāsā naktam oṣadhīḥ
Griffith: I sing to cattle and to Earth, to trees, to Dawns, to Night, to plants.
Devanāgarī: आ पशुं गासि पृथिवीं वनस्पतीनुषासा नक्तमोषधीः
pada pāṭha: ā | paśum | gāsi | pr̥thivīm | vanaspatīn | uṣasā | naktam | oṣadhīḥ || viśve | ca | naḥ | vasavaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | dhīnām | bhūta | pra-avitāraḥ ||8.27.2||

IAST: viśve ca no vasavo viśvavedaso dhīnām bhūta prāvitāraḥ
Griffith: O all ye Vasus, ye possessors of all wealth, be ye the furtherers of our thoughts.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे च नो वसवो विश्ववेदसो धीनां भूत प्रावितारः
pada pāṭha: ā | paśum | gāsi | pr̥thivīm | vanaspatīn | uṣasā | naktam | oṣadhīḥ || viśve | ca | naḥ | vasavaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | dhīnām | bhūta | pra-avitāraḥ ||8.27.2||

IAST: pra sū na etv adhvaro 'gnā deveṣu pūrvyaḥ
Griffith: Forth go, with Agni, to the Gods our sacrifice of ancient use,
Devanāgarī: प्र सू न एत्वध्वरोऽग्ना देवेषु पूर्व्यः
pada pāṭha: pra | su | naḥ | etu | adhvaraḥ | agnā | deveṣu | pūrvyaḥ || ādityeṣu | pra | varuṇe | dhr̥ta-vrate | marut-su | viśva-bhānuṣu ||8.27.3||

IAST: ādityeṣu pra varuṇe dhṛtavrate marutsu viśvabhānuṣu
Griffith: To the Adityas, Varuna whose Law stands fast, and the all-lightening Marut troop.
Devanāgarī: आदित्येषु प्र वरुणे धृतव्रते मरुत्सु विश्वभानुषु
pada pāṭha: pra | su | naḥ | etu | adhvaraḥ | agnā | deveṣu | pūrvyaḥ || ādityeṣu | pra | varuṇe | dhr̥ta-vrate | marut-su | viśva-bhānuṣu ||8.27.3||

IAST: viśve hi ṣmā manave viśvavedaso bhuvan vṛdhe riśādasaḥ
Griffith: Lords of all wealth, may they be strengtheners of man, destroyers of his enemies.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे हि ष्मा मनवे विश्ववेदसो भुवन्वृधे रिशादसः
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | sma | manave | viśva-vedasaḥ | bhuvan | vr̥dhe | riśādasaḥ || ariṣṭebhiḥ | pāyu-bhiḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | yanta | naḥ | avr̥kam | chardiḥ ||8.27.4||

IAST: ariṣṭebhiḥ pāyubhir viśvavedaso yantā no 'vṛkaṁ chardiḥ
Griffith: Lords of all wealth, do ye, with guards which none may harm, preserve our dwelling free from foes.
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | sma | manave | viśva-vedasaḥ | bhuvan | vr̥dhe | riśādasaḥ || ariṣṭebhiḥ | pāyu-bhiḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | yanta | naḥ | avr̥kam | chardiḥ ||8.27.4||

IAST: ā no adya samanaso gantā viśve sajoṣasaḥ
Griffith: Come to us with one mind to-day, come to us all with one accord,
Devanāgarī: आ नो अद्य समनसो गन्ता विश्वे सजोषसः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | adya | sa-manasaḥ | ganta | viśve | sa-joṣasaḥ || r̥cā | girā | marutaḥ | devi | adite | sadane | pastye | mahi ||8.27.5||

IAST: ṛcā girā maruto devy adite sadane pastye mahi
Griffith: Maruts with holy song, and, Goddess Aditi, Mighty One, to our house and home.
Devanāgarī: ऋचा गिरा मरुतो देव्यदिते सदने पस्त्ये महि
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | adya | sa-manasaḥ | ganta | viśve | sa-joṣasaḥ || r̥cā | girā | marutaḥ | devi | adite | sadane | pastye | mahi ||8.27.5||

IAST: abhi priyā maruto yā vo aśvyā havyā mitra prayāthana
Griffith: Send us delightful things, ye Maruts, on your steeds: come ye, O Mitra, to our gifts.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्रिया मरुतो या वो अश्व्या हव्या मित्र प्रयाथन
pada pāṭha: abhi | priyā | marutaḥ | yā | vaḥ | aśvyā | havyā | mitra | pra-yāthana || ā | barhiḥ | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | turāḥ | naraḥ | ādityāsaḥ | sadantu | naḥ ||8.27.6||

IAST: ā barhir indro varuṇas turā nara ādityāsaḥ sadantu naḥ
Griffith: Let Indra, Varuna, and the Adityas sit, swift Heroes, on our sacred grass.
Devanāgarī: आ बर्हिरिन्द्रो वरुणस्तुरा नर आदित्यासः सदन्तु नः
pada pāṭha: abhi | priyā | marutaḥ | yā | vaḥ | aśvyā | havyā | mitra | pra-yāthana || ā | barhiḥ | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | turāḥ | naraḥ | ādityāsaḥ | sadantu | naḥ ||8.27.6||

IAST: vayaṁ vo vṛktabarhiṣo hitaprayasa ānuṣak
Griffith: We who have trimmed the grass for you, and set the banquet in array,
pada pāṭha: vayam | vaḥ | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | hita-prayasaḥ | ānuṣak || suta-somāsaḥ | varuṇa | havāmahe | manuṣvat | iddha-agnayaḥ ||8.27.7||

IAST: sutasomāso varuṇa havāmahe manuṣvad iddhāgnayaḥ
Griffith: And pressed the Soma, call you, Varuina, like men, with sacrificial fires aflame.
pada pāṭha: vayam | vaḥ | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | hita-prayasaḥ | ānuṣak || suta-somāsaḥ | varuṇa | havāmahe | manuṣvat | iddha-agnayaḥ ||8.27.7||

IAST: ā pra yāta maruto viṣṇo aśvinā pūṣan mākīnayā dhiyā
Griffith: O Maruts, Visinu, Asvins, Pusan, haste away with minds turned hitherward to Me.
Devanāgarī: आ प्र यात मरुतो विष्णो अश्विना पूषन्माकीनया धिया
pada pāṭha: ā | pra | yāta | marutaḥ | viṣṇo iti | aśvinā | pūṣan | mākīnayā | dhiyā || indraḥ | ā | yātu | prathamaḥ | saniṣyu-bhiḥ | vr̥ṣā | yaḥ | vr̥tra-hā | gr̥ṇe ||8.27.8||

IAST: indra ā yātu prathamaḥ saniṣyubhir vṛṣā yo vṛtrahā gṛṇe
Griffith: Let the Strong Indra, famed as Vrtra's slayer, come first with the winners of the spoil.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र आ यातु प्रथमः सनिष्युभिर्वृषा यो वृत्रहा गृणे
pada pāṭha: ā | pra | yāta | marutaḥ | viṣṇo iti | aśvinā | pūṣan | mākīnayā | dhiyā || indraḥ | ā | yātu | prathamaḥ | saniṣyu-bhiḥ | vr̥ṣā | yaḥ | vr̥tra-hā | gr̥ṇe ||8.27.8||

IAST: vi no devāso adruho 'cchidraṁ śarma yacchata
Griffith: Ye Guileless Gods, bestow on us a refuge strong on every side,
Devanāgarī: वि नो देवासो अद्रुहोऽच्छिद्रं शर्म यच्छत
pada pāṭha: vi | naḥ | devāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | acchidram | śarma | yacchata || na | yat | dūrāt | vasavaḥ | nu | cit | antitaḥ | varūtham | ā-dadharṣati ||8.27.9||

IAST: na yad dūrād vasavo nū cid antito varūtham ādadharṣati
Griffith: A sure protection, Vasus, unassailable from near at hand or from afar.
pada pāṭha: vi | naḥ | devāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | acchidram | śarma | yacchata || na | yat | dūrāt | vasavaḥ | nu | cit | antitaḥ | varūtham | ā-dadharṣati ||8.27.9||

IAST: asti hi vaḥ sajātyaṁ riśādaso devāso asty āpyam
Griffith: Kinship have I with you, and close alliance O ye Gods, destroyers of our foes.
Devanāgarī: अस्ति हि वः सजात्यं रिशादसो देवासो अस्त्याप्यम्
pada pāṭha: asti | hi | vaḥ | sa-jātyam | riśādasaḥ | devāsaḥ | asti | āpyam || pra | naḥ | pūrvasmai | suvitāya | vocata | makṣu | sumnāya | navyase ||8.27.10||

IAST: pra ṇaḥ pūrvasmai suvitāya vocata makṣū sumnāya navyase
Griffith: Call us to our prosperity of former days, and soon to new klicity.
Devanāgarī: प्र णः पूर्वस्मै सुविताय वोचत मक्षू सुम्नाय नव्यसे
pada pāṭha: asti | hi | vaḥ | sa-jātyam | riśādasaḥ | devāsaḥ | asti | āpyam || pra | naḥ | pūrvasmai | suvitāya | vocata | makṣu | sumnāya | navyase ||8.27.10||

IAST: idā hi va upastutim idā vāmasya bhaktaye
Griffith: For now have I sent forth to you, that I may win a fair reward,
Devanāgarī: इदा हि व उपस्तुतिमिदा वामस्य भक्तये
pada pāṭha: idā | hi | vaḥ | upa-stutim | idā | vāmasya | bhaktaye || upa | vaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | namasyuḥ | ā | asr̥kṣi | anyām-iva ||8.27.11||

IAST: upa vo viśvavedaso namasyur ām̐ asṛkṣy anyām iva
Griffith: Lords of all wealth, with homage, this my song of praise. like a milch-cow that faileth not.
pada pāṭha: idā | hi | vaḥ | upa-stutim | idā | vāmasya | bhaktaye || upa | vaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | namasyuḥ | ā | asr̥kṣi | anyām-iva ||8.27.11||

IAST: ud u ṣya vaḥ savitā supraṇītayo 'sthād ūrdhvo vareṇyaḥ
Griffith: Excellent Savitar hath mounted up on high for you, ye sure and careful Guides.
Devanāgarī: उदु ष्य वः सविता सुप्रणीतयोऽस्थादूर्ध्वो वरेण्यः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | vaḥ | savitā | su-pranītayaḥ | asthāt | ūrdhvaḥ | vareṇyaḥ || ni | dvi-pādaḥ | catuḥ-pādaḥ | arthinaḥ | aviśran | patayiṣṇavaḥ ||8.27.12||

IAST: ni dvipādaś catuṣpādo arthino 'viśran patayiṣṇavaḥ
Griffith: Bipeds and quadrupeds, with several hopes and aims, and birds have settled to their tasks.
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | vaḥ | savitā | su-pranītayaḥ | asthāt | ūrdhvaḥ | vareṇyaḥ || ni | dvi-pādaḥ | catuḥ-pādaḥ | arthinaḥ | aviśran | patayiṣṇavaḥ ||8.27.12||

IAST: devaṁ-devaṁ vo 'vase devaṁ-devam abhiṣṭaye
Griffith: Singing their praise with God-like thought let us invoke each God for grace,
pada pāṭha: devam-devam | vaḥ | avase | devam-devam | abhiṣṭaye || devam-devam | huvema | vāja-sātaye | gr̥ṇantaḥ | devyā | dhiyā ||8.27.13||

IAST: devaṁ-devaṁ huvema vājasātaye gṛṇanto devyā dhiyā
Griffith: Each God to bring you help, each God to strengthen you.
Devanāgarī: देवंदेवं हुवेम वाजसातये गृणन्तो देव्या धिया
pada pāṭha: devam-devam | vaḥ | avase | devam-devam | abhiṣṭaye || devam-devam | huvema | vāja-sātaye | gr̥ṇantaḥ | devyā | dhiyā ||8.27.13||

IAST: devāso hi ṣmā manave samanyavo viśve sākaṁ sarātayaḥ
Griffith: For of one spirit are the Gods with mortal man, co-sharers all of gracious gifts.
Devanāgarī: देवासो हि ष्मा मनवे समन्यवो विश्वे साकं सरातयः
pada pāṭha: devāsaḥ | hi | sma | manave | sa-manyavaḥ | viśve | sākam | sa-rātayaḥ || te | naḥ | adya | te | aparam | tuce | tu | naḥ | bhavantu | varivaḥ-vidaḥ ||8.27.14||

IAST: te no adya te aparaṁ tuce tu no bhavantu varivovidaḥ
Griffith: May they increase our strength hereafter and to-day, providing case and ample room.
Devanāgarī: ते नो अद्य ते अपरं तुचे तु नो भवन्तु वरिवोविदः
pada pāṭha: devāsaḥ | hi | sma | manave | sa-manyavaḥ | viśve | sākam | sa-rātayaḥ || te | naḥ | adya | te | aparam | tuce | tu | naḥ | bhavantu | varivaḥ-vidaḥ ||8.27.14||

IAST: pra vaḥ śaṁsāmy adruhaḥ saṁstha upastutīnām
Griffith: I laud you, O ye Guileless Gods, here where we meet to render praise.
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | śaṁsāmi | adruhaḥ | sam-sthe | upa-stutīnām || na | tam | dhūrtiḥ | varuṇa | mitra | martyam | yaḥ | vaḥ | dhāma-bhyaḥ | avidhat ||8.27.15||

IAST: na taṁ dhūrtir varuṇa mitra martyaṁ yo vo dhāmabhyo 'vidhat
Griffith: None, Varuna and Mitra, harins the mortal, man who honours and obeys your laws.
Devanāgarī: न तं धूर्तिर्वरुण मित्र मर्त्यं यो वो धामभ्योऽविधत्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | śaṁsāmi | adruhaḥ | sam-sthe | upa-stutīnām || na | tam | dhūrtiḥ | varuṇa | mitra | martyam | yaḥ | vaḥ | dhāma-bhyaḥ | avidhat ||8.27.15||

IAST: pra sa kṣayaṁ tirate vi mahīr iṣo yo vo varāya dāśati
Griffith: He makes his house endure, he gathers plenteous food who pays obedience to your will.
Devanāgarī: प्र स क्षयं तिरते वि महीरिषो यो वो वराय दाशति
pada pāṭha: pra | saḥ | kṣayam | tirate | vi | mahīḥ | iṣaḥ | yaḥ | vaḥ | varāya | dāśati || pra | pra-jābhiḥ | jāyate | dharmaṇaḥ | pari | ariṣṭaḥ | sarvaḥ | edhate ||8.27.16||

IAST: pra prajābhir jāyate dharmaṇas pary ariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate
Griffith: Born in his sons anew he spreads as Law commands, and prospers every way unharmed.
pada pāṭha: pra | saḥ | kṣayam | tirate | vi | mahīḥ | iṣaḥ | yaḥ | vaḥ | varāya | dāśati || pra | pra-jābhiḥ | jāyate | dharmaṇaḥ | pari | ariṣṭaḥ | sarvaḥ | edhate ||8.27.16||

IAST: ṛte sa vindate yudhaḥ sugebhir yāty adhvanaḥ
Griffith: E'en without war he gathers wealth, and goes hisway on pleasant paths,
pada pāṭha: r̥te | saḥ | vindate | yudhaḥ | su-gebhiḥ | yāti | adhvanaḥ || aryamā | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | sa-rātayaḥ | yam | trāyante | sa-joṣasaḥ ||8.27.17||

IAST: aryamā mitro varuṇaḥ sarātayo yaṁ trāyante sajoṣasaḥ
Griffith: Whom Mitra, Varuna and Aryaman protect, sharing the gift,of one accord.
Devanāgarī: अर्यमा मित्रो वरुणः सरातयो यं त्रायन्ते सजोषसः
pada pāṭha: r̥te | saḥ | vindate | yudhaḥ | su-gebhiḥ | yāti | adhvanaḥ || aryamā | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | sa-rātayaḥ | yam | trāyante | sa-joṣasaḥ ||8.27.17||

IAST: ajre cid asmai kṛṇuthā nyañcanaṁ durge cid ā susaraṇam
Griffith: E'en on the plain for him ye make a sloping path, an easy way where road is none:
Devanāgarī: अज्रे चिदस्मै कृणुथा न्यञ्चनं दुर्गे चिदा सुसरणम्
pada pāṭha: ajre | cit | asmai | kr̥ṇutha | ni-añcanam | duḥ-ge | cit | ā | su-saraṇam || eṣā | cit | asmāt | aśaniḥ | paraḥ | nu | sā | asredhantī | vi | naśyatu ||8.27.18||

IAST: eṣā cid asmād aśaniḥ paro nu sāsredhantī vi naśyatu
Griffith: And far away from him the ineffectual shaft must vanish, shot at him in vain.
Devanāgarī: एषा चिदस्मादशनिः परो नु सास्रेधन्ती वि नश्यतु
pada pāṭha: ajre | cit | asmai | kr̥ṇutha | ni-añcanam | duḥ-ge | cit | ā | su-saraṇam || eṣā | cit | asmāt | aśaniḥ | paraḥ | nu | sā | asredhantī | vi | naśyatu ||8.27.18||

IAST: yad adya sūrya udyati priyakṣatrā ṛtaṁ dadha
Griffith: If ye appoint the rite to-day, kind Rulers, when the Sun ascends,
Devanāgarī: यदद्य सूर्य उद्यति प्रियक्षत्रा ऋतं दध
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sūrye | ut-yati | priya-kṣatrāḥ | r̥tam | dadha || yat | ni-mruci | pra-budhi | viśva-vedasaḥ | yat | vā | madhyaṁdine | divaḥ ||8.27.19||

IAST: yan nimruci prabudhi viśvavedaso yad vā madhyaṁdine divaḥ
Griffith: Lords of all wealth, at sunset or at wakingtime, or be it at the noon of day,
Devanāgarī: यन्निम्रुचि प्रबुधि विश्ववेदसो यद्वा मध्यंदिने दिवः
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sūrye | ut-yati | priya-kṣatrāḥ | r̥tam | dadha || yat | ni-mruci | pra-budhi | viśva-vedasaḥ | yat | vā | madhyaṁdine | divaḥ ||8.27.19||

IAST: yad vābhipitve asurā ṛtaṁ yate chardir yema vi dāśuṣe
Griffith: Or, Asuras, when ye have sheltered the worshipper who goes to sacrifice, at eve
Devanāgarī: यद्वाभिपित्वे असुरा ऋतं यते छर्दिर्येम वि दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: yat | vā | abhi-pitve | asurāḥ | r̥tam | yate | chardiḥ | yema | vi | dāśuṣe || vayam | tat | vaḥ | vasavaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | upa | stheyāma | madhye | ā ||8.27.20||

IAST: vayaṁ tad vo vasavo viśvavedasa upa stheyāma madhya ā
Griffith: may we, O Vasus, ye possessors of all wealth, come then into the midst of You.
Devanāgarī: वयं तद्वो वसवो विश्ववेदस उप स्थेयाम मध्य आ
pada pāṭha: yat | vā | abhi-pitve | asurāḥ | r̥tam | yate | chardiḥ | yema | vi | dāśuṣe || vayam | tat | vaḥ | vasavaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | upa | stheyāma | madhye | ā ||8.27.20||

IAST: yad adya sūra udite yan madhyaṁdina ātuci
Griffith: If ye to-day at sunrise, or at noon, or in the gloom of eve,
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sūre | ut-ite | yat | madhyaṁdine | ā-tuci || vāmam | dhattha | manave | viśva-vedasaḥ | juhvānāya | pra-cetase ||8.27.21||

IAST: vāmaṁ dhattha manave viśvavedaso juhvānāya pracetase
Griffith: Lords of all riches, give fair treasure to the man, the wise man who hath sacrificed,
Devanāgarī: वामं धत्थ मनवे विश्ववेदसो जुह्वानाय प्रचेतसे
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sūre | ut-ite | yat | madhyaṁdine | ā-tuci || vāmam | dhattha | manave | viśva-vedasaḥ | juhvānāya | pra-cetase ||8.27.21||

IAST: vayaṁ tad vaḥ samrāja ā vṛṇīmahe putro na bahupāyyam
Griffith: Then we, imperial Rulers, claim of you this boon, your wide protection, as a son.
Devanāgarī: वयं तद्वः सम्राज आ वृणीमहे पुत्रो न बहुपाय्यम्
pada pāṭha: vayam | tat | vaḥ | sam-rājaḥ | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe | putraḥ | na | bahu-pāyyam || aśyāma | tat | ādityāḥ | juhvataḥ | haviḥ | yena | vasyaḥ | anaśāmahai ||8.27.22||

IAST: aśyāma tad ādityā juhvato havir yena vasyo 'naśāmahai
Griffith: May we, Adityas, offering holy gifts, obtain that which shall bring us greater bliss.
pada pāṭha: vayam | tat | vaḥ | sam-rājaḥ | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe | putraḥ | na | bahu-pāyyam || aśyāma | tat | ādityāḥ | juhvataḥ | haviḥ | yena | vasyaḥ | anaśāmahai ||8.27.22||

IAST: ye triṁśati trayas paro devāso barhir āsadan
Griffith: THE Thirty Gods and Three besides, whose seat hath been the sacred grass,
pada pāṭha: ye | triṁśati | trayaḥ | paraḥ | devāsaḥ | barhiḥ | ā | asadan || vidan | aha | dvitā | asanan ||8.28.1||

IAST: vidann aha dvitāsanan
Griffith: From time of old have found and gained.
pada pāṭha: ye | triṁśati | trayaḥ | paraḥ | devāsaḥ | barhiḥ | ā | asadan || vidan | aha | dvitā | asanan ||8.28.1||

IAST: varuṇo mitro aryamā smadrātiṣāco agnayaḥ
Griffith: Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, Agnis, with Consorts, sending boons,
pada pāṭha: varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | smadrāti-sācaḥ | agnayaḥ || patnī-vantaḥ | vaṣaṭ-kr̥ṭāḥ ||8.28.2||

IAST: patnīvanto vaṣaṭkṛtāḥ
Griffith: To whom our Vasat! is addressed:
pada pāṭha: varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | smadrāti-sācaḥ | agnayaḥ || patnī-vantaḥ | vaṣaṭ-kr̥ṭāḥ ||8.28.2||

IAST: te no gopā apācyās ta udak ta itthā nyak
Griffith: These are our guardians in the west, and northward here, and in the south,
Devanāgarī: ते नो गोपा अपाच्यास्त उदक्त इत्था न्यक्
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | gopāḥ | apācyāḥ | te | udak | te | itthā | nyak || purastāt | sarvayā | viśā ||8.28.3||

IAST: purastāt sarvayā viśā
Griffith: And on the cast, with all the tribe.
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | gopāḥ | apācyāḥ | te | udak | te | itthā | nyak || purastāt | sarvayā | viśā ||8.28.3||

IAST: yathā vaśanti devās tathed asat tad eṣāṁ nakir ā minat
Griffith: Even as the Gods desire so verily shall it be. None minisheth this power of theirs,
pada pāṭha: yathā | vaśanti | devāḥ | tathā | it | asat | tat | eṣām | nakiḥ | ā | minat || arāvā | cana | martyaḥ ||8.28.4||

IAST: arāvā cana martyaḥ
Griffith: No demon, and no mortal
pada pāṭha: yathā | vaśanti | devāḥ | tathā | it | asat | tat | eṣām | nakiḥ | ā | minat || arāvā | cana | martyaḥ ||8.28.4||

IAST: saptānāṁ sapta ṛṣṭayaḥ sapta dyumnāny eṣām
Griffith: The Seven carry seven spears; seven are the splendours they possess,
pada pāṭha: saptānām | sapta | r̥ṣṭayaḥ | sapta | dyumnāni | eṣām || sapto iti | adhi | śriyaḥ | dhire ||8.28.5||

IAST: sapto adhi śriyo dhire
Griffith: And seven the glories they assume.
pada pāṭha: saptānām | sapta | r̥ṣṭayaḥ | sapta | dyumnāni | eṣām || sapto iti | adhi | śriyaḥ | dhire ||8.28.5||

IAST: babhrur eko viṣuṇaḥ sūnaro yuvāñjy aṅkte hiraṇyayam
Griffith: ONE is a youth brown, active, manifold he decks the golden one with ornament.
pada pāṭha: babhruḥ | ekaḥ | viṣuṇaḥ | sūnaraḥ | yuvā | añji | aṅkte | hiraṇyayam ||8.29.1||

IAST: yonim eka ā sasāda dyotano 'ntar deveṣu medhiraḥ
Griffith: Another, luminous, occupies the place of sacritice, Sage, among the Gods.
pada pāṭha: yonim | ekaḥ | ā | sasāda | dyotanaḥ | antaḥ | deveṣu | medhiraḥ ||8.29.2||

IAST: vāśīm eko bibharti hasta āyasīm antar deveṣu nidhruviḥ
Griffith: One brandishes in his hand an iron knife, firm, in his seat amid the Deities.
pada pāṭha: vāśīm | ekaḥ | bibharti | haste | āyasīm | antaḥ | deveṣu | ni-dhruviḥ ||8.29.3||

IAST: vajram eko bibharti hasta āhitaṁ tena vṛtrāṇi jighnate
Griffith: Another holds the thunderbolt, wherewith he slays the Vrtras, resting in his hand.
Devanāgarī: वज्रमेको बिभर्ति हस्त आहितं तेन वृत्राणि जिघ्नते
pada pāṭha: vajram | ekaḥ | bibharti | haste | ā-hitam | tena | vr̥trāṇi | jighnate ||8.29.4||

IAST: tigmam eko bibharti hasta āyudhaṁ śucir ugro jalāṣabheṣajaḥ
Griffith: Another bears a pointed weapon: bright is he, and strong, with healing medicines.
Devanāgarī: तिग्ममेको बिभर्ति हस्त आयुधं शुचिरुग्रो जलाषभेषजः
pada pāṭha: tigmam | ekaḥ | bibharti | haste | āyudham | śuciḥ | ugraḥ | jalāṣa-bheṣajaḥ ||8.29.5||

IAST: patha ekaḥ pīpāya taskaro yathām̐ eṣa veda nidhīnām
Griffith: Another, thief-like, watches well the ways, and knows the places where the treasures lie.
Devanāgarī: पथ एकः पीपाय तस्करो यथाँ एष वेद निधीनाम्
pada pāṭha: pathaḥ | ekaḥ | pīpāya | taskaraḥ | yathā | eṣaḥ | veda | ni-dhīnām ||8.29.6||

IAST: trīṇy eka urugāyo vi cakrame yatra devāso madanti
Griffith: Another with his mighty stride hath made his three steps thither where the Gods rejoice.
Devanāgarī: त्रीण्येक उरुगायो वि चक्रमे यत्र देवासो मदन्ति
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | ekaḥ | uru-gāyaḥ | vi | cakrame | yatra | devāsaḥ | madanti ||8.29.7||

IAST: vibhir dvā carata ekayā saha pra pravāseva vasataḥ
Griffith: Two with one Dame ride on with winged steeds, and journey forth like travellers on their way.
Devanāgarī: विभिर्द्वा चरत एकया सह प्र प्रवासेव वसतः
pada pāṭha: vi-bhiḥ | dvā | carataḥ | ekayā | saha | pra | pravāsā-iva | vasataḥ ||8.29.8||

IAST: sado dvā cakrāte upamā divi samrājā sarpirāsutī
Griffith: Two, highest, in the heavens have set their seat, worshipped with holy oil, imperial Kings.
Devanāgarī: सदो द्वा चक्राते उपमा दिवि सम्राजा सर्पिरासुती
pada pāṭha: sadaḥ | dvā | cakrāte iti | upa-mā | divi | sam-rājā | sarpirāsutī iti sarpiḥ-āsutī ||8.29.9||

IAST: arcanta eke mahi sāma manvata tena sūryam arocayan
Griffith: Some, singing lauds, conceived the Sama-hymn, great hymn whereby they caused the Sun to shine.
Devanāgarī: अर्चन्त एके महि साम मन्वत तेन सूर्यमरोचयन्
pada pāṭha: arcantaḥ | eke | mahi | sāma | manvata | tena | sūryam | arocayan ||8.29.10||

IAST: nahi vo asty arbhako devāso na kumārakaḥ
Griffith: NOT one of you, ye Gods, is small, none of you is a feeble child:
Devanāgarī: नहि वो अस्त्यर्भको देवासो न कुमारकः
pada pāṭha: nahi | vaḥ | asti | arbhakaḥ | devāsaḥ | na | kumārakaḥ || viśve | sataḥ-mahāntaḥ | it ||8.30.1||

IAST: viśve satomahānta it
Griffith: All of you, verily, are great.
pada pāṭha: nahi | vaḥ | asti | arbhakaḥ | devāsaḥ | na | kumārakaḥ || viśve | sataḥ-mahāntaḥ | it ||8.30.1||

IAST: iti stutāso asathā riśādaso ye stha trayaś ca triṁśac ca
Griffith: Thus be ye lauded, ye destroyers of the foe, ye Three-and-Thirty Deities,
Devanāgarī: इति स्तुतासो असथा रिशादसो ये स्थ त्रयश्च त्रिंशच्च
pada pāṭha: iti | stutāsaḥ | asatha | riśādasaḥ | ye | stha | trayaḥ | ca | triṁśat | ca || manoḥ | devāḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ ||8.30.2||

IAST: manor devā yajñiyāsaḥ
Griffith: The Gods of man, the Holy Ones.
pada pāṭha: iti | stutāsaḥ | asatha | riśādasaḥ | ye | stha | trayaḥ | ca | triṁśat | ca || manoḥ | devāḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ ||8.30.2||

IAST: te nas trādhvaṁ te 'vata ta u no adhi vocata
Griffith: As such defend and succour us, with benedictions speak to us:
Devanāgarī: ते नस्त्राध्वं तेऽवत त उ नो अधि वोचत
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | trādhvam | te | avata | te | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | adhi | vocata || mā | naḥ | pathaḥ | pitryāt | mānavāt | adhi | dūram | naiṣṭa | parā-vataḥ ||8.30.3||

IAST: mā naḥ pathaḥ pitryān mānavād adhi dūraṁ naiṣṭa parāvataḥ
Griffith: Lead us not from our fathers' and from Manu's path into the distance far away.
Devanāgarī: मा नः पथः पित्र्यान्मानवादधि दूरं नैष्ट परावतः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | trādhvam | te | avata | te | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | adhi | vocata || mā | naḥ | pathaḥ | pitryāt | mānavāt | adhi | dūram | naiṣṭa | parā-vataḥ ||8.30.3||

IAST: ye devāsa iha sthana viśve vaiśvānarā uta
Griffith: Ye Deities who stay with us, and all ye Gods of all mankind,
Devanāgarī: ये देवास इह स्थन विश्वे वैश्वानरा उत
pada pāṭha: ye | devāsaḥ | iha | sthana | viśve | vaiśvānarāḥ | uta || asmabhyam | śarma | sa-prathaḥ | gave | aśvāya | yacchata ||8.30.4||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ śarma sapratho gave 'śvāya yacchata
Griffith: Give us your wide protection, give shelter for cattle and for steed.
pada pāṭha: ye | devāsaḥ | iha | sthana | viśve | vaiśvānarāḥ | uta || asmabhyam | śarma | sa-prathaḥ | gave | aśvāya | yacchata ||8.30.4||

IAST: yo yajāti yajāta it sunavac ca pacāti ca
Griffith: THAT Brahman pleases Indra well,
Devanāgarī: यो यजाति यजात इत्सुनवच्च पचाति च
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | yajāti | yajāte | it | sunavat | ca | pacāti | ca || brahmā | it | indrasya | cākanat ||8.31.1||

IAST: brahmed indrasya cākanat
Griffith: who worships, sacrifices, pours Libation, and prepares the meal.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | yajāti | yajāte | it | sunavat | ca | pacāti | ca || brahmā | it | indrasya | cākanat ||8.31.1||

IAST: puroḻāśaṁ yo asmai somaṁ rarata āśiram
Griffith: Sakra protects from woe the man who gives him sacrificial cake.
Devanāgarī: पुरोळाशं यो अस्मै सोमं ररत आशिरम्
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | yaḥ | asmai | somam | rarate | ā-śiram || pāt | it | tam | śakraḥ | aṁhasaḥ ||8.31.2||

IAST: pād it taṁ śakro aṁhasaḥ
Griffith: And offers Soma blent with milk.
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | yaḥ | asmai | somam | rarate | ā-śiram || pāt | it | tam | śakraḥ | aṁhasaḥ ||8.31.2||

IAST: tasya dyumām̐ asad ratho devajūtaḥ sa śūśuvat
Griffith: His chariot shall be glorious, sped by Gods, and mighty shall he be,
Devanāgarī: तस्य द्युमाँ असद्रथो देवजूतः स शूशुवत्
pada pāṭha: tasya | dyu-mān | asat | rathaḥ | deva-jūtaḥ | saḥ | śūśuvat || viśvā | vanvan | amitriyā ||8.31.3||

IAST: viśvā vanvann amitriyā
Griffith: Subduing all hostilities.
pada pāṭha: tasya | dyu-mān | asat | rathaḥ | deva-jūtaḥ | saḥ | śūśuvat || viśvā | vanvan | amitriyā ||8.31.3||

IAST: asya prajāvatī gṛhe 'saścantī dive-dive
Griffith: Each day that passes, in his house flows his libation, rich in milk,
pada pāṭha: asya | prajā-vatī | gr̥he | asaścantī | dive-dive || iḷā | dhenu-matī | duhe ||8.31.4||

IAST: iḻā dhenumatī duhe
Griffith: Exhaustless, bringing progeny.
pada pāṭha: asya | prajā-vatī | gr̥he | asaścantī | dive-dive || iḷā | dhenu-matī | duhe ||8.31.4||

IAST: yā dampatī samanasā sunuta ā ca dhāvataḥ
Griffith: O Gods, with constant draught of milk, husband and wife with one accord
Devanāgarī: या दम्पती समनसा सुनुत आ च धावतः
pada pāṭha: yā | daṁpatī iti dam-patī | sa-manasā | sunutaḥ | ā | ca | dhāvataḥ || devāsaḥ | nityayā | ā-śirā ||8.31.5||

IAST: devāso nityayāśirā
Griffith: Press out and wash the Soma juice.
pada pāṭha: yā | daṁpatī iti dam-patī | sa-manasā | sunutaḥ | ā | ca | dhāvataḥ || devāsaḥ | nityayā | ā-śirā ||8.31.5||

IAST: prati prāśavyām̐ itaḥ samyañcā barhir āśāte
Griffith: They gain sufficient food: they come united to the sacred grass,
pada pāṭha: prati | prāśavyān | itaḥ | samyañcā | barhiḥ | āśāte iti || na | tā | vājeṣu | vāyataḥ ||8.31.6||

IAST: na tā vājeṣu vāyataḥ
Griffith: And never do they fail in strength.
pada pāṭha: prati | prāśavyān | itaḥ | samyañcā | barhiḥ | āśāte iti || na | tā | vājeṣu | vāyataḥ ||8.31.6||

IAST: na devānām api hnutaḥ sumatiṁ na jugukṣataḥ
Griffith: Never do they deny or seek to hide the favour of the Gods:
Devanāgarī: न देवानामपि ह्नुतः सुमतिं न जुगुक्षतः
pada pāṭha: na | devānām | api | hnutaḥ | su-matim | na | jughukṣataḥ || śravaḥ | br̥hat | vivāsataḥ ||8.31.7||

IAST: śravo bṛhad vivāsataḥ
Griffith: They win high glory for themselves.
pada pāṭha: na | devānām | api | hnutaḥ | su-matim | na | jughukṣataḥ || śravaḥ | br̥hat | vivāsataḥ ||8.31.7||

IAST: putriṇā tā kumāriṇā viśvam āyur vy aśnutaḥ
Griffith: With sons and daughters by their side they reach their full extent of life,
pada pāṭha: putriṇā | tā | kumāriṇā | viśvam | āyuḥ | vi | aśnutaḥ || ubhā | hiraṇya-peśasā ||8.31.8||

IAST: ubhā hiraṇyapeśasā
Griffith: Both decked with ornaments of gold.
pada pāṭha: putriṇā | tā | kumāriṇā | viśvam | āyuḥ | vi | aśnutaḥ || ubhā | hiraṇya-peśasā ||8.31.8||

IAST: vītihotrā kṛtadvasū daśasyantāmṛtāya kam
Griffith: Serving the Immortal One with gifts of sacrificial meal and wealth,
pada pāṭha: vīti-hotrā | kr̥tadvasū iti kr̥tat-vasū | daśasyantā | amr̥tāya | kam || sam | ūdhaḥ | romaśam | hataḥ | deveṣu | kr̥ṇutaḥ | duvaḥ ||8.31.9||

IAST: sam ūdho romaśaṁ hato deveṣu kṛṇuto duvaḥ
Griffith: They satisfy the claims of love and pay due honour to the Gods.
Devanāgarī: समूधो रोमशं हतो देवेषु कृणुतो दुवः
pada pāṭha: vīti-hotrā | kr̥tadvasū iti kr̥tat-vasū | daśasyantā | amr̥tāya | kam || sam | ūdhaḥ | romaśam | hataḥ | deveṣu | kr̥ṇutaḥ | duvaḥ ||8.31.9||

IAST: ā śarma parvatānāṁ vṛṇīmahe nadīnām
Griffith: We claim protection from the Hills, we claim protection of the Floods,
pada pāṭha: ā | śarma | parvatānām | vr̥ṇīmahe | nadīnām || ā | viṣṇoḥ | sacā-bhuvaḥ ||8.31.10||

IAST: ā viṣṇoḥ sacābhuvaḥ
Griffith: Of him who stands by Visnu's side.
pada pāṭha: ā | śarma | parvatānām | vr̥ṇīmahe | nadīnām || ā | viṣṇoḥ | sacā-bhuvaḥ ||8.31.10||

IAST: aitu pūṣā rayir bhagaḥ svasti sarvadhātamaḥ
Griffith: May Pusan come, and Bhaga, Lord of wealth, All-bounteous, for our weal
pada pāṭha: ā | etu | pūṣā | rayiḥ | bhagaḥ | svasti | sarva-dhātamaḥ || uruḥ | adhvā | svastaye ||8.31.11||

IAST: urur adhvā svastaye
Griffith: Broad be the path that leads to bliss:
pada pāṭha: ā | etu | pūṣā | rayiḥ | bhagaḥ | svasti | sarva-dhātamaḥ || uruḥ | adhvā | svastaye ||8.31.11||

IAST: aramatir anarvaṇo viśvo devasya manasā
Griffith: Aramati, and, free from foes, Visva with spirit of a God,
pada pāṭha: aramatiḥ | anarvaṇaḥ | viśvaḥ | devasya | manasā || ādityānām | anehaḥ | it ||8.31.12||

IAST: ādityānām aneha it
Griffith: And the Adityas' peerless might.
pada pāṭha: aramatiḥ | anarvaṇaḥ | viśvaḥ | devasya | manasā || ādityānām | anehaḥ | it ||8.31.12||

IAST: yathā no mitro aryamā varuṇaḥ santi gopāḥ
Griffith: Seeing that Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuna are guarding us,
Devanāgarī: यथा नो मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणः सन्ति गोपाः
pada pāṭha: yathā | naḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | santi | gopāḥ || su-gāḥ | r̥tasya | panthāḥ ||8.31.13||

IAST: sugā ṛtasya panthāḥ
Griffith: The paths of Law are fair to tread.
pada pāṭha: yathā | naḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | santi | gopāḥ || su-gāḥ | r̥tasya | panthāḥ ||8.31.13||

IAST: agniṁ vaḥ pūrvyaṁ girā devam īḻe vasūnām
Griffith: I glorify with song, for wealth, Agni the God, the first of you.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं वः पूर्व्यं गिरा देवमीळे वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | vaḥ | pūrvyam | girā | devam | īḷe | vasūnām || saparyantaḥ | puru-priyam | mitram | na | kṣetra-sādhasam ||8.31.14||

IAST: saparyantaḥ purupriyam mitraṁ na kṣetrasādhasam
Griffith: We honour as a well-loved Friend the God who prospereth our fields.
pada pāṭha: agnim | vaḥ | pūrvyam | girā | devam | īḷe | vasūnām || saparyantaḥ | puru-priyam | mitram | na | kṣetra-sādhasam ||8.31.14||

IAST: makṣū devavato rathaḥ śūro vā pṛtsu kāsu cit
Griffith: As in all frays the hero, so swift moves his car whom Gods attend.
Devanāgarī: मक्षू देववतो रथः शूरो वा पृत्सु कासु चित्
pada pāṭha: makṣu | deva-vataḥ | rathaḥ | śūraḥ | vā | pr̥t-su | kāsu | cit || devānām | yaḥ | it | manaḥ | yajamānaḥ | iyakṣati | abhi | it | ayajvanaḥ | bhuvat ||8.31.15||

IAST: devānāṁ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣaty abhīd ayajvano bhuvat
Griffith: The man who, sacrificing, strives to win the heart of Deities will conquer those who worship not.
Devanāgarī: देवानां य इन्मनो यजमान इयक्षत्यभीदयज्वनो भुवत्
pada pāṭha: makṣu | deva-vataḥ | rathaḥ | śūraḥ | vā | pr̥t-su | kāsu | cit || devānām | yaḥ | it | manaḥ | yajamānaḥ | iyakṣati | abhi | it | ayajvanaḥ | bhuvat ||8.31.15||

IAST: na yajamāna riṣyasi na sunvāna na devayo
Griffith: Ne'er are ye injured, worshipper, presser of juice, or pious man.
Devanāgarī: न यजमान रिष्यसि न सुन्वान न देवयो
pada pāṭha: na | yajamāna | riṣyasi | na | sunvāna | na | devayo iti deva-yo || devānām | yaḥ | it | manaḥ | yajamānaḥ | iyakṣati | abhi | it | ayajvanaḥ | bhuvat ||8.31.16||

IAST: devānāṁ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣaty abhīd ayajvano bhuvat
Griffith: The man who, sacrificing, strives to win the heart of Deities will conquer those who worship not.
Devanāgarī: देवानां य इन्मनो यजमान इयक्षत्यभीदयज्वनो भुवत्
pada pāṭha: na | yajamāna | riṣyasi | na | sunvāna | na | devayo iti deva-yo || devānām | yaḥ | it | manaḥ | yajamānaḥ | iyakṣati | abhi | it | ayajvanaḥ | bhuvat ||8.31.16||

IAST: nakiṣ ṭaṁ karmaṇā naśan na pra yoṣan na yoṣati
Griffith: None in his action equals him, none holds him far or keeps him off.
Devanāgarī: नकिष्टं कर्मणा नशन्न प्र योषन्न योषति
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | tam | karmaṇā | naśat | na | pra | yoṣat | na | yoṣati || devānām | yaḥ | it | manaḥ | yajamānaḥ | iyakṣati | abhi | it | ayajvanaḥ | bhuvat ||8.31.17||

IAST: devānāṁ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣaty abhīd ayajvano bhuvat
Griffith: The man who, sacrificing, strives to win the heart of Deities will conquer those who worship not.
Devanāgarī: देवानां य इन्मनो यजमान इयक्षत्यभीदयज्वनो भुवत्
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | tam | karmaṇā | naśat | na | pra | yoṣat | na | yoṣati || devānām | yaḥ | it | manaḥ | yajamānaḥ | iyakṣati | abhi | it | ayajvanaḥ | bhuvat ||8.31.17||

IAST: asad atra suvīryam uta tyad āśvaśvyam
Griffith: Such strength of heroes shall be his, such mastery of fleet-foot steeds.
pada pāṭha: asat | atra | su-vīryam | uta | tyat | āśu-aśvyam || devānām | yaḥ | it | manaḥ | yajamānaḥ | iyakṣati | abhi | it | ayajvanaḥ | bhuvat ||8.31.18||

IAST: devānāṁ ya in mano yajamāna iyakṣaty abhīd ayajvano bhuvat
Griffith: The man who, sacrificing, strives to win the heart of Deities will conquer those who worship not.
Devanāgarī: देवानां य इन्मनो यजमान इयक्षत्यभीदयज्वनो भुवत्
pada pāṭha: asat | atra | su-vīryam | uta | tyat | āśu-aśvyam || devānām | yaḥ | it | manaḥ | yajamānaḥ | iyakṣati | abhi | it | ayajvanaḥ | bhuvat ||8.31.18||

IAST: pra kṛtāny ṛjīṣiṇaḥ kaṇvā indrasya gāthayā
Griffith: KANVAS, tell forth with song the deeds of Indra, the Impetuous,
pada pāṭha: pra | kr̥tāni | r̥jīṣiṇaḥ | kaṇvāḥ | indrasya | gāthayā || made | somasya | vocata ||8.32.1||

IAST: made somasya vocata
Griffith: Wrought in the Soma's wild delight.
pada pāṭha: pra | kr̥tāni | r̥jīṣiṇaḥ | kaṇvāḥ | indrasya | gāthayā || made | somasya | vocata ||8.32.1||

IAST: yaḥ sṛbindam anarśanim pipruṁ dāsam ahīśuvam
Griffith: Strong God, he slew Anarsani, Srbinda, Pipru, and the fiend,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sr̥bindam | anarśanim | piprum | dāsam | ahīśuvam || vadhīt | ugraḥ | riṇan | apaḥ ||8.32.2||

IAST: vadhīd ugro riṇann apaḥ
Griffith: Ahisuva, and loosed the floods.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sr̥bindam | anarśanim | piprum | dāsam | ahīśuvam || vadhīt | ugraḥ | riṇan | apaḥ ||8.32.2||

IAST: ny arbudasya viṣṭapaṁ varṣmāṇam bṛhatas tira
Griffith: Thou broughtest down the dwelling-place, the height of lofty Arbuda.
pada pāṭha: ni | arbudasya | viṣṭapam | varṣmāṇam | br̥hataḥ | tira || kr̥ṣe | tat | indra | pauṁsyam ||8.32.3||

IAST: kṛṣe tad indra pauṁsyam
Griffith: That exploit, Indra, must be famed.
pada pāṭha: ni | arbudasya | viṣṭapam | varṣmāṇam | br̥hataḥ | tira || kr̥ṣe | tat | indra | pauṁsyam ||8.32.3||

IAST: prati śrutāya vo dhṛṣat tūrṇāśaṁ na girer adhi
Griffith: Bold, to your famous Soma I call the fair-visored God for aid,
Devanāgarī: प्रति श्रुताय वो धृषत्तूर्णाशं न गिरेरधि
pada pāṭha: prati | śrutāya | vaḥ | dhr̥ṣat | tūrṇāśam | na | gireḥ | adhi || huve | su-śipram | ūtaye ||8.32.4||

IAST: huve suśipram ūtaye
Griffith: Down like a torrent from the hill.
pada pāṭha: prati | śrutāya | vaḥ | dhr̥ṣat | tūrṇāśam | na | gireḥ | adhi || huve | su-śipram | ūtaye ||8.32.4||

IAST: sa gor aśvasya vi vrajam mandānaḥ somyebhyaḥ
Griffith: Rejoicing in the Soma-draughts, Hero, burst open, like a fort,
Devanāgarī: स गोरश्वस्य वि व्रजं मन्दानः सोम्येभ्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | goḥ | aśvasya | vi | vrajam | mandānaḥ | somyebhyaḥ || puram | na | śūra | darṣasi ||8.32.5||

IAST: puraṁ na śūra darṣasi
Griffith: The stall of horses and of kine.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | goḥ | aśvasya | vi | vrajam | mandānaḥ | somyebhyaḥ || puram | na | śūra | darṣasi ||8.32.5||

IAST: yadi me rāraṇaḥ suta ukthe vā dadhase canaḥ
Griffith: If my libation gladdens, if thou takest pleasure in my laud,
Devanāgarī: यदि मे रारणः सुत उक्थे वा दधसे चनः
pada pāṭha: yadi | me | raraṇaḥ | sute | ukthe | vā | dadhase | canaḥ || ārāt | upa | svadhā | ā | gahi ||8.32.6||

IAST: ārād upa svadhā gahi
Griffith: Come with thy Godhead from afar.
pada pāṭha: yadi | me | raraṇaḥ | sute | ukthe | vā | dadhase | canaḥ || ārāt | upa | svadhā | ā | gahi ||8.32.6||

IAST: vayaṁ ghā te api ṣmasi stotāra indra girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, Lover of the Song, the singers of thy praise are we:
Devanāgarī: वयं घा ते अपि ष्मसि स्तोतार इन्द्र गिर्वणः
pada pāṭha: vayam | gha | te | api | smasi | stotāraḥ | indra | girvaṇaḥ || tvam | naḥ | jinva | soma-pāḥ ||8.32.7||

IAST: tvaṁ no jinva somapāḥ
Griffith: O Soma-drinker, quicken us.
pada pāṭha: vayam | gha | te | api | smasi | stotāraḥ | indra | girvaṇaḥ || tvam | naḥ | jinva | soma-pāḥ ||8.32.7||

IAST: uta naḥ pitum ā bhara saṁrarāṇo avikṣitam
Griffith: And, taking thy delight with us bring us still undiminished food:
Devanāgarī: उत नः पितुमा भर संरराणो अविक्षितम्
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | pitum | ā | bhara | sam-rarāṇaḥ | avi-kṣitam || magha-van | bhūri | te | vasu ||8.32.8||

IAST: maghavan bhūri te vasu
Griffith: Great is thy wealth, O Maghavan.
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | pitum | ā | bhara | sam-rarāṇaḥ | avi-kṣitam || magha-van | bhūri | te | vasu ||8.32.8||

IAST: uta no gomatas kṛdhi hiraṇyavato aśvinaḥ
Griffith: Make thou us rich in herds of kine, in steeds, in gold: let us exert
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | go-mataḥ | kr̥dhi | hiraṇya-vataḥ | aśvinaḥ || iḷābhiḥ | sam | rabhemahi ||8.32.9||

IAST: iḻābhiḥ saṁ rabhemahi
Griffith: Our strength in sacrificial gifts.
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | go-mataḥ | kr̥dhi | hiraṇya-vataḥ | aśvinaḥ || iḷābhiḥ | sam | rabhemahi ||8.32.9||

IAST: bṛbadukthaṁ havāmahe sṛprakarasnam ūtaye
Griffith: Let us call him to aid whose hands stretch far, to whom high laud is due.
pada pāṭha: br̥bat-uktham | havāmahe | sr̥pra-karasnam | ūtaye || sādhu | kr̥ṇvantam | avase ||8.32.10||

IAST: sādhu kṛṇvantam avase
Griffith: Who worketh well to succour us.
pada pāṭha: br̥bat-uktham | havāmahe | sr̥pra-karasnam | ūtaye || sādhu | kr̥ṇvantam | avase ||8.32.10||

IAST: yaḥ saṁsthe cic chatakratur ād īṁ kṛṇoti vṛtrahā
Griffith: He, Satakratu, even in fight acts as a Vrtra-slayer s,till:
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sam-sthe | cit | śata-kratuḥ | āt | īm | kr̥ṇoti | vr̥tra-hā || jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | puru-vasuḥ ||8.32.11||

IAST: jaritṛbhyaḥ purūvasuḥ
Griffith: He gives his worshippers much wealth.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sam-sthe | cit | śata-kratuḥ | āt | īm | kr̥ṇoti | vr̥tra-hā || jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | puru-vasuḥ ||8.32.11||

IAST: sa naḥ śakraś cid ā śakad dānavām̐ antarābharaḥ
Griffith: May he, this A;akra, strengthen us, Boon God who satisfies our needs,
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | śakraḥ | cit | ā | śakat | dāna-vān | antara-ābharaḥ || indraḥ | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ ||8.32.12||

IAST: indro viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: Indra, with all lhis saving helps.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | śakraḥ | cit | ā | śakat | dāna-vān | antara-ābharaḥ || indraḥ | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ ||8.32.12||

IAST: yo rāyo 'vanir mahān supāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā
Griffith: To him, the mighty stream of wealth, the Soma-presser's rescuing Friend,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rāyaḥ | avaniḥ | mahān | su-pāraḥ | sunvataḥ | sakhā || tam | indram | abhi | gāyata ||8.32.13||

IAST: tam indram abhi gāyata
Griffith: To Indra sing your song of praise;
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rāyaḥ | avaniḥ | mahān | su-pāraḥ | sunvataḥ | sakhā || tam | indram | abhi | gāyata ||8.32.13||

IAST: āyantāram mahi sthiram pṛtanāsu śravojitam
Griffith: Who bringeth what is great and firm, who winneth glory in his wars,
pada pāṭha: ā-yantāram | mahi | sthiram | pr̥tanāsu | śravaḥ-jitam || bhūreḥ | īśānam | ojasā ||8.32.14||

IAST: bhūrer īśānam ojasā
Griffith: Lord of vast wealth through power and might.
pada pāṭha: ā-yantāram | mahi | sthiram | pr̥tanāsu | śravaḥ-jitam || bhūreḥ | īśānam | ojasā ||8.32.14||

IAST: nakir asya śacīnāṁ niyantā sūnṛtānām
Griffith: There liveth none to cheek or stay his energies and gracious deeds:
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | asya | śacīnām | ni-yantā | sūnr̥tānām || nakiḥ | vaktā | na | dāt | iti ||8.32.15||

IAST: nakir vaktā na dād iti
Griffith: None who can say, He giveth not.
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | asya | śacīnām | ni-yantā | sūnr̥tānām || nakiḥ | vaktā | na | dāt | iti ||8.32.15||

IAST: na nūnam brahmaṇām ṛṇam prāśūnām asti sunvatām
Griffith: No debt is due by Brahmans now, by active men who press the juice:
pada pāṭha: na | nūnam | brahmaṇām | r̥ṇam | prāśūnām | asti | sunvatām || na | somaḥ | apratā | pape ||8.32.16||

IAST: na somo apratā pape
Griffith: Well hath each Soma-draught been paid.
pada pāṭha: na | nūnam | brahmaṇām | r̥ṇam | prāśūnām | asti | sunvatām || na | somaḥ | apratā | pape ||8.32.16||

IAST: panya id upa gāyata panya ukthāni śaṁsata
Griffith: Sing ye to him who must be praised, say lauds to him who must be praised,
Devanāgarī: पन्य इदुप गायत पन्य उक्थानि शंसत
pada pāṭha: panye | it | upa | gāyata | panye | ukthāni | śaṁsata || brahma | kr̥ṇota | panye | it ||8.32.17||

IAST: brahmā kṛṇota panya it
Griffith: Bring prayer to him who must be praised.
pada pāṭha: panye | it | upa | gāyata | panye | ukthāni | śaṁsata || brahma | kr̥ṇota | panye | it ||8.32.17||

IAST: panya ā dardirac chatā sahasrā vājy avṛtaḥ
Griffith: May be, unchecked, strong, meet for praise, bring hundreds, thousands forth to light,
pada pāṭha: panyaḥ | ā | dardirat | śatā | sahasrā | vājī | avr̥taḥ || indraḥ | yaḥ | yajvanaḥ | vr̥dhaḥ ||8.32.18||

IAST: indro yo yajvano vṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Indra who aids the worshipper.
pada pāṭha: panyaḥ | ā | dardirat | śatā | sahasrā | vājī | avr̥taḥ || indraḥ | yaḥ | yajvanaḥ | vr̥dhaḥ ||8.32.18||

IAST: vi ṣū cara svadhā anu kṛṣṭīnām anv āhuvaḥ
Griffith: Go with thy God-like nature forth, go where the folk are calling thee:
Devanāgarī: वि षू चर स्वधा अनु कृष्टीनामन्वाहुवः
pada pāṭha: vi | su | cara | svadhāḥ | anu | kr̥ṣṭīnām | anu | ā-huvaḥ || indra | piba | sutānām ||8.32.19||

IAST: indra piba sutānām
Griffith: Drink, Indra, of the drops we pour.
pada pāṭha: vi | su | cara | svadhāḥ | anu | kr̥ṣṭīnām | anu | ā-huvaḥ || indra | piba | sutānām ||8.32.19||

IAST: piba svadhainavānām uta yas tugrye sacā
Griffith: Drink milky draughts which are thine own, this too which was with Tugrya once,
pada pāṭha: piba | sva-dhainavānām | uta | yaḥ | tugrye | sacā || uta | ayam | indra | yaḥ | tava ||8.32.20||

IAST: utāyam indra yas tava
Griffith: This is it, Indra, that is thine.
pada pāṭha: piba | sva-dhainavānām | uta | yaḥ | tugrye | sacā || uta | ayam | indra | yaḥ | tava ||8.32.20||

IAST: atīhi manyuṣāviṇaṁ suṣuvāṁsam upāraṇe
Griffith: Pass him who psours libations out in angry mood or after sin:
pada pāṭha: ati | ihi | manyu-sāvinam | susu-vāṁsam | upa-araṇe || imam | rātam | sutam | piba ||8.32.21||

IAST: imaṁ rātaṁ sutam piba
Griffith: Here drink the juice we offer thee.
pada pāṭha: ati | ihi | manyu-sāvinam | susu-vāṁsam | upa-araṇe || imam | rātam | sutam | piba ||8.32.21||

IAST: ihi tisraḥ parāvata ihi pañca janām̐ ati
Griffith: Over the three great distances, past the Five Peoples go thy way,
Devanāgarī: इहि तिस्रः परावत इहि पञ्च जनाँ अति
pada pāṭha: ihi | tisraḥ | parā-vataḥ | ihi | pañca | janān | ati || dhenāḥ | indra | ava-cākaśat ||8.32.22||

IAST: dhenā indrāvacākaśat
Griffith: O Indra, noticing our voice.
pada pāṭha: ihi | tisraḥ | parā-vataḥ | ihi | pañca | janān | ati || dhenāḥ | indra | ava-cākaśat ||8.32.22||

IAST: sūryo raśmiṁ yathā sṛjā tvā yacchantu me giraḥ
Griffith: Send forth thy ray like Surya: let my songs attract thee hitherward,
Devanāgarī: सूर्यो रश्मिं यथा सृजा त्वा यच्छन्तु मे गिरः
pada pāṭha: sūryaḥ | raśmim | yathā | sr̥ja | ā | tvā | yacchantu | me | giraḥ || nimnam | āpaḥ | na | sadhryak ||8.32.23||

IAST: nimnam āpo na sadhryak
Griffith: Like waters gathering to the vale.
pada pāṭha: sūryaḥ | raśmim | yathā | sr̥ja | ā | tvā | yacchantu | me | giraḥ || nimnam | āpaḥ | na | sadhryak ||8.32.23||

IAST: adhvaryav ā tu hi ṣiñca somaṁ vīrāya śipriṇe
Griffith: Now to the Hero fair of cheek, Adhvaryu, pour the Soma forth:
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवा तु हि षिञ्च सोमं वीराय शिप्रिणे
pada pāṭha: adhvaryo iti | ā | tu | hi | siñca | somam | vīrāya | śipriṇe || bhara | sutasya | pītaye ||8.32.24||

IAST: bharā sutasya pītaye
Griffith: Bring of the juice that he may drink
pada pāṭha: adhvaryo iti | ā | tu | hi | siñca | somam | vīrāya | śipriṇe || bhara | sutasya | pītaye ||8.32.24||

IAST: ya udnaḥ phaligam bhinan nyak sindhūm̐r avāsṛjat
Griffith: Who cleft the water-cloud in twain, loosed rivers for their downward flow,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | udnaḥ | phali-gam | bhinat | nyak | sindhūn | ava-asr̥jat || yaḥ | goṣu | pakvam | dhārayat ||8.32.25||

IAST: yo goṣu pakvaṁ dhārayat
Griffith: And set the ripe milk in the kine.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | udnaḥ | phali-gam | bhinat | nyak | sindhūn | ava-asr̥jat || yaḥ | goṣu | pakvam | dhārayat ||8.32.25||

IAST: ahan vṛtram ṛcīṣama aurṇavābham ahīśuvam
Griffith: He, meet for praise, slew Vrtra, slew Ahisuva, Urnavabha's son,
pada pāṭha: ahan | vr̥tram | r̥cīṣamaḥ | aurṇa-vābham | ahīśuvam || himena | avidhyat | arbudam ||8.32.26||

IAST: himenāvidhyad arbudam
Griffith: And pierced th:rough Arbuda with frost.
pada pāṭha: ahan | vr̥tram | r̥cīṣamaḥ | aurṇa-vābham | ahīśuvam || himena | avidhyat | arbudam ||8.32.26||

IAST: pra va ugrāya niṣṭure 'ṣāḻhāya prasakṣiṇe
Griffith: To him your matchless Mighty One, unconquerable Conqueror,
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | ugrāya | niḥ-ture | aṣāḷhāya | pra-sakṣiṇe || devattam | brahma | gāyata ||8.32.27||

IAST: devattam brahma gāyata
Griffith: Sing forth the prayer which Gods have given:
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | ugrāya | niḥ-ture | aṣāḷhāya | pra-sakṣiṇe || devattam | brahma | gāyata ||8.32.27||

IAST: yo viśvāny abhi vratā somasya made andhasaḥ
Griffith: Indra, who in the wild delight of Soma juice considers here
Devanāgarī: यो विश्वान्यभि व्रता सोमस्य मदे अन्धसः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | viśvāni | abhi | vratā | somasya | made | andhasaḥ || indraḥ | deveṣu | cetati ||8.32.28||

IAST: indro deveṣu cetati
Griffith: All holy Laws among the Gods.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | viśvāni | abhi | vratā | somasya | made | andhasaḥ || indraḥ | deveṣu | cetati ||8.32.28||

IAST: iha tyā sadhamādyā harī hiraṇyakeśyā
Griffith: Hither let these thy Bays who share thy banquet, Steeds with golden manes,
pada pāṭha: iha | tyā | sadha-mādyā | harī iti | hiraṇya-keśyā || voḷhām | abhi | prayaḥ | hitam ||8.32.29||

IAST: voḻhām abhi prayo hitam
Griffith: Convey thee to the feast prepared.
pada pāṭha: iha | tyā | sadha-mādyā | harī iti | hiraṇya-keśyā || voḷhām | abhi | prayaḥ | hitam ||8.32.29||

IAST: arvāñcaṁ tvā puruṣṭuta priyamedhastutā harī
Griffith: Hither, O thou whom many laud, the Bays whom Priyamedha praised,
pada pāṭha: arvāñcam | tvā | puru-stuta | priyamedha-stutā | harī iti || soma-peyāya | vakṣataḥ ||8.32.30||

IAST: somapeyāya vakṣataḥ
Griffith: Shall bring thee to the Soma-draught.
pada pāṭha: arvāñcam | tvā | puru-stuta | priyamedha-stutā | harī iti || soma-peyāya | vakṣataḥ ||8.32.30||

IAST: vayaṁ gha tvā sutāvanta āpo na vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
Griffith: WE compass thee like waters, we whose grass is trimmed and Soma pressed.
Devanāgarī: वयं घ त्वा सुतावन्त आपो न वृक्तबर्हिषः
pada pāṭha: vayam | gha | tvā | suta-vantaḥ | āpaḥ | na | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || pavitrasya | pra-sravaṇeṣu | vr̥tra-han | pari | stotāraḥ | āsate ||8.33.1||

IAST: pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāra āsate
Griffith: Here where the filter pours its stream, thy worshippers round thee, O Vrtra-slayer, sit.
pada pāṭha: vayam | gha | tvā | suta-vantaḥ | āpaḥ | na | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || pavitrasya | pra-sravaṇeṣu | vr̥tra-han | pari | stotāraḥ | āsate ||8.33.1||

IAST: svaranti tvā sute naro vaso nireka ukthinaḥ
Griffith: Men, Vasu! by the Soma, with lauds call thee to the foremost place:
Devanāgarī: स्वरन्ति त्वा सुते नरो वसो निरेक उक्थिनः
pada pāṭha: svaranti | tvā | sute | naraḥ | vaso iti | nireke | ukthinaḥ || kadā | sutam | tr̥ṣāṇaḥ | okaḥ | ā | gamaḥ | indra | svabdī-iva | vaṁsagaḥ ||8.33.2||

IAST: kadā sutaṁ tṛṣāṇa oka ā gama indra svabdīva vaṁsagaḥ
Griffith: When comest thou athirst unto the juice as home, O Indra, like a bellowing bull?
Devanāgarī: कदा सुतं तृषाण ओक आ गम इन्द्र स्वब्दीव वंसगः
pada pāṭha: svaranti | tvā | sute | naraḥ | vaso iti | nireke | ukthinaḥ || kadā | sutam | tr̥ṣāṇaḥ | okaḥ | ā | gamaḥ | indra | svabdī-iva | vaṁsagaḥ ||8.33.2||

IAST: kaṇvebhir dhṛṣṇav ā dhṛṣad vājaṁ darṣi sahasriṇam
Griffith: Boldly, Bold Hero, bring us spoil in thousands for the Kanvas' sake.
pada pāṭha: kaṇvebhiḥ | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | ā | dhr̥ṣat | vājam | darṣi | sahasriṇam || piśaṅga-rūpam | magha-van | vi-carṣaṇe | makṣu | go-mantam | īmahe ||8.33.3||

IAST: piśaṅgarūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe
Griffith: O active Maghavan, with eager prayer we crave the yellow-hued with store ol kine.
pada pāṭha: kaṇvebhiḥ | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | ā | dhr̥ṣat | vājam | darṣi | sahasriṇam || piśaṅga-rūpam | magha-van | vi-carṣaṇe | makṣu | go-mantam | īmahe ||8.33.3||

IAST: pāhi gāyāndhaso mada indrāya medhyātithe
Griffith: Medhyatithi, to Indra sing, drink of the juice to make thee glad.
pada pāṭha: pāhi | gāya | andhasaḥ | made | indrāya | medhya-atithe || yaḥ | sam-miślaḥ | haryoḥ | yaḥ | sute | sacā | vajrī | rathaḥ | hiraṇyayaḥ ||8.33.4||

IAST: yaḥ sammiślo haryor yaḥ sute sacā vajrī ratho hiraṇyayaḥ
Griffith: Close-knit to his Bay Steeds, bolt-armed, beside the juice is he: his chariot is of gold.
Devanāgarī: यः सम्मिश्लो हर्योर्यः सुते सचा वज्री रथो हिरण्ययः
pada pāṭha: pāhi | gāya | andhasaḥ | made | indrāya | medhya-atithe || yaḥ | sam-miślaḥ | haryoḥ | yaḥ | sute | sacā | vajrī | rathaḥ | hiraṇyayaḥ ||8.33.4||

IAST: yaḥ suṣavyaḥ sudakṣiṇa ino yaḥ sukratur gṛṇe
Griffith: He Who is praised as strong of hand both right and left, most wise and hold:
Devanāgarī: यः सुषव्यः सुदक्षिण इनो यः सुक्रतुर्गृणे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | su-savyaḥ | su-dakṣiṇaḥ | inaḥ | yaḥ | su-kratuḥ | gr̥ṇe || yaḥ | ā-karaḥ | sahasrā | yaḥ | śata-maghaḥ | indraḥ | yaḥ | pūḥ-bhit | āritaḥ ||8.33.5||

IAST: ya ākaraḥ sahasrā yaḥ śatāmagha indro yaḥ pūrbhid āritaḥ
Griffith: Indra who, rich in hundreds, gathers thousands up, honoured as breaker-down of forts.
Devanāgarī: य आकरः सहस्रा यः शतामघ इन्द्रो यः पूर्भिदारितः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | su-savyaḥ | su-dakṣiṇaḥ | inaḥ | yaḥ | su-kratuḥ | gr̥ṇe || yaḥ | ā-karaḥ | sahasrā | yaḥ | śata-maghaḥ | indraḥ | yaḥ | pūḥ-bhit | āritaḥ ||8.33.5||

IAST: yo dhṛṣito yo 'vṛto yo asti śmaśruṣu śritaḥ
Griffith: The bold of heart whom none provokes, who stands in bearded confidence;
Devanāgarī: यो धृषितो योऽवृतो यो अस्ति श्मश्रुषु श्रितः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dhr̥ṣitaḥ | yaḥ | avr̥taḥ | yaḥ | asti | śmaśruṣu | śritaḥ || vibhūta-dyumnaḥ | cyavanaḥ | puru-stutaḥ | kratvā | gauḥ-iva | śākinaḥ ||8.33.6||

IAST: vibhūtadyumnaś cyavanaḥ puruṣṭutaḥ kratvā gaur iva śākinaḥ
Griffith: Much-lauded, very glorious, overthrowing foes, strong Helper, like a bull with might.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dhr̥ṣitaḥ | yaḥ | avr̥taḥ | yaḥ | asti | śmaśruṣu | śritaḥ || vibhūta-dyumnaḥ | cyavanaḥ | puru-stutaḥ | kratvā | gauḥ-iva | śākinaḥ ||8.33.6||

IAST: ka īṁ veda sute sacā pibantaṁ kad vayo dadhe
Griffith: Who knows what vital ower he wins, drinking beside the flowing juice?
Devanāgarī: क ईं वेद सुते सचा पिबन्तं कद्वयो दधे
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | īm | veda | sute | sacā | pibantam | kat | vayaḥ | dadhe || ayam | yaḥ | puraḥ | vi-bhinatti | ojasā | mandānaḥ | śiprī | andhasaḥ ||8.33.7||

IAST: ayaṁ yaḥ puro vibhinatty ojasā mandānaḥ śipry andhasaḥ
Griffith: This is the fair-checked God who, joying in the draught, breaks down the castles in his strength.
Devanāgarī: अयं यः पुरो विभिनत्त्योजसा मन्दानः शिप्र्यन्धसः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | īm | veda | sute | sacā | pibantam | kat | vayaḥ | dadhe || ayam | yaḥ | puraḥ | vi-bhinatti | ojasā | mandānaḥ | śiprī | andhasaḥ ||8.33.7||

IAST: dānā mṛgo na vāraṇaḥ purutrā carathaṁ dadhe
Griffith: As a wild elephant rushes on this way and that way, mad with heat,'
Devanāgarī: दाना मृगो न वारणः पुरुत्रा चरथं दधे
pada pāṭha: dānā | mr̥gaḥ | na | vāraṇaḥ | puru-trā | caratham | dadhe || nakiḥ | tvā | ni | yamat | ā | sute | gamaḥ | mahān | carasi | ojasā ||8.33.8||

IAST: nakiṣ ṭvā ni yamad ā sute gamo mahām̐ś carasy ojasā
Griffith: None may compel thee, yet come hither to the draught: thou movest mighty in thy power.
Devanāgarī: नकिष्ट्वा नि यमदा सुते गमो महाँश्चरस्योजसा
pada pāṭha: dānā | mr̥gaḥ | na | vāraṇaḥ | puru-trā | caratham | dadhe || nakiḥ | tvā | ni | yamat | ā | sute | gamaḥ | mahān | carasi | ojasā ||8.33.8||

IAST: ya ugraḥ sann aniṣṭṛtaḥ sthiro raṇāya saṁskṛtaḥ
Griffith: When he, the Mighty, ne'er o'erthrown, steadfast, made ready for the fight,
Devanāgarī: य उग्रः सन्ननिष्टृतः स्थिरो रणाय संस्कृतः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ugraḥ | san | aniḥ-str̥taḥ | sthiraḥ | raṇāya | saṁskr̥taḥ || yadi | stotuḥ | magha-vā | śr̥ṇavat | havam | na | indraḥ | yoṣati | ā | gamat ||8.33.9||

IAST: yadi stotur maghavā śṛṇavad dhavaṁ nendro yoṣaty ā gamat
Griffith: When Indra Maghavan lists to his praiser's call, he will not stand aloof, but come.
Devanāgarī: यदि स्तोतुर्मघवा शृणवद्धवं नेन्द्रो योषत्या गमत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ugraḥ | san | aniḥ-str̥taḥ | sthiraḥ | raṇāya | saṁskr̥taḥ || yadi | stotuḥ | magha-vā | śr̥ṇavat | havam | na | indraḥ | yoṣati | ā | gamat ||8.33.9||

IAST: satyam itthā vṛṣed asi vṛṣajūtir no 'vṛtaḥ
Griffith: Yea, verily, thou art a Bull, with a bull's rush. whom none may stay:
pada pāṭha: satyam | itthā | vr̥ṣā | it | asi | vr̥ṣa-jūtiḥ | naḥ | avr̥taḥ || vr̥ṣā | hi | ugra | śr̥ṇviṣe | parā-vati | vr̥ṣo iti | arvā-vati | śrutaḥ ||8.33.10||

IAST: vṛṣā hy ugra śṛṇviṣe parāvati vṛṣo arvāvati śrutaḥ
Griffith: Thou Mighty One, art celebrated as a Bull, famed as a Bull both near and far.
Devanāgarī: वृषा ह्युग्र शृण्विषे परावति वृषो अर्वावति श्रुतः
pada pāṭha: satyam | itthā | vr̥ṣā | it | asi | vr̥ṣa-jūtiḥ | naḥ | avr̥taḥ || vr̥ṣā | hi | ugra | śr̥ṇviṣe | parā-vati | vr̥ṣo iti | arvā-vati | śrutaḥ ||8.33.10||

IAST: vṛṣaṇas te abhīśavo vṛṣā kaśā hiraṇyayī
Griffith: Thy reins are very bulls in strength, bulls' strength is in thy golden whip.
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | te | abhīśavaḥ | vr̥ṣā | kaśā | hiraṇyayī || vr̥ṣā | rathaḥ | magha-van | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti | vr̥ṣā | tvam | śatakrato iti śata-krato ||8.33.11||

IAST: vṛṣā ratho maghavan vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣā tvaṁ śatakrato
Griffith: Thy car, O Maghavan, thy Bays are strong as bulls: thou, Satakratu, art a Bull.
Devanāgarī: वृषा रथो मघवन्वृषणा हरी वृषा त्वं शतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | te | abhīśavaḥ | vr̥ṣā | kaśā | hiraṇyayī || vr̥ṣā | rathaḥ | magha-van | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti | vr̥ṣā | tvam | śatakrato iti śata-krato ||8.33.11||

IAST: vṛṣā sotā sunotu te vṛṣann ṛjīpinn ā bhara
Griffith: Let the strong presser press for thee. Bring hither, thou straight-rushing Bull.
Devanāgarī: वृषा सोता सुनोतु ते वृषन्नृजीपिन्ना भर
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | sotā | sunotu | te | vr̥ṣan | r̥jīpin | ā | bhara || vr̥ṣā | dadhanve | vr̥ṣaṇam | nadīṣu | ā | tubhyam | sthātaḥ | harīṇām ||8.33.12||

IAST: vṛṣā dadhanve vṛṣaṇaṁ nadīṣv ā tubhyaṁ sthātar harīṇām
Griffith: The mighty makes the mighty run in flowing streams for thee whom thy Bay Horses bear.
Devanāgarī: वृषा दधन्वे वृषणं नदीष्वा तुभ्यं स्थातर्हरीणाम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | sotā | sunotu | te | vr̥ṣan | r̥jīpin | ā | bhara || vr̥ṣā | dadhanve | vr̥ṣaṇam | nadīṣu | ā | tubhyam | sthātaḥ | harīṇām ||8.33.12||

IAST: endra yāhi pītaye madhu śaviṣṭha somyam
Griffith: Come, thou most potent Indra, come to drink the savoury Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: एन्द्र याहि पीतये मधु शविष्ठ सोम्यम्
pada pāṭha: ā | indra | yāhi | pītaye | madhu | śaviṣṭha | somyam || na | ayam | accha | magha-vā | śr̥ṇavat | giraḥ | brahma | ukthā | ca | su-kratuḥ ||8.33.13||

IAST: nāyam acchā maghavā śṛṇavad giro brahmokthā ca sukratuḥ
Griffith: Maghavan, very wise, will quickly come to hear the songs, the prayer, the hymns of praise.
Devanāgarī: नायमच्छा मघवा शृणवद्गिरो ब्रह्मोक्था च सुक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: ā | indra | yāhi | pītaye | madhu | śaviṣṭha | somyam || na | ayam | accha | magha-vā | śr̥ṇavat | giraḥ | brahma | ukthā | ca | su-kratuḥ ||8.33.13||

IAST: vahantu tvā ratheṣṭhām ā harayo rathayujaḥ
Griffith: When thou hast mounted on thy car let thy yoked Bay Steeds carry thee,
pada pāṭha: vahantu | tvā | rathe-sthām | ā | harayaḥ | ratha-yujaḥ || tiraḥ | cit | aryam | savanāni | vr̥tra-han | anyeṣām | yā | śatakrato iti śata-krato ||8.33.14||

IAST: tiraś cid aryaṁ savanāni vṛtrahann anyeṣāṁ yā śatakrato
Griffith: Past other men's libations, Lord of Hundred Powers, thee, Vrtra-slayer, thee our Friend.
pada pāṭha: vahantu | tvā | rathe-sthām | ā | harayaḥ | ratha-yujaḥ || tiraḥ | cit | aryam | savanāni | vr̥tra-han | anyeṣām | yā | śatakrato iti śata-krato ||8.33.14||

IAST: asmākam adyāntamaṁ stomaṁ dhiṣva mahāmaha
Griffith: O thou Most Lofty One, accept our laud as nearest to thine heart.
pada pāṭha: asmākam | adya | antamam | stomam | dhiṣva | mahā-maha || asmākam | te | savanā | santu | śam-tamā | madāya | dyukṣa | soma-pāḥ ||8.33.15||

IAST: asmākaṁ te savanā santu śaṁtamā madāya dyukṣa somapāḥ
Griffith: May our libations be most sweet to make thee glad, O Soma-drinker, Heavenly Lord.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं ते सवना सन्तु शंतमा मदाय द्युक्ष सोमपाः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | adya | antamam | stomam | dhiṣva | mahā-maha || asmākam | te | savanā | santu | śam-tamā | madāya | dyukṣa | soma-pāḥ ||8.33.15||

IAST: nahi ṣas tava no mama śāstre anyasya raṇyati
Griffith: Neither in thy decree nor mine, but in another's he delights,-
Devanāgarī: नहि षस्तव नो मम शास्त्रे अन्यस्य रण्यति
pada pāṭha: nahi | saḥ | tava | no iti | mama | śāstre | anyasya | raṇyati || yaḥ | asmān | vīraḥ | ā | anayat ||8.33.16||

IAST: yo asmān vīra ānayat
Griffith: The man who brought us unto this.
pada pāṭha: nahi | saḥ | tava | no iti | mama | śāstre | anyasya | raṇyati || yaḥ | asmān | vīraḥ | ā | anayat ||8.33.16||

IAST: indraś cid ghā tad abravīt striyā aśāsyam manaḥ
Griffith: Indra himself hath said, The mind of woman brooks not discipline,
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | cit | gha | tat | abravīt | striyāḥ | aśāsyam | manaḥ || uto iti | aha | kratum | raghum ||8.33.17||

IAST: uto aha kratuṁ raghum
Griffith: Her intellect hath little weight.
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | cit | gha | tat | abravīt | striyāḥ | aśāsyam | manaḥ || uto iti | aha | kratum | raghum ||8.33.17||

IAST: saptī cid ghā madacyutā mithunā vahato ratham
Griffith: His pair of horses, rushing on in their wild transport, draw his car:
Devanāgarī: सप्ती चिद्घा मदच्युता मिथुना वहतो रथम्
pada pāṭha: saptī iti | cit | gha | mada-cyutā | mithunā | vahataḥ | ratham || eva | it | dhūḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | ut-tarā ||8.33.18||

IAST: eved dhūr vṛṣṇa uttarā
Griffith: High-lifted is the stallion's yoke.
pada pāṭha: saptī iti | cit | gha | mada-cyutā | mithunā | vahataḥ | ratham || eva | it | dhūḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | ut-tarā ||8.33.18||

IAST: adhaḥ paśyasva mopari saṁtarām pādakau hara
Griffith: Cast down thine eyes and look not up. More closely set thy feet. Let none
Devanāgarī: अधः पश्यस्व मोपरि संतरां पादकौ हर
pada pāṭha: adhaḥ | paśyasva | mā | upari | sam-tarām | pādakau | hara || mā | te | kaśa-plakau | dr̥śan | strī | hi | brahmā | babhūvitha ||8.33.19||

IAST: mā te kaśaplakau dṛśan strī hi brahmā babhūvitha
Griffith: See what thy garment veils, for thou, a Brahman, hast become a dame.
Devanāgarī: मा ते कशप्लकौ दृशन्स्त्री हि ब्रह्मा बभूविथ
pada pāṭha: adhaḥ | paśyasva | mā | upari | sam-tarām | pādakau | hara || mā | te | kaśa-plakau | dr̥śan | strī | hi | brahmā | babhūvitha ||8.33.19||

IAST: endra yāhi haribhir upa kaṇvasya suṣṭutim
Griffith: Come hither, Indra, with thy Bays, come thou to Kanva's eulogy.
pada pāṭha: ā | indra | yāhi | hari-bhiḥ | upa | kaṇvasya | su-stutim || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.1||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | indra | yāhi | hari-bhiḥ | upa | kaṇvasya | su-stutim || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.1||

IAST: ā tvā grāvā vadann iha somī ghoṣeṇa yacchatu
Griffith: May the stone draw thee as it speaks, the Soma-stone with ringing voice.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा ग्रावा वदन्निह सोमी घोषेण यच्छतु
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | grāvā | vadan | iha | somī | ghoṣeṇa | yacchatu || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.2||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | grāvā | vadan | iha | somī | ghoṣeṇa | yacchatu || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.2||

IAST: atrā vi nemir eṣām urāṁ na dhūnute vṛkaḥ
Griffith: The stones' rim shakes the Soma here like a wolf worrying a sheep.
Devanāgarī: अत्रा वि नेमिरेषामुरां न धूनुते वृकः
pada pāṭha: atra | vi | nemiḥ | eṣām | urām | na | dhūnute | vr̥kaḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.3||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: atra | vi | nemiḥ | eṣām | urām | na | dhūnute | vr̥kaḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.3||

IAST: ā tvā kaṇvā ihāvase havante vājasātaye
Griffith: The Kanvas call thee hitherward for succour and to win the spoil.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा कण्वा इहावसे हवन्ते वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | kaṇvāḥ | iha | avase | havante | vāja-sātaye || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.4||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | kaṇvāḥ | iha | avase | havante | vāja-sātaye || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.4||

IAST: dadhāmi te sutānāṁ vṛṣṇe na pūrvapāyyam
Griffith: I set for thee, as for the Strong,
Devanāgarī: दधामि ते सुतानां वृष्णे न पूर्वपाय्यम्
pada pāṭha: dadhāmi | te | sutānām | vr̥ṣṇe | na | pūrva-pāyyam || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.5||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: the first draught of the juices shed.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: dadhāmi | te | sutānām | vr̥ṣṇe | na | pūrva-pāyyam || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.5||

IAST: smatpuraṁdhir na ā gahi viśvatodhīr na ūtaye
Griffith: Come with abundant blessings,
pada pāṭha: smat-purandhiḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | viśvataḥ-dhīḥ | naḥ | ūtaye || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.6||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: come with perfect care to succour us.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: smat-purandhiḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | viśvataḥ-dhīḥ | naḥ | ūtaye || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.6||

IAST: ā no yāhi mahemate sahasrote śatāmagha
Griffith: Come, Lord of lofty thought,
Devanāgarī: आ नो याहि महेमते सहस्रोते शतामघ
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yāhi | mahe-mate | sahasra-ūte | śata-magha || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.7||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: who hast infinite wealth and countless aids.
