Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yāhi | mahe-mate | sahasra-ūte | śata-magha || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.7||

IAST: ā tvā hotā manurhito devatrā vakṣad īḍyaḥ
Griffith: Adorable mid Gods,
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा होता मनुर्हितो देवत्रा वक्षदीड्यः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | hotā | manuḥ-hitaḥ | deva-trā | vakṣat | īḍyaḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.8||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: the Priest good to mankind shall bring thee near.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | hotā | manuḥ-hitaḥ | deva-trā | vakṣat | īḍyaḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.8||

IAST: ā tvā madacyutā harī śyenam pakṣeva vakṣataḥ
Griffith: As wings the falcon,
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा मदच्युता हरी श्येनं पक्षेव वक्षतः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | mada-cyutā | harī iti | śyenam | pakṣā-iva | vakṣataḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.9||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: so thy Bays rushing in joy shall carry thee.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | mada-cyutā | harī iti | śyenam | pakṣā-iva | vakṣataḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.9||

IAST: ā yāhy arya ā pari svāhā somasya pītaye
Griffith: Come from the enemy to us,
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यर्य आ परि स्वाहा सोमस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | aryaḥ | ā | pari | svāhā | somasya | pītaye || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.10||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: to svaha and the Soma-draught.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | aryaḥ | ā | pari | svāhā | somasya | pītaye || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.10||

IAST: ā no yāhy upaśruty uktheṣu raṇayā iha
Griffith: Come hither with thine car inclined to hear,
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yāhi | upa-śruti | uktheṣu | raṇaya | iha || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.11||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: take pleasure in our lauds.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yāhi | upa-śruti | uktheṣu | raṇaya | iha || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.11||

IAST: sarūpair ā su no gahi sambhṛtaiḥ sambhṛtāśvaḥ
Griffith: Lord of well-nourished Horses,
Devanāgarī: सरूपैरा सु नो गहि सम्भृतैः सम्भृताश्वः
pada pāṭha: sa-rūpaiḥ | ā | su | naḥ | gahi | sam-bhr̥taiḥ | saṁbhr̥ta-aśvaḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.12||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: come with well-fed Steeds alike in hue.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: sa-rūpaiḥ | ā | su | naḥ | gahi | sam-bhr̥taiḥ | saṁbhr̥ta-aśvaḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.12||

IAST: ā yāhi parvatebhyaḥ samudrasyādhi viṣṭapaḥ
Griffith: Come hither from the mountains,
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | parvatebhyaḥ | samudrasya | adhi | viṣṭapaḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.13||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: come from regions of the sea of air.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | parvatebhyaḥ | samudrasya | adhi | viṣṭapaḥ || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.13||

IAST: ā no gavyāny aśvyā sahasrā śūra dardṛhi
Griffith: Disclose to us O Hero,
Devanāgarī: आ नो गव्यान्यश्व्या सहस्रा शूर दर्दृहि
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | gavyāni | aśvyā | sahasrā | śūra | dardr̥hi || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.14||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: wealth in thousands both of kine and steeds.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | gavyāni | aśvyā | sahasrā | śūra | dardr̥hi || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.14||

IAST: ā naḥ sahasraśo bharāyutāni śatāni ca
Griffith: Bring riches hitherward to us in hundreds, thousands, myriads.
Devanāgarī: आ नः सहस्रशो भरायुतानि शतानि च
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | sahasra-śaḥ | bhara | ayutāni | śatāni | ca || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.15||

IAST: divo amuṣya śāsato divaṁ yaya divāvaso
Griffith: Ye by command of yonder Dyaus, God bright by day! have gone to heaven.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अमुष्य शासतो दिवं यय दिवावसो
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | sahasra-śaḥ | bhara | ayutāni | śatāni | ca || divaḥ | amuṣya | śāsataḥ | divam | yaya | divāvaso iti divā-vaso ||8.34.15||

IAST: ā yad indraś ca dadvahe sahasraṁ vasurociṣaḥ
Griffith: The thousand steeds, the mightiest troop, which we and Indra have received
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | indraḥ | ca | dadvahe iti | sahasram | vasu-rociṣaḥ || ojiṣṭham | aśvyam | paśum ||8.34.16||

IAST: ojiṣṭham aśvyam paśum
Griffith: From Vasurocis as a gift,
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | indraḥ | ca | dadvahe iti | sahasram | vasu-rociṣaḥ || ojiṣṭham | aśvyam | paśum ||8.34.16||

IAST: ya ṛjrā vātaraṁhaso 'ruṣāso raghuṣyadaḥ
Griffith: The brown that match the wind in speed, and bright bay coursers fleet of foot,
pada pāṭha: ye | r̥jrāḥ | vāta-raṁhasaḥ | aruṣāsaḥ | raghu-syadaḥ || bhrājante | sūryāḥ-iva ||8.34.17||

IAST: bhrājante sūryā iva
Griffith: Like Suns, resplendent are they all.
pada pāṭha: ye | r̥jrāḥ | vāta-raṁhasaḥ | aruṣāsaḥ | raghu-syadaḥ || bhrājante | sūryāḥ-iva ||8.34.17||

IAST: pārāvatasya rātiṣu dravaccakreṣv āśuṣu
Griffith: Mid the Pargvata's rich gifts, swift steeds whose wheels run rapidly,
pada pāṭha: pārāvatasya | rātiṣu | dravat-cakreṣu | āśuṣu || tiṣṭham | vanasya | madhye | ā ||8.34.18||

IAST: tiṣṭhaṁ vanasya madhya ā
Griffith: I seemed to stand amid a wood.
pada pāṭha: pārāvatasya | rātiṣu | dravat-cakreṣu | āśuṣu || tiṣṭham | vanasya | madhye | ā ||8.34.18||

IAST: agninendreṇa varuṇena viṣṇunādityai rudrair vasubhiḥ sacābhuvā
Griffith: WITH Agni and with Indra, Visnu. Varuna, with the Adityas, Rudras, Vasus, closely leagued;
pada pāṭha: agninā | indreṇa | varuṇena | viṣṇunā | ādityaiḥ | rudraiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | sacā-bhuvā || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | somam | pibatam | aśvinā ||8.35.1||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, O Asvins, drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं पिबतमश्विना
pada pāṭha: agninā | indreṇa | varuṇena | viṣṇunā | ādityaiḥ | rudraiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | sacā-bhuvā || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | somam | pibatam | aśvinā ||8.35.1||

IAST: viśvābhir dhībhir bhuvanena vājinā divā pṛthivyādribhiḥ sacābhuvā
Griffith: With all the Holy Thoughts, all being Mighty Ones! in close alliance wil the Mountains, Heaven, and Earth
pada pāṭha: viśvābhiḥ | dhībhiḥ | bhuvanena | vājinā | divā | pr̥thivyā | adri-bhiḥ | sacā-bhuvā || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | somam | pibatam | aśvinā ||8.35.2||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant. of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, O Asvins, drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं पिबतमश्विना
pada pāṭha: viśvābhiḥ | dhībhiḥ | bhuvanena | vājinā | divā | pr̥thivyā | adri-bhiḥ | sacā-bhuvā || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | somam | pibatam | aśvinā ||8.35.2||

IAST: viśvair devais tribhir ekādaśair ihādbhir marudbhir bhṛgubhiḥ sacābhuvā
Griffith: With all the Deities, three times eleven, here, in close alliance with the Maruts, Bhrgus, Floods;
pada pāṭha: viśvaiḥ | devaiḥ | tri-bhiḥ | ekādaśaiḥ | iha | at-bhiḥ | marut-bhiḥ | bhr̥gu-bhiḥ | sacā-bhuvā || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | somam | pibatam | aśvinā ||8.35.3||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca somam pibatam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, O Asvins, drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण च सोमं पिबतमश्विना
pada pāṭha: viśvaiḥ | devaiḥ | tri-bhiḥ | ekādaśaiḥ | iha | at-bhiḥ | marut-bhiḥ | bhr̥gu-bhiḥ | sacā-bhuvā || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | somam | pibatam | aśvinā ||8.35.3||

IAST: juṣethāṁ yajñam bodhataṁ havasya me viśveha devau savanāva gacchatam
Griffith: Accept the sacrifice, attend to this my call: come nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.
Devanāgarī: जुषेथां यज्ञं बोधतं हवस्य मे विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: juṣethām | yajñam | bodhatam | havasya | me | viśvā | iha | devau | savanā | ava | gacchatam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ā | iṣam | naḥ | voḷham | aśvinā ||8.35.4||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṁ no voḻham aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, O Asvins, bring us strengthening food.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चेषं नो वोळ्हमश्विना
pada pāṭha: juṣethām | yajñam | bodhatam | havasya | me | viśvā | iha | devau | savanā | ava | gacchatam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ā | iṣam | naḥ | voḷham | aśvinā ||8.35.4||

IAST: stomaṁ juṣethāṁ yuvaśeva kanyanāṁ viśveha devau savanāva gacchatam
Griffith: Accept our praise-song as a youth accepts a maid. Come nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.
Devanāgarī: स्तोमं जुषेथां युवशेव कन्यनां विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: stomam | juṣethām | yuvaśā-iva | kanyanām | viśvā | iha | devau | savanā | ava | gacchatam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ā | iṣam | naḥ | voḷham | aśvinā ||8.35.5||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṁ no voḻham aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Sarya and with Dawn O Asvins, bring us strengthening food.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चेषं नो वोळ्हमश्विना
pada pāṭha: stomam | juṣethām | yuvaśā-iva | kanyanām | viśvā | iha | devau | savanā | ava | gacchatam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ā | iṣam | naḥ | voḷham | aśvinā ||8.35.5||

IAST: giro juṣethām adhvaraṁ juṣethāṁ viśveha devau savanāva gacchatam
Griffith: Accept the songs we sing, accept the solemn rite. Conie nigh, O ye Twain Gods, to all libations here.
Devanāgarī: गिरो जुषेथामध्वरं जुषेथां विश्वेह देवौ सवनाव गच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: giraḥ | juṣethām | adhvaram | juṣethām | viśvā | iha | devau | savanā | ava | gacchatam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ā | iṣam | naḥ | voḷham | aśvinā ||8.35.6||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ceṣaṁ no voḻham aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, O Asvins, bring us strengthening food.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चेषं नो वोळ्हमश्विना
pada pāṭha: giraḥ | juṣethām | adhvaram | juṣethām | viśvā | iha | devau | savanā | ava | gacchatam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ā | iṣam | naḥ | voḷham | aśvinā ||8.35.6||

IAST: hāridraveva patatho vaned upa somaṁ sutam mahiṣevāva gacchathaḥ
Griffith: Ye fly as starlings fly unto the forest trees; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.
Devanāgarī: हारिद्रवेव पतथो वनेदुप सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गच्छथः
pada pāṭha: hāridravā-iva | patathaḥ | vanā | it | upa | somam | sutam | mahiṣā-iva | ava | gacchathaḥ || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | triḥ | vartiḥ | yātam | aśvinā ||8.35.7||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir vartir yātam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Asvins, to our home.
pada pāṭha: hāridravā-iva | patathaḥ | vanā | it | upa | somam | sutam | mahiṣā-iva | ava | gacchathaḥ || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | triḥ | vartiḥ | yātam | aśvinā ||8.35.7||

IAST: haṁsāv iva patatho adhvagāv iva somaṁ sutam mahiṣevāva gacchathaḥ
Griffith: Ye fly like swans, like those who travel on their way; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.
Devanāgarī: हंसाविव पतथो अध्वगाविव सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गच्छथः
pada pāṭha: haṁsau-iva | patathaḥ | adhvagau-iva | somam | sutam | mahiṣā-iva | ava | gacchathaḥ || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | triḥ | vartiḥ | yātam | aśvinā ||8.35.8||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir vartir yātam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Asvins, to our home.
pada pāṭha: haṁsau-iva | patathaḥ | adhvagau-iva | somam | sutam | mahiṣā-iva | ava | gacchathaḥ || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | triḥ | vartiḥ | yātam | aśvinā ||8.35.8||

IAST: śyenāv iva patatho havyadātaye somaṁ sutam mahiṣevāva gacchathaḥ
Griffith: Ye fly to our oblation like a pair of hawks; like buffaloes ye seek the Soma we have shed.
Devanāgarī: श्येनाविव पतथो हव्यदातये सोमं सुतं महिषेवाव गच्छथः
pada pāṭha: śyenau-iva | patathaḥ | havya-dātaye | somam | sutam | mahiṣā-iva | ava | gacchathaḥ || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | triḥ | vartiḥ | yātam | aśvinā ||8.35.9||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa ca trir vartir yātam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, come thrice, O Asvins, to our home.
pada pāṭha: śyenau-iva | patathaḥ | havya-dātaye | somam | sutam | mahiṣā-iva | ava | gacchathaḥ || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | triḥ | vartiḥ | yātam | aśvinā ||8.35.9||

IAST: pibataṁ ca tṛpṇutaṁ cā ca gacchatam prajāṁ ca dhattaṁ draviṇaṁ ca dhattam
Griffith: Come hitherward and drink and satisfy yourselves, bestow upon us progeny and affluence.
Devanāgarī: पिबतं च तृप्णुतं चा च गच्छतं प्रजां च धत्तं द्रविणं च धत्तम्
pada pāṭha: pibatam | ca | tr̥pṇutam | ca | ā | ca | gacchatam | pra-jām | ca | dhattam | draviṇam | ca | dhattam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ūrjam | naḥ | dhattam | aśvinā ||8.35.10||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṁ no dhattam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, O Asvins, grant us vigorous strength.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं नो धत्तमश्विना
pada pāṭha: pibatam | ca | tr̥pṇutam | ca | ā | ca | gacchatam | pra-jām | ca | dhattam | draviṇam | ca | dhattam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ūrjam | naḥ | dhattam | aśvinā ||8.35.10||

IAST: jayataṁ ca pra stutaṁ ca pra cāvatam prajāṁ ca dhattaṁ draviṇaṁ ca dhattam
Griffith: Conquer your foes, protect us, praise your worshippers; bestow upon us progeny and affluence.
Devanāgarī: जयतं च प्र स्तुतं च प्र चावतं प्रजां च धत्तं द्रविणं च धत्तम्
pada pāṭha: jayatam | ca | pra | stutam | ca | pra | ca | avatam | pra-jām | ca | dhattam | draviṇam | ca | dhattam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ūrjam | naḥ | dhattam | aśvinā ||8.35.11||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṁ no dhattam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, O Asvins, grant us vigolms strength.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं नो धत्तमश्विना
pada pāṭha: jayatam | ca | pra | stutam | ca | pra | ca | avatam | pra-jām | ca | dhattam | draviṇam | ca | dhattam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ūrjam | naḥ | dhattam | aśvinā ||8.35.11||

IAST: hataṁ ca śatrūn yatataṁ ca mitriṇaḥ prajāṁ ca dhattaṁ draviṇaṁ ca dhattam
Griffith: Slay enemies, animate men whom ye befriend; bestow upon us progeny and aff luence.
Devanāgarī: हतं च शत्रून्यततं च मित्रिणः प्रजां च धत्तं द्रविणं च धत्तम्
pada pāṭha: hatam | ca | śatrūn | yatatam | ca | mitriṇaḥ | pra-jām | ca | dhattam | draviṇam | ca | dhattam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ūrjam | naḥ | dhattam | aśvinā ||8.35.12||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa corjaṁ no dhattam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, O Asvins, grant us vigorous strength.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसा उषसा सूर्येण चोर्जं नो धत्तमश्विना
pada pāṭha: hatam | ca | śatrūn | yatatam | ca | mitriṇaḥ | pra-jām | ca | dhattam | draviṇam | ca | dhattam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ūrjam | naḥ | dhattam | aśvinā ||8.35.12||

IAST: mitrāvaruṇavantā uta dharmavantā marutvantā jaritur gacchatho havam
Griffith: With Mitra, Varuna, Dharma, and the Maruts in your company approach unto your praiser's call.
Devanāgarī: मित्रावरुणवन्ता उत धर्मवन्ता मरुत्वन्ता जरितुर्गच्छथो हवम्
pada pāṭha: mitrāvaruṇa-vantau | uta | dharma-vantā | marutvantā | jarituḥ | gacchathaḥ | havam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ādityaiḥ | yātam | aśvinā ||8.35.13||

IAST: sajoṣasā uṣasā sūryeṇa cādityair yātam aśvinā
Griffith: Accordant, of one mind with Surya and with Dawn, and with the Adityas, Asvins! come.
pada pāṭha: mitrāvaruṇa-vantau | uta | dharma-vantā | marutvantā | jarituḥ | gacchathaḥ | havam || sa-joṣasau | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ca | ādityaiḥ | yātam | aśvinā ||8.35.13||

IAST: aṅgirasvantā uta viṣṇuvantā marutvantā jaritur gacchatho havam
Griffith: With Visnu and the Angirases attending you, and with the Maruts come unto your praiser's call.
Devanāgarī: अङ्गिरस्वन्ता उत विष्णुवन्ता मरुत्वन्ता जरितुर्गच्छथो हवम्

Griffith: He brings the Vasus strengthening gifts, and grants deliglht, in rest and stir, for every calling on the
Devanāgarī: ऊर्जाहुतिर्वसूनां शं च योश्च मयो दधे विश्वस्यै देवहूत्यै नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: tat-tat | agniḥ | vayaḥ | dadhe | yathā-yathā | kr̥paṇyati || ūrjā-āhutiḥ | vasūnām | śam | ca | yoḥ | ca | mayaḥ | dadhe | viśvasyai | deva-hūtyai | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.4||

IAST: sa ciketa sahīyasāgniś citreṇa karmaṇā
Griffith: Agni hath made himself renowned by wonderful victorious act.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ciketa | sahīyasā | agniḥ | citreṇa | karmaṇā || saḥ | hotā | śaśvatīnām | dakṣiṇābhiḥ | abhi-vr̥taḥ | inoti | ca | pratīvyam | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.5||

IAST: sa hotā śaśvatīnāṁ dakṣiṇābhir abhīvṛta inoti ca pratīvyaṁ nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: He is the Priest of all the tribes, chosen with sacrificial meeds. He urges Deities to receive. Let all
Devanāgarī: स होता शश्वतीनां दक्षिणाभिरभीवृत इनोति च प्रतीव्यं नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ciketa | sahīyasā | agniḥ | citreṇa | karmaṇā || saḥ | hotā | śaśvatīnām | dakṣiṇābhiḥ | abhi-vr̥taḥ | inoti | ca | pratīvyam | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.5||

IAST: agnir jātā devānām agnir veda martānām apīcyam
Griffith: Agni knows all that springs from Gods, he knows the mystery of men.
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jātā | devānām | agniḥ | veda | martānām | apīcyam || agniḥ | saḥ | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | agniḥ | dvārā | vi | ūrṇute | su-āhutaḥ | navīyasā | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.6||

IAST: agniḥ sa draviṇodā agnir dvārā vy ūrṇute svāhuto navīyasā nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Giver of wealth is Agni, he uncloses both the doors to us when worshipped with our newest gift. Let all
Devanāgarī: अग्निः स द्रविणोदा अग्निर्द्वारा व्यूर्णुते स्वाहुतो नवीयसा नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jātā | devānām | agniḥ | veda | martānām | apīcyam || agniḥ | saḥ | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | agniḥ | dvārā | vi | ūrṇute | su-āhutaḥ | navīyasā | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.6||

IAST: agnir deveṣu saṁvasuḥ sa vikṣu yajñiyāsv ā
Griffith: Agni inhabiteth with Gods and men who offer sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | deveṣu | sam-vasuḥ | saḥ | vikṣu | yajñiyāsu | ā || saḥ | mudā | kāvyā | puru | viśvam | bhūma-iva | puṣyati | devaḥ | deveṣu | yajñiyaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.7||

IAST: sa mudā kāvyā puru viśvam bhūmeva puṣyati devo deveṣu yajñiyo nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: He cherisheth with great delight much wisdom, as all things that be, God among Gods adorable. May all t
Devanāgarī: स मुदा काव्या पुरु विश्वं भूमेव पुष्यति देवो देवेषु यज्ञियो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | deveṣu | sam-vasuḥ | saḥ | vikṣu | yajñiyāsu | ā || saḥ | mudā | kāvyā | puru | viśvam | bhūma-iva | puṣyati | devaḥ | deveṣu | yajñiyaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.7||

IAST: yo agniḥ saptamānuṣaḥ śrito viśveṣu sindhuṣu
Griffith: Agni who liveth in all streams, Lord of the Sevenfold Race of men,
Devanāgarī: यो अग्निः सप्तमानुषः श्रितो विश्वेषु सिन्धुषु
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | agniḥ | sapta-mānuṣaḥ | śritaḥ | viśveṣu | sindhuṣu || tam | ā | aganma | tri-pastyam | mandhātuḥ | dasyuhan-tamam | agnim | yajñeṣu | pūrvyam | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.8||

IAST: tam āganma tripastyam mandhātur dasyuhantamam agniṁ yajñeṣu pūrvyaṁ nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Him dweller in three homes we seek, best slayer of the Dasytis for Mandhatar, first in sacrifice. Let al
Devanāgarī: तमागन्म त्रिपस्त्यं मन्धातुर्दस्युहन्तममग्निं यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यं नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | agniḥ | sapta-mānuṣaḥ | śritaḥ | viśveṣu | sindhuṣu || tam | ā | aganma | tri-pastyam | mandhātuḥ | dasyuhan-tamam | agnim | yajñeṣu | pūrvyam | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.8||

IAST: agnis trīṇi tridhātūny ā kṣeti vidathā kaviḥ
Griffith: Agni the Wise inhabiteth three gathering-places, triply formed.
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | trīṇi | tri-dhātūni | ā | kṣeti | vidathā | kaviḥ || saḥ | trīn | ekādaśān | iha | yakṣat | ca | piprayat | ca | naḥ | vipraḥ | dūtaḥ | pari-kr̥taḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.9||

IAST: sa trīm̐r ekādaśām̐ iha yakṣac ca piprayac ca no vipro dūtaḥ pariṣkṛto nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Decked as our envoy let the Sage bring hither and conciliate the Thrice Eleven Deities. Let all the othe
Devanāgarī: स त्रीँरेकादशाँ इह यक्षच्च पिप्रयच्च नो विप्रो दूतः परिष्कृतो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | trīṇi | tri-dhātūni | ā | kṣeti | vidathā | kaviḥ || saḥ | trīn | ekādaśān | iha | yakṣat | ca | piprayat | ca | naḥ | vipraḥ | dūtaḥ | pari-kr̥taḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.9||

IAST: tvaṁ no agna āyuṣu tvaṁ deveṣu pūrvya vasva eka irajyasi
Griffith: Our Agni, thou art first among the Gods, and first mid living men.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो अग्न आयुषु त्वं देवेषु पूर्व्य वस्व एक इरज्यसि
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | āyuṣu | tvam | deveṣu | pūrvya | vasvaḥ | ekaḥ | irajyasi || tvām | āpaḥ | pari-srutaḥ | pari | yanti | sva-setavaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.10||

IAST: tvām āpaḥ parisrutaḥ pari yanti svasetavo nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Thou only rulest over wealth. Round about thee, as natural dams, circumfluous the waters run. Let all t
Devanāgarī: त्वामापः परिस्रुतः परि यन्ति स्वसेतवो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | āyuṣu | tvam | deveṣu | pūrvya | vasvaḥ | ekaḥ | irajyasi || tvām | āpaḥ | pari-srutaḥ | pari | yanti | sva-setavaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.39.10||

IAST: indrāgnī yuvaṁ su naḥ sahantā dāsatho rayim
Griffith: INDRA and Agni, surely ye as Conquerors will give us wealth,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी युवं सु नः सहन्ता दासथो रयिम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | yuvam | su | naḥ | sahantā | dāsathaḥ | rayim || yena | dr̥ḷhā | samat-su | ā | vīḷu | cit | sahiṣīmahi | agniḥ | vanā-iva | vāte | it | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.1||

IAST: yena dṛḻhā samatsv ā vīḻu cit sāhiṣīmahy agnir vaneva vāta in nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Whereby in fight we may o'ercome that which is strong and firmly fixed, as Agni burns the woods with wi
Devanāgarī: येन दृळ्हा समत्स्वा वीळु चित्साहिषीमह्यग्निर्वनेव वात इन्नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | yuvam | su | naḥ | sahantā | dāsathaḥ | rayim || yena | dr̥ḷhā | samat-su | ā | vīḷu | cit | sahiṣīmahi | agniḥ | vanā-iva | vāte | it | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.1||

IAST: nahi vāṁ vavrayāmahe 'thendram id yajāmahe śaviṣṭhaṁ nṛṇāṁ naram
Griffith: We set no snares to tangle you; Indra we worship and adore, Hero of heroes mightiest.
Devanāgarī: नहि वां वव्रयामहेऽथेन्द्रमिद्यजामहे शविष्ठं नृणां नरम्
pada pāṭha: nahi | vām | vavrayāmahe | atha | indram | it | yajāmahe | śaviṣṭham | nr̥ṇām | naram || saḥ | naḥ | kadā | cit | arvatā | gamat | ā | vāja-sātaye | gamat | ā | medha-sātaye | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.2||

IAST: sa naḥ kadā cid arvatā gamad ā vājasātaye gamad ā medhasātaye nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Once may he come unto us with his Steed, come unto us to win us strength, and to complete the sacrifice
Devanāgarī: स नः कदा चिदर्वता गमदा वाजसातये गमदा मेधसातये नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: nahi | vām | vavrayāmahe | atha | indram | it | yajāmahe | śaviṣṭham | nr̥ṇām | naram || saḥ | naḥ | kadā | cit | arvatā | gamat | ā | vāja-sātaye | gamat | ā | medha-sātaye | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.2||

IAST: tā hi madhyam bharāṇām indrāgnī adhikṣitaḥ
Griffith: For, famous Indra-Agni, ye are dwellers in the midst of frays.
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | madhyam | bharāṇām | indrāgnī iti | adhi-kṣitaḥ || tau | ūm̐ iti | kavi-tvanā | kavī iti | pr̥cchyamānā | sakhi-yate | sam | dhītam | aśnutam | narā | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.3||

IAST: tā u kavitvanā kavī pṛcchyamānā sakhīyate saṁ dhītam aśnutaṁ narā nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Sages in wisdom, ye are knit to him who seeketh you as friends. Heroes, bestow on him his wish.
Devanāgarī: ता उ कवित्वना कवी पृच्छ्यमाना सखीयते सं धीतमश्नुतं नरा नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | madhyam | bharāṇām | indrāgnī iti | adhi-kṣitaḥ || tau | ūm̐ iti | kavi-tvanā | kavī iti | pr̥cchyamānā | sakhi-yate | sam | dhītam | aśnutam | narā | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.3||

IAST: abhy arca nabhākavad indrāgnī yajasā girā
Griffith: Nabhaka-like, with sacred song Indra's and Agni's praise I sing,
pada pāṭha: abhi | arca | nabhāka-vat | indrāgnī iti | yajasā | girā || yayoḥ | viśvam | idam | jagat | iyam | dyauḥ | pr̥thivī | mahī | upa-sthe | bibhr̥taḥ | vasu | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.4||

IAST: yayor viśvam idaṁ jagad iyaṁ dyauḥ pṛthivī mahy upasthe bibhṛto vasu nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Theirs to whom all this world belongs, this heaven and this mighty earth which bear rich treasure in the
Devanāgarī: ययोर्विश्वमिदं जगदियं द्यौः पृथिवी मह्युपस्थे बिभृतो वसु नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: abhi | arca | nabhāka-vat | indrāgnī iti | yajasā | girā || yayoḥ | viśvam | idam | jagat | iyam | dyauḥ | pr̥thivī | mahī | upa-sthe | bibhr̥taḥ | vasu | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.4||

IAST: pra brahmāṇi nabhākavad indrāgnibhyām irajyata
Griffith: To Indra and to Agni send your prayers, as was Nabhaka's wont,-
pada pāṭha: pra | brahmāṇi | nabhāka-vat | indrāgni-bhyām | irajyata || yā | sapta-budhnam | arṇavam | jihma-bāram | apa-ūrṇutaḥ | indraḥ | īśānaḥ | ojasā | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.5||

IAST: yā saptabudhnam arṇavaṁ jihmabāram aporṇuta indra īśāna ojasā nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Who oped with sideway opening the sea with its foundations seven-Indra all powerful in his might.
Devanāgarī: या सप्तबुध्नमर्णवं जिह्मबारमपोर्णुत इन्द्र ईशान ओजसा नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: pra | brahmāṇi | nabhāka-vat | indrāgni-bhyām | irajyata || yā | sapta-budhnam | arṇavam | jihma-bāram | apa-ūrṇutaḥ | indraḥ | īśānaḥ | ojasā | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.5||

IAST: api vṛśca purāṇavad vratater iva guṣpitam ojo dāsasya dambhaya
Griffith: Tear thou asunder, as of old, like tangles of a creeping plant,
Devanāgarī: अपि वृश्च पुराणवद्व्रततेरिव गुष्पितमोजो दासस्य दम्भय
pada pāṭha: api | vr̥śca | purāṇa-vat | vratateḥ-iva | guṣpitam | ojaḥ | dāsasya | dambhaya || vayam | tat | asya | sam-bhr̥tam | vasu | indreṇa | vi | bhajemahi | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.6||

IAST: vayaṁ tad asya sambhṛtaṁ vasv indreṇa vi bhajemahi nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Demolish thou the Dasa's might. May we with Indra's help divide the treasure he hath gathered up.
Devanāgarī: वयं तदस्य सम्भृतं वस्विन्द्रेण वि भजेमहि नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: api | vr̥śca | purāṇa-vat | vratateḥ-iva | guṣpitam | ojaḥ | dāsasya | dambhaya || vayam | tat | asya | sam-bhr̥tam | vasu | indreṇa | vi | bhajemahi | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.6||

IAST: yad indrāgnī janā ime vihvayante tanā girā
Griffith: What time with this same song these men call Indra-Agni sundry ways,
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्राग्नी जना इमे विह्वयन्ते तना गिरा
pada pāṭha: yat | indrāgnī iti | janāḥ | ime | vi-hvayante | tanā | girā || asmākebhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | vayam | sasahyāma | pr̥tanyataḥ | vanuyāma | vanuṣyataḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.7||

IAST: asmākebhir nṛbhir vayaṁ sāsahyāma pṛtanyato vanuyāma vanuṣyato nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: May we with our own heroes quell those who provoke us to the fight, and conquer those who strive with us
Devanāgarī: अस्माकेभिर्नृभिर्वयं सासह्याम पृतन्यतो वनुयाम वनुष्यतो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yat | indrāgnī iti | janāḥ | ime | vi-hvayante | tanā | girā || asmākebhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | vayam | sasahyāma | pr̥tanyataḥ | vanuyāma | vanuṣyataḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.7||

IAST: yā nu śvetāv avo diva uccarāta upa dyubhiḥ
Griffith: The Two refulgent with their beams rise and come downward from the sky.
Devanāgarī: या नु श्वेताववो दिव उच्चरात उप द्युभिः
pada pāṭha: yā | nu | śvetau | avaḥ | divaḥ | ut-carātaḥ | upa | dyu-bhiḥ || indrāgnyoḥ | anu | vratam | uhānāḥ | yanti | sindhavaḥ | yān | sīm | bandhāt | amuñcatām | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.8||

IAST: indrāgnyor anu vratam uhānā yanti sindhavo yān sīm bandhād amuñcatāṁ nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: By Indra's and by Agni's hest, flowing away, the rivers, run which they released from their restraint.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्न्योरनु व्रतमुहाना यन्ति सिन्धवो यान्सीं बन्धादमुञ्चतां नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yā | nu | śvetau | avaḥ | divaḥ | ut-carātaḥ | upa | dyu-bhiḥ || indrāgnyoḥ | anu | vratam | uhānāḥ | yanti | sindhavaḥ | yān | sīm | bandhāt | amuñcatām | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.8||

IAST: pūrvīṣ ṭa indropamātayaḥ pūrvīr uta praśastayaḥ sūno hinvasya harivaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, many are thine aids, many thy ways of guiding us,
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीष्ट इन्द्रोपमातयः पूर्वीरुत प्रशस्तयः सूनो हिन्वस्य हरिवः
pada pāṭha: pūrvīḥ | te | indra | upa-mātayaḥ | pūrvīḥ | uta | pra-śastayaḥ | sūno iti | hinvasya | hari-vaḥ || vasvaḥ | vīrasya | ā-pr̥caḥ | yāḥ | nu | sādhanta | naḥ | dhiyaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.9||

IAST: vasvo vīrasyāpṛco yā nu sādhanta no dhiyo nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Lord of the Bay Steeds, Hinva's Son. To a Good Hero come our prayers, which soon shall have accomplishme
Devanāgarī: वस्वो वीरस्यापृचो या नु साधन्त नो धियो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: pūrvīḥ | te | indra | upa-mātayaḥ | pūrvīḥ | uta | pra-śastayaḥ | sūno iti | hinvasya | hari-vaḥ || vasvaḥ | vīrasya | ā-pr̥caḥ | yāḥ | nu | sādhanta | naḥ | dhiyaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.9||

IAST: taṁ śiśītā suvṛktibhis tveṣaṁ satvānam ṛgmiyam
Griffith: Inspire him with your holy hymns, the Hero bright and glorious,
pada pāṭha: tam | śiśīta | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | tveṣam | satvānam | r̥gmiyam || uto iti | nu | cit | yaḥ | ojasā | śuṣṇasya | āṇḍāni | bhedati | jeṣat | svaḥ-vatīḥ | apaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.10||

IAST: uto nu cid ya ojasā śuṣṇasyāṇḍāni bhedati jeṣat svarvatīr apo nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Him who with might demolisbeth even the brood of Susna, and winneth for us the heavenly streams.
Devanāgarī: उतो नु चिद्य ओजसा शुष्णस्याण्डानि भेदति जेषत्स्वर्वतीरपो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: tam | śiśīta | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | tveṣam | satvānam | r̥gmiyam || uto iti | nu | cit | yaḥ | ojasā | śuṣṇasya | āṇḍāni | bhedati | jeṣat | svaḥ-vatīḥ | apaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.10||

IAST: taṁ śiśītā svadhvaraṁ satyaṁ satvānam ṛtviyam
Griffith: Inspire him worshipped with fair rites, the glorious Hero truly brave.
pada pāṭha: tam | śiśīta | su-adhvaram | satyam | satvānam | r̥tviyam || uto iti | nu | cit | yaḥ | ohate | āṇḍā | śuṣṇasya | bhedati | ajaiḥ | svaḥ-vatīḥ | apaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.11||

IAST: uto nu cid ya ohata āṇḍā śuṣṇasya bhedaty ajaiḥ svarvatīr apo nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: He brake in pieces Susna's brood who still expected not the stroke, and won for us the heavenly streams
Devanāgarī: उतो नु चिद्य ओहत आण्डा शुष्णस्य भेदत्यजैः स्वर्वतीरपो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: tam | śiśīta | su-adhvaram | satyam | satvānam | r̥tviyam || uto iti | nu | cit | yaḥ | ohate | āṇḍā | śuṣṇasya | bhedati | ajaiḥ | svaḥ-vatīḥ | apaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.40.11||

IAST: evendrāgnibhyām pitṛvan navīyo mandhātṛvad aṅgirasvad avāci
Griffith: Thus have we sung anew to Indra-Agni, as sang our sires, Angirases, and Mandhatar.
pada pāṭha: eva | indrāgni-bhyām | pitr̥-vat | navīyaḥ | mandhātr̥-vat | aṅgirasvat | avāci || tri-dhātunā | śarmaṇā | pātam | asmān | vayam | syāma | patayaḥ | rayīṇām ||8.40.12||

IAST: tridhātunā śarmaṇā pātam asmān vayaṁ syāma patayo rayīṇām
Griffith: Guard us with triple shelter and preserve us: may we be masters of a store of riches.
Devanāgarī: त्रिधातुना शर्मणा पातमस्मान्वयं स्याम पतयो रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: eva | indrāgni-bhyām | pitr̥-vat | navīyaḥ | mandhātr̥-vat | aṅgirasvat | avāci || tri-dhātunā | śarmaṇā | pātam | asmān | vayam | syāma | patayaḥ | rayīṇām ||8.40.12||

IAST: asmā ū ṣu prabhūtaye varuṇāya marudbhyo 'rcā viduṣṭarebhyaḥ
Griffith: To make this Varuna come forth sing thou a song unto the band of Maruts wiser than thyself,-
Devanāgarī: अस्मा ऊ षु प्रभूतये वरुणाय मरुद्भ्योऽर्चा विदुष्टरेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: asmai | ūm̐ iti | su | pra-bhūtaye | varuṇāya | marut-bhyaḥ | arca | viduḥ-tarebhyaḥ || yaḥ | dhītā | mānuṣāṇām | paśvaḥ | gāḥ-iva | rakṣati | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.1||

IAST: yo dhītā mānuṣāṇām paśvo gā iva rakṣati nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: This Varuna who guardeth well the thoughts of men like herds of kine. Let all the others die away.
Devanāgarī: यो धीता मानुषाणां पश्वो गा इव रक्षति नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: asmai | ūm̐ iti | su | pra-bhūtaye | varuṇāya | marut-bhyaḥ | arca | viduḥ-tarebhyaḥ || yaḥ | dhītā | mānuṣāṇām | paśvaḥ | gāḥ-iva | rakṣati | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.1||

IAST: tam ū ṣu samanā girā pitṝṇāṁ ca manmabhiḥ
Griffith: Him altogether praise I with the song and hymns our fathers sang, and with Nabhaka's eulogies,-
Devanāgarī: तमू षु समना गिरा पितॄणां च मन्मभिः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | su | samanā | girā | pitr̥̄ṇām | ca | manma-bhiḥ || nābhākasya | prasasti-bhiḥ | yaḥ | sindhūnām | upa | ut-aye | sapta-svasā | saḥ | madhyamaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.2||

IAST: nābhākasya praśastibhir yaḥ sindhūnām upodaye saptasvasā sa madhyamo nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Him dwelling at the rivers' source, surrounded by his Sisters Seven.
Devanāgarī: नाभाकस्य प्रशस्तिभिर्यः सिन्धूनामुपोदये सप्तस्वसा स मध्यमो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | su | samanā | girā | pitr̥̄ṇām | ca | manma-bhiḥ || nābhākasya | prasasti-bhiḥ | yaḥ | sindhūnām | upa | ut-aye | sapta-svasā | saḥ | madhyamaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.2||

IAST: sa kṣapaḥ pari ṣasvaje ny usro māyayā dadhe sa viśvam pari darśataḥ
Griffith: The nights he hath encompassed, and stablished the morns with magic art visible over all is he.
Devanāgarī: स क्षपः परि षस्वजे न्युस्रो मायया दधे स विश्वं परि दर्शतः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | kṣapaḥ | pari | sasvaje | ni | usraḥ | māyayā | dadhe | saḥ | viśvam | pari | darśataḥ || tasya | venīḥ | anu | vratam | uṣaḥ | tisraḥ | avardhayan | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.3||

IAST: tasya venīr anu vratam uṣas tisro avardhayan nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: His dear Ones, following his Law, have prospered the Three Dawns for him.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | kṣapaḥ | pari | sasvaje | ni | usraḥ | māyayā | dadhe | saḥ | viśvam | pari | darśataḥ || tasya | venīḥ | anu | vratam | uṣaḥ | tisraḥ | avardhayan | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.3||

IAST: yaḥ kakubho nidhārayaḥ pṛthivyām adhi darśataḥ
Griffith: He, visible o'er all the earth, stablished the quarters of the sky:
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | kakubhaḥ | ni-dhārayaḥ | pr̥thivyām | adhi | darśataḥ || saḥ | mātā | pūrvyam | padam | tat | varuṇasya | saptyam | saḥ | hi | gopāḥ-iva | iryaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.4||

IAST: sa mātā pūrvyam padaṁ tad varuṇasya saptyaṁ sa hi gopā iveryo nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: He measured out the eastern place, that is the fold of Varuna: like a strong herdsman is the God.
Devanāgarī: स माता पूर्व्यं पदं तद्वरुणस्य सप्त्यं स हि गोपा इवेर्यो नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | kakubhaḥ | ni-dhārayaḥ | pr̥thivyām | adhi | darśataḥ || saḥ | mātā | pūrvyam | padam | tat | varuṇasya | saptyam | saḥ | hi | gopāḥ-iva | iryaḥ | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.4||

IAST: yo dhartā bhuvanānāṁ ya usrāṇām apīcyā veda nāmāni guhyā
Griffith: He who supports the worlds of life, he who well knows the hidden names mysterious of the morning beams,
Devanāgarī: यो धर्ता भुवनानां य उस्राणामपीच्या वेद नामानि गुह्या
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dhartā | bhuvanānām | yaḥ | usrāṇām | apīcyā | veda | nāmāni | guhyā || saḥ | kaviḥ | kāvyā | puru | rūpam | dyauḥ-iva | puṣyati | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.5||

IAST: sa kaviḥ kāvyā puru rūpaṁ dyaur iva puṣyati nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: He cherishes much wisdom, Sage, as heaven brings forth each varied form.
Devanāgarī: स कविः काव्या पुरु रूपं द्यौरिव पुष्यति नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dhartā | bhuvanānām | yaḥ | usrāṇām | apīcyā | veda | nāmāni | guhyā || saḥ | kaviḥ | kāvyā | puru | rūpam | dyauḥ-iva | puṣyati | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.5||

IAST: yasmin viśvāni kāvyā cakre nābhir iva śritā
Griffith: In whom all wisdom centres, as the nave is set within the wheel.
pada pāṭha: yasmin | viśvāni | kāvyā | cakre | nābhiḥ-iva | śritā || tritam | jūtī | saparyata | vraje | gāvaḥ | na | sam-yuje | yuje | aśvān | ayukṣata | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.6||

IAST: tritaṁ jūtī saparyata vraje gāvo na saṁyuje yuje aśvām̐ ayukṣata nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Haste ye to honour Trita, as kine haste to gather in the fold, even as they muster steeds to yoke.
Devanāgarī: त्रितं जूती सपर्यत व्रजे गावो न संयुजे युजे अश्वाँ अयुक्षत नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yasmin | viśvāni | kāvyā | cakre | nābhiḥ-iva | śritā || tritam | jūtī | saparyata | vraje | gāvaḥ | na | sam-yuje | yuje | aśvān | ayukṣata | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.6||

IAST: ya āsv atka āśaye viśvā jātāny eṣām
Griffith: He wraps these regions as a robe; he contemplates the tribes of Gods and all the works of mortal men.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | āsu | atkaḥ | ā-śaye | viśvā | jātāni | eṣām || pari | dhāmāni | marmr̥śat | varuṇasya | puraḥ | gaye | viśve | devāḥ | anu | vratam | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.7||

IAST: pari dhāmāni marmṛśad varuṇasya puro gaye viśve devā anu vrataṁ nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Before the home of Varuna all the Gods follow his decree.
Devanāgarī: परि धामानि मर्मृशद्वरुणस्य पुरो गये विश्वे देवा अनु व्रतं नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | āsu | atkaḥ | ā-śaye | viśvā | jātāni | eṣām || pari | dhāmāni | marmr̥śat | varuṇasya | puraḥ | gaye | viśve | devāḥ | anu | vratam | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.7||

IAST: sa samudro apīcyas turo dyām iva rohati ni yad āsu yajur dadhe
Griffith: He is an Ocean far-removed, yet through the heaven to him ascends the worship which these realms possess.
Devanāgarī: स समुद्रो अपीच्यस्तुरो द्यामिव रोहति नि यदासु यजुर्दधे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | samudraḥ | apīcyaḥ | turaḥ | dyām-iva | rohati | ni | yat | āsu | yajuḥ | dadhe || saḥ | māyāḥ | arcinā | padā | astr̥ṇāt | nākam | ā | aruhat | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.8||

IAST: sa māyā arcinā padāstṛṇān nākam āruhan nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: With his bright foot he overthrew their magic, and went up to heaven.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | samudraḥ | apīcyaḥ | turaḥ | dyām-iva | rohati | ni | yat | āsu | yajuḥ | dadhe || saḥ | māyāḥ | arcinā | padā | astr̥ṇāt | nākam | ā | aruhat | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.8||

IAST: yasya śvetā vicakṣaṇā tisro bhūmīr adhikṣitaḥ
Griffith: Ruler, whose bright far-seeing rays, pervading all three earths, have filled the three superior realms of
pada pāṭha: yasya | śvetā | vi-cakṣaṇā | tisraḥ | bhūmīḥ | adhi-kṣitaḥ || triḥ | ut-tarāṇi | papratuḥ | varuṇasya | dhruvam | sadaḥ | saḥ | saptānām | irajyati | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.9||

IAST: trir uttarāṇi papratur varuṇasya dhruvaṁ sadaḥ sa saptānām irajyati nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Firm is the seat of Varuna: over the Seven he rules as King.
Devanāgarī: त्रिरुत्तराणि पप्रतुर्वरुणस्य ध्रुवं सदः स सप्तानामिरज्यति नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yasya | śvetā | vi-cakṣaṇā | tisraḥ | bhūmīḥ | adhi-kṣitaḥ || triḥ | ut-tarāṇi | papratuḥ | varuṇasya | dhruvam | sadaḥ | saḥ | saptānām | irajyati | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.9||

IAST: yaḥ śvetām̐ adhinirṇijaś cakre kṛṣṇām̐ anu vratā
Griffith: Who, after his decree, o'erspread the Dark Ones with a robe of light;
Devanāgarī: यः श्वेताँ अधिनिर्णिजश्चक्रे कृष्णाँ अनु व्रता
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śvetān | adhi-nirnijaḥ | cakre | kr̥ṣṇān | anu | vratā || saḥ | dhāma | pūrvyam | mame | yaḥ | skambhena | vi | rodasī iti | ajaḥ | na | dyām | adhārayat | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.10||

IAST: sa dhāma pūrvyam mame yaḥ skambhena vi rodasī ajo na dyām adhārayan nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Who measured out the ancient seat, who pillared both the worlds apart as the Unborn supported heaven. Le
Devanāgarī: स धाम पूर्व्यं ममे यः स्कम्भेन वि रोदसी अजो न द्यामधारयन्नभन्तामन्यके समे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śvetān | adhi-nirnijaḥ | cakre | kr̥ṣṇān | anu | vratā || saḥ | dhāma | pūrvyam | mame | yaḥ | skambhena | vi | rodasī iti | ajaḥ | na | dyām | adhārayat | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.41.10||

IAST: astabhnād dyām asuro viśvavedā amimīta varimāṇam pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: LORD of all wealth, the Asura propped the heavens, and measured out the broad earth's wide expanses.
pada pāṭha: astabhnāt | dyām | asuraḥ | viśva-vedāḥ | amimīta | varimāṇam | pr̥thivyāḥ || ā | asīdat | viśvā | bhuvanāni | sam-rāṭ | viśvā | it | tāni | varuṇasya | vratāni ||8.42.1||

IAST: āsīdad viśvā bhuvanāni samrāḍ viśvet tāni varuṇasya vratāni
Griffith: He, King supreme, approached all living creatures. All these are Varuna's holy operations.
pada pāṭha: astabhnāt | dyām | asuraḥ | viśva-vedāḥ | amimīta | varimāṇam | pr̥thivyāḥ || ā | asīdat | viśvā | bhuvanāni | sam-rāṭ | viśvā | it | tāni | varuṇasya | vratāni ||8.42.1||

IAST: evā vandasva varuṇam bṛhantaṁ namasyā dhīram amṛtasya gopām
Griffith: So humbly worship Varuna the Mighty revere the wise Guard of World Immortal.
Devanāgarī: एवा वन्दस्व वरुणं बृहन्तं नमस्या धीरममृतस्य गोपाम्
pada pāṭha: eva | vandasva | varuṇam | br̥hantam | namasya | dhīram | amr̥tasya | gopām || saḥ | naḥ | śarma | tri-varūtham | vi | yaṁsat | pātam | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | upa-sthe ||8.42.2||

IAST: sa naḥ śarma trivarūthaṁ vi yaṁsat pātaṁ no dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe
Griffith: May he vouchsafe us triply-barred protection. O Earth and Heaven, within your lap preserve us.
Devanāgarī: स नः शर्म त्रिवरूथं वि यंसत्पातं नो द्यावापृथिवी उपस्थे
pada pāṭha: eva | vandasva | varuṇam | br̥hantam | namasya | dhīram | amr̥tasya | gopām || saḥ | naḥ | śarma | tri-varūtham | vi | yaṁsat | pātam | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | upa-sthe ||8.42.2||

IAST: imāṁ dhiyaṁ śikṣamāṇasya deva kratuṁ dakṣaṁ varuṇa saṁ śiśādhi
Griffith: Sharpen this song of him who strives his utmost, sharpen, God Varuna, his strength and insight;
Devanāgarī: इमां धियं शिक्षमाणस्य देव क्रतुं दक्षं वरुण सं शिशाधि
pada pāṭha: imām | dhiyam | śikṣamāṇasya | deva | kratum | dakṣam | varuṇa | sam | śiśādhi || yayā | ati | viśvā | duḥ-itā | tarema | su-tarmāṇam | adhi | nāvam | ruhema ||8.42.3||

IAST: yayāti viśvā duritā tarema sutarmāṇam adhi nāvaṁ ruhema
Griffith: May we ascend the ship that bears us safely, whereby we may pass over all misfortune.
Devanāgarī: ययाति विश्वा दुरिता तरेम सुतर्माणमधि नावं रुहेम
pada pāṭha: imām | dhiyam | śikṣamāṇasya | deva | kratum | dakṣam | varuṇa | sam | śiśādhi || yayā | ati | viśvā | duḥ-itā | tarema | su-tarmāṇam | adhi | nāvam | ruhema ||8.42.3||

IAST: ā vāṁ grāvāṇo aśvinā dhībhir viprā acucyavuḥ
Griffith: Asvins, with songs the singer stones have made you hasten hitherward,
Devanāgarī: आ वां ग्रावाणो अश्विना धीभिर्विप्रा अचुच्यवुः
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | grāvāṇaḥ | aśvinā | dhībhiḥ | viprāḥ | acucyavuḥ || nāsatyā | soma-pītaye | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.42.4||

IAST: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Nasatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | grāvāṇaḥ | aśvinā | dhībhiḥ | viprāḥ | acucyavuḥ || nāsatyā | soma-pītaye | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.42.4||

IAST: yathā vām atrir aśvinā gīrbhir vipro ajohavīt
Griffith: As the sage Atri with his hymns, O Asvins, called you eagerly,
pada pāṭha: yathā | vām | atriḥ | aśvinā | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vipraḥ | ajohavīt || nāsatyā | soma-pītaye | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.42.5||

IAST: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Nasatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.
pada pāṭha: yathā | vām | atriḥ | aśvinā | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vipraḥ | ajohavīt || nāsatyā | soma-pītaye | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.42.5||

IAST: evā vām ahva ūtaye yathāhuvanta medhirāḥ
Griffith: So have I called you to our aid, even as the wise have called of old,
pada pāṭha: eva | vām | ahve | ūtaye | yathā | ahuvanta | medhirāḥ || nāsatyā | soma-pītaye | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.42.6||

IAST: nāsatyā somapītaye nabhantām anyake same
Griffith: Nasatyas, to the Soma-draught. Let all the others die away.
pada pāṭha: eva | vām | ahve | ūtaye | yathā | ahuvanta | medhirāḥ || nāsatyā | soma-pītaye | nabhantām | anyake | same ||8.42.6||

IAST: ime viprasya vedhaso 'gner astṛtayajvanaḥ
Griffith: THESE songs of mine go forth as lauds of Agni, the disposing Sage,
pada pāṭha: ime | viprasya | vedhasaḥ | agneḥ | astr̥ta-yajvanaḥ || giraḥ | stomāsaḥ | īrate ||8.43.1||

IAST: giraḥ stomāsa īrate
Griffith: Whose worshipper is ne'er o'erthrawn.
pada pāṭha: ime | viprasya | vedhasaḥ | agneḥ | astr̥ta-yajvanaḥ || giraḥ | stomāsaḥ | īrate ||8.43.1||

IAST: asmai te pratiharyate jātavedo vicarṣaṇe
Griffith: Wise Agni Jatavedas, I beget a song of praise for thee.
pada pāṭha: asmai | te | prati-haryate | jāta-vedaḥ | vi-carṣaṇe || agne | janāmi | su-stutim ||8.43.2||

IAST: agne janāmi suṣṭutim
Griffith: Who willingly receivest it.
pada pāṭha: asmai | te | prati-haryate | jāta-vedaḥ | vi-carṣaṇe || agne | janāmi | su-stutim ||8.43.2||

IAST: ārokā iva ghed aha tigmā agne tava tviṣaḥ
Griffith: Thy sharpened flames, O Agni, like the gleams of light that glitter through,
Devanāgarī: आरोका इव घेदह तिग्मा अग्ने तव त्विषः
pada pāṭha: ārokāḥ-iva | gha | it | aha | tigmāḥ | agne | tava | tviṣaḥ || dat-bhiḥ | vanāni | bapsati ||8.43.3||

IAST: dadbhir vanāni bapsati
Griffith: Devour the forests with their teeth.
pada pāṭha: ārokāḥ-iva | gha | it | aha | tigmāḥ | agne | tava | tviṣaḥ || dat-bhiḥ | vanāni | bapsati ||8.43.3||

IAST: harayo dhūmaketavo vātajūtā upa dyavi
Griffith: Gold-coloured, bannered with the smoke, urged by the wind, aloft to heaven
pada pāṭha: harayaḥ | dhūma-ketavaḥ | vāta-jūtāḥ | upa | dyavi || yatante | vr̥thak | agnayaḥ ||8.43.4||

IAST: yatante vṛthag agnayaḥ
Griffith: Rise, lightly borne, the flames of fire.
pada pāṭha: harayaḥ | dhūma-ketavaḥ | vāta-jūtāḥ | upa | dyavi || yatante | vr̥thak | agnayaḥ ||8.43.4||

IAST: ete tye vṛthag agnaya iddhāsaḥ sam adṛkṣata
Griffith: These lightly kindled fiery flames are all around made visible,
pada pāṭha: ete | tye | vr̥thak | agnayaḥ | iddhāsaḥ | sam | adr̥kṣata || uṣasām-iva | ketavaḥ ||8.43.5||

IAST: uṣasām iva ketavaḥ
Griffith: Even as the glearaings of the Dawns.
pada pāṭha: ete | tye | vr̥thak | agnayaḥ | iddhāsaḥ | sam | adr̥kṣata || uṣasām-iva | ketavaḥ ||8.43.5||

IAST: kṛṣṇā rajāṁsi patsutaḥ prayāṇe jātavedasaḥ
Griffith: As Jatavedas speeds along, the dust is black beneath his feet,
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṣṇā | rajāṁsi | patsutaḥ | pra-yāṇe | jāta-vedasaḥ || agniḥ | yat | rodhati | kṣami ||8.43.6||

IAST: agnir yad rodhati kṣami
Griffith: When Agni spreads upon the earth.
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṣṇā | rajāṁsi | patsutaḥ | pra-yāṇe | jāta-vedasaḥ || agniḥ | yat | rodhati | kṣami ||8.43.6||

IAST: dhāsiṁ kṛṇvāna oṣadhīr bapsad agnir na vāyati
Griffith: Making the plants his nourishment, Agni devours and wearies not,
pada pāṭha: dhāsim | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | bapsat | agniḥ | na | vāyati || punaḥ | yan | taruṇīḥ | api ||8.43.7||

IAST: punar yan taruṇīr api
Griffith: Seeking the tender shrubs again.
pada pāṭha: dhāsim | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | bapsat | agniḥ | na | vāyati || punaḥ | yan | taruṇīḥ | api ||8.43.7||

IAST: jihvābhir aha nannamad arciṣā jañjaṇābhavan
Griffith: Bending him down with all his tongues, he flickers with his fiery glow
pada pāṭha: jihvābhiḥ | aha | nannamat | arciṣā | jañjaṇā-bhavan || agniḥ | vaneṣu | rocate ||8.43.8||

IAST: agnir vaneṣu rocate
Griffith: Splendid is Agni in the woods.
pada pāṭha: jihvābhiḥ | aha | nannamat | arciṣā | jañjaṇā-bhavan || agniḥ | vaneṣu | rocate ||8.43.8||

IAST: apsv agne sadhiṣ ṭava sauṣadhīr anu rudhyase
Griffith: Agni, thine home is in the floods: into the plants thou forcest way,
pada pāṭha: ap-su | agne | sadhiḥ | tava | saḥ | oṣadhīḥ | anu | rudhyase || garbhe | san | jāyase | punariti ||8.43.9||

IAST: garbhe sañ jāyase punaḥ
Griffith: And as their Child art born anew.
pada pāṭha: ap-su | agne | sadhiḥ | tava | saḥ | oṣadhīḥ | anu | rudhyase || garbhe | san | jāyase | punariti ||8.43.9||

IAST: ud agne tava tad ghṛtād arcī rocata āhutam
Griffith: Worshipped with offerings shines thy flame, O Agni, from the sacred oil,
pada pāṭha: ut | agne | tava | tat | ghr̥tāt | arciḥ | rocate | ā-hutam || niṁsānam | juhvaḥ | mukhe ||8.43.10||

IAST: niṁsānaṁ juhvo mukhe
Griffith: With kisses on the ladle's mouth.
pada pāṭha: ut | agne | tava | tat | ghr̥tāt | arciḥ | rocate | ā-hutam || niṁsānam | juhvaḥ | mukhe ||8.43.10||

IAST: ukṣānnāya vaśānnāya somapṛṣṭhāya vedhase
Griffith: Let us serve Agni with our hymns, Disposer, fed on ox and cow,
pada pāṭha: ukṣa-annāya | vaśā-annāya | soma-pr̥ṣṭhāya | vedhase || stomaiḥ | vidhema | agnaye ||8.43.11||

IAST: stomair vidhemāgnaye
Griffith: Who bears the Soma on his back.
pada pāṭha: ukṣa-annāya | vaśā-annāya | soma-pr̥ṣṭhāya | vedhase || stomaiḥ | vidhema | agnaye ||8.43.11||

IAST: uta tvā namasā vayaṁ hotar vareṇyakrato
Griffith: Yea, thee, O Agni, do we seek with homage and with fuel, Priest
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | namasā | vayam | hotaḥ | vareṇyakrato iti vareṇya-krato || agne | samit-bhiḥ | īmahe ||8.43.12||

IAST: agne samidbhir īmahe
Griffith: Whose wisdom is most excellent.
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | namasā | vayam | hotaḥ | vareṇyakrato iti vareṇya-krato || agne | samit-bhiḥ | īmahe ||8.43.12||

IAST: uta tvā bhṛguvac chuce manuṣvad agna āhuta
Griffith: O worshipped with oblations, pure Agni, we call on thee as erst,
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | bhr̥gu-vat | śuce | manuṣvat | agne | ā-huta || aṅgirasvat | havāmahe ||8.43.13||

IAST: aṅgirasvad dhavāmahe
Griffith: Did Bhrgu, Manus, Angiras.
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | bhr̥gu-vat | śuce | manuṣvat | agne | ā-huta || aṅgirasvat | havāmahe ||8.43.13||

IAST: tvaṁ hy agne agninā vipro vipreṇa san satā
Griffith: For thou, O Agni, by the fire, Sage by the Sage, Good by the Good,
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह्यग्ने अग्निना विप्रो विप्रेण सन्सता
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | agne | agninā | vipraḥ | vipreṇa | san | satā || sakhā | sakhyā | sam-idhyase ||8.43.14||

IAST: sakhā sakhyā samidhyase
Griffith: Friend by the Friend, art lighted up.
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | agne | agninā | vipraḥ | vipreṇa | san | satā || sakhā | sakhyā | sam-idhyase ||8.43.14||

IAST: sa tvaṁ viprāya dāśuṣe rayiṁ dehi sahasriṇam
Griffith: So wealth in thousands, food with store of heroes give thou to the sage,
Devanāgarī: स त्वं विप्राय दाशुषे रयिं देहि सहस्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | viprāya | dāśuṣe | rayim | dehi | sahasriṇam || agne | vīra-vatīm | iṣam ||8.43.15||

IAST: agne vīravatīm iṣam
Griffith: O Agni, to the worshipper.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | viprāya | dāśuṣe | rayim | dehi | sahasriṇam || agne | vīra-vatīm | iṣam ||8.43.15||

IAST: agne bhrātaḥ sahaskṛta rohidaśva śucivrata
Griffith: O Agni, Brother, made by strength, Lord of red steeds and brilliant sway,
pada pāṭha: agne | bhrātariti | sahaḥ-kr̥ta | rohit-aśva | śuci-vrata || imam | stomam | juṣasva | me ||8.43.16||

IAST: imaṁ stomaṁ juṣasva me
Griffith: Take pleasure in this laud of mine.
pada pāṭha: agne | bhrātariti | sahaḥ-kr̥ta | rohit-aśva | śuci-vrata || imam | stomam | juṣasva | me ||8.43.16||

IAST: uta tvāgne mama stuto vāśrāya pratiharyate
Griffith: My praises, Agni, go to thee, as the cows seek the stall to meet,
Devanāgarī: उत त्वाग्ने मम स्तुतो वाश्राय प्रतिहर्यते
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | agne | mama | stutaḥ | vāśrāya | prati-haryate || go-stham | gāvaḥ-iva | āśata ||8.43.17||

IAST: goṣṭhaṁ gāva ivāśata
Griffith: The lowing calf that longs for milk.
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | agne | mama | stutaḥ | vāśrāya | prati-haryate || go-stham | gāvaḥ-iva | āśata ||8.43.17||

IAST: tubhyaṁ tā aṅgirastama viśvāḥ sukṣitayaḥ pṛthak
Griffith: Agni, best Angiras, to thee all people who have pleasant homes,
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं ता अङ्गिरस्तम विश्वाः सुक्षितयः पृथक्
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | tāḥ | aṅgiraḥ-tama | viśvāḥ | su-kṣitayaḥ | pr̥thak || agne | kāmāya | yemire ||8.43.18||

IAST: agne kāmāya yemire
Griffith: Apart, have turned as to their wish.
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | tāḥ | aṅgiraḥ-tama | viśvāḥ | su-kṣitayaḥ | pr̥thak || agne | kāmāya | yemire ||8.43.18||

IAST: agniṁ dhībhir manīṣiṇo medhirāso vipaścitaḥ
Griffith: The sages skilled in holy song and thin. kers with their thoughts have urged
pada pāṭha: agnim | dhībhiḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | medhirāsaḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ || adma-sadyāya | hinvire ||8.43.19||

IAST: admasadyāya hinvire
Griffith: Agni to share the sacred feast.
pada pāṭha: agnim | dhībhiḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ | medhirāsaḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ || adma-sadyāya | hinvire ||8.43.19||

IAST: taṁ tvām ajmeṣu vājinaṁ tanvānā agne adhvaram
Griffith: So, Agni, unto thee the Priest, Invoker, strong in forays, pray
Devanāgarī: तं त्वामज्मेषु वाजिनं तन्वाना अग्ने अध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: tam | tvām | ajmeṣu | vājinam | tanvānāḥ | agne | adhvaram || vahnim | hotāram | īḷate ||8.43.20||

IAST: vahniṁ hotāram īḻate
Griffith: nose who spin out the sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: tam | tvām | ajmeṣu | vājinam | tanvānāḥ | agne | adhvaram || vahnim | hotāram | īḷate ||8.43.20||

IAST: purutrā hi sadṛṅṅ asi viśo viśvā anu prabhuḥ
Griffith: In many a place, the same in look art thou, a Prince o'er all the tribes
Devanāgarī: पुरुत्रा हि सदृङ्ङसि विशो विश्वा अनु प्रभुः
pada pāṭha: puru-trā | hi | sa-dr̥ṅ | asi | viśaḥ | viśvāḥ | anu | pra-bhuḥ || samat-su | tvā | havāmahe ||8.43.21||

IAST: samatsu tvā havāmahe
Griffith: In battles we invoke thine aid.
pada pāṭha: puru-trā | hi | sa-dr̥ṅ | asi | viśaḥ | viśvāḥ | anu | pra-bhuḥ || samat-su | tvā | havāmahe ||8.43.21||

IAST: tam īḻiṣva ya āhuto 'gnir vibhrājate ghṛtaiḥ
Griffith: Pray thou to Agni, pray to him who blazes served with sacred oil:
pada pāṭha: tam | īḷiṣva | yaḥ | ā-hutaḥ | agniḥ | vi-bhrājate | ghr̥taiḥ || imam | naḥ | śr̥ṇavat | havam ||8.43.22||

IAST: imaṁ naḥ śṛṇavad dhavam
Griffith: Let him give ear to this our call.
pada pāṭha: tam | īḷiṣva | yaḥ | ā-hutaḥ | agniḥ | vi-bhrājate | ghr̥taiḥ || imam | naḥ | śr̥ṇavat | havam ||8.43.22||

IAST: taṁ tvā vayaṁ havāmahe śṛṇvantaṁ jātavedasam
Griffith: We call on thee as such, as one who hears, as Jatavedas, one,
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा वयं हवामहे शृण्वन्तं जातवेदसम्
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | vayam | havāmahe | śr̥ṇvantam | jāta-vedasam || agne | ghnantam | apa | dviṣaḥ ||8.43.23||

IAST: agne ghnantam apa dviṣaḥ
Griffith: Agni! who beats away our foes.
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | vayam | havāmahe | śr̥ṇvantam | jāta-vedasam || agne | ghnantam | apa | dviṣaḥ ||8.43.23||

IAST: viśāṁ rājānam adbhutam adhyakṣaṁ dharmaṇām imam
Griffith: I pray to Agni, King of men, the Wonderful, the President
pada pāṭha: viśām | rājānam | adbhutam | adhi-akṣam | dharmaṇām | imam || agnim | īḷe | saḥ | ūm̐ iti | śravat ||8.43.24||

IAST: agnim īḻe sa u śravat
Griffith: Of holy Laws: may he give ear.
pada pāṭha: viśām | rājānam | adbhutam | adhi-akṣam | dharmaṇām | imam || agnim | īḷe | saḥ | ūm̐ iti | śravat ||8.43.24||

IAST: agniṁ viśvāyuvepasam maryaṁ na vājinaṁ hitam
Griffith: Him like a bridegroom, him who stirs all people, like a noble horse,
Devanāgarī: अग्निं विश्वायुवेपसं मर्यं न वाजिनं हितम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | viśvāyu-vepasam | maryam | na | vājinam | hitam || saptim | na | vājayāmasi ||8.43.25||

IAST: saptiṁ na vājayāmasi
Griffith: Like a fleet steed, we instigate.
pada pāṭha: agnim | viśvāyu-vepasam | maryam | na | vājinam | hitam || saptim | na | vājayāmasi ||8.43.25||

IAST: ghnan mṛdhrāṇy apa dviṣo dahan rakṣāṁsi viśvahā
Griffith: Slaying things deadly, burning up foes, Riksasas, on every side,
pada pāṭha: ghnan | mr̥dhrāṇi | apa | dviṣaḥ | dahan | rakṣāṁsi | viśvahā || agne | tigmena | dīdihi ||8.43.26||

IAST: agne tigmena dīdihi
Griffith: Shine, Agni, with thy sharpened flame.
pada pāṭha: ghnan | mr̥dhrāṇi | apa | dviṣaḥ | dahan | rakṣāṁsi | viśvahā || agne | tigmena | dīdihi ||8.43.26||

IAST: yaṁ tvā janāsa indhate manuṣvad aṅgirastama
Griffith: Thou whom the people kindle even as Manus did, best Angiras!
pada pāṭha: yam | tvā | janāsaḥ | indhate | manuṣvat | aṅgiraḥ-tama || agne | saḥ | bodhi | me | vacaḥ ||8.43.27||

IAST: agne sa bodhi me vacaḥ
Griffith: O Agni, mark thou this my speech.
pada pāṭha: yam | tvā | janāsaḥ | indhate | manuṣvat | aṅgiraḥ-tama || agne | saḥ | bodhi | me | vacaḥ ||8.43.27||

IAST: yad agne divijā asy apsujā vā sahaskṛta
Griffith: O Agni, made by strength! be thou born in the heavens or born in floods,
pada pāṭha: yat | agne | divi-jāḥ | asi | apsu-jāḥ | vā | sahaḥ-kr̥ta || tam | tvā | gīḥ-bhiḥ | havāmahe ||8.43.28||

IAST: taṁ tvā gīrbhir havāmahe
Griffith: As such we call on thee with songs.
pada pāṭha: yat | agne | divi-jāḥ | asi | apsu-jāḥ | vā | sahaḥ-kr̥ta || tam | tvā | gīḥ-bhiḥ | havāmahe ||8.43.28||

IAST: tubhyaṁ ghet te janā ime viśvāḥ sukṣitayaḥ pṛthak
Griffith: Yea, all the people, all the folk who have good dwellings, each apart,
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं घेत्ते जना इमे विश्वाः सुक्षितयः पृथक्
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | gha | it | te | janāḥ | ime | viśvāḥ | su-kṣitayaḥ | pr̥thak || dhāsim | hinvanti | attave ||8.43.29||

IAST: dhāsiṁ hinvanty attave
Griffith: Send food for thee to eat thereof.
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | gha | it | te | janāḥ | ime | viśvāḥ | su-kṣitayaḥ | pr̥thak || dhāsim | hinvanti | attave ||8.43.29||

IAST: te ghed agne svādhyo 'hā viśvā nṛcakṣasaḥ
Griffith: O Agni, so may we, devout, gazed at by men, throughout our days,
pada pāṭha: te | gha | it | agne | su-ādhyaḥ | ahā | viśvā | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ || tarantaḥ | syāma | duḥ-gahā ||8.43.30||

IAST: tarantaḥ syāma durgahā
Griffith: Pass lightly over all distress.
pada pāṭha: te | gha | it | agne | su-ādhyaḥ | ahā | viśvā | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ || tarantaḥ | syāma | duḥ-gahā ||8.43.30||

IAST: agnim mandram purupriyaṁ śīram pāvakaśociṣam
Griffith: We venerate with cheerful hearts the cheerful Agni, dear to all,
pada pāṭha: agnim | mandram | puru-priyam | śīram | pāvaka-śociṣam || hr̥t-bhiḥ | mandrebhiḥ | īmahe ||8.43.31||

IAST: hṛdbhir mandrebhir īmahe
Griffith: Burning, with purifying flame.
pada pāṭha: agnim | mandram | puru-priyam | śīram | pāvaka-śociṣam || hr̥t-bhiḥ | mandrebhiḥ | īmahe ||8.43.31||

IAST: sa tvam agne vibhāvasuḥ sṛjan sūryo na raśmibhiḥ
Griffith: So thou, O Agni rich in light, beaming like Surya with thy rays
Devanāgarī: स त्वमग्ने विभावसुः सृजन्सूर्यो न रश्मिभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | agne | vibhā-vasuḥ | sr̥jan | sūryaḥ | na | raśmi-bhiḥ || śardhan | tamāṁsi | jighnase ||8.43.32||

IAST: śardhan tamāṁsi jighnase
Griffith: Boldly demolishest the gloom,
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | agne | vibhā-vasuḥ | sr̥jan | sūryaḥ | na | raśmi-bhiḥ || śardhan | tamāṁsi | jighnase ||8.43.32||

IAST: tat te sahasva īmahe dātraṁ yan nopadasyati
Griffith: We pray to thee for this thy gift, Victor the gift that faileth not,
pada pāṭha: tat | te | sahasvaḥ | īmahe | dātram | yat | na | upa-dasyati || tvat | agne | vāryam | vasu ||8.43.33||

IAST: tvad agne vāryaṁ vasu
Griffith: O Agni, choicest wealth from thee.
pada pāṭha: tat | te | sahasvaḥ | īmahe | dātram | yat | na | upa-dasyati || tvat | agne | vāryam | vasu ||8.43.33||

IAST: samidhāgniṁ duvasyata ghṛtair bodhayatātithim
Griffith: PAY service unto Agni with your fuel, rouse your Guest with oil:
pada pāṭha: sam-idhā | agnim | duvasyata | ghr̥taiḥ | bodhayata | atithim || ā | asmin | havyā | juhotana ||8.44.1||

IAST: āsmin havyā juhotana
Griffith: In him present your offerings.
pada pāṭha: sam-idhā | agnim | duvasyata | ghr̥taiḥ | bodhayata | atithim || ā | asmin | havyā | juhotana ||8.44.1||

IAST: agne stomaṁ juṣasva me vardhasvānena manmanā
Griffith: Agni, do thou accept my laud, be magnified by this my song:
Devanāgarī: अग्ने स्तोमं जुषस्व मे वर्धस्वानेन मन्मना
pada pāṭha: agne | stomam | juṣasva | me | vardhasva | anena | manmanā || prati | su-uktāni | harya | naḥ ||8.44.2||

IAST: prati sūktāni harya naḥ
Griffith: Welcome my sweedy-spoken words.
pada pāṭha: agne | stomam | juṣasva | me | vardhasva | anena | manmanā || prati | su-uktāni | harya | naḥ ||8.44.2||

IAST: agniṁ dūtam puro dadhe havyavāham upa bruve
Griffith: Agni, envoy, I place in front; the oblation-bearer I address:
Devanāgarī: अग्निं दूतं पुरो दधे हव्यवाहमुप ब्रुवे
pada pāṭha: agnim | dūtam | puraḥ | dadhe | havya-vāham | upa | bruve || devān | ā | sādayāt | iha ||8.44.3||

IAST: devām̐ ā sādayād iha
Griffith: Here let him seat the Deities.
pada pāṭha: agnim | dūtam | puraḥ | dadhe | havya-vāham | upa | bruve || devān | ā | sādayāt | iha ||8.44.3||

IAST: ut te bṛhanto arcayaḥ samidhānasya dīdivaḥ
Griffith: Agni, the lofty flames of' thee enkindled have gone up on high,
pada pāṭha: ut | te | br̥hantaḥ | arcayaḥ | sam-idhānasya | dīdi-vaḥ || agne | śukrāsaḥ | īrate ||8.44.4||

IAST: agne śukrāsa īrate
Griffith: Thy bright flames, thou Refulgent One.
pada pāṭha: ut | te | br̥hantaḥ | arcayaḥ | sam-idhānasya | dīdi-vaḥ || agne | śukrāsaḥ | īrate ||8.44.4||

IAST: upa tvā juhvo mama ghṛtācīr yantu haryata
Griffith: Beloved! let my ladles full of sacred oil come near to thee:
Devanāgarī: उप त्वा जुह्वो मम घृताचीर्यन्तु हर्यत
pada pāṭha: upa | tvā | juhvaḥ | mama | ghr̥tācīḥ | yantu | haryata || agne | havyā | juṣasva | naḥ ||8.44.5||

IAST: agne havyā juṣasva naḥ
Griffith: Agni, accept our offerings.
pada pāṭha: upa | tvā | juhvaḥ | mama | ghr̥tācīḥ | yantu | haryata || agne | havyā | juṣasva | naḥ ||8.44.5||

IAST: mandraṁ hotāram ṛtvijaṁ citrabhānuṁ vibhāvasum
Griffith: I worship Agni-may he hear!-the cheerful, the Invoker, Priest,
pada pāṭha: mandram | hotāram | r̥tvijam | citra-bhānum | vibhā-vasum || agnim | īḷe | saḥ | ūm̐ iti | śravat ||8.44.6||

IAST: agnim īḻe sa u śravat
Griffith: Of varied splendour, rich in light.
pada pāṭha: mandram | hotāram | r̥tvijam | citra-bhānum | vibhā-vasum || agnim | īḷe | saḥ | ūm̐ iti | śravat ||8.44.6||

IAST: pratnaṁ hotāram īḍyaṁ juṣṭam agniṁ kavikratum
Griffith: Ancient Invoker, meet for praise, beloved Agni, wise and strong,
pada pāṭha: pratnam | hotāram | īḍyam | juṣṭam | agnim | kavi-kratum || adhvarāṇām | abhi-śriyam ||8.44.7||

IAST: adhvarāṇām abhiśriyam
Griffith: The visitant of solemn rites.
pada pāṭha: pratnam | hotāram | īḍyam | juṣṭam | agnim | kavi-kratum || adhvarāṇām | abhi-śriyam ||8.44.7||

IAST: juṣāṇo aṅgirastamemā havyāny ānuṣak
Griffith: Agni, best Angiras, accept straightway these offerings, and guide
pada pāṭha: juṣāṇaḥ | aṅgiraḥ-tama | imā | havyāni | ānuṣak || agne | yajñam | naya | r̥tu-thā ||8.44.8||

IAST: agne yajñaṁ naya ṛtuthā
Griffith: The seasonable sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: juṣāṇaḥ | aṅgiraḥ-tama | imā | havyāni | ānuṣak || agne | yajñam | naya | r̥tu-thā ||8.44.8||

IAST: samidhāna u santya śukraśoca ihā vaha
Griffith: Excellent God, with brilliant flames, enkindled bring thou hitherward,
Devanāgarī: समिधान उ सन्त्य शुक्रशोच इहा वह
pada pāṭha: sam-idhānaḥ | ūm̐ iti | santya | śukra-śoce | iha | ā | vaha || cikitvān | daivyam | janam ||8.44.9||

IAST: cikitvān daivyaṁ janam
Griffith: Knowing the way, the Heavenly Host.
pada pāṭha: sam-idhānaḥ | ūm̐ iti | santya | śukra-śoce | iha | ā | vaha || cikitvān | daivyam | janam ||8.44.9||

IAST: vipraṁ hotāram adruhaṁ dhūmaketuṁ vibhāvasum
Griffith: Him, Sage and Herald, void of guile, ensign of sacrifices, him
pada pāṭha: vipram | hotāram | adruham | dhūma-ketum | vibhā-vasum || yajñānām | ketum | īmahe ||8.44.10||

IAST: yajñānāṁ ketum īmahe
Griffith: Smoke-bannered, rich in light, we seek.
pada pāṭha: vipram | hotāram | adruham | dhūma-ketum | vibhā-vasum || yajñānām | ketum | īmahe ||8.44.10||

IAST: agne ni pāhi nas tvam prati ṣma deva rīṣataḥ
Griffith: O Agni, be our Guardian thou, God, against those who injure us:
Devanāgarī: अग्ने नि पाहि नस्त्वं प्रति ष्म देव रीषतः
pada pāṭha: agne | ni | pāhi | naḥ | tvam | prati | sma | deva | riṣataḥ || bhindhi | dveṣaḥ | sahaḥ-kr̥ta ||8.44.11||

IAST: bhindhi dveṣaḥ sahaskṛta
Griffith: Destroy our foes, thou Son of Strength.
pada pāṭha: agne | ni | pāhi | naḥ | tvam | prati | sma | deva | riṣataḥ || bhindhi | dveṣaḥ | sahaḥ-kr̥ta ||8.44.11||

IAST: agniḥ pratnena manmanā śumbhānas tanvaṁ svām
Griffith: Making his body beautiful, Agni the Sage hath waxen by
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | pratnena | manmanā | śumbhānaḥ | tanvam | svām || kaviḥ | vipreṇa | vavr̥dhe ||8.44.12||

IAST: kavir vipreṇa vāvṛdhe
Griffith: The singer and his ancient hymn.
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | pratnena | manmanā | śumbhānaḥ | tanvam | svām || kaviḥ | vipreṇa | vavr̥dhe ||8.44.12||

IAST: ūrjo napātam ā huve 'gnim pāvakaśociṣam
Griffith: I invocate the Child of Strength, Agni with purifying flame,
pada pāṭha: ūrjaḥ | napātam | ā | huve | agnim | pāvaka-śociṣam || asmin | yajñe | su-adhvare ||8.44.13||

IAST: asmin yajñe svadhvare
Griffith: At this well-ordered sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: ūrjaḥ | napātam | ā | huve | agnim | pāvaka-śociṣam || asmin | yajñe | su-adhvare ||8.44.13||

IAST: sa no mitramahas tvam agne śukreṇa śociṣā
Griffith: So Agni, rich in many friends, with fiery splendour, seat thyself
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | tvam | agne | śukreṇa | śociṣā || devaiḥ | ā | satsi | barhiṣi ||8.44.14||

IAST: devair ā satsi barhiṣi
Griffith: With Gods upon our sacred grass.
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | tvam | agne | śukreṇa | śociṣā || devaiḥ | ā | satsi | barhiṣi ||8.44.14||

IAST: yo agniṁ tanvo dame devam martaḥ saparyati
Griffith: The mortal man who serves the God Agni within his own abode,
Devanāgarī: यो अग्निं तन्वो दमे देवं मर्तः सपर्यति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | agnim | tanvaḥ | dame | devam | martaḥ | saparyati || tasmai | it | dīdayat | vasu ||8.44.15||

IAST: tasmā id dīdayad vasu
Griffith: For him he causes wealth to shine.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | agnim | tanvaḥ | dame | devam | martaḥ | saparyati || tasmai | it | dīdayat | vasu ||8.44.15||

IAST: agnir mūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam
Griffith: Agni is head and height of heaven, the Master of the earth is he:
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | mūrdhā | divaḥ | kakut | patiḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | ayam || apām | retāṁsi | jinvati ||8.44.16||

IAST: apāṁ retāṁsi jinvati
Griffith: He quickeneth the watere seed.
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | mūrdhā | divaḥ | kakut | patiḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | ayam || apām | retāṁsi | jinvati ||8.44.16||

IAST: ud agne śucayas tava śukrā bhrājanta īrate
Griffith: Upward, O Agni, rise thy flames, pure and resplendent, blazing high,
pada pāṭha: ut | agne | śucayaḥ | tava | śukrāḥ | bhrājantaḥ | īrate || tava | jyotīṁṣi | arcayaḥ ||8.44.17||

IAST: tava jyotīṁṣy arcayaḥ
Griffith: Thy lustres, fair effulgences.
pada pāṭha: ut | agne | śucayaḥ | tava | śukrāḥ | bhrājantaḥ | īrate || tava | jyotīṁṣi | arcayaḥ ||8.44.17||

IAST: īśiṣe vāryasya hi dātrasyāgne svarpatiḥ
Griffith: For, Agni, thou as Lord of Light rulest o'er choicest gifts: may I,
pada pāṭha: īśiṣe | vāryasya | hi | dātrasya | agne | svaḥ-patiḥ || stotā | syām | tava | śarmaṇi ||8.44.18||

IAST: stotā syāṁ tava śarmaṇi
Griffith: Thy singer, find defence in thee.
pada pāṭha: īśiṣe | vāryasya | hi | dātrasya | agne | svaḥ-patiḥ || stotā | syām | tava | śarmaṇi ||8.44.18||

IAST: tvām agne manīṣiṇas tvāṁ hinvanti cittibhiḥ
Griffith: O Agni, they who understand stir thee to action with their thoughts:
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | manīṣiṇaḥ | tvām | hinvanti | citti-bhiḥ || tvām | vardhantu | naḥ | giraḥ ||8.44.19||

IAST: tvāṁ vardhantu no giraḥ
Griffith: So let our songs enhance thy might.
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | manīṣiṇaḥ | tvām | hinvanti | citti-bhiḥ || tvām | vardhantu | naḥ | giraḥ ||8.44.19||

IAST: adabdhasya svadhāvato dūtasya rebhataḥ sadā
Griffith: We ever claim the friendship of Agni, the singing messenger,
pada pāṭha: adabdhasya | svadhā-vataḥ | dūtasya | rebhataḥ | sadā || agneḥ | sakhyam | vr̥ṇīmahe ||8.44.20||

IAST: agneḥ sakhyaṁ vṛṇīmahe
Griffith: Of God-like nature, void of guile.
pada pāṭha: adabdhasya | svadhā-vataḥ | dūtasya | rebhataḥ | sadā || agneḥ | sakhyam | vr̥ṇīmahe ||8.44.20||

IAST: agniḥ śucivratatamaḥ śucir vipraḥ śuciḥ kaviḥ
Griffith: Agni who bears most holy sway, the holy Singer, holy Sage,
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | śucivrata-tamaḥ | śuciḥ | vipraḥ | śuciḥ | kaviḥ || śuciḥ | rocate | ā-hutaḥ ||8.44.21||

IAST: śucī rocata āhutaḥ
Griffith: Shines holy when we worship him.
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | śucivrata-tamaḥ | śuciḥ | vipraḥ | śuciḥ | kaviḥ || śuciḥ | rocate | ā-hutaḥ ||8.44.21||

IAST: uta tvā dhītayo mama giro vardhantu viśvahā
Griffith: Yea, let my meditations, let my songs exalt thee evermore.
Devanāgarī: उत त्वा धीतयो मम गिरो वर्धन्तु विश्वहा
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | dhītayaḥ | mama | giraḥ | vr̥dhantu | visvahā || agne | sakhyasya | bodhi | naḥ ||8.44.22||

IAST: agne sakhyasya bodhi naḥ
Griffith: Think, Agni, of our friendly bond,
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | dhītayaḥ | mama | giraḥ | vr̥dhantu | visvahā || agne | sakhyasya | bodhi | naḥ ||8.44.22||

IAST: yad agne syām ahaṁ tvaṁ tvaṁ vā ghā syā aham
Griffith: If I were thou and thou wert I, O Agni, every prayer of thine
Devanāgarī: यदग्ने स्यामहं त्वं त्वं वा घा स्या अहम्
pada pāṭha: yat | agne | syām | aham | tvam | tvam | vā | gha | syāḥ | aham || syuḥ | te | satyāḥ | iha | ā-śiṣaḥ ||8.44.23||

IAST: syuṣ ṭe satyā ihāśiṣaḥ
Griffith: Should have its due fulfilment here.
pada pāṭha: yat | agne | syām | aham | tvam | tvam | vā | gha | syāḥ | aham || syuḥ | te | satyāḥ | iha | ā-śiṣaḥ ||8.44.23||

IAST: vasur vasupatir hi kam asy agne vibhāvasuḥ
Griffith: For Excellent and Lord of wealth. art thou O Agni, rich in light:
pada pāṭha: vasuḥ | vasu-patiḥ | hi | kam | asi | agne | vibhā-vasuḥ || syāma | te | su-matau | api ||8.44.24||

IAST: syāma te sumatāv api
Griffith: May we enjoy thy favouring grace.
pada pāṭha: vasuḥ | vasu-patiḥ | hi | kam | asi | agne | vibhā-vasuḥ || syāma | te | su-matau | api ||8.44.24||

IAST: agne dhṛtavratāya te samudrāyeva sindhavaḥ
Griffith: Agni, to thee whose laws stand fast our resonant songs of praise speed forth,
pada pāṭha: agne | dhr̥ta-vratāya | te | samudrāya-iva | sindhavaḥ || giraḥ | vāśrāsaḥ | īrate ||8.44.25||

IAST: giro vāśrāsa īrate
Griffith: As rivers hasten to the sea.
pada pāṭha: agne | dhr̥ta-vratāya | te | samudrāya-iva | sindhavaḥ || giraḥ | vāśrāsaḥ | īrate ||8.44.25||

IAST: yuvānaṁ viśpatiṁ kaviṁ viśvādam puruvepasam
Griffith: Agni, the Youthful Lord of men, who stirreth much and eateth all,
pada pāṭha: yuvānam | viśpatim | kavim | viśva-adam | puru-vepasam || agnim | śumbhāmi | manma-bhiḥ ||8.44.26||

IAST: agniṁ śumbhāmi manmabhiḥ
Griffith: The Sage, I glorify with hymns.
pada pāṭha: yuvānam | viśpatim | kavim | viśva-adam | puru-vepasam || agnim | śumbhāmi | manma-bhiḥ ||8.44.26||

IAST: yajñānāṁ rathye vayaṁ tigmajambhāya vīḻave
Griffith: To Agni let us haste with lauds, the Guide of sacrificial rites,
pada pāṭha: yajñānām | rathye | vayam | tigma-jambhāya | vīḷave || stomaiḥ | iṣema | agnaye ||8.44.27||

IAST: stomair iṣemāgnaye
Griffith: Armed with sharp teeth, the Mighty One.
pada pāṭha: yajñānām | rathye | vayam | tigma-jambhāya | vīḷave || stomaiḥ | iṣema | agnaye ||8.44.27||

IAST: ayam agne tve api jaritā bhūtu santya
Griffith: And let this man, good Agni, be with thee the singer of thy praise:
Devanāgarī: अयमग्ने त्वे अपि जरिता भूतु सन्त्य
pada pāṭha: ayam | agne | tve iti | api | jaritā | bhūtu | santya || tasmai | pāvaka | mr̥ḷaya ||8.44.28||

IAST: tasmai pāvaka mṛḻaya
Griffith: Be gracious, Holy One, to him.
pada pāṭha: ayam | agne | tve iti | api | jaritā | bhūtu | santya || tasmai | pāvaka | mr̥ḷaya ||8.44.28||

IAST: dhīro hy asy admasad vipro na jāgṛviḥ sadā
Griffith: For thou art sharer of our feast, wise, ever watchful as a Sage:
pada pāṭha: dhīraḥ | hi | asi | adma-sat | vipraḥ | na | jāgr̥viḥ | sadā || agne | dīdayasi | dyavi ||8.44.29||

IAST: agne dīdayasi dyavi
Griffith: Agni, thou shinest in the sky.
pada pāṭha: dhīraḥ | hi | asi | adma-sat | vipraḥ | na | jāgr̥viḥ | sadā || agne | dīdayasi | dyavi ||8.44.29||

IAST: purāgne duritebhyaḥ purā mṛdhrebhyaḥ kave
Griffith: O Agni, Sage, before our foes, before misfortunes fall on us,
pada pāṭha: purā | agne | duḥ-itebhyaḥ | purā | mr̥dhrebhyaḥ | kave || pra | naḥ | āyuḥ | vaso iti | tira ||8.44.30||

IAST: pra ṇa āyur vaso tira
Griffith: Excellent Lord, prolong our lives.
pada pāṭha: purā | agne | duḥ-itebhyaḥ | purā | mr̥dhrebhyaḥ | kave || pra | naḥ | āyuḥ | vaso iti | tira ||8.44.30||

IAST: ā ghā ye agnim indhate stṛṇanti barhir ānuṣak
Griffith: HITHERWARD! they who light flame and straightway trim the sacred grass.
Devanāgarī: आ घा ये अग्निमिन्धते स्तृणन्ति बर्हिरानुषक्
pada pāṭha: ā | gha | ye | agnim | indhate | str̥ṇanti | barhiḥ | ānuṣak || yeṣām | indraḥ | yuvā | sakhā ||8.45.1||

IAST: yeṣām indro yuvā sakhā
Griffith: Whose Friend is Indra ever young.
pada pāṭha: ā | gha | ye | agnim | indhate | str̥ṇanti | barhiḥ | ānuṣak || yeṣām | indraḥ | yuvā | sakhā ||8.45.1||

IAST: bṛhann id idhma eṣām bhūri śastam pṛthuḥ svaruḥ
Griffith: High is their fuel, great their laud, wide is their splinter from the stake,
Devanāgarī: बृहन्निदिध्म एषां भूरि शस्तं पृथुः स्वरुः
pada pāṭha: br̥han | it | idhmaḥ | eṣām | bhūri | śastam | pr̥thuḥ | svaruḥ || yeṣām | indraḥ | yuvā | sakhā ||8.45.2||

IAST: yeṣām indro yuvā sakhā
Griffith: Whose Friend is Indra ever young.
pada pāṭha: br̥han | it | idhmaḥ | eṣām | bhūri | śastam | pr̥thuḥ | svaruḥ || yeṣām | indraḥ | yuvā | sakhā ||8.45.2||

IAST: ayuddha id yudhā vṛtaṁ śūra ājati satvabhiḥ
Griffith: Unequelled in fight the hero leads his army with the warrior chiefs.
Devanāgarī: अयुद्ध इद्युधा वृतं शूर आजति सत्वभिः
pada pāṭha: ayuddhaḥ | it | yudhā | vr̥tam | śūraḥ | ā | ajati | satva-bhiḥ || yeṣām | indraḥ | yuvā | sakhā ||8.45.3||

IAST: yeṣām indro yuvā sakhā
Griffith: Whose Friend is Indra ever young.
pada pāṭha: ayuddhaḥ | it | yudhā | vr̥tam | śūraḥ | ā | ajati | satva-bhiḥ || yeṣām | indraḥ | yuvā | sakhā ||8.45.3||

IAST: ā bundaṁ vṛtrahā dade jātaḥ pṛcchad vi mātaram
Griffith: The new-born Vrtra-slayer asked his Mother, as he seized his shaft,
Devanāgarī: आ बुन्दं वृत्रहा ददे जातः पृच्छद्वि मातरम्
pada pāṭha: ā | bundam | vr̥tra-hā | dade | jātaḥ | pr̥cchat | vi | mātaram || ke | ugrāḥ | ke | ha | śr̥ṇvire ||8.45.4||

IAST: ka ugrāḥ ke ha śṛṇvire
Griffith: Who are the fierce? Who are renowned?
pada pāṭha: ā | bundam | vr̥tra-hā | dade | jātaḥ | pr̥cchat | vi | mātaram || ke | ugrāḥ | ke | ha | śr̥ṇvire ||8.45.4||

IAST: prati tvā śavasī vadad girāv apso na yodhiṣat
Griffith: Savasi answered, He who seeks thine enmity will battle like
Devanāgarī: प्रति त्वा शवसी वदद्गिरावप्सो न योधिषत्
pada pāṭha: prati | tvā | śavasī | vadat | girau | apsaḥ | na | yodhiṣat || yaḥ | te | śatru-tvam | ā-cake ||8.45.5||

IAST: yas te śatrutvam ācake
Griffith: A stately elephant on a hill.
pada pāṭha: prati | tvā | śavasī | vadat | girau | apsaḥ | na | yodhiṣat || yaḥ | te | śatru-tvam | ā-cake ||8.45.5||

IAST: uta tvam maghavañ chṛṇu yas te vaṣṭi vavakṣi tat
Griffith: And hear, O Maghavan; to him who craves of thee thou grantest all
Devanāgarī: उत त्वं मघवञ्छृणु यस्ते वष्टि ववक्षि तत्
pada pāṭha: uta | tvam | magha-van | śr̥ṇu | yaḥ | te | vaṣṭi | vavakṣi | tat || yat | vīḷayāsi | vīḷu | tat ||8.45.6||

IAST: yad vīḻayāsi vīḻu tat
Griffith: Whate'er thou makest firm is firm.
pada pāṭha: uta | tvam | magha-van | śr̥ṇu | yaḥ | te | vaṣṭi | vavakṣi | tat || yat | vīḷayāsi | vīḷu | tat ||8.45.6||

IAST: yad ājiṁ yāty ājikṛd indraḥ svaśvayur upa
Griffith: What time the Warrior Indra goes to battle, borne by noble steeds,
pada pāṭha: yat | ājim | yāti | āji-kr̥t | indraḥ | svaśva-yuḥ | upa || rathi-tamaḥ | rathīnām ||8.45.7||

IAST: rathītamo rathīnām
Griffith: Best of all charioteers is he.
pada pāṭha: yat | ājim | yāti | āji-kr̥t | indraḥ | svaśva-yuḥ | upa || rathi-tamaḥ | rathīnām ||8.45.7||

IAST: vi ṣu viśvā abhiyujo vajrin viṣvag yathā vṛha
Griffith: Repel, O Thunder-armed, in all directions all attacks on us:
Devanāgarī: वि षु विश्वा अभियुजो वज्रिन्विष्वग्यथा वृह
pada pāṭha: vi | su | viśvāḥ | abhi-yujaḥ | vajrin | viṣvak | yathā | vr̥ha || bhava | naḥ | suśravaḥ-tamaḥ ||8.45.8||

IAST: bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ
Griffith: And be our own most glorious God.
pada pāṭha: vi | su | viśvāḥ | abhi-yujaḥ | vajrin | viṣvak | yathā | vr̥ha || bhava | naḥ | suśravaḥ-tamaḥ ||8.45.8||

IAST: asmākaṁ su ratham pura indraḥ kṛṇotu sātaye
Griffith: May Indra set our car in front, in foremost Place to win the spoil,
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं सु रथं पुर इन्द्रः कृणोतु सातये
pada pāṭha: asmākam | su | ratham | puraḥ | indraḥ | kr̥ṇotu | sātaye || na | yam | dhūrvanti | dhūrtayaḥ ||8.45.9||

IAST: na yaṁ dhūrvanti dhūrtayaḥ
Griffith: He whom the wicked injure not.
pada pāṭha: asmākam | su | ratham | puraḥ | indraḥ | kr̥ṇotu | sātaye || na | yam | dhūrvanti | dhūrtayaḥ ||8.45.9||

IAST: vṛjyāma te pari dviṣo 'raṁ te śakra dāvane
Griffith: Thine enmity may we escape, and, gakra, for thy bounty, rich
Devanāgarī: वृज्याम ते परि द्विषोऽरं ते शक्र दावने
pada pāṭha: vr̥jyāma | te | pari | dviṣaḥ | aram | te | śakra | dāvane || gamema | it | indra | go-mataḥ ||8.45.10||

IAST: gamemed indra gomataḥ
Griffith: In kine, may we come near to thee
pada pāṭha: vr̥jyāma | te | pari | dviṣaḥ | aram | te | śakra | dāvane || gamema | it | indra | go-mataḥ ||8.45.10||

IAST: śanaiś cid yanto adrivo 'śvāvantaḥ śatagvinaḥ
Griffith: Softly approaching, Thunder-armed wealthy by hundreds, rich in steeds,
pada pāṭha: śanaiḥ | cit | yantaḥ | adri-vaḥ | aśva-vantaḥ | śata-gvinaḥ || vivakṣaṇāḥ | anehasaḥ ||8.45.11||

IAST: vivakṣaṇā anehasaḥ
Griffith: Unrivalled, readywith our gifts.
pada pāṭha: śanaiḥ | cit | yantaḥ | adri-vaḥ | aśva-vantaḥ | śata-gvinaḥ || vivakṣaṇāḥ | anehasaḥ ||8.45.11||

IAST: ūrdhvā hi te dive-dive sahasrā sūnṛtā śatā
Griffith: For thine exalted excellence gives to thy worshippers each day
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वा हि ते दिवेदिवे सहस्रा सूनृता शता
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvā | hi | te | dive-dive | sahasrā | sūnr̥tā | śatā || jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | vi-maṁhate ||8.45.12||

IAST: jaritṛbhyo vimaṁhate
Griffith: Hundreds and thousands of thy boons.
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvā | hi | te | dive-dive | sahasrā | sūnr̥tā | śatā || jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | vi-maṁhate ||8.45.12||

IAST: vidmā hi tvā dhanaṁjayam indra dṛḻhā cid ārujam
Griffith: Indra, we know thee breaker-down even of trong forts, winner of spoil,
Devanāgarī: विद्मा हि त्वा धनंजयमिन्द्र दृळ्हा चिदारुजम्
pada pāṭha: vidma | hi | tvā | dhanam-jayam | indra | dr̥ḷhā | cit | ā-rujam || ādāriṇam | yathā | gayam ||8.45.13||

IAST: ādāriṇaṁ yathā gayam
Griffith: A:one who conquers wealth for us.
pada pāṭha: vidma | hi | tvā | dhanam-jayam | indra | dr̥ḷhā | cit | ā-rujam || ādāriṇam | yathā | gayam ||8.45.13||

IAST: kakuhaṁ cit tvā kave mandantu dhṛṣṇav indavaḥ
Griffith: Though thou art highest, Sage and Bold let the drops cheer thee when we come
pada pāṭha: kakuham | cit | tvā | kave | mandantu | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | indavaḥ || ā | tvā | paṇim | yat | īmahe ||8.45.14||

IAST: ā tvā paṇiṁ yad īmahe
Griffith: To thee as to a trafficker.
pada pāṭha: kakuham | cit | tvā | kave | mandantu | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | indavaḥ || ā | tvā | paṇim | yat | īmahe ||8.45.14||

IAST: yas te revām̐ adāśuriḥ pramamarṣa maghattaye
Griffith: Bring unto us the treasure of the opulent man who, loth to give,
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | revān | adāśuriḥ | pra-mamarṣa | maghattaye || tasya | naḥ | vedaḥ | ā | bhara ||8.45.15||

IAST: tasya no veda ā bhara
Griffith: Hath slighted thee for gain of wealth.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | revān | adāśuriḥ | pra-mamarṣa | maghattaye || tasya | naḥ | vedaḥ | ā | bhara ||8.45.15||

IAST: ima u tvā vi cakṣate sakhāya indra sominaḥ
Griffith: Indra, these friends of ours, supplied with Soma, wait and look to thee,
Devanāgarī: इम उ त्वा वि चक्षते सखाय इन्द्र सोमिनः
pada pāṭha: ime | ūm̐ iti | tvā | vi | cakṣate | sakhāyaḥ | indra | sominaḥ || puṣṭa-vantaḥ | yathā | paśum ||8.45.16||

IAST: puṣṭāvanto yathā paśum
Griffith: As men with fodder to the herd.
pada pāṭha: ime | ūm̐ iti | tvā | vi | cakṣate | sakhāyaḥ | indra | sominaḥ || puṣṭa-vantaḥ | yathā | paśum ||8.45.16||

IAST: uta tvābadhiraṁ vayaṁ śrutkarṇaṁ santam ūtaye
Griffith: And thee who art not deaf, whose cars are quick to listen, for our aid,
