pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | abadhiram | vayam | śrut-karṇam | santam | ūtaye || dūrāt | iha | havāmahe ||8.45.17||

IAST: dūrād iha havāmahe
Griffith: We call to us from far away.
pada pāṭha: uta | tvā | abadhiram | vayam | śrut-karṇam | santam | ūtaye || dūrāt | iha | havāmahe ||8.45.17||

IAST: yac chuśrūyā imaṁ havaṁ durmarṣaṁ cakriyā uta
Griffith: When thou hast listened, make our call one which thou never wilt forget,
Devanāgarī: यच्छुश्रूया इमं हवं दुर्मर्षं चक्रिया उत
pada pāṭha: yat | śuśrūyāḥ | imam | havam | duḥ-marṣam | cakriyāḥ | uta || bhaveḥ | āpiḥ | naḥ | antamaḥ ||8.45.18||

IAST: bhaver āpir no antamaḥ
Griffith: And be our very nearest Friend.
pada pāṭha: yat | śuśrūyāḥ | imam | havam | duḥ-marṣam | cakriyāḥ | uta || bhaveḥ | āpiḥ | naḥ | antamaḥ ||8.45.18||

IAST: yac cid dhi te api vyathir jaganvāṁso amanmahi
Griffith: When even now, when we have been in trouble, we have thought of thee,
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | te | api | vyathiḥ | jaganvāṁsaḥ | amanmahi || go-dāḥ | it | indra | bodhi | naḥ ||8.45.19||

IAST: godā id indra bodhi naḥ
Griffith: O Indra, give us gifts of kine.
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | te | api | vyathiḥ | jaganvāṁsaḥ | amanmahi || go-dāḥ | it | indra | bodhi | naḥ ||8.45.19||

IAST: ā tvā rambhaṁ na jivrayo rarabhmā śavasas pate
Griffith: O Lord of Strength, we rest on thee, as old men rest upon a staff:
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा रम्भं न जिव्रयो ररभ्मा शवसस्पते
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | rambham | na | jivrayaḥ | rarabhma | śavasaḥ | pate || uśmasi | tvā | sadha-sthe | ā ||8.45.20||

IAST: uśmasi tvā sadhastha ā
Griffith: We long to have. thee dwell with us.
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | rambham | na | jivrayaḥ | rarabhma | śavasaḥ | pate || uśmasi | tvā | sadha-sthe | ā ||8.45.20||

IAST: stotram indrāya gāyata purunṛmṇāya satvane
Griffith: To Indra sing a song of praise, Hero of mighty valour, him
pada pāṭha: stotram | indrāya | gāyata | puru-nr̥mṇāya | satvane || nakiḥ | yam | vr̥ṇvate | yudhi ||8.45.21||

IAST: nakir yaṁ vṛṇvate yudhi
Griffith: Whom no one challenges to war.
pada pāṭha: stotram | indrāya | gāyata | puru-nr̥mṇāya | satvane || nakiḥ | yam | vr̥ṇvate | yudhi ||8.45.21||

IAST: abhi tvā vṛṣabhā sute sutaṁ sṛjāmi pītaye
Griffith: Hero, the Soma being shed, I pour the juice for thee to drink:
Devanāgarī: अभि त्वा वृषभा सुते सुतं सृजामि पीतये
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | vr̥ṣabha | sute | sutam | sr̥jāmi | pītaye || tr̥mpa | vi | aśnuhi | madam ||8.45.22||

IAST: tṛmpā vy aśnuhī madam
Griffith: Sate thee and finish thy carouse.
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | vr̥ṣabha | sute | sutam | sr̥jāmi | pītaye || tr̥mpa | vi | aśnuhi | madam ||8.45.22||

IAST: mā tvā mūrā aviṣyavo mopahasvāna ā dabhan
Griffith: Let not the fools, or those who mock beguile thee when they seek thine aid
Devanāgarī: मा त्वा मूरा अविष्यवो मोपहस्वान आ दभन्
pada pāṭha: mā | tvā | mūrāḥ | aviṣyavaḥ | mā | upa-hasvānaḥ | ā | dabhan || mākīm | brahma-dviṣaḥ | vanaḥ ||8.45.23||

IAST: mākīm brahmadviṣo vanaḥ
Griffith: Love not the enemies of prayer.
pada pāṭha: mā | tvā | mūrāḥ | aviṣyavaḥ | mā | upa-hasvānaḥ | ā | dabhan || mākīm | brahma-dviṣaḥ | vanaḥ ||8.45.23||

IAST: iha tvā goparīṇasā mahe mandantu rādhase
Griffith: Here let them with rich milky draught cheer thee to great munificence:
Devanāgarī: इह त्वा गोपरीणसा महे मन्दन्तु राधसे
pada pāṭha: iha | tvā | go-parīṇasā | mahe | mandantu | rādhase || saraḥ | gauraḥ | yathā | piba ||8.45.24||

IAST: saro gauro yathā piba
Griffith: Drink as the wild-bull drinks the lake.
pada pāṭha: iha | tvā | go-parīṇasā | mahe | mandantu | rādhase || saraḥ | gauraḥ | yathā | piba ||8.45.24||

IAST: yā vṛtrahā parāvati sanā navā ca cucyuve
Griffith: Proclaim in our assemblies what deeds, new and ancient, far away,
Devanāgarī: या वृत्रहा परावति सना नवा च चुच्युवे
pada pāṭha: yā | vr̥tra-hā | parā-vati | sanā | navā | ca | cucyuve || tā | saṁsat-su | pra | vocata ||8.45.25||

IAST: tā saṁsatsu pra vocata
Griffith: The Vrtra-slayer hath achieved.
pada pāṭha: yā | vr̥tra-hā | parā-vati | sanā | navā | ca | cucyuve || tā | saṁsat-su | pra | vocata ||8.45.25||

IAST: apibat kadruvaḥ sutam indraḥ sahasrabāhve
Griffith: In battle of a thousand arms Indra drank Kadru's Soma juice:
pada pāṭha: apibat | kadruvaḥ | sutam | indraḥ | sahasra-bāhve || atra | adediṣṭa | pauṁsyam ||8.45.26||

IAST: atrādediṣṭa pauṁsyam
Griffith: There he displayed his manly might.
pada pāṭha: apibat | kadruvaḥ | sutam | indraḥ | sahasra-bāhve || atra | adediṣṭa | pauṁsyam ||8.45.26||

IAST: satyaṁ tat turvaśe yadau vidāno ahnavāyyam
Griffith: True undeniabIc strength he found in Yadu and in Turvasa,
pada pāṭha: satyam | tat | turvaśe | yadau | vidānaḥ | ahnavāyyam || vi | ānaṭ | turvaṇe | śami ||8.45.27||

IAST: vy ānaṭ turvaṇe śami
Griffith: And conquered through the sacrifice.
pada pāṭha: satyam | tat | turvaśe | yadau | vidānaḥ | ahnavāyyam || vi | ānaṭ | turvaṇe | śami ||8.45.27||

IAST: taraṇiṁ vo janānāṁ tradaṁ vājasya gomataḥ
Griffith: Him have I magnified, our Lord in, common, Guardian of your folk,
Devanāgarī: तरणिं वो जनानां त्रदं वाजस्य गोमतः
pada pāṭha: taraṇim | vaḥ | janānām | tradam | vājasya | go-mataḥ || samānam | ūm̐ iti | pra | śaṁsiṣam ||8.45.28||

IAST: samānam u pra śaṁsiṣam
Griffith: Discloser of great wealth in kine;
pada pāṭha: taraṇim | vaḥ | janānām | tradam | vājasya | go-mataḥ || samānam | ūm̐ iti | pra | śaṁsiṣam ||8.45.28||

IAST: ṛbhukṣaṇaṁ na vartava uktheṣu tugryāvṛdham
Griffith: Rbhuksan, not to be restrained, who strengthened Tugra's son in lauds,
pada pāṭha: r̥bhukṣaṇam | na | vartave | uktheṣu | tugrya-vr̥dham || indram | some | sacā | sute ||8.45.29||

IAST: indraṁ some sacā sute
Griffith: Indra beside the flowingjuice;
pada pāṭha: r̥bhukṣaṇam | na | vartave | uktheṣu | tugrya-vr̥dham || indram | some | sacā | sute ||8.45.29||

IAST: yaḥ kṛntad id vi yonyaṁ triśokāya girim pṛthum
Griffith: Who for Trisoka clave the hill that formed a wide receptacle,
Devanāgarī: यः कृन्तदिद्वि योन्यं त्रिशोकाय गिरिं पृथुम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | kr̥ntat | it | vi | yonyam | tri-śokāya | girim | pr̥thum || go-bhyaḥ | gātum | niḥ-etave ||8.45.30||

IAST: gobhyo gātuṁ niretave
Griffith: So that the cows might issue forth.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | kr̥ntat | it | vi | yonyam | tri-śokāya | girim | pr̥thum || go-bhyaḥ | gātum | niḥ-etave ||8.45.30||

IAST: yad dadhiṣe manasyasi mandānaḥ pred iyakṣasi
Griffith: Whate'er thy plan or purpose be, whate'er, in transport, thou wouldst do,
pada pāṭha: yat | dadhiṣe | manasyasi | mandānaḥ | pra | it | iyakṣasi || mā | tat | kaḥ | indra | mr̥ḷaya ||8.45.31||

IAST: mā tat kar indra mṛḻaya
Griffith: Do it not, Indra, but be kind.
pada pāṭha: yat | dadhiṣe | manasyasi | mandānaḥ | pra | it | iyakṣasi || mā | tat | kaḥ | indra | mr̥ḷaya ||8.45.31||

IAST: dabhraṁ cid dhi tvāvataḥ kṛtaṁ śṛṇve adhi kṣami
Griffith: But little hath been heard of done upon the earth by one like thee i
Devanāgarī: दभ्रं चिद्धि त्वावतः कृतं शृण्वे अधि क्षमि
pada pāṭha: dabhram | cit | hi | tvā-vataḥ | kr̥tam | śr̥ṇve | adhi | kṣami || jigātu | indra | te | manaḥ ||8.45.32||

IAST: jigātv indra te manaḥ
Griffith: Let thine heart, Indra, turn to us.
pada pāṭha: dabhram | cit | hi | tvā-vataḥ | kr̥tam | śr̥ṇve | adhi | kṣami || jigātu | indra | te | manaḥ ||8.45.32||

IAST: taved u tāḥ sukīrtayo 'sann uta praśastayaḥ
Griffith: Thine then shall be this high renown, thine shall these lofty praises be,
pada pāṭha: tava | it | ūm̐ iti | tāḥ | su-kīrtayaḥ | asan | uta | pra-śastayaḥ || yat | indra | mr̥ḷayāsi | naḥ ||8.45.33||

IAST: yad indra mṛḻayāsi naḥ
Griffith: When, Indra, thou art kind to us.
pada pāṭha: tava | it | ūm̐ iti | tāḥ | su-kīrtayaḥ | asan | uta | pra-śastayaḥ || yat | indra | mr̥ḷayāsi | naḥ ||8.45.33||

IAST: mā na ekasminn āgasi mā dvayor uta triṣu
Griffith: Not for one trespass, not for two, O Hero, slay us, nor for three,
Devanāgarī: मा न एकस्मिन्नागसि मा द्वयोरुत त्रिषु
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | ekasmin | āgasi | mā | dvayoḥ | uta | triṣu || vadhīḥ | mā | śūra | bhūriṣu ||8.45.34||

IAST: vadhīr mā śūra bhūriṣu
Griffith: Nor yet for many trespasses.
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | ekasmin | āgasi | mā | dvayoḥ | uta | triṣu || vadhīḥ | mā | śūra | bhūriṣu ||8.45.34||

IAST: bibhayā hi tvāvata ugrād abhiprabhaṅgiṇaḥ
Griffith: I fear one powerful like thee, the crusherdown of enemies,
pada pāṭha: bibhaya | hi | tvā-vataḥ | ugrāt | abhi-prabhaṅginaḥ || dasmāt | aham | r̥ti-sahaḥ ||8.45.35||

IAST: dasmād aham ṛtīṣahaḥ
Griffith: Mighty, repelling all attacks.
pada pāṭha: bibhaya | hi | tvā-vataḥ | ugrāt | abhi-prabhaṅginaḥ || dasmāt | aham | r̥ti-sahaḥ ||8.45.35||

IAST: mā sakhyuḥ śūnam ā vide mā putrasya prabhūvaso
Griffith: O wealthy God, ne'er may I live to see my friend or son in need*:
Devanāgarī: मा सख्युः शूनमा विदे मा पुत्रस्य प्रभूवसो
pada pāṭha: mā | sakhyuḥ | śūnam | ā | vide | mā | putrasya | prabhuvaso iti prabhu-vaso || ā-vr̥tvat | bhūtu | te | manaḥ ||8.45.36||

IAST: āvṛtvad bhūtu te manaḥ
Griffith: Hitherward let thy heart be turned.
pada pāṭha: mā | sakhyuḥ | śūnam | ā | vide | mā | putrasya | prabhuvaso iti prabhu-vaso || ā-vr̥tvat | bhūtu | te | manaḥ ||8.45.36||

IAST: ko nu maryā amithitaḥ sakhā sakhāyam abravīt
Griffith: What friend, O people, unprovoked, hath ever said unto a friend,
Devanāgarī: को नु मर्या अमिथितः सखा सखायमब्रवीत्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | nu | maryāḥ | amithitaḥ | sakhā | sakhāyam | abravīt || jahā | kaḥ | asmat | īṣate ||8.45.37||

IAST: jahā ko asmad īṣate
Griffith: He turns and leaves us in distress?
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | nu | maryāḥ | amithitaḥ | sakhā | sakhāyam | abravīt || jahā | kaḥ | asmat | īṣate ||8.45.37||

IAST: evāre vṛṣabhā sute 'sinvan bhūry āvayaḥ
Griffith: Hero, insatiate enjoy this Soma juice so near to thee,
pada pāṭha: evāre | vr̥ṣabha | sute | asinvan | bhūri | āvayaḥ || śvaghnī-iva | ni-vatā | caran ||8.45.38||

IAST: śvaghnīva nivatā caran
Griffith: Even as a hunter rushing down.
pada pāṭha: evāre | vr̥ṣabha | sute | asinvan | bhūri | āvayaḥ || śvaghnī-iva | ni-vatā | caran ||8.45.38||

IAST: ā ta etā vacoyujā harī gṛbhṇe sumadrathā
Griffith: Hither I draw those Bays of thine yoked by our hymn, with splendid car,
Devanāgarī: आ त एता वचोयुजा हरी गृभ्णे सुमद्रथा
pada pāṭha: ā | te | etā | vacaḥ-yujā | harī iti | gr̥bhṇe | samat-rathā || yat | īm | brahma-bhyaḥ | it | dadaḥ ||8.45.39||

IAST: yad īm brahmabhya id dadaḥ
Griffith: That thou mayst give unto the priests.
pada pāṭha: ā | te | etā | vacaḥ-yujā | harī iti | gr̥bhṇe | samat-rathā || yat | īm | brahma-bhyaḥ | it | dadaḥ ||8.45.39||

IAST: bhindhi viśvā apa dviṣaḥ pari bādho jahī mṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Drive all our enemies away, smite down the foes who press around,
Devanāgarī: भिन्धि विश्वा अप द्विषः परि बाधो जही मृधः
pada pāṭha: bhindhi | viśvāḥ | apa | dviṣaḥ | pari | bādhaḥ | jahi | mr̥dhaḥ || vasu | spārham | tat | ā | bhara ||8.45.40||

IAST: vasu spārhaṁ tad ā bhara
Griffith: And bring the wealth for which we long:
pada pāṭha: bhindhi | viśvāḥ | apa | dviṣaḥ | pari | bādhaḥ | jahi | mr̥dhaḥ || vasu | spārham | tat | ā | bhara ||8.45.40||

IAST: yad vīḻāv indra yat sthire yat parśāne parābhṛtam
Griffith: O Tndra, that which is concealed in strong firm place precipitous:
pada pāṭha: yat | vīḷau | indra | yat | sthire | yat | parśāne | parā-bhr̥tam || vasu | spārham | tat | ā | bhara ||8.45.41||

IAST: vasu spārhaṁ tad ā bhara
Griffith: Bring us the wealth for which we long
pada pāṭha: yat | vīḷau | indra | yat | sthire | yat | parśāne | parā-bhr̥tam || vasu | spārham | tat | ā | bhara ||8.45.41||

IAST: yasya te viśvamānuṣo bhūrer dattasya vedati
Griffith: Great riches which the world of men shall recognize as sent by thbe:
pada pāṭha: yasya | te | viśva-mānuṣaḥ | bhūreḥ | dattasya | vedati || vasu | spārham | tat | ā | bhara ||8.45.42||

IAST: vasu spārhaṁ tad ā bhara
Griffith: Bring us the wealth for which we long.
pada pāṭha: yasya | te | viśva-mānuṣaḥ | bhūreḥ | dattasya | vedati || vasu | spārham | tat | ā | bhara ||8.45.42||

IAST: tvāvataḥ purūvaso vayam indra praṇetaḥ
Griffith: WE, Indra, Lord of ample wealth, our Guide, depend on one like thee,
pada pāṭha: tvā-vataḥ | puruvaso iti puru-vaso | vayam | indra | pranetariti pra-netaḥ || smasi | sthātaḥ | harīṇām ||8.46.1||

IAST: smasi sthātar harīṇām
Griffith: Thou driver of the Tawny Steeds.
pada pāṭha: tvā-vataḥ | puruvaso iti puru-vaso | vayam | indra | pranetariti pra-netaḥ || smasi | sthātaḥ | harīṇām ||8.46.1||

IAST: tvāṁ hi satyam adrivo vidma dātāram iṣām
Griffith: For, Hurler of the Bolt, we know thee true, the giver of our food,
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | satyam | adri-vaḥ | vidma | dātāram | iṣām || vidma | dātāram | rayīṇām ||8.46.2||

IAST: vidma dātāraṁ rayīṇām
Griffith: We know the giver of our wealth.
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | satyam | adri-vaḥ | vidma | dātāram | iṣām || vidma | dātāram | rayīṇām ||8.46.2||

IAST: ā yasya te mahimānaṁ śatamūte śatakrato
Griffith: O thou whose majesty the bards celebrate with their songs, thou Lord,
Devanāgarī: आ यस्य ते महिमानं शतमूते शतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: ā | yasya | te | mahimānam | śatam-ūte | śatakrato iti śata-krato || gīḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇanti | kāravaḥ ||8.46.3||

IAST: gīrbhir gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
Griffith: Of hundred powers and hundred aids.
pada pāṭha: ā | yasya | te | mahimānam | śatam-ūte | śatakrato iti śata-krato || gīḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇanti | kāravaḥ ||8.46.3||

IAST: sunītho ghā sa martyo yam maruto yam aryamā
Griffith: Fair guidance hath the mortal man whom Aryaman, the Marut host,
Devanāgarī: सुनीथो घा स मर्त्यो यं मरुतो यमर्यमा
pada pāṭha: su-nīthaḥ | gha | saḥ | martyaḥ | yam | marutaḥ | yam | aryamā || mitraḥ | pānti | adruhaḥ ||8.46.4||

IAST: mitraḥ pānty adruhaḥ
Griffith: And Mitra, void of guile, protect.
pada pāṭha: su-nīthaḥ | gha | saḥ | martyaḥ | yam | marutaḥ | yam | aryamā || mitraḥ | pānti | adruhaḥ ||8.46.4||

IAST: dadhāno gomad aśvavat suvīryam ādityajūta edhate
Griffith: Kine, steeds, and hero strength he gains, and prospers, by the Adityas sped,
pada pāṭha: dadhānaḥ | go-mat | aśva-vat | su-vīryam | āditya-jūtaḥ | edhate || sadā | rāyā | puru-spr̥hā ||8.46.5||

IAST: sadā rāyā puruspṛhā
Griffith: Ever in wealth which all desire.
pada pāṭha: dadhānaḥ | go-mat | aśva-vat | su-vīryam | āditya-jūtaḥ | edhate || sadā | rāyā | puru-spr̥hā ||8.46.5||

IAST: tam indraṁ dānam īmahe śavasānam abhīrvam
Griffith: We pray to Indra for his gift, to him the Fearless and the Strong,
pada pāṭha: tam | indram | dānam | īmahe | śavasānam | abhīrvam || īśānam | rāyaḥ | īmahe ||8.46.6||

IAST: īśānaṁ rāya īmahe
Griffith: We pray to him the Lord of wealth.
pada pāṭha: tam | indram | dānam | īmahe | śavasānam | abhīrvam || īśānam | rāyaḥ | īmahe ||8.46.6||

IAST: tasmin hi santy ūtayo viśvā abhīravaḥ sacā
Griffith: For verily combined in him are all the fearless powers of aid.
pada pāṭha: tasmin | hi | santi | ūtayaḥ | viśvāḥ | abhīravaḥ | sacā || tam | ā | vahantu | saptayaḥ | puru-vasum | madāya | harayaḥ | sutam ||8.46.7||

IAST: tam ā vahantu saptayaḥ purūvasum madāya harayaḥ sutam
Griffith: Him, rich in wealth, let swift Steeds bring to us, his Bays, to Soma juice for his carouse:
Devanāgarī: तमा वहन्तु सप्तयः पुरूवसुं मदाय हरयः सुतम्
pada pāṭha: tasmin | hi | santi | ūtayaḥ | viśvāḥ | abhīravaḥ | sacā || tam | ā | vahantu | saptayaḥ | puru-vasum | madāya | harayaḥ | sutam ||8.46.7||

IAST: yas te mado vareṇyo ya indra vṛtrahantamaḥ
Griffith: Yea, that most excellent carouse, Indra, which slays most enemies,
Devanāgarī: यस्ते मदो वरेण्यो य इन्द्र वृत्रहन्तमः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | madaḥ | vareṇyaḥ | yaḥ | indra | vr̥trahan-tamaḥ || yaḥ | ā-dadiḥ | svaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | yaḥ | pr̥tanāsu | dustaraḥ ||8.46.8||

IAST: ya ādadiḥ svar nṛbhir yaḥ pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ
Griffith: With Heroes wins the light of heaven, and is invincible in war:
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | madaḥ | vareṇyaḥ | yaḥ | indra | vr̥trahan-tamaḥ || yaḥ | ā-dadiḥ | svaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | yaḥ | pr̥tanāsu | dustaraḥ ||8.46.8||

IAST: yo duṣṭaro viśvavāra śravāyyo vājeṣv asti tarutā
Griffith: Which merits fame, all-bountiful! and, unsubdued, hath victory in deeds of might.
Devanāgarī: यो दुष्टरो विश्ववार श्रवाय्यो वाजेष्वस्ति तरुता
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dustaraḥ | viśva-vāra | śravāyyaḥ | vājeṣu | asti | tarutā || saḥ | naḥ | śaviṣṭha | savanā | ā | vaso iti | gahi | gamema | go-mati | vraje ||8.46.9||

IAST: sa naḥ śaviṣṭha savanā vaso gahi gamema gomati vraje
Griffith: So come to our libations, Strongest! Excellent! May we obtain a stall of kine.
Devanāgarī: स नः शविष्ठ सवना वसो गहि गमेम गोमति व्रजे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dustaraḥ | viśva-vāra | śravāyyaḥ | vājeṣu | asti | tarutā || saḥ | naḥ | śaviṣṭha | savanā | ā | vaso iti | gahi | gamema | go-mati | vraje ||8.46.9||

IAST: gavyo ṣu ṇo yathā purāśvayota rathayā
Griffith: Responding to our wish for cows, for steeds, and chariots, as of old,
Devanāgarī: गव्यो षु णो यथा पुराश्वयोत रथया
pada pāṭha: gavyo iti | su | naḥ | yathā | purā | aśva-yā | uta | ratha-yā || varivasya | mahā-maha ||8.46.10||

IAST: varivasya mahāmaha
Griffith: Be gracious, Greatest of the Great
pada pāṭha: gavyo iti | su | naḥ | yathā | purā | aśva-yā | uta | ratha-yā || varivasya | mahā-maha ||8.46.10||

IAST: nahi te śūra rādhaso 'ntaṁ vindāmi satrā
Griffith: For, Hero, nowhere can I find the bounds of thy munificence.
Devanāgarī: नहि ते शूर राधसोऽन्तं विन्दामि सत्रा
pada pāṭha: nahi | te | śūra | rādhasaḥ | antam | vindāmi | satrā || daśasya | naḥ | magha-van | nu | cit | adri-vaḥ | dhiyaḥ | vājebhiḥ | āvitha ||8.46.11||

IAST: daśasyā no maghavan nū cid adrivo dhiyo vājebhir āvitha
Griffith: Still do thou favour us, O Bolt-armed Maghavan: with strength hast thou rewarded hymns.
Devanāgarī: दशस्या नो मघवन्नू चिदद्रिवो धियो वाजेभिराविथ
pada pāṭha: nahi | te | śūra | rādhasaḥ | antam | vindāmi | satrā || daśasya | naḥ | magha-van | nu | cit | adri-vaḥ | dhiyaḥ | vājebhiḥ | āvitha ||8.46.11||

IAST: ya ṛṣvaḥ śrāvayatsakhā viśvet sa veda janimā puruṣṭutaḥ
Griffith: High, glorifier of his friend, he knows all generations, he whom many praise.
Devanāgarī: य ऋष्वः श्रावयत्सखा विश्वेत्स वेद जनिमा पुरुष्टुतः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | śravayat-sakhā | viśvā | it | saḥ | veda | janima | puru-stutaḥ || tam | viśve | mānuṣā | yugā | indram | havante | taviṣam | yata-srucaḥ ||8.46.12||

IAST: taṁ viśve mānuṣā yugendraṁ havante taviṣaṁ yatasrucaḥ
Griffith: All races of mankind with ladies lifted up invoke that Mighty Indra's aid.
Devanāgarī: तं विश्वे मानुषा युगेन्द्रं हवन्ते तविषं यतस्रुचः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | śravayat-sakhā | viśvā | it | saḥ | veda | janima | puru-stutaḥ || tam | viśve | mānuṣā | yugā | indram | havante | taviṣam | yata-srucaḥ ||8.46.12||

IAST: sa no vājeṣv avitā purūvasuḥ puraḥsthātā maghavā vṛtrahā bhuvat
Griffith: Be he our Champion and Protector in great deeds, rich in all wealth, the Vrtra-slayer, Maghavan.
Devanāgarī: स नो वाजेष्वविता पुरूवसुः पुरःस्थाता मघवा वृत्रहा भुवत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vājeṣu | avitā | puru-vasuḥ | puraḥ-sthātā | magha-vā | vr̥tra-hā | bhuvat ||8.46.13||

IAST: abhi vo vīram andhaso madeṣu gāya girā mahā vicetasam
Griffith: In the wild raptures of the juice sing to your Hero with high laud, to him the Wise,
Devanāgarī: अभि वो वीरमन्धसो मदेषु गाय गिरा महा विचेतसम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | vaḥ | vīram | andhasaḥ | madeṣu | gāya | girā | mahā | vi-cetasam || indram | nāma | śrutyam | śākinam | vacaḥ | yathā ||8.46.14||

IAST: indraṁ nāma śrutyaṁ śākinaṁ vaco yathā
Griffith: To Indra, glorious in his name, the Mighty One, even as the hymn alloweth it.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं नाम श्रुत्यं शाकिनं वचो यथा
pada pāṭha: abhi | vaḥ | vīram | andhasaḥ | madeṣu | gāya | girā | mahā | vi-cetasam || indram | nāma | śrutyam | śākinam | vacaḥ | yathā ||8.46.14||

IAST: dadī rekṇas tanve dadir vasu dadir vājeṣu puruhūta vājinam
Griffith: Thou givest wealth to me myself, thou givest treasure, Excellent! and the strong steed,
Devanāgarī: ददी रेक्णस्तन्वे ददिर्वसु ददिर्वाजेषु पुरुहूत वाजिनम्
pada pāṭha: dadiḥ | rekṇaḥ | tanve | dadiḥ | vasu | dadiḥ | vājeṣu | puru-hūta | vājinam || nūnam | atha ||8.46.15||

IAST: nūnam atha
Griffith: O Much-invoked, in deeds of might, yea, even now.
pada pāṭha: dadiḥ | rekṇaḥ | tanve | dadiḥ | vasu | dadiḥ | vājeṣu | puru-hūta | vājinam || nūnam | atha ||8.46.15||

IAST: viśveṣām irajyantaṁ vasūnāṁ sāsahvāṁsaṁ cid asya varpasaḥ
Griffith: Him, Sovran Ruler of all precious things, who even hath power o'er this fair form of his,
pada pāṭha: viśveṣām | irajyantam | vasūnām | sasahvāṁsam | cit | asya | varpasaḥ || kr̥pa-yataḥ | nūnam | ati | atha ||8.46.16||

IAST: kṛpayato nūnam aty atha
Griffith: As now it taketh shape, and afterward,
pada pāṭha: viśveṣām | irajyantam | vasūnām | sasahvāṁsam | cit | asya | varpasaḥ || kr̥pa-yataḥ | nūnam | ati | atha ||8.46.16||

IAST: mahaḥ su vo aram iṣe stavāmahe mīḻhuṣe araṁgamāya jagmaye
Griffith: We praise, so that the Mighty One may speed to you, Pourer of boun ies, Traveller, prepared to go.
Devanāgarī: महः सु वो अरमिषे स्तवामहे मीळ्हुषे अरंगमाय जग्मये
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | su | vaḥ | aram | iṣe | stavāmahe | mīḷhuṣe | aram-gamāya | jagmaye || yajñebhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | viśva-manuṣām | marutām | iyakṣasi | gāye | tvā | namasā | girā ||8.46.17||

IAST: yajñebhir gīrbhir viśvamanuṣām marutām iyakṣasi gāye tvā namasā girā
Griffith: Thou favourest the Maruts known to all, by song and sacrifice. With song and praise I sing to thee.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेभिर्गीर्भिर्विश्वमनुषां मरुतामियक्षसि गाये त्वा नमसा गिरा
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | su | vaḥ | aram | iṣe | stavāmahe | mīḷhuṣe | aram-gamāya | jagmaye || yajñebhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | viśva-manuṣām | marutām | iyakṣasi | gāye | tvā | namasā | girā ||8.46.17||

IAST: ye pātayante ajmabhir girīṇāṁ snubhir eṣām
Griffith: We in the sacrifice perform their will whose voice is lifted high,
pada pāṭha: ye | pātayante | ajma-bhiḥ | girīṇām | snu-bhiḥ | eṣām || yajñam | mahi-svanīnām | sumnam | tuvi-svanīnām | pra | adhvare ||8.46.18||

IAST: yajñam mahiṣvaṇīnāṁ sumnaṁ tuviṣvaṇīnām prādhvare
Griffith: The worship of those Thundering Ories who o'er the ridges of these mountains fly in troops.
pada pāṭha: ye | pātayante | ajma-bhiḥ | girīṇām | snu-bhiḥ | eṣām || yajñam | mahi-svanīnām | sumnam | tuvi-svanīnām | pra | adhvare ||8.46.18||

IAST: prabhaṅgaṁ durmatīnām indra śaviṣṭhā bhara
Griffith: O Indra, Mightiest, bring us that which crushes men of evil minds,
pada pāṭha: pra-bhaṅgam | duḥ-matīnām | indra | śaviṣṭha | ā | bhara || rayim | asmabhyam | yujyam | codayat-mate | jyeṣṭham | codayat-mate ||8.46.19||

IAST: rayim asmabhyaṁ yujyaṁ codayanmate jyeṣṭhaṁ codayanmate
Griffith: Wealth suited to our needs, O Stirrer of the thought, best wealth, O thou who stirrest thought.
pada pāṭha: pra-bhaṅgam | duḥ-matīnām | indra | śaviṣṭha | ā | bhara || rayim | asmabhyam | yujyam | codayat-mate | jyeṣṭham | codayat-mate ||8.46.19||

IAST: sanitaḥ susanitar ugra citra cetiṣṭha sūnṛta
Griffith: O Winner, noble winner, strong, wondrous, most splendid, excellent,
pada pāṭha: sanitariti | su-sanitaḥ | ugra | citra | cetiṣṭha | sūnr̥ta || pra-sahā | sam-rāṭ | sahurim | sahantam | bhujyum | vājeṣu | pūrvyam ||8.46.20||

IAST: prāsahā samrāṭ sahuriṁ sahantam bhujyuṁ vājeṣu pūrvyam
Griffith: Sole Lord of victory, bring all-ovcrpowering wealth, joy-giving, chief in deeds of might.
Devanāgarī: प्रासहा सम्राट् सहुरिं सहन्तं भुज्युं वाजेषु पूर्व्यम्
pada pāṭha: sanitariti | su-sanitaḥ | ugra | citra | cetiṣṭha | sūnr̥ta || pra-sahā | sam-rāṭ | sahurim | sahantam | bhujyum | vājeṣu | pūrvyam ||8.46.20||

IAST: ā sa etu ya īvad ām̐ adevaḥ pūrtam ādade
Griffith: Now let the godless man approach who hath received reward so great
Devanāgarī: आ स एतु य ईवदाँ अदेवः पूर्तमाददे
pada pāṭha: ā | saḥ | etu | yaḥ | īvat | ā | adevaḥ | pūrtam | ā-dade || yathā | cit | vaśaḥ | aśvyaḥ | pr̥thu-śravasi | kānīte | asyāḥ | vi-uṣi | ā-dade ||8.46.21||

IAST: yathā cid vaśo aśvyaḥ pṛthuśravasi kānīte 'syā vyuṣy ādade
Griffith: As Vasa, Asvya, when this light of morning dawned, received from Prthusravas, from Kanita's son.
Devanāgarī: यथा चिद्वशो अश्व्यः पृथुश्रवसि कानीतेऽस्या व्युष्याददे
pada pāṭha: ā | saḥ | etu | yaḥ | īvat | ā | adevaḥ | pūrtam | ā-dade || yathā | cit | vaśaḥ | aśvyaḥ | pr̥thu-śravasi | kānīte | asyāḥ | vi-uṣi | ā-dade ||8.46.21||

IAST: ṣaṣṭiṁ sahasrāśvyasyāyutāsanam uṣṭrānāṁ viṁśatiṁ śatā
Griffith: Steeds sixty thousand and ten thousand kine, and twenty hundred camels I obtained;
pada pāṭha: ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | aśvyasya | ayutā | asanam | uṣṭrānām | viṁśatim | śatā || daśa | śyāvīnām | śatā | daśa | tri-aruṣīṇām | daśa | gavām | sahasrā ||8.46.22||

IAST: daśa śyāvīnāṁ śatā daśa tryaruṣīṇāṁ daśa gavāṁ sahasrā
Griffith: Ten hundred brown in hue, and other ten red in three spots: in all, ten thousand kine.
Devanāgarī: दश श्यावीनां शता दश त्र्यरुषीणां दश गवां सहस्रा
pada pāṭha: ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | aśvyasya | ayutā | asanam | uṣṭrānām | viṁśatim | śatā || daśa | śyāvīnām | śatā | daśa | tri-aruṣīṇām | daśa | gavām | sahasrā ||8.46.22||

IAST: daśa śyāvā ṛdhadrayo vītavārāsa āśavaḥ
Griffith: Ten browns that make my wealth increase, fleet steeds whose tails are long and fair,
pada pāṭha: daśa | śyāvāḥ | r̥dhat-rayaḥ | vīta-vārāsaḥ | āśavaḥ || mathrāḥ | nemim | ni | vavr̥tuḥ ||8.46.23||

IAST: mathrā nemiṁ ni vāvṛtuḥ
Griffith: Turn with swift whirl my chariot wheel;
pada pāṭha: daśa | śyāvāḥ | r̥dhat-rayaḥ | vīta-vārāsaḥ | āśavaḥ || mathrāḥ | nemim | ni | vavr̥tuḥ ||8.46.23||

IAST: dānāsaḥ pṛthuśravasaḥ kānītasya surādhasaḥ
Griffith: The gifts which Prthusravas gave, Kanita's son munificent.
pada pāṭha: dānāsaḥ | pr̥thu-śravasaḥ | kānītasya | su-rādhasaḥ || ratham | hiraṇyayam | dadat | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | sūriḥ | abhūt | varṣiṣṭham | akr̥ta | śravaḥ ||8.46.24||

IAST: rathaṁ hiraṇyayaṁ dadan maṁhiṣṭhaḥ sūrir abhūd varṣiṣṭham akṛta śravaḥ
Griffith: He gave a chariot wrought of gold: the prince was passing bountiful, and won himself most lofty fame.
pada pāṭha: dānāsaḥ | pr̥thu-śravasaḥ | kānītasya | su-rādhasaḥ || ratham | hiraṇyayam | dadat | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | sūriḥ | abhūt | varṣiṣṭham | akr̥ta | śravaḥ ||8.46.24||

IAST: ā no vāyo mahe tane yāhi makhāya pājase
Griffith: Come thou to this great rite of ours, Vayu! to give us vigorous light.
Devanāgarī: आ नो वायो महे तने याहि मखाय पाजसे
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | vāyo iti | mahe | tane | yāhi | makhāya | pājase || vayam | hi | te | cakr̥ma | bhūri | dāvane | sadyaḥ | cit | mahi | dāvane ||8.46.25||

IAST: vayaṁ hi te cakṛmā bhūri dāvane sadyaś cin mahi dāvane
Griffith: We have served thee that thou mightest give much to us, yea, mightest quickly give great wealth.
Devanāgarī: वयं हि ते चकृमा भूरि दावने सद्यश्चिन्महि दावने
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | vāyo iti | mahe | tane | yāhi | makhāya | pājase || vayam | hi | te | cakr̥ma | bhūri | dāvane | sadyaḥ | cit | mahi | dāvane ||8.46.25||

IAST: yo aśvebhir vahate vasta usrās triḥ sapta saptatīnām
Griffith: Who with thrice seven times seventy horses comes to us, invested with the rays of morn,
Devanāgarī: यो अश्वेभिर्वहते वस्त उस्रास्त्रिः सप्त सप्ततीनाम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | aśvebhiḥ | vahate | vaste | usrāḥ | triḥ | sapta | saptatīnām || ebhiḥ | somebhiḥ | somasut-bhiḥ | soma-pāḥ | dānāya | śukrapūta-pāḥ ||8.46.26||

IAST: ebhiḥ somebhiḥ somasudbhiḥ somapā dānāya śukrapūtapāḥ
Griffith: Through these our Soma-draughts and those who press, to give, drinker of pure bright Soma Juice.
Devanāgarī: एभिः सोमेभिः सोमसुद्भिः सोमपा दानाय शुक्रपूतपाः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | aśvebhiḥ | vahate | vaste | usrāḥ | triḥ | sapta | saptatīnām || ebhiḥ | somebhiḥ | somasut-bhiḥ | soma-pāḥ | dānāya | śukrapūta-pāḥ ||8.46.26||

IAST: yo ma imaṁ cid u tmanāmandac citraṁ dāvane
Griffith: Who hath inclined this glorious one, buunteous himself, to give me gifts.
Devanāgarī: यो म इमं चिदु त्मनामन्दच्चित्रं दावने
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | imam | cit | ūm̐ iti | tmanā | amandat | citram | dāvane || araṭve | akṣe | nahuṣe | su-kr̥tvani | sukr̥t-tarāya | su-kratuḥ ||8.46.27||

IAST: araṭve akṣe nahuṣe sukṛtvani sukṛttarāya sukratuḥ
Griffith: Borne on firm chariot with the prosperous Nahup, wise, to a man yet more devout.
Devanāgarī: अरट्वे अक्षे नहुषे सुकृत्वनि सुकृत्तराय सुक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | imam | cit | ūm̐ iti | tmanā | amandat | citram | dāvane || araṭve | akṣe | nahuṣe | su-kr̥tvani | sukr̥t-tarāya | su-kratuḥ ||8.46.27||

IAST: ucathye vapuṣi yaḥ svarāḻ uta vāyo ghṛtasnāḥ
Griffith: Sole Lord in beauty meet for praise, O Vayu, dropping fatness down,
Devanāgarī: उचथ्ये वपुषि यः स्वराळुत वायो घृतस्नाः
pada pāṭha: ucathye | vapuṣi | yaḥ | sva-rāṭ | uta | vāyo iti | ghr̥ta-snāḥ || aśva-iṣitam | rajaḥ-iṣitam | śunā-iṣitam | pra | ajma | tat | idam | nu | tat ||8.46.28||

IAST: aśveṣitaṁ rajeṣitaṁ śuneṣitam prājma tad idaṁ nu tat
Griffith: Hurried along by steeds, by camels, and by hounds, spreads forth thy train: even this it is.
Devanāgarī: अश्वेषितं रजेषितं शुनेषितं प्राज्म तदिदं नु तत्
pada pāṭha: ucathye | vapuṣi | yaḥ | sva-rāṭ | uta | vāyo iti | ghr̥ta-snāḥ || aśva-iṣitam | rajaḥ-iṣitam | śunā-iṣitam | pra | ajma | tat | idam | nu | tat ||8.46.28||

IAST: adha priyam iṣirāya ṣaṣṭiṁ sahasrāsanam
Griffith: So, as a prize dear to the strong, the sixty thousand have I gained,
pada pāṭha: adha | priyam | iṣirāya | ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | asanam || aśvānām | it | na | vr̥ṣṇām ||8.46.29||

IAST: aśvānām in na vṛṣṇām
Griffith: Bulls that resemble vigorous steeds.
pada pāṭha: adha | priyam | iṣirāya | ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | asanam || aśvānām | it | na | vr̥ṣṇām ||8.46.29||

IAST: gāvo na yūtham upa yanti vadhraya upa mā yanti vadhrayaḥ
Griffith: To me come oxen like a herd, yea, unto me the oxen come.
Devanāgarī: गावो न यूथमुप यन्ति वध्रय उप मा यन्ति वध्रयः
pada pāṭha: gāvaḥ | na | yūtham | upa | yanti | vadhrayaḥ | upa | mā | ā | yanti | vadhrayaḥ ||8.46.30||

IAST: adha yac cārathe gaṇe śatam uṣṭrām̐ acikradat
Griffith: And in the grazing herd he made a hundred camels bleat for me,
pada pāṭha: adha | yat | cārathe | gaṇe | śatam | uṣṭrān | acikradat || adha | śvitneṣu | viṁśatim | śatā ||8.46.31||

IAST: adha śvitneṣu viṁśatiṁ śatā
Griffith: And twenty hundred mid the white.
pada pāṭha: adha | yat | cārathe | gaṇe | śatam | uṣṭrān | acikradat || adha | śvitneṣu | viṁśatim | śatā ||8.46.31||

IAST: śataṁ dāse balbūthe vipras tarukṣa ā dade
Griffith: A hundred has the sage received, Dasa Balbutha's and Taruksa's gifts.
Devanāgarī: शतं दासे बल्बूथे विप्रस्तरुक्ष आ ददे
pada pāṭha: śatam | dāse | balbūthe | vipraḥ | tarukṣe | ā | dade || te | te | vāyo iti | ime | janāḥ | madanti | indra-gopāḥ | madanti | deva-gopāḥ ||8.46.32||

IAST: te te vāyav ime janā madantīndragopā madanti devagopāḥ
Griffith: These are thy people, Vayu, who rejoice with Indra for their guard, rejoice with Gods for guards.
Devanāgarī: ते ते वायविमे जना मदन्तीन्द्रगोपा मदन्ति देवगोपाः
pada pāṭha: śatam | dāse | balbūthe | vipraḥ | tarukṣe | ā | dade || te | te | vāyo iti | ime | janāḥ | madanti | indra-gopāḥ | madanti | deva-gopāḥ ||8.46.32||

IAST: adha syā yoṣaṇā mahī pratīcī vaśam aśvyam
Griffith: And now to Vasa Asvya here this stately woman is led forth,
Devanāgarī: अध स्या योषणा मही प्रतीची वशमश्व्यम्
pada pāṭha: adha | syā | yoṣaṇā | mahī | pratīcī | vaśam | aśvyam || adhi-rukmā | vi | nīyate ||8.46.33||

IAST: adhirukmā vi nīyate
Griffith: Adorned with ornaments of gold.
pada pāṭha: adha | syā | yoṣaṇā | mahī | pratīcī | vaśam | aśvyam || adhi-rukmā | vi | nīyate ||8.46.33||

IAST: mahi vo mahatām avo varuṇa mitra dāśuṣe
Griffith: GREAT help ye give the worshipper, Varuna, Mitra, Mighty Ones! No sorrow ever reaches him whom ye, Adityas, keep from harm.
Devanāgarī: महि वो महतामवो वरुण मित्र दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: mahi | vaḥ | mahatām | avaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | dāśuṣe || yam | ādityāḥ | abhi | druhaḥ | rakṣatha | na | īm | agham | naśat | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.1||

IAST: yam ādityā abhi druho rakṣathā nem aghaṁ naśad anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: Yours are incomparable aids, and good the succour they afford.
Devanāgarī: यमादित्या अभि द्रुहो रक्षथा नेमघं नशदनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: mahi | vaḥ | mahatām | avaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | dāśuṣe || yam | ādityāḥ | abhi | druhaḥ | rakṣatha | na | īm | agham | naśat | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.1||

IAST: vidā devā aghānām ādityāso apākṛtim
Griffith: O Gods, Adityas, well ye know the way to keep all woes afar.
pada pāṭha: vida | devāḥ | aghānām | ādityāsaḥ | apa-ākr̥tim || pakṣā | vayaḥ | yathā | upari | vi | asme iti | śarma | yacchata | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.2||

IAST: pakṣā vayo yathopari vy asme śarma yacchatānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: As the birds spread their sheltering wings, spread your protection over us.
Devanāgarī: पक्षा वयो यथोपरि व्यस्मे शर्म यच्छतानेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: vida | devāḥ | aghānām | ādityāsaḥ | apa-ākr̥tim || pakṣā | vayaḥ | yathā | upari | vi | asme iti | śarma | yacchata | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.2||

IAST: vy asme adhi śarma tat pakṣā vayo na yantana
Griffith: As the birds spread their sheltering wings let your protection cover us.
Devanāgarī: व्यस्मे अधि शर्म तत्पक्षा वयो न यन्तन
pada pāṭha: vi | asme iti | adhi | śarma | tat | pakṣā | vayaḥ | na | yantana || viśvāni | viśva-vedasaḥ | varūthyā | manāmahe | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.3||

IAST: viśvāni viśvavedaso varūthyā manāmahe 'nehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: We mean all shelter and defence, ye who have all things for your own.
Devanāgarī: विश्वानि विश्ववेदसो वरूथ्या मनामहेऽनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: vi | asme iti | adhi | śarma | tat | pakṣā | vayaḥ | na | yantana || viśvāni | viśva-vedasaḥ | varūthyā | manāmahe | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.3||

IAST: yasmā arāsata kṣayaṁ jīvātuṁ ca pracetasaḥ
Griffith: To whomsoever they, Most Wise, have given a home and means of life,
Devanāgarī: यस्मा अरासत क्षयं जीवातुं च प्रचेतसः
pada pāṭha: yasmai | arāsata | kṣayam | jīvātum | ca | pra-cetasaḥ || manoḥ | viśvasya | gha | it | ime | ādityāḥ | rāyaḥ | īśate | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.4||

IAST: manor viśvasya ghed ima ādityā rāya īśate 'nehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: O'er the whole riches of this man they, the Adityas, have control.
Devanāgarī: मनोर्विश्वस्य घेदिम आदित्या राय ईशतेऽनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: yasmai | arāsata | kṣayam | jīvātum | ca | pra-cetasaḥ || manoḥ | viśvasya | gha | it | ime | ādityāḥ | rāyaḥ | īśate | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.4||

IAST: pari ṇo vṛṇajann aghā durgāṇi rathyo yathā
Griffith: As drivers of the car avoid ill roads, let sorrows pass us by.
Devanāgarī: परि णो वृणजन्नघा दुर्गाणि रथ्यो यथा
pada pāṭha: pari | naḥ | vr̥ṇajan | aghā | duḥ-gāni | rathyaḥ | yathā || syāma | it | indrasya | śarmaṇi | ādityānām | uta | avasi | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.5||

IAST: syāmed indrasya śarmaṇy ādityānām utāvasy anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: May we be under Indra's guard, in the Adityas' favouring grace.
Devanāgarī: स्यामेदिन्द्रस्य शर्मण्यादित्यानामुतावस्यनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: pari | naḥ | vr̥ṇajan | aghā | duḥ-gāni | rathyaḥ | yathā || syāma | it | indrasya | śarmaṇi | ādityānām | uta | avasi | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.5||

IAST: parihvṛted anā jano yuṣmādattasya vāyati
Griffith: For verily men sink and faint through loss of wealth which ye have given.
pada pāṭha: pari-hvr̥tā | it | anā | janaḥ | yuṣmā-dattasya | vāyati || devāḥ | adabhram | āśa | vaḥ | yam | ādityāḥ | ahetana | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.6||

IAST: devā adabhram āśa vo yam ādityā ahetanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: Much hath he gained from you, O Gods, whom ye, Adityas, have approached.
Devanāgarī: देवा अदभ्रमाश वो यमादित्या अहेतनानेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: pari-hvr̥tā | it | anā | janaḥ | yuṣmā-dattasya | vāyati || devāḥ | adabhram | āśa | vaḥ | yam | ādityāḥ | ahetana | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.6||

IAST: na taṁ tigmaṁ cana tyajo na drāsad abhi taṁ guru
Griffith: On him shall no fierce anger fall, no sore distress shall visit him,
Devanāgarī: न तं तिग्मं चन त्यजो न द्रासदभि तं गुरु
pada pāṭha: na | tam | tigmam | cana | tyajaḥ | na | drāsat | abhi | tam | guru || yasmai | ūm̐ iti | śarma | sa-prathaḥ | ādityāsaḥ | arādhvam | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.7||

IAST: yasmā u śarma sapratha ādityāso arādhvam anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: To whom, Adityas, ye have lent your shelter that extendeth far.
Devanāgarī: यस्मा उ शर्म सप्रथ आदित्यासो अराध्वमनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: na | tam | tigmam | cana | tyajaḥ | na | drāsat | abhi | tam | guru || yasmai | ūm̐ iti | śarma | sa-prathaḥ | ādityāsaḥ | arādhvam | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.7||

IAST: yuṣme devā api ṣmasi yudhyanta iva varmasu
Griffith: Resting in you, O Gods, we are like men who fight in coats of mail.
Devanāgarī: युष्मे देवा अपि ष्मसि युध्यन्त इव वर्मसु
pada pāṭha: yuṣme iti | devāḥ | api | smasi | yudhyantaḥ-iva | varma-su || yūyam | mahaḥ | naḥ | enasaḥ | yūyam | arbhāt | uruṣyata | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.8||

IAST: yūyam maho na enaso yūyam arbhād uruṣyatānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: Ye guard us from each great offence, ye guard us from each lighter fault.
Devanāgarī: यूयं महो न एनसो यूयमर्भादुरुष्यतानेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: yuṣme iti | devāḥ | api | smasi | yudhyantaḥ-iva | varma-su || yūyam | mahaḥ | naḥ | enasaḥ | yūyam | arbhāt | uruṣyata | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.8||

IAST: aditir na uruṣyatv aditiḥ śarma yacchatu
Griffith: May Aditi defend us, may Aditi guard and shelter us,
pada pāṭha: aditiḥ | naḥ | uruṣyatu | aditiḥ | śarma | yacchatu || mātā | mitrasya | revataḥ | aryamṇaḥ | varuṇasya | ca | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.9||

IAST: mātā mitrasya revato 'ryamṇo varuṇasya cānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: Mother of wealthy Mitra and of Aryaman and Varuna.
Devanāgarī: माता मित्रस्य रेवतोऽर्यम्णो वरुणस्य चानेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: aditiḥ | naḥ | uruṣyatu | aditiḥ | śarma | yacchatu || mātā | mitrasya | revataḥ | aryamṇaḥ | varuṇasya | ca | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.9||

IAST: yad devāḥ śarma śaraṇaṁ yad bhadraṁ yad anāturam
Griffith: The shelter, Gods, that is secure, auspicious, free from malady,
pada pāṭha: yat | devāḥ | śarma | śaraṇam | yat | bhadram | yat | anāturam || tri-dhātu | yat | varūthyam | tat | asmāsu | vi | yantana | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.10||

IAST: tridhātu yad varūthyaṁ tad asmāsu vi yantanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: A sure protection, triply strong, even that do ye extend to us.
Devanāgarī: त्रिधातु यद्वरूथ्यं तदस्मासु वि यन्तनानेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: yat | devāḥ | śarma | śaraṇam | yat | bhadram | yat | anāturam || tri-dhātu | yat | varūthyam | tat | asmāsu | vi | yantana | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.10||

IAST: ādityā ava hi khyatādhi kūlād iva spaśaḥ
Griffith: Look down on us, Adityas, as a guide exploring from the bank.
Devanāgarī: आदित्या अव हि ख्यताधि कूलादिव स्पशः
pada pāṭha: ādityāḥ | ava | hi | khyata | adhi | kūlāt-iva | spaśaḥ || su-tīrtham | arvataḥ | yathā | anu | naḥ | neṣatha | su-gam | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.11||

IAST: sutīrtham arvato yathānu no neṣathā sugam anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: Lead us to pleasant ways as men lead horses to an easy ford.
Devanāgarī: सुतीर्थमर्वतो यथानु नो नेषथा सुगमनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: ādityāḥ | ava | hi | khyata | adhi | kūlāt-iva | spaśaḥ || su-tīrtham | arvataḥ | yathā | anu | naḥ | neṣatha | su-gam | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.11||

IAST: neha bhadraṁ rakṣasvine nāvayai nopayā uta
Griffith: Ill be it for the demons' friend to find us or come near to us.
Devanāgarī: नेह भद्रं रक्षस्विने नावयै नोपया उत
pada pāṭha: na | iha | bhadram | rakṣasvine | na | ava-yai | na | upa-yai | uta || gave | ca | bhadram | dhenave | vīrāya | ca | śravasyate | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.12||

IAST: gave ca bhadraṁ dhenave vīrāya ca śravasyate 'nehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: But for the milch-cow be it well, and for the man who strives for fame.
Devanāgarī: गवे च भद्रं धेनवे वीराय च श्रवस्यतेऽनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: na | iha | bhadram | rakṣasvine | na | ava-yai | na | upa-yai | uta || gave | ca | bhadram | dhenave | vīrāya | ca | śravasyate | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.12||

IAST: yad āvir yad apīcyaṁ devāso asti duṣkṛtam
Griffith: Each evil deed made manifest, and that which is concealed, O Gods,
pada pāṭha: yat | āviḥ | yat | apīcyam | devāsaḥ | asti | duḥ-kr̥tam || trite | tat | viśvam | āptye | āre | asmat | dadhātana | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.13||

IAST: trite tad viśvam āptya āre asmad dadhātanānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: The whole thereof remove from us to Trita Aptya far away.
Devanāgarī: त्रिते तद्विश्वमाप्त्य आरे अस्मद्दधातनानेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: yat | āviḥ | yat | apīcyam | devāsaḥ | asti | duḥ-kr̥tam || trite | tat | viśvam | āptye | āre | asmat | dadhātana | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.13||

IAST: yac ca goṣu duṣṣvapnyaṁ yac cāsme duhitar divaḥ
Griffith: Daughter of Heaven, the dream that bodes evil to us or to our kine,
pada pāṭha: yat | ca | goṣu | duḥ-svapnyam | yat | ca | asme iti | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || tritāya | tat | vibhā-vari | āptyāya | parā | vaha | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.14||

IAST: tritāya tad vibhāvary āptyāya parā vahānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: Remove, O Lady of the Light, to Trita Aptya far away.
Devanāgarī: त्रिताय तद्विभावर्याप्त्याय परा वहानेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: yat | ca | goṣu | duḥ-svapnyam | yat | ca | asme iti | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || tritāya | tat | vibhā-vari | āptyāya | parā | vaha | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.14||

IAST: niṣkaṁ vā ghā kṛṇavate srajaṁ vā duhitar divaḥ
Griffith: Even if, O Child of Heaven, it make a garland or a chain of gold,
Devanāgarī: निष्कं वा घा कृणवते स्रजं वा दुहितर्दिवः
pada pāṭha: niṣkam | vā | gha | kr̥ṇavate | srajam | vā | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || trite | duḥ-svapnyam | sarvam | āptye | pari | dadmasi | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.15||

IAST: trite duṣṣvapnyaṁ sarvam āptye pari dadmasy anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: The whole bad dream, whate'cr it be, to Trita Aptya we consign.
Devanāgarī: त्रिते दुष्ष्वप्न्यं सर्वमाप्त्ये परि दद्मस्यनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: niṣkam | vā | gha | kr̥ṇavate | srajam | vā | duhitaḥ | divaḥ || trite | duḥ-svapnyam | sarvam | āptye | pari | dadmasi | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.15||

IAST: tadannāya tadapase tam bhāgam upaseduṣe
Griffith: To him whose food and work is this, who comes to take his share therein,
pada pāṭha: tat-annāya | tat-apase | tam | bhāgam | upa-seduṣe || tritāya | ca | dvitāya | ca | uṣaḥ | duḥ-svapnyam | vaha | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.16||

IAST: tritāya ca dvitāya coṣo duṣṣvapnyaṁ vahānehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: To Trita, and to Dvita, Dawn! bear thou the evil dream away.
Devanāgarī: त्रिताय च द्विताय चोषो दुष्ष्वप्न्यं वहानेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: tat-annāya | tat-apase | tam | bhāgam | upa-seduṣe || tritāya | ca | dvitāya | ca | uṣaḥ | duḥ-svapnyam | vaha | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.16||

IAST: yathā kalāṁ yathā śaphaṁ yatha ṛṇaṁ saṁnayāmasi
Griffith: As we collect the utmost debt, even the eighth and sixteenth part,
Devanāgarī: यथा कलां यथा शफं यथ ऋणं संनयामसि
pada pāṭha: yathā | kalām | yathā | śapham | yathā | r̥ṇam | sam-nayāmasi || eva | duḥ-svapnyam | sarvam | āptye | sam | nayāmasi | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.17||

IAST: evā duṣṣvapnyaṁ sarvam āptye saṁ nayāmasy anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: So unto Aptya we transfer together all the evil dream.
Devanāgarī: एवा दुष्ष्वप्न्यं सर्वमाप्त्ये सं नयामस्यनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: yathā | kalām | yathā | śapham | yathā | r̥ṇam | sam-nayāmasi || eva | duḥ-svapnyam | sarvam | āptye | sam | nayāmasi | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.17||

IAST: ajaiṣmādyāsanāma cābhūmānāgaso vayam
Griffith: Now have we conquered and obtained, and from our trespasses are free.
pada pāṭha: ajaiṣma | adya | asanāma | ca | abhūma | anāgasaḥ | vayam || uṣaḥ | yasmāt | duḥ-svapnyāt | abhaiṣma | apa | tat | ucchatu | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.18||

IAST: uṣo yasmād duṣṣvapnyād abhaiṣmāpa tad ucchatv anehaso va ūtayaḥ suūtayo va ūtayaḥ
Griffith: Shine thou away the evil dream, O Dawn, whereof we are afraid. Yours are incomparable aids, and good the
Devanāgarī: उषो यस्माद्दुष्ष्वप्न्यादभैष्माप तदुच्छत्वनेहसो व ऊतयः सुतयो व ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: ajaiṣma | adya | asanāma | ca | abhūma | anāgasaḥ | vayam || uṣaḥ | yasmāt | duḥ-svapnyāt | abhaiṣma | apa | tat | ucchatu | anehasaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ | su-ūtayaḥ | vaḥ | ūtayaḥ ||8.47.18||

IAST: svādor abhakṣi vayasaḥ sumedhāḥ svādhyo varivovittarasya
Griffith: WISELY have I enjoyed the savoury viand, religious-thoughted, best to find out treasure,
pada pāṭha: svādoḥ | abhakṣi | vayasaḥ | su-medhāḥ | su-ādhyaḥ | varivovit-tarasya || viśve | yam | devāḥ | uta | martyāsaḥ | madhu | bruvantaḥ | abhi | sam-caranti ||8.48.1||

IAST: viśve yaṁ devā uta martyāso madhu bruvanto abhi saṁcaranti
Griffith: The food to which all Deities and mortals, calling it meath, gather themselves together.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे यं देवा उत मर्त्यासो मधु ब्रुवन्तो अभि संचरन्ति
pada pāṭha: svādoḥ | abhakṣi | vayasaḥ | su-medhāḥ | su-ādhyaḥ | varivovit-tarasya || viśve | yam | devāḥ | uta | martyāsaḥ | madhu | bruvantaḥ | abhi | sam-caranti ||8.48.1||

IAST: antaś ca prāgā aditir bhavāsy avayātā haraso daivyasya
Griffith: Tlou shalt be Aditi as thou hast entered within, appeaser of celestial anger.
pada pāṭha: antariti | ca | pra | agāḥ | aditiḥ | bhavāsi | ava-yātā | harasaḥ | daivyasya || indo iti | indrasya | sakhyam | juṣāṇaḥ | śrauṣṭī-iva | dhuram | anu | rāye | r̥dhyāḥ ||8.48.2||

IAST: indav indrasya sakhyaṁ juṣāṇaḥ śrauṣṭīva dhuram anu rāya ṛdhyāḥ
Griffith: Indu, enjoying Indra's friendship, bring us - as a swift steed the car - forward to riches.
Devanāgarī: इन्दविन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुषाणः श्रौष्टीव धुरमनु राय ऋध्याः
pada pāṭha: antariti | ca | pra | agāḥ | aditiḥ | bhavāsi | ava-yātā | harasaḥ | daivyasya || indo iti | indrasya | sakhyam | juṣāṇaḥ | śrauṣṭī-iva | dhuram | anu | rāye | r̥dhyāḥ ||8.48.2||

IAST: apāma somam amṛtā abhūmāganma jyotir avidāma devān
Griffith: We have drunk Soma and become immortal; we have attained the light, the Gods discovered.
pada pāṭha: apāma | somam | amr̥tāḥ | abhūma | aganma | jyotiḥ | avidāma | devān || kim | nūnam | asmān | kr̥ṇavat | arātiḥ | kim | ūm̐ iti | dhūrtiḥ | amr̥ta | martyasya ||8.48.3||

IAST: kiṁ nūnam asmān kṛṇavad arātiḥ kim u dhūrtir amṛta martyasya
Griffith: Now what may foeman's malice do to harm us? What, O Immortal, mortal man's deception?
pada pāṭha: apāma | somam | amr̥tāḥ | abhūma | aganma | jyotiḥ | avidāma | devān || kim | nūnam | asmān | kr̥ṇavat | arātiḥ | kim | ūm̐ iti | dhūrtiḥ | amr̥ta | martyasya ||8.48.3||

IAST: śaṁ no bhava hṛda ā pīta indo piteva soma sūnave suśevaḥ
Griffith: Absorbed into the heart, be sweet, O Indu, as a kind father to his son, O Soma,
Devanāgarī: शं नो भव हृद आ पीत इन्दो पितेव सोम सूनवे सुशेवः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | bhava | hr̥de | ā | pītaḥ | indo iti | pitā-iva | soma | sūnave | su-śevaḥ || sakhā-iva | sakhye | uru-śaṁsa | dhīraḥ | pra | naḥ | āyuḥ | jīvase | soma | tārīḥ ||8.48.4||

IAST: sakheva sakhya uruśaṁsa dhīraḥ pra ṇa āyur jīvase soma tārīḥ
Griffith: As a wise Friend to friend: do thou, wide-ruler, O Soma, lengthen out our days for living.
Devanāgarī: सखेव सख्य उरुशंस धीरः प्र ण आयुर्जीवसे सोम तारीः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | bhava | hr̥de | ā | pītaḥ | indo iti | pitā-iva | soma | sūnave | su-śevaḥ || sakhā-iva | sakhye | uru-śaṁsa | dhīraḥ | pra | naḥ | āyuḥ | jīvase | soma | tārīḥ ||8.48.4||

IAST: ime mā pītā yaśasa uruṣyavo rathaṁ na gāvaḥ sam anāha parvasu
Griffith: These glorious drops that give me freedom have I drunk. Closely they knit my joints as straps secure a ca
Devanāgarī: इमे मा पीता यशस उरुष्यवो रथं न गावः समनाह पर्वसु
pada pāṭha: ime | mā | pītāḥ | yaśasaḥ | uruṣyavaḥ | ratham | na | gāvaḥ | sam | anāha | parva-su || te | mā | rakṣantu | vi-srasaḥ | caritrāt | uta | mā | srāmāt | yavayantu | indavaḥ ||8.48.5||

IAST: te mā rakṣantu visrasaś caritrād uta mā srāmād yavayantv indavaḥ
Griffith: Let them protect my foot from slipping on the way: yea, let the drops I drink preserve me from disease.
Devanāgarī: ते मा रक्षन्तु विस्रसश्चरित्रादुत मा स्रामाद्यवयन्त्विन्दवः
pada pāṭha: ime | mā | pītāḥ | yaśasaḥ | uruṣyavaḥ | ratham | na | gāvaḥ | sam | anāha | parva-su || te | mā | rakṣantu | vi-srasaḥ | caritrāt | uta | mā | srāmāt | yavayantu | indavaḥ ||8.48.5||

IAST: agniṁ na mā mathitaṁ saṁ didīpaḥ pra cakṣaya kṛṇuhi vasyaso naḥ
Griffith: Make me shine bright like fire produced by friction: give us a clearer sight and make us better.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं न मा मथितं सं दिदीपः प्र चक्षय कृणुहि वस्यसो नः
pada pāṭha: agnim | na | mā | mathitam | sam | didīpaḥ | pra | cakṣaya | kr̥ṇuhi | vasyasaḥ | naḥ || atha | hi | te | made | ā | soma | manye | revān-iva | pra | cara | puṣṭim | accha ||8.48.6||

IAST: athā hi te mada ā soma manye revām̐ iva pra carā puṣṭim accha
Griffith: For in carouse I think of thee, O Soma, Shall I, as a rich man, attain to comfort?
Devanāgarī: अथा हि ते मद आ सोम मन्ये रेवाँ इव प्र चरा पुष्टिमच्छ
pada pāṭha: agnim | na | mā | mathitam | sam | didīpaḥ | pra | cakṣaya | kr̥ṇuhi | vasyasaḥ | naḥ || atha | hi | te | made | ā | soma | manye | revān-iva | pra | cara | puṣṭim | accha ||8.48.6||

IAST: iṣireṇa te manasā sutasya bhakṣīmahi pitryasyeva rāyaḥ
Griffith: May we enjoy with an enlivened spirit the juice thou givest, like ancestral riches.
Devanāgarī: इषिरेण ते मनसा सुतस्य भक्षीमहि पित्र्यस्येव रायः
pada pāṭha: iṣireṇa | te | manasā | sutasya | bhakṣīmahi | pitryasya-iva | rāyaḥ || soma | rājan | pra | naḥ | āyūṁṣi | tārīḥ | ahāni-iva | sūryaḥ | vāsarāṇi ||8.48.7||

IAST: soma rājan pra ṇa āyūṁṣi tārīr ahānīva sūryo vāsarāṇi
Griffith: O Soma, King, prolong thou our existence as Surya makes the shining days grow longer.
Devanāgarī: सोम राजन्प्र ण आयूंषि तारीरहानीव सूर्यो वासराणि
pada pāṭha: iṣireṇa | te | manasā | sutasya | bhakṣīmahi | pitryasya-iva | rāyaḥ || soma | rājan | pra | naḥ | āyūṁṣi | tārīḥ | ahāni-iva | sūryaḥ | vāsarāṇi ||8.48.7||

IAST: soma rājan mṛḻayā naḥ svasti tava smasi vratyās tasya viddhi
Griffith: King Soma, favour us and make us prosper: we are thy devotees; of this be mindful.
Devanāgarī: सोम राजन्मृळया नः स्वस्ति तव स्मसि व्रत्यास्तस्य विद्धि
pada pāṭha: soma | rājan | mr̥ḷaya | naḥ | svasti | tava | smasi | vratyāḥ | tasya | viddhi || alarti | dakṣaḥ | uta | manyuḥ | indo iti | mā | naḥ | aryaḥ | anu-kāmam | parā | dāḥ ||8.48.8||

IAST: alarti dakṣa uta manyur indo mā no aryo anukāmam parā dāḥ
Griffith: Spirit and power are fresh in us, O Indu give us not up unto our foeman's pleasure.
Devanāgarī: अलर्ति दक्ष उत मन्युरिन्दो मा नो अर्यो अनुकामं परा दाः
pada pāṭha: soma | rājan | mr̥ḷaya | naḥ | svasti | tava | smasi | vratyāḥ | tasya | viddhi || alarti | dakṣaḥ | uta | manyuḥ | indo iti | mā | naḥ | aryaḥ | anu-kāmam | parā | dāḥ ||8.48.8||

IAST: tvaṁ hi nas tanvaḥ soma gopā gātre-gātre niṣasatthā nṛcakṣāḥ
Griffith: For thou hast settled in each joint, O Soma, aim of men's eyes and guardian of our bodies.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि नस्तन्वः सोम गोपा गात्रेगात्रे निषसत्था नृचक्षाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | naḥ | tanvaḥ | soma | gopāḥ | gātre-gātre | ni-sasattha | nr̥-cakṣāḥ || yat | te | vayam | pra-mināma | vratāni | saḥ | naḥ | mr̥ḷa | su-sakhā | deva | vasyaḥ ||8.48.9||

IAST: yat te vayam pramināma vratāni sa no mṛḻa suṣakhā deva vasyaḥ
Griffith: When we offend against thine holy statutes, as a kind Friend, God, best of all, be gracious.
Devanāgarī: यत्ते वयं प्रमिनाम व्रतानि स नो मृळ सुषखा देव वस्यः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | naḥ | tanvaḥ | soma | gopāḥ | gātre-gātre | ni-sasattha | nr̥-cakṣāḥ || yat | te | vayam | pra-mināma | vratāni | saḥ | naḥ | mr̥ḷa | su-sakhā | deva | vasyaḥ ||8.48.9||

IAST: ṛdūdareṇa sakhyā saceya yo mā na riṣyed dharyaśva pītaḥ
Griffith: May I be with the Friend whose heart is tender, who, Lord of Bays! when quaffed will never harm me-
Devanāgarī: ऋदूदरेण सख्या सचेय यो मा न रिष्येद्धर्यश्व पीतः
pada pāṭha: r̥dūdareṇa | sakhyā | saceya | yaḥ | mā | na | riṣyet | hari-aśva | pītaḥ || ayam | yaḥ | somaḥ | ni | adhāyi | asme iti | tasmai | indram | pra-tiram | emi | āyuḥ ||8.48.10||

IAST: ayaṁ yaḥ somo ny adhāyy asme tasmā indram pratiram emy āyuḥ
Griffith: This Soma now deposited within me. For this, I pray for longer life to Indra.
Devanāgarī: अयं यः सोमो न्यधाय्यस्मे तस्मा इन्द्रं प्रतिरमेम्यायुः
pada pāṭha: r̥dūdareṇa | sakhyā | saceya | yaḥ | mā | na | riṣyet | hari-aśva | pītaḥ || ayam | yaḥ | somaḥ | ni | adhāyi | asme iti | tasmai | indram | pra-tiram | emi | āyuḥ ||8.48.10||

IAST: apa tyā asthur anirā amīvā nir atrasan tamiṣīcīr abhaiṣuḥ
Griffith: Our maladies have lost their strength and vanished: they feared, and passed away into the darkness.
pada pāṭha: apa | tyāḥ | asthuḥ | anirāḥ | amīvāḥ | niḥ | atrasan | tamiṣīcīḥ | abhaiṣuḥ || ā | somaḥ | asmān | aruhat | vi-hāyāḥ | aganma | yatra | pra-tirante | āyuḥ ||8.48.11||

IAST: ā somo asmām̐ aruhad vihāyā aganma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ
Griffith: Soma hath risen in us, exceeding mighty, and we are come where men prolong existence.
Devanāgarī: आ सोमो अस्माँ अरुहद्विहाया अगन्म यत्र प्रतिरन्त आयुः
pada pāṭha: apa | tyāḥ | asthuḥ | anirāḥ | amīvāḥ | niḥ | atrasan | tamiṣīcīḥ | abhaiṣuḥ || ā | somaḥ | asmān | aruhat | vi-hāyāḥ | aganma | yatra | pra-tirante | āyuḥ ||8.48.11||

IAST: yo na induḥ pitaro hṛtsu pīto 'martyo martyām̐ āviveśa
Griffith: Fathers, that Indu which our hearts have drunken, Immortal in himself, hath entered mortals.
Devanāgarī: यो न इन्दुः पितरो हृत्सु पीतोऽमर्त्यो मर्त्याँ आविवेश
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | induḥ | pitaraḥ | hr̥t-su | pītaḥ | amartyaḥ | martyān | ā-viveśa || tasmai | somāya | haviṣā | vidhema | mr̥ḷīke | asya | su-matau | syāma ||8.48.12||

IAST: tasmai somāya haviṣā vidhema mṛḻīke asya sumatau syāma
Griffith: So let us serve this Soma with oblation, and rest securely in his grace and favour.
Devanāgarī: तस्मै सोमाय हविषा विधेम मृळीके अस्य सुमतौ स्याम
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | induḥ | pitaraḥ | hr̥t-su | pītaḥ | amartyaḥ | martyān | ā-viveśa || tasmai | somāya | haviṣā | vidhema | mr̥ḷīke | asya | su-matau | syāma ||8.48.12||

IAST: tvaṁ soma pitṛbhiḥ saṁvidāno 'nu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha
Griffith: Associate with the Fathers thou, O Soma, hast spread thyself abroad through earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्वं सोम पितृभिः संविदानोऽनु द्यावापृथिवी आ ततन्थ
pada pāṭha: tvam | soma | pitr̥-bhiḥ | sam-vidānaḥ | anu | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | ā | tatantha || tasmai | te | indo iti | haviṣā | vidhema | vayam | syāma | patayaḥ | rayīṇām ||8.48.13||

IAST: tasmai ta indo haviṣā vidhema vayaṁ syāma patayo rayīṇām
Griffith: So with oblation let us serve thee, Indu, and so let us become the lords of riches,
Devanāgarī: तस्मै त इन्दो हविषा विधेम वयं स्याम पतयो रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | soma | pitr̥-bhiḥ | sam-vidānaḥ | anu | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | ā | tatantha || tasmai | te | indo iti | haviṣā | vidhema | vayam | syāma | patayaḥ | rayīṇām ||8.48.13||

IAST: trātāro devā adhi vocatā no mā no nidrā īśata mota jalpiḥ
Griffith: Give us your blessing, O ye Gods' preservers. Never may sleep or idle talk control us.
Devanāgarī: त्रातारो देवा अधि वोचता नो मा नो निद्रा ईशत मोत जल्पिः
pada pāṭha: trātāraḥ | devāḥ | adhi | vocata | naḥ | mā | naḥ | ni-drā | īśata | mā | uta | jalpiḥ || vayam | somasya | viśvaha | priyāsaḥ | su-vīrāsaḥ | vidatham | ā | vadema ||8.48.14||

IAST: vayaṁ somasya viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidatham ā vadema
Griffith: But evermore may we, as friends of Soma, speak to the synod with brave sons around us.
Devanāgarī: वयं सोमस्य विश्वह प्रियासः सुवीरासो विदथमा वदेम
pada pāṭha: trātāraḥ | devāḥ | adhi | vocata | naḥ | mā | naḥ | ni-drā | īśata | mā | uta | jalpiḥ || vayam | somasya | viśvaha | priyāsaḥ | su-vīrāsaḥ | vidatham | ā | vadema ||8.48.14||

IAST: tvaṁ naḥ soma viśvato vayodhās tvaṁ svarvid ā viśā nṛcakṣāḥ
Griffith: On all sides,. Soma, thou art our life-giver: aim of all eyes, light-finder, come within us.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नः सोम विश्वतो वयोधास्त्वं स्वर्विदा विशा नृचक्षाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | soma | viśvataḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | tvam | svaḥ-vit | ā | viśa | nr̥-cakṣāḥ || tvam | naḥ | indo iti | ūti-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | pāhi | paścātāt | uta | vā | purastāt ||8.48.15||

IAST: tvaṁ na inda ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ pāhi paścātād uta vā purastāt
Griffith: Indu, of one accord with thy protections both from behind and from before preserve us.
Devanāgarī: त्वं न इन्द ऊतिभिः सजोषाः पाहि पश्चातादुत वा पुरस्तात्
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | soma | viśvataḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | tvam | svaḥ-vit | ā | viśa | nr̥-cakṣāḥ || tvam | naḥ | indo iti | ūti-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | pāhi | paścātāt | uta | vā | purastāt ||8.48.15||

IAST: abhi pra vaḥ surādhasam indram arca yathā vide
Griffith: AGNI, come hither with thy fires; we choose thee as Invoking Priest.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्र वः सुराधसमिन्द्रमर्च यथा विदे
pada pāṭha: abhi | pra | vaḥ | su-rādhasam | indram | arca | yathā | vide || yaḥ | jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | magha-vā | puru-vasuḥ | sahasreṇa-iva | śikṣati ||8.49.1||

IAST: yo jaritṛbhyo maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇeva śikṣati
Griffith: Let the extended ladle full of oil balm thee, best Priest, to sit on sacred grass.
Devanāgarī: यो जरितृभ्यो मघवा पुरूवसुः सहस्रेणेव शिक्षति
pada pāṭha: abhi | pra | vaḥ | su-rādhasam | indram | arca | yathā | vide || yaḥ | jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | magha-vā | puru-vasuḥ | sahasreṇa-iva | śikṣati ||8.49.1||

IAST: śatānīkeva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe
Griffith: For unto thee, O Angiras, O Son of Strength, move ladles in the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: शतानीकेव प्र जिगाति धृष्णुया हन्ति वृत्राणि दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: śatānīkā-iva | pra | jigāti | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | hanti | vr̥trāṇi | dāśuṣe || gireḥ-iva | pra | rasāḥ | asya | pinvire | datrāṇi | puru-bhojasaḥ ||8.49.2||

IAST: girer iva pra rasā asya pinvire datrāṇi purubhojasaḥ
Griffith: To Agni, Child of Force, whose locks drop oil, we seek, foremost in sacrificial rites.
Devanāgarī: गिरेरिव प्र रसा अस्य पिन्विरे दत्राणि पुरुभोजसः
pada pāṭha: śatānīkā-iva | pra | jigāti | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | hanti | vr̥trāṇi | dāśuṣe || gireḥ-iva | pra | rasāḥ | asya | pinvire | datrāṇi | puru-bhojasaḥ ||8.49.2||

IAST: ā tvā sutāsa indavo madā ya indra girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: Agni, thou art Disposer, Sage, Herald, bright God! and worshipful,
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा सुतास इन्दवो मदा य इन्द्र गिर्वणः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | sutāsaḥ | indavaḥ | madāḥ | ye | indra | girvaṇaḥ || āpaḥ | na | vajrin | anu | okyam | saraḥ | pr̥ṇanti | śūra | rādhase ||8.49.3||

IAST: āpo na vajrinn anv okyaṁ saraḥ pṛṇanti śūra rādhase
Griffith: Best offercr, cheerful, to be praised in holy rites, pure Lord! by singers with their hymns.
Devanāgarī: आपो न वज्रिन्नन्वोक्यं सरः पृणन्ति शूर राधसे
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | sutāsaḥ | indavaḥ | madāḥ | ye | indra | girvaṇaḥ || āpaḥ | na | vajrin | anu | okyam | saraḥ | pr̥ṇanti | śūra | rādhase ||8.49.3||

IAST: anehasam prataraṇaṁ vivakṣaṇam madhvaḥ svādiṣṭham īm piba
Griffith: Most Youthful and Eternal, bring the longing Gods to me, the guileless, for the feast.
Devanāgarī: अनेहसं प्रतरणं विवक्षणं मध्वः स्वादिष्ठमीं पिब
pada pāṭha: anehasam | pra-taraṇam | vivakṣaṇam | madhvaḥ | svādiṣṭham | īm | piba || ā | yathā | mandasānaḥ | kirāsi | naḥ | pra | kṣudrā-iva | tmanā | dhr̥ṣat ||8.49.4||

IAST: ā yathā mandasānaḥ kirāsi naḥ pra kṣudreva tmanā dhṛṣat
Griffith: Come, Vasu, to the banquet that is well-prepared: rejoice thee, gracious, with our songs.
Devanāgarī: आ यथा मन्दसानः किरासि नः प्र क्षुद्रेव त्मना धृषत्
pada pāṭha: anehasam | pra-taraṇam | vivakṣaṇam | madhvaḥ | svādiṣṭham | īm | piba || ā | yathā | mandasānaḥ | kirāsi | naḥ | pra | kṣudrā-iva | tmanā | dhr̥ṣat ||8.49.4||

IAST: ā naḥ stomam upa dravad dhiyāno aśvo na sotṛbhiḥ
Griffith: Famed art thou, Agni, far and wide, Preserver, righteous, and a Sage.
Devanāgarī: आ नः स्तोममुप द्रवद्धियानो अश्वो न सोतृभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | stomam | upa | dravat | hiyānaḥ | aśvaḥ | na | sotr̥-bhiḥ || yam | te | svadhā-van | svadayanti | dhenavaḥ | indra | kaṇveṣu | rātayaḥ ||8.49.5||

IAST: yaṁ te svadhāvan svadayanti dhenava indra kaṇveṣu rātayaḥ
Griffith: The holy singers, O refulgent kindled God! arrangers, call on thee to come -
Devanāgarī: यं ते स्वधावन्स्वदयन्ति धेनव इन्द्र कण्वेषु रातयः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | stomam | upa | dravat | hiyānaḥ | aśvaḥ | na | sotr̥-bhiḥ || yam | te | svadhā-van | svadayanti | dhenavaḥ | indra | kaṇveṣu | rātayaḥ ||8.49.5||

IAST: ugraṁ na vīraṁ namasopa sedima vibhūtim akṣitāvasum
Griffith: Shine, Most Resplendent! blaze, send bliss unto the folk, and to thy worshipper great art thou.
Devanāgarī: उग्रं न वीरं नमसोप सेदिम विभूतिमक्षितावसुम्
pada pāṭha: ugram | na | vīram | namasā | upa | sedima | vi-bhūtim | akṣita-vasum || udrī-iva | vajrin | avataḥ | na | siñcate | kṣaranti | indra | dhītayaḥ ||8.49.6||

IAST: udrīva vajrinn avato na siñcate kṣarantīndra dhītayaḥ
Griffith: So may my princes, with good fires, subduing foes, rest in the keeping of the Gods.
Devanāgarī: उद्रीव वज्रिन्नवतो न सिञ्चते क्षरन्तीन्द्र धीतयः
pada pāṭha: ugram | na | vīram | namasā | upa | sedima | vi-bhūtim | akṣita-vasum || udrī-iva | vajrin | avataḥ | na | siñcate | kṣaranti | indra | dhītayaḥ ||8.49.6||

IAST: yad dha nūnaṁ yad vā yajñe yad vā pṛthivyām adhi
Griffith: O Agni, as thou burnest down to earth even high-grown underwood,
Devanāgarī: यद्ध नूनं यद्वा यज्ञे यद्वा पृथिव्यामधि
pada pāṭha: yat | ha | nūnam | yat | vā | yajñe | yat | vā | pr̥thivyām | adhi || ataḥ | naḥ | yajñam | āśu-bhiḥ | mahe-mate | ugraḥ | ugrebhiḥ | ā | gahi ||8.49.7||

IAST: ato no yajñam āśubhir mahemata ugra ugrebhir ā gahi
Griffith: So, bright as Mitra is, burn him who injures us, him who plots ill against thy friend.
Devanāgarī: अतो नो यज्ञमाशुभिर्महेमत उग्र उग्रेभिरा गहि
pada pāṭha: yat | ha | nūnam | yat | vā | yajñe | yat | vā | pr̥thivyām | adhi || ataḥ | naḥ | yajñam | āśu-bhiḥ | mahe-mate | ugraḥ | ugrebhiḥ | ā | gahi ||8.49.7||

IAST: ajirāso harayo ye ta āśavo vātā iva prasakṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: Give us not as a prey to mortal enemy, nor to the wicked friend of fiends.
Devanāgarī: अजिरासो हरयो ये त आशवो वाता इव प्रसक्षिणः
pada pāṭha: ajirāsaḥ | harayaḥ | ye | te | āśavaḥ | vātāḥ-iva | pra-sakṣiṇaḥ || yebhiḥ | apatyam | manuṣaḥ | pari-īyase | yebhiḥ | viśvam | svaḥ | dr̥śe ||8.49.8||

IAST: yebhir apatyam manuṣaḥ parīyase yebhir viśvaṁ svar dṛśe
Griffith: With conquering guards, auspicious, unassailable, protect us, O Most Youthful God.
pada pāṭha: ajirāsaḥ | harayaḥ | ye | te | āśavaḥ | vātāḥ-iva | pra-sakṣiṇaḥ || yebhiḥ | apatyam | manuṣaḥ | pari-īyase | yebhiḥ | viśvam | svaḥ | dr̥śe ||8.49.8||

IAST: etāvatas ta īmaha indra sumnasya gomataḥ
Griffith: Protect us, Agni, through the first, protect us through the second hymn,
pada pāṭha: etāvataḥ | te | īmahe | indra | sumnasya | go-mataḥ || yathā | pra | āvaḥ | magha-van | medhya-atithim | yathā | nīpa-atithim | dhane ||8.49.9||

IAST: yathā prāvo maghavan medhyātithiṁ yathā nīpātithiṁ dhane
Griffith: Protect us through three hymns, O Lord of Power and Might, through four hymns, Vasu, guard thou us.
Devanāgarī: यथा प्रावो मघवन्मेध्यातिथिं यथा नीपातिथिं धने
pada pāṭha: etāvataḥ | te | īmahe | indra | sumnasya | go-mataḥ || yathā | pra | āvaḥ | magha-van | medhya-atithim | yathā | nīpa-atithim | dhane ||8.49.9||

IAST: yathā kaṇve maghavan trasadasyavi yathā pakthe daśavraje
Griffith: Preserve us from each fiend who brings the Gods no gift, preserve thou us in deeds of strength:
Devanāgarī: यथा कण्वे मघवन्त्रसदस्यवि यथा पक्थे दशव्रजे
pada pāṭha: yathā | kaṇve | magha-van | trasadasyavi | yathā | pakthe | daśa-vraje || yathā | go-śarye | asanoḥ | r̥jiśvani | indra | go-mat | hiraṇya-vat ||8.49.10||

IAST: yathā gośarye asanor ṛjiśvanīndra gomad dhiraṇyavat
Griffith: For we possess in thee the nearest Friend of all, for service of the Gods and weal.
pada pāṭha: yathā | kaṇve | magha-van | trasadasyavi | yathā | pakthe | daśa-vraje || yathā | go-śarye | asanoḥ | r̥jiśvani | indra | go-mat | hiraṇya-vat ||8.49.10||

IAST: pra su śrutaṁ surādhasam arcā śakram abhiṣṭaye
Griffith: BOTH boons,-may Indra, hitherward turned, listen to this prayer of ours,
pada pāṭha: pra | su | śrutam | su-rādhasam | arca | śakram | abhiṣṭaye || yaḥ | sunvate | stuvate | kāmyam | vasu | sahasreṇa-iva | maṁhate ||8.50.1||

IAST: yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyaṁ vasu sahasreṇeva maṁhate
Griffith: And mightiest Maghavan with thought inclined to us come near to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: यः सुन्वते स्तुवते काम्यं वसु सहस्रेणेव मंहते
pada pāṭha: pra | su | śrutam | su-rādhasam | arca | śakram | abhiṣṭaye || yaḥ | sunvate | stuvate | kāmyam | vasu | sahasreṇa-iva | maṁhate ||8.50.1||

IAST: śatānīkā hetayo asya duṣṭarā indrasya samiṣo mahīḥ
Griffith: For him, strong, independent Ruler, Heaven and Earth have fashioned forth for power and might.
Devanāgarī: शतानीका हेतयो अस्य दुष्टरा इन्द्रस्य समिषो महीः
pada pāṭha: śata-anīkāḥ | hetayaḥ | asya | dustarāḥ | indrasya | sam-iṣaḥ | mahīḥ || giriḥ | na | bhujmā | maghavat-su | pinvate | yat | īm | sutāḥ | amandiṣuḥ ||8.50.2||

IAST: girir na bhujmā maghavatsu pinvate yad īṁ sutā amandiṣuḥ
Griffith: Thou seatest thee as first among thy peers in place, for thy soul longs for Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: गिरिर्न भुज्मा मघवत्सु पिन्वते यदीं सुता अमन्दिषुः
pada pāṭha: śata-anīkāḥ | hetayaḥ | asya | dustarāḥ | indrasya | sam-iṣaḥ | mahīḥ || giriḥ | na | bhujmā | maghavat-su | pinvate | yat | īm | sutāḥ | amandiṣuḥ ||8.50.2||

IAST: yad īṁ sutāsa indavo 'bhi priyam amandiṣuḥ
Griffith: Fill thyself full, O Lord of wealth, O Indra, with the juice we shed.
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | sutāsaḥ | indavaḥ | abhi | priyam | amandiṣuḥ || āpaḥ | na | dhāyi | savanam | me | ā | vaso iti | dughāḥ-iva | upa | dāśuṣe ||8.50.3||

IAST: āpo na dhāyi savanam ma ā vaso dughā ivopa dāśuṣe
Griffith: We know thee, Lord of Bay Steeds victor in the fight, vanquishing e'en the invincible.
Devanāgarī: आपो न धायि सवनं म आ वसो दुघा इवोप दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | sutāsaḥ | indavaḥ | abhi | priyam | amandiṣuḥ || āpaḥ | na | dhāyi | savanam | me | ā | vaso iti | dughāḥ-iva | upa | dāśuṣe ||8.50.3||

IAST: anehasaṁ vo havamānam ūtaye madhvaḥ kṣaranti dhītayaḥ
Griffith: Changeless in truth, O Maghavan Indra, let it be as thou in wisdom willest it.
Devanāgarī: अनेहसं वो हवमानमूतये मध्वः क्षरन्ति धीतयः
pada pāṭha: anehasam | vaḥ | havamānam | ūtaye | madhvaḥ | kṣaranti | dhītayaḥ || ā | tvā | vaso iti | havamānāsaḥ | indavaḥ | upa | stotreṣu | dadhire ||8.50.4||

IAST: ā tvā vaso havamānāsa indava upa stotreṣu dadhire
Griffith: May we, O fair of check, win booty with thine aid, O Thunderer, swiftly seeking it.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा वसो हवमानास इन्दव उप स्तोत्रेषु दधिरे
pada pāṭha: anehasam | vaḥ | havamānam | ūtaye | madhvaḥ | kṣaranti | dhītayaḥ || ā | tvā | vaso iti | havamānāsaḥ | indavaḥ | upa | stotreṣu | dadhire ||8.50.4||

IAST: ā naḥ some svadhvara iyāno atyo na tośate
Griffith: Indra, with all thy saving helps give us assistance, Lord of power.
Devanāgarī: आ नः सोमे स्वध्वर इयानो अत्यो न तोशते
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | some | su-adhvare | iyānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | tośate || yam | te | svadā-van | svadanti | gūrtayaḥ | paure | chandayase | havam ||8.50.5||

IAST: yaṁ te svadāvan svadanti gūrtayaḥ paure chandayase havam
Griffith: For after thee we follow even as glorious bliss, thee, Hero, finder-out of wealth.
Devanāgarī: यं ते स्वदावन्स्वदन्ति गूर्तयः पौरे छन्दयसे हवम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | some | su-adhvare | iyānaḥ | atyaḥ | na | tośate || yam | te | svadā-van | svadanti | gūrtayaḥ | paure | chandayase | havam ||8.50.5||

IAST: pra vīram ugraṁ viviciṁ dhanaspṛtaṁ vibhūtiṁ rādhaso mahaḥ
Griffith: Increaser of our steeds and multiplying kine, a golden well, O God, art thou,
Devanāgarī: प्र वीरमुग्रं विविचिं धनस्पृतं विभूतिं राधसो महः
pada pāṭha: pra | vīram | ugram | vivicim | dhana-spr̥tam | vi-bhūtim | rādhasaḥ | mahaḥ || udrī-iva | vajrin | avataḥ | vasu-tvanā | sadā | pīpetha | dāśuṣe ||8.50.6||

IAST: udrīva vajrinn avato vasutvanā sadā pīpetha dāśuṣe
Griffith: For no one may impair the gifts laid up in thee. Bring me whatever thing I ask.
Devanāgarī: उद्रीव वज्रिन्नवतो वसुत्वना सदा पीपेथ दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: pra | vīram | ugram | vivicim | dhana-spr̥tam | vi-bhūtim | rādhasaḥ | mahaḥ || udrī-iva | vajrin | avataḥ | vasu-tvanā | sadā | pīpetha | dāśuṣe ||8.50.6||

IAST: yad dha nūnam parāvati yad vā pṛthivyāṁ divi
Griffith: For thou,-come to the worshipper!-wilt find great wealth to make us rich.
Devanāgarī: यद्ध नूनं परावति यद्वा पृथिव्यां दिवि
pada pāṭha: yat | ha | nūnam | parā-vati | yat | vā | pr̥thivyām | divi || yujānaḥ | indra | hari-bhiḥ | mahe-mate | r̥ṣvaḥ | r̥ṣvebhiḥ | ā | gahi ||8.50.7||

IAST: yujāna indra haribhir mahemata ṛṣva ṛṣvebhir ā gahi
Griffith: Fill thyself full, O Maghavan, for gain of kine, full, Indra, for the gain of steeds.
Devanāgarī: युजान इन्द्र हरिभिर्महेमत ऋष्व ऋष्वेभिरा गहि
pada pāṭha: yat | ha | nūnam | parā-vati | yat | vā | pr̥thivyām | divi || yujānaḥ | indra | hari-bhiḥ | mahe-mate | r̥ṣvaḥ | r̥ṣvebhiḥ | ā | gahi ||8.50.7||

IAST: rathirāso harayo ye te asridha ojo vātasya piprati
Griffith: Thou as thy gift bestowest many hundred herds, yea, many thousands dost thou give.
Devanāgarī: रथिरासो हरयो ये ते अस्रिध ओजो वातस्य पिप्रति
pada pāṭha: rathirāsaḥ | harayaḥ | ye | te | asridhaḥ | ojaḥ | vātasya | piprati || yebhiḥ | ni | dasyum | manuṣaḥ | ni-ghoṣayaḥ | yebhiḥ | svariti svaḥ | pari-īyase ||8.50.8||

IAST: yebhir ni dasyum manuṣo nighoṣayo yebhiḥ svaḥ parīyase
Griffith: With singers' hymns have we brought the Fort-render near, singing to Indra for his grace.
Devanāgarī: येभिर्नि दस्युं मनुषो निघोषयो येभिः स्वः परीयसे
pada pāṭha: rathirāsaḥ | harayaḥ | ye | te | asridhaḥ | ojaḥ | vātasya | piprati || yebhiḥ | ni | dasyum | manuṣaḥ | ni-ghoṣayaḥ | yebhiḥ | svariti svaḥ | pari-īyase ||8.50.8||

IAST: etāvatas te vaso vidyāma śūra navyasaḥ
Griffith: Whether the simple or the sage, Indra, have offered praise to thee,
pada pāṭha: etāvataḥ | te | vaso iti | vidyāma | śūra | navyasaḥ || yathā | pra | āvaḥ | etaśam | kr̥tvye | dhane | yathā | vaśam | daśa-vraje ||8.50.9||

IAST: yathā prāva etaśaṁ kṛtvye dhane yathā vaśaṁ daśavraje
Griffith: He Satakratu! by his love hath gladdened thee, ambitious! ever pressing on!
Devanāgarī: यथा प्राव एतशं कृत्व्ये धने यथा वशं दशव्रजे
pada pāṭha: etāvataḥ | te | vaso iti | vidyāma | śūra | navyasaḥ || yathā | pra | āvaḥ | etaśam | kr̥tvye | dhane | yathā | vaśam | daśa-vraje ||8.50.9||

IAST: yathā kaṇve maghavan medhe adhvare dīrghanīthe damūnasi
Griffith: If he the Strong of arm, the breaker-down of forts, the great Destroyer, hear my call,
Devanāgarī: यथा कण्वे मघवन्मेधे अध्वरे दीर्घनीथे दमूनसि
pada pāṭha: yathā | kaṇve | magha-van | medhe | adhvare | dīrgha-nīthe | damūnasi || yathā | go-śarye | asisāsaḥ | adri-vaḥ | mayi | gotram | hari-śriyam ||8.50.10||

IAST: yathā gośarye asiṣāso adrivo mayi gotraṁ hariśriyam
Griffith: We, seeking riches cry to Indra, Lord of wealth, to Satakratu with our lauds.
Devanāgarī: यथा गोशर्ये असिषासो अद्रिवो मयि गोत्रं हरिश्रियम्
pada pāṭha: yathā | kaṇve | magha-van | medhe | adhvare | dīrgha-nīthe | damūnasi || yathā | go-śarye | asisāsaḥ | adri-vaḥ | mayi | gotram | hari-śriyam ||8.50.10||

IAST: yathā manau sāṁvaraṇau somam indrāpibaḥ sutam
Griffith: OFFER ye up as praise to him that wherein Indra takes delight.
pada pāṭha: yathā | manau | sām-varaṇau | somam | indra | apibaḥ | sutam || nīpa-atithau | magha-van | medhya-atithau | puṣṭi-gau | śruṣṭi-gau | sacā ||8.51.1||

IAST: nīpātithau maghavan medhyātithau puṣṭigau śruṣṭigau sacā
Griffith: The Soma-bringers magnify Indra's great energy with hymns. Good are the gifts that Indra gives.
pada pāṭha: yathā | manau | sām-varaṇau | somam | indra | apibaḥ | sutam || nīpa-atithau | magha-van | medhya-atithau | puṣṭi-gau | śruṣṭi-gau | sacā ||8.51.1||

IAST: pārṣadvāṇaḥ praskaṇvaṁ sam asādayac chayānaṁ jivrim uddhitam
Griffith: Sole among chiefs, companionless, impetuous, and peerless, he
pada pāṭha: pārṣadvāṇaḥ | praskaṇvam | sam | asādayat | śayānam | jivrim | uddhitam || sahasrāṇi | asisāsat | gavām | r̥ṣiḥ | tvā-ūtaḥ | dasyave | vr̥kaḥ ||8.51.2||

IAST: sahasrāṇy asiṣāsad gavām ṛṣis tvoto dasyave vṛkaḥ
Griffith: Hath waxen great o'er many folk, yea., over all things born, in might.
pada pāṭha: pārṣadvāṇaḥ | praskaṇvam | sam | asādayat | śayānam | jivrim | uddhitam || sahasrāṇi | asisāsat | gavām | r̥ṣiḥ | tvā-ūtaḥ | dasyave | vr̥kaḥ ||8.51.2||

IAST: ya ukthebhir na vindhate cikid ya ṛṣicodanaḥ
Griffith: Lord of swift bounty, he will win e'en with a steed of worthless sort.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ukthebhiḥ | na | vindhate | cikit | yaḥ | r̥ṣi-codanaḥ || indram | tam | accha | vada | navyasyā | matī | ariṣyantam | na | bhojase ||8.51.3||

IAST: indraṁ tam acchā vada navyasyā maty ariṣyantaṁ na bhojase
Griffith: This, Indra, must be told of thee who wilt perform heroic deeds.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं तमच्छा वद नव्यस्या मत्यरिष्यन्तं न भोजसे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ukthebhiḥ | na | vindhate | cikit | yaḥ | r̥ṣi-codanaḥ || indram | tam | accha | vada | navyasyā | matī | ariṣyantam | na | bhojase ||8.51.3||

IAST: yasmā arkaṁ saptaśīrṣāṇam ānṛcus tridhātum uttame pade
Griffith: Come to us.hither: let us pay devotions that enhance thy might,
pada pāṭha: yasmai | arkam | sapta-śīrṣāṇam | ānr̥cuḥ | tri-dhātum | ut-tame | pade || saḥ | tu | imā | viśvā | bhuvanāni | cikradat | āt | it | janiṣṭa | pauṁsyam ||8.51.4||

IAST: sa tv imā viśvā bhuvanāni cikradad ād ij janiṣṭa pauṁsyam
Griffith: For which, Most Potent! thou wouldst fain bless the man here who strives for fame.
Devanāgarī: स त्विमा विश्वा भुवनानि चिक्रददादिज्जनिष्ट पौंस्यम्
pada pāṭha: yasmai | arkam | sapta-śīrṣāṇam | ānr̥cuḥ | tri-dhātum | ut-tame | pade || saḥ | tu | imā | viśvā | bhuvanāni | cikradat | āt | it | janiṣṭa | pauṁsyam ||8.51.4||

IAST: yo no dātā vasūnām indraṁ taṁ hūmahe vayam
Griffith: For thou, O Indra, makest yet more bold the spirit of the bold
Devanāgarī: यो नो दाता वसूनामिन्द्रं तं हूमहे वयम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | dātā | vasūnām | indram | tam | hūmahe | vayam || vidma | hi | asya | su-matim | navīyasīm | gamema | go-mati | vraje ||8.51.5||

IAST: vidmā hy asya sumatiṁ navīyasīṁ gamema gomati vraje
Griffith: Who with strong Soma serveth thee, still ready with his reverent prayers.
Devanāgarī: विद्मा ह्यस्य सुमतिं नवीयसीं गमेम गोमति व्रजे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | dātā | vasūnām | indram | tam | hūmahe | vayam || vidma | hi | asya | su-matim | navīyasīm | gamema | go-mati | vraje ||8.51.5||

IAST: yasmai tvaṁ vaso dānāya śikṣasi sa rāyas poṣam aśnute
Griffith: Worthy of song, he looketh down as a man looketh into wells.
Devanāgarī: यस्मै त्वं वसो दानाय शिक्षसि स रायस्पोषमश्नुते
pada pāṭha: yasmai | tvam | vaso iti | dānāya | śikṣasi | saḥ | rāyaḥ | poṣam | aśnute || tam | tvā | vayam | magha-van | indra | girvaṇaḥ | suta-vantaḥ | havāmahe ||8.51.6||

IAST: taṁ tvā vayam maghavann indra girvaṇaḥ sutāvanto havāmahe
Griffith: Pleased with the Soma-bringer's skill he maketh him his mate and friend.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा वयं मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणः सुतावन्तो हवामहे
pada pāṭha: yasmai | tvam | vaso iti | dānāya | śikṣasi | saḥ | rāyaḥ | poṣam | aśnute || tam | tvā | vayam | magha-van | indra | girvaṇaḥ | suta-vantaḥ | havāmahe ||8.51.6||

IAST: kadā cana starīr asi nendra saścasi dāśuṣe
Griffith: In strength and wisdom all the Gods, Indra, have yielded unto thee.
Devanāgarī: कदा चन स्तरीरसि नेन्द्र सश्चसि दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: kadā | cana | starīḥ | asi | na | indra | saścasi | dāśuṣe || upa-upa | it | nu | magha-van | bhūyaḥ | it | nu | te | dānam | devasya | pr̥cyate ||8.51.7||

IAST: upopen nu maghavan bhūya in nu te dānaṁ devasya pṛcyate
Griffith: Be thou the Guard of all, O thou whom many praise.
Devanāgarī: उपोपेन्नु मघवन्भूय इन्नु ते दानं देवस्य पृच्यते
pada pāṭha: kadā | cana | starīḥ | asi | na | indra | saścasi | dāśuṣe || upa-upa | it | nu | magha-van | bhūyaḥ | it | nu | te | dānam | devasya | pr̥cyate ||8.51.7||

IAST: pra yo nanakṣe abhy ojasā kriviṁ vadhaiḥ śuṣṇaṁ nighoṣayan
Griffith: Praised, Indra, is this might of thine, best for the service of the Gods,
Devanāgarī: प्र यो ननक्षे अभ्योजसा क्रिविं वधैः शुष्णं निघोषयन्
pada pāṭha: pra | yaḥ | nanakṣe | abhi | ojasā | krivim | vadhaiḥ | śuṣṇam | ni-ghoṣayan || yadā | it | astambhīt | prathayan | amūm | divam | āt | it | janiṣṭa | pārthivaḥ ||8.51.8||

IAST: yaded astambhīt prathayann amūṁ divam ād ij janiṣṭa pārthivaḥ
Griffith: That thou with power dost slay Vrtra, O Lord of Strength.
pada pāṭha: pra | yaḥ | nanakṣe | abhi | ojasā | krivim | vadhaiḥ | śuṣṇam | ni-ghoṣayan || yadā | it | astambhīt | prathayan | amūm | divam | āt | it | janiṣṭa | pārthivaḥ ||8.51.8||

IAST: yasyāyaṁ viśva āryo dāsaḥ śevadhipā ariḥ
Griffith: He makes the races of mankind like synods of the Beauteous One.
Devanāgarī: यस्यायं विश्व आर्यो दासः शेवधिपा अरिः
pada pāṭha: yasya | ayam | viśvaḥ | āryaḥ | dāsaḥ | śevadhi-pāḥ | ariḥ || tiraḥ | cit | arye | ruśame | pavīravi | tubhya | it | saḥ | ajyate | rayiḥ ||8.51.9||

IAST: tiraś cid arye ruśame parīravi tubhyet so ajyate rayiḥ
Griffith: Indra knows this his manifest deed, and is renowned.
Devanāgarī: तिरश्चिदर्ये रुशमे परीरवि तुभ्येत्सो अज्यते रयिः
pada pāṭha: yasya | ayam | viśvaḥ | āryaḥ | dāsaḥ | śevadhi-pāḥ | ariḥ || tiraḥ | cit | arye | ruśame | pavīravi | tubhya | it | saḥ | ajyate | rayiḥ ||8.51.9||

IAST: turaṇyavo madhumantaṁ ghṛtaścutaṁ viprāso arkam ānṛcuḥ
Griffith: Thy might, O Indra, at its birth, thee also, and thy mental power,
pada pāṭha: turaṇyavaḥ | madhu-mantam | ghr̥ta-ścutam | viprāsaḥ | arkam | ānr̥cuḥ || asme iti | rayiḥ | paprathe | vr̥ṣṇyam | śavaḥ | asme iti | suvānāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||8.51.10||

IAST: asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyaṁ śavo 'sme suvānāsa indavaḥ
Griffith: In thy care, Maghavan rich in kine! they have increased exceedingly.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे रयिः पप्रथे वृष्ण्यं शवोऽस्मे सुवानास इन्दवः
pada pāṭha: turaṇyavaḥ | madhu-mantam | ghr̥ta-ścutam | viprāsaḥ | arkam | ānr̥cuḥ || asme iti | rayiḥ | paprathe | vr̥ṣṇyam | śavaḥ | asme iti | suvānāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||8.51.10||

IAST: yathā manau vivasvati somaṁ śakrāpibaḥ sutam
Griffith: WITH powers of Mighty Ones hath he, Ancient, Beloved, been equipped,
Devanāgarī: यथा मनौ विवस्वति सोमं शक्रापिबः सुतम्
pada pāṭha: yathā | manau | vivasvati | somam | śakra | apibaḥ | sutam || yathā | trite | chandaḥ | indra | jujoṣasi | āyau | mādayase | sacā ||8.52.1||

IAST: yathā trite chanda indra jujoṣasy āyau mādayase sacā
Griffith: Through whom the Father Manu made prayers cfficacious with the Gods.
Devanāgarī: यथा त्रिते छन्द इन्द्र जुजोषस्यायौ मादयसे सचा
pada pāṭha: yathā | manau | vivasvati | somam | śakra | apibaḥ | sutam || yathā | trite | chandaḥ | indra | jujoṣasi | āyau | mādayase | sacā ||8.52.1||

IAST: pṛṣadhre medhye mātariśvanīndra suvāne amandathāḥ
Griffith: Him, Maker of the sky, let stones wet with the Soma ne'er forsake,
pada pāṭha: pr̥ṣadhre | medhye | mātariśvani | indra | suvāne | amandathāḥ || yathā | somam | daśa-śipre | daśa-oṇye | syūma-raśmau | r̥jūnasi ||8.52.2||

IAST: yathā somaṁ daśaśipre daśoṇye syūmaraśmāv ṛjūnasi
Griffith: Nor hymns and prayer that must be said.
pada pāṭha: pr̥ṣadhre | medhye | mātariśvani | indra | suvāne | amandathāḥ || yathā | somam | daśa-śipre | daśa-oṇye | syūma-raśmau | r̥jūnasi ||8.52.2||
