pada pāṭha: idam | te | somyam | madhu | adhukṣan | adri-bhiḥ | naraḥ || juṣāṇaḥ | indra | tat | piba ||8.65.8||

IAST: juṣāṇa indra tat piba
Griffith: Are offered from the heart with lauds.
pada pāṭha: idam | te | somyam | madhu | adhukṣan | adri-bhiḥ | naraḥ || juṣāṇaḥ | indra | tat | piba ||8.65.8||

IAST: viśvām̐ aryo vipaścito 'ti khyas tūyam ā gahi
Griffith: Drink, Indra, with thy Marut Friends, pressed Soma at the morning rites,
pada pāṭha: viśvān | aryaḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ | ati | khyaḥ | tūyam | ā | gahi || asme iti | dhehi | śravaḥ | br̥hat ||8.65.9||

IAST: asme dhehi śravo bṛhat
Griffith: Whetting thy thunderbolt with strength.
pada pāṭha: viśvān | aryaḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ | ati | khyaḥ | tūyam | ā | gahi || asme iti | dhehi | śravaḥ | br̥hat ||8.65.9||

IAST: dātā me pṛṣatīnāṁ rājā hiraṇyavīnām
Griffith: Arising in thy might, thy jaws thou shookest, Indra, having quaffed
pada pāṭha: dātā | me | pr̥ṣatīnām | rājā | hiraṇya-vīnām || mā | devāḥ | magha-vā | riṣat ||8.65.10||

IAST: mā devā maghavā riṣat
Griffith: The Soma which the mortar pressed.
pada pāṭha: dātā | me | pr̥ṣatīnām | rājā | hiraṇya-vīnām || mā | devāḥ | magha-vā | riṣat ||8.65.10||

IAST: sahasre pṛṣatīnām adhi ścandram bṛhat pṛthu
Griffith: Indra, both worlds complained to thee when uttering thy fearful roar,
pada pāṭha: sahasre | pr̥ṣatīnām | adhi | candram | br̥hat | pr̥thu || śukram | hiraṇyam | ā | dade ||8.65.11||

IAST: śukraṁ hiraṇyam ā dade
Griffith: What time thou smotest Dasyus dead.
pada pāṭha: sahasre | pr̥ṣatīnām | adhi | candram | br̥hat | pr̥thu || śukram | hiraṇyam | ā | dade ||8.65.11||

IAST: napāto durgahasya me sahasreṇa surādhasaḥ
Griffith: From Indra have I measured out a song eight-footed with nine parts,
pada pāṭha: napātaḥ | duḥ-gahasya | me | sahasreṇa | su-rādhasaḥ || śravaḥ | deveṣu | akrata ||8.65.12||

IAST: śravo deveṣv akrata
Griffith: Delicate, faithful. to the Law.
pada pāṭha: napātaḥ | duḥ-gahasya | me | sahasreṇa | su-rādhasaḥ || śravaḥ | deveṣu | akrata ||8.65.12||

IAST: tarobhir vo vidadvasum indraṁ sabādha ūtaye
Griffith: SCARCELY was Satakratu, born when of his Mother he inquired,
pada pāṭha: taraḥ-bhiḥ | vaḥ | vidat-vasum | indram | sa-bādhaḥ | ūtaye || br̥hat | gāyantaḥ | suta-some | adhvare | huve | bharam | na | kāriṇam ||8.66.1||

IAST: bṛhad gāyantaḥ sutasome adhvare huve bharaṁ na kāriṇam
Griffith: Who are the mighty? Who are famed?
Devanāgarī: बृहद्गायन्तः सुतसोमे अध्वरे हुवे भरं न कारिणम्
pada pāṭha: taraḥ-bhiḥ | vaḥ | vidat-vasum | indram | sa-bādhaḥ | ūtaye || br̥hat | gāyantaḥ | suta-some | adhvare | huve | bharam | na | kāriṇam ||8.66.1||

IAST: na yaṁ dudhrā varante na sthirā muro made suśipram andhasaḥ
Griffith: Then Savassi declared to him Aurnavabha, Ahisuva:
Devanāgarī: न यं दुध्रा वरन्ते न स्थिरा मुरो मदे सुशिप्रमन्धसः
pada pāṭha: na | yam | dudhrāḥ | varante | na | sthirāḥ | muraḥ | made | su-śipram | andhasaḥ || yaḥ | ā-dr̥tya | śaśamānāya | sunvate | dātā | jaritre | ukthyam ||8.66.2||

IAST: ya ādṛtyā śaśamānāya sunvate dātā jaritra ukthyam
Griffith: Son, these be they thou must o'erthrow
Devanāgarī: य आदृत्या शशमानाय सुन्वते दाता जरित्र उक्थ्यम्
pada pāṭha: na | yam | dudhrāḥ | varante | na | sthirāḥ | muraḥ | made | su-śipram | andhasaḥ || yaḥ | ā-dr̥tya | śaśamānāya | sunvate | dātā | jaritre | ukthyam ||8.66.2||

IAST: yaḥ śakro mṛkṣo aśvyo yo vā kījo hiraṇyayaḥ
Griffith: The Vrtra-slayer smote them all as spokes are hammered into naves:
Devanāgarī: यः शक्रो मृक्षो अश्व्यो यो वा कीजो हिरण्ययः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śakraḥ | mr̥kṣaḥ | aśvyaḥ | yaḥ | vā | kījaḥ | hiraṇyayaḥ || saḥ | ūrvasya | rejayati | apa-vr̥tim | indraḥ | gavyasya | vr̥tra-hā ||8.66.3||

IAST: sa ūrvasya rejayaty apāvṛtim indro gavyasya vṛtrahā
Griffith: The Dasyu-killer waxed in might.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śakraḥ | mr̥kṣaḥ | aśvyaḥ | yaḥ | vā | kījaḥ | hiraṇyayaḥ || saḥ | ūrvasya | rejayati | apa-vr̥tim | indraḥ | gavyasya | vr̥tra-hā ||8.66.3||

IAST: nikhātaṁ cid yaḥ purusambhṛtaṁ vasūd id vapati dāśuṣe
Griffith: Then Indra at a single draught drank the contents of thirty pails,
pada pāṭha: ni-khātam | cit | yaḥ | puru-saṁbhr̥tam | vasu | ut | it | vapati | dāśuṣe || vajrī | su-śipraḥ | hari-aśvaḥ | it | karat | indraḥ | kratvā | yathā | vaśat ||8.66.4||

IAST: vajrī suśipro haryaśva it karad indraḥ kratvā yathā vaśat
Griffith: Pails that were filled with Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: वज्री सुशिप्रो हर्यश्व इत्करदिन्द्रः क्रत्वा यथा वशत्
pada pāṭha: ni-khātam | cit | yaḥ | puru-saṁbhr̥tam | vasu | ut | it | vapati | dāśuṣe || vajrī | su-śipraḥ | hari-aśvaḥ | it | karat | indraḥ | kratvā | yathā | vaśat ||8.66.4||

IAST: yad vāvantha puruṣṭuta purā cic chūra nṛṇām
Griffith: Indra in groundless realms of space pierced the Gandharva through, that he
pada pāṭha: yat | vavantha | puru-stuta | purā | cit | śūra | nr̥ṇām || vayam | tat | te | indra | sam | bharāmasi | yajñam | uktham | turam | vacaḥ ||8.66.5||

IAST: vayaṁ tat ta indra sam bharāmasi yajñam ukthaṁ turaṁ vacaḥ
Griffith: Might make Brahmans' strength increase.
Devanāgarī: वयं तत्त इन्द्र सं भरामसि यज्ञमुक्थं तुरं वचः
pada pāṭha: yat | vavantha | puru-stuta | purā | cit | śūra | nr̥ṇām || vayam | tat | te | indra | sam | bharāmasi | yajñam | uktham | turam | vacaḥ ||8.66.5||

IAST: sacā someṣu puruhūta vajrivo madāya dyukṣa somapāḥ
Griffith: Down from the mountains Indra shot hither his well-directed shaft:
Devanāgarī: सचा सोमेषु पुरुहूत वज्रिवो मदाय द्युक्ष सोमपाः
pada pāṭha: sacā | someṣu | puru-hūta | vajri-vaḥ | madāya | dyukṣa | soma-pāḥ || tvam | it | hi | brahma-kr̥te | kāmyam | vasu | deṣṭhaḥ | sunvate | bhuvaḥ ||8.66.6||

IAST: tvam id dhi brahmakṛte kāmyaṁ vasu deṣṭhaḥ sunvate bhuvaḥ
Griffith: He gained the ready brew of rice.
Devanāgarī: त्वमिद्धि ब्रह्मकृते काम्यं वसु देष्ठः सुन्वते भुवः
pada pāṭha: sacā | someṣu | puru-hūta | vajri-vaḥ | madāya | dyukṣa | soma-pāḥ || tvam | it | hi | brahma-kr̥te | kāmyam | vasu | deṣṭhaḥ | sunvate | bhuvaḥ ||8.66.6||

IAST: vayam enam idā hyo 'pīpemeha vajriṇam
Griffith: One only is that shaft of thine, with thousand feathers, hundred barbs,
pada pāṭha: vayam | enam | idā | hyaḥ | apīpema | iha | vajriṇam || tasmai | ūm̐ iti | adya | samanā | sutam | bhara | ā | nūnam | bhūṣata | śrute ||8.66.7||

IAST: tasmā u adya samanā sutam bharā nūnam bhūṣata śrute
Griffith: Which, Indra, thou hast made thy friend.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा उ अद्य समना सुतं भरा नूनं भूषत श्रुते
pada pāṭha: vayam | enam | idā | hyaḥ | apīpema | iha | vajriṇam || tasmai | ūm̐ iti | adya | samanā | sutam | bhara | ā | nūnam | bhūṣata | śrute ||8.66.7||

IAST: vṛkaś cid asya vāraṇa urāmathir ā vayuneṣu bhūṣati
Griffith: Strong as the gbhus at thy birth, therewith to those who praise thee, men,
pada pāṭha: vr̥kaḥ | cit | asya | vāraṇaḥ | urā-mathiḥ | ā | vayuneṣu | bhūṣati || saḥ | imam | naḥ | stomam | jujuṣāṇaḥ | ā | gahi | indra | pra | citrayā | dhiyā ||8.66.8||

IAST: semaṁ naḥ stomaṁ jujuṣāṇa ā gahīndra pra citrayā dhiyā
Griffith: And women, bring thou food to eat.
Devanāgarī: सेमं नः स्तोमं जुजुषाण आ गहीन्द्र प्र चित्रया धिया

pada pāṭha: aṣāḷham | ugram | pr̥tanāsu | sasahim | yasmin | mahīḥ | uru-jrayaḥ || sam | dhenavaḥ | jāyamāne | anonavuḥ | dyāvaḥ | kṣāmaḥ | anonavuḥ ||8.70.4||

pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | mahaḥ | mahāyyam | indram | dānāya | sakṣaṇim || yaḥ | gādheṣu | yaḥ | ā-araṇeṣu | havyaḥ | vājeṣu | asti | havyaḥ ||8.70.8||

Griffith: Thyself with juices blent with milk.

Griffith: Drink thou, for thou art Lord thereof.

Griffith: Drink thou, for thou art Lord thereof.
pada pāṭha: agne | mākiḥ | te | devasya | rātim | adevaḥ | yuyota || tvam | īśiṣe | vasūnām ||8.71.8||

IAST: sa no vasva upa māsy ūrjo napān māhinasya

IAST: indra mā no vasor nir bhāk
Griffith: Hath far surpassed all things that are.
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | bhara | dakṣiṇena | abhi | savyena | pra | mr̥śa || indra | mā | naḥ | vasoḥ | niḥ | bhāk ||8.81.6||

IAST: upa kramasvā bhara dhṛṣatā dhṛṣṇo janānām
Griffith: Thou speedest down to succour us this ever-conquering God of yours,
Devanāgarī: उप क्रमस्वा भर धृषता धृष्णो जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: upa | kramasva | ā | bhara | dhr̥ṣatā | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | janānām || adāśūḥ-tarasya | vedaḥ ||8.81.7||

IAST: adāśūṣṭarasya vedaḥ
Griffith: Him who is drawn to all our songs
pada pāṭha: upa | kramasva | ā | bhara | dhr̥ṣatā | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | janānām || adāśūḥ-tarasya | vedaḥ ||8.81.7||

IAST: indra ya u nu te asti vājo viprebhiḥ sanitvaḥ
Griffith: The Warrior not to he restrained, the Soma-drinker ne'er o'erthrown,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र य उ नु ते अस्ति वाजो विप्रेभिः सनित्वः
pada pāṭha: indra | yaḥ | ūm̐ iti | nu | te | asti | vājaḥ | viprebhiḥ | sanitvaḥ || asmābhiḥ | su | tam | sanuhi ||8.81.8||

IAST: asmābhiḥ su taṁ sanuhi
Griffith: The Chieftain of resistless might.
pada pāṭha: indra | yaḥ | ūm̐ iti | nu | te | asti | vājaḥ | viprebhiḥ | sanitvaḥ || asmābhiḥ | su | tam | sanuhi ||8.81.8||

IAST: sadyojuvas te vājā asmabhyaṁ viśvaścandrāḥ
Griffith: O Indra, send us riches, thou Omniscient, worthy of our praise:
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ-juvaḥ | te | vājāḥ | asmabhyam | viśva-candrāḥ || vaśaiḥ | ca | makṣu | jarante ||8.81.9||

IAST: vaśaiś ca makṣū jarante
Griffith: Help us in the decisive fray.
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ-juvaḥ | te | vājāḥ | asmabhyam | viśva-candrāḥ || vaśaiḥ | ca | makṣu | jarante ||8.81.9||

IAST: ā pra drava parāvato 'rvāvataś ca vṛtrahan
Griffith: SURYA, thou mountest up to meet the Hero famous for his wealth,
pada pāṭha: ā | pra | drava | parā-vataḥ | arvā-vataḥ | ca | vr̥tra-han || madhvaḥ | prati | pra-bharmaṇi ||8.82.1||

IAST: madhvaḥ prati prabharmaṇi
Griffith: Who hurls the bolt and works for man
pada pāṭha: ā | pra | drava | parā-vataḥ | arvā-vataḥ | ca | vr̥tra-han || madhvaḥ | prati | pra-bharmaṇi ||8.82.1||

IAST: tīvrāḥ somāsa ā gahi sutāso mādayiṣṇavaḥ
Griffith: Him who with might of both his arms brake nine-and-ninety castles down,
Devanāgarī: तीव्राः सोमास आ गहि सुतासो मादयिष्णवः
pada pāṭha: tīvrāḥ | somāsaḥ | ā | gahi | sutāsaḥ | mādayiṣṇavaḥ || piba | dadhr̥k | yathā | ociṣe ||8.82.2||

IAST: pibā dadhṛg yathociṣe
Griffith: Slew Vrtra and smote Ahi dead.
pada pāṭha: tīvrāḥ | somāsaḥ | ā | gahi | sutāsaḥ | mādayiṣṇavaḥ || piba | dadhr̥k | yathā | ociṣe ||8.82.2||

IAST: iṣā mandasvād u te 'raṁ varāya manyave
Griffith: This Indra is our gracious Friend. He sends us in a full broad stream
pada pāṭha: iṣā | mandasva | āt | ūm̐ iti | te | aram | varāya | manyave || bhuvat | te | indra | śam | hr̥de ||8.82.3||

IAST: bhuvat ta indra śaṁ hṛde
Griffith: Riches in horses, kine, and corn.
pada pāṭha: iṣā | mandasva | āt | ūm̐ iti | te | aram | varāya | manyave || bhuvat | te | indra | śam | hr̥de ||8.82.3||

IAST: ā tv aśatrav ā gahi ny ukthāni ca hūyase
Griffith: Whatever, Vrtra-slayer! thou, Surya, hast risen upon to-day,
Devanāgarī: आ त्वशत्रवा गहि न्युक्थानि च हूयसे
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | aśatro iti | ā | gahi | ni | ukthāni | ca | hūyase || upa-me | rocane | divaḥ ||8.82.4||

IAST: upame rocane divaḥ
Griffith: Tbat, Indra, all is in thy power.
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | aśatro iti | ā | gahi | ni | ukthāni | ca | hūyase || upa-me | rocane | divaḥ ||8.82.4||

IAST: tubhyāyam adribhiḥ suto gobhiḥ śrīto madāya kam
Griffith: When, Mighty One, Lord of the brave, thou thinkest thus, I shall not die,
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यायमद्रिभिः सुतो गोभिः श्रीतो मदाय कम्
pada pāṭha: tubhya | ayam | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | gobhiḥ | śrītaḥ | madāya | kam || pra | somaḥ | indra | hūyate ||8.82.5||

IAST: pra soma indra hūyate
Griffith: That thought of thine is true indeed.
pada pāṭha: tubhya | ayam | adri-bhiḥ | sutaḥ | gobhiḥ | śrītaḥ | madāya | kam || pra | somaḥ | indra | hūyate ||8.82.5||

IAST: indra śrudhi su me havam asme sutasya gomataḥ
Griffith: Thou, Indra, goest unto all Soma libations shed for thee,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र श्रुधि सु मे हवमस्मे सुतस्य गोमतः
pada pāṭha: indra | śrudhi | su | me | havam | asme iti | sutasya | go-mataḥ || vi | pītim | tr̥ptim | aśnuhi ||8.82.6||

IAST: vi pītiṁ tṛptim aśnuhi
Griffith: Both far away and near at hand.
pada pāṭha: indra | śrudhi | su | me | havam | asme iti | sutasya | go-mataḥ || vi | pītim | tr̥ptim | aśnuhi ||8.82.6||

IAST: ya indra camaseṣv ā somaś camūṣu te sutaḥ
Griffith: We make this Indra very strong to strike the mighty Vrtra dead:
Devanāgarī: य इन्द्र चमसेष्वा सोमश्चमूषु ते सुतः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indra | camaseṣu | ā | somaḥ | camūṣu | te | sutaḥ || piba | it | asya | tvam | īśiṣe ||8.82.7||

IAST: pibed asya tvam īśiṣe
Griffith: A vigorous Hero shall he be.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indra | camaseṣu | ā | somaḥ | camūṣu | te | sutaḥ || piba | it | asya | tvam | īśiṣe ||8.82.7||

IAST: yo apsu candramā iva somaś camūṣu dadṛśe
Griffith: Indra was made for giving, set, most mighty, o'er the joyous draught.
Devanāgarī: यो अप्सु चन्द्रमा इव सोमश्चमूषु ददृशे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ap-su | candramāḥ-iva | somaḥ | camūṣu | dadr̥śe || piba | it | asya | tvam | īśiṣe ||8.82.8||

IAST: pibed asya tvam īśiṣe
Griffith: Bright, meet for Soma, famed in song.
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ap-su | candramāḥ-iva | somaḥ | camūṣu | dadr̥śe || piba | it | asya | tvam | īśiṣe ||8.82.8||

IAST: yaṁ te śyenaḥ padābharat tiro rajāṁsy aspṛtam
Griffith: By song as 'twere, the powerful bolt which none may parry was prepared
pada pāṭha: yam | te | śyenaḥ | padā | ā | abharat | tiraḥ | rajāṁsi | aspr̥tam || piba | it | asya | tvam | īśiṣe ||8.82.9||

IAST: pibed asya tvam īśiṣe
Griffith: Lofty, invincible he grew.
pada pāṭha: yam | te | śyenaḥ | padā | ā | abharat | tiraḥ | rajāṁsi | aspr̥tam || piba | it | asya | tvam | īśiṣe ||8.82.9||

IAST: devānām id avo mahat tad ā vṛṇīmahe vayam
Griffith: THE Cow, the famous Mother of the wealthy Maruts, pours her milk:
pada pāṭha: devānām | it | avaḥ | mahat | tat | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe | vayam || vr̥ṣṇām | asmabhyam | ūtaye ||8.83.1||

IAST: vṛṣṇām asmabhyam ūtaye
Griffith: Both horses of the cars are yoked,-
pada pāṭha: devānām | it | avaḥ | mahat | tat | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe | vayam || vr̥ṣṇām | asmabhyam | ūtaye ||8.83.1||

IAST: te naḥ santu yujaḥ sadā varuṇo mitro aryamā
Griffith: She in whose bosom all the Gods, and Sun and Moon for men to see,
Devanāgarī: ते नः सन्तु युजः सदा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | santu | yujaḥ | sadā | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || vr̥dhāsaḥ | ca | pra-cetasaḥ ||8.83.2||

IAST: vṛdhāsaś ca pracetasaḥ
Griffith: Maintain their everlasting Laws.
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | santu | yujaḥ | sadā | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || vr̥dhāsaḥ | ca | pra-cetasaḥ ||8.83.2||

IAST: ati no viṣpitā puru naubhir apo na parṣatha
Griffith: This all the pious sing to us, and sacred poets evermore:
Devanāgarī: अति नो विष्पिता पुरु नौभिरपो न पर्षथ
pada pāṭha: ati | naḥ | viṣpitā | puru | naubhiḥ | apaḥ | na | parṣatha || yūyam | r̥tasya | rathyaḥ ||8.83.3||

IAST: yūyam ṛtasya rathyaḥ
Griffith: The Maruts to the Soma-draught
pada pāṭha: ati | naḥ | viṣpitā | puru | naubhiḥ | apaḥ | na | parṣatha || yūyam | r̥tasya | rathyaḥ ||8.83.3||

IAST: vāmaṁ no astv aryaman vāmaṁ varuṇa śaṁsyam
Griffith: Here is the Soma ready pressed of this the Maruts drink, of this
pada pāṭha: vāmam | naḥ | astu | aryaman | vāmam | varuṇa | śaṁsyam || vāmam | hi | ā-vr̥ṇīmahe ||8.83.4||

IAST: vāmaṁ hy āvṛṇīmahe
Griffith: Self-luminous the Asvins drink.
pada pāṭha: vāmam | naḥ | astu | aryaman | vāmam | varuṇa | śaṁsyam || vāmam | hi | ā-vr̥ṇīmahe ||8.83.4||

IAST: vāmasya hi pracetasa īśānāśo riśādasaḥ
Griffith: Of this, moreover, purified, set in three places, procreant,
pada pāṭha: vāmasya | hi | pra-cetasaḥ | īśānāsaḥ | riśādasaḥ || na | īm | ādityāḥ | aghasya | yat ||8.83.5||

IAST: nem ādityā aghasya yat
Griffith: Drink Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman.
pada pāṭha: vāmasya | hi | pra-cetasaḥ | īśānāsaḥ | riśādasaḥ || na | īm | ādityāḥ | aghasya | yat ||8.83.5||

IAST: vayam id vaḥ sudānavaḥ kṣiyanto yānto adhvann ā
Griffith: And Indra, like the Herald Priest, desirous of the milky juice,
pada pāṭha: vayam | it | vaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | kṣiyantaḥ | yāntaḥ | adhvan | ā || devāḥ | vr̥dhāya | hūmahe ||8.83.6||

IAST: devā vṛdhāya hūmahe
Griffith: At early morn will quaff thereof.
pada pāṭha: vayam | it | vaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | kṣiyantaḥ | yāntaḥ | adhvan | ā || devāḥ | vr̥dhāya | hūmahe ||8.83.6||

IAST: adhi na indraiṣāṁ viṣṇo sajātyānām
Griffith: When have the Princes gleamed and shone through waters as through troops of foes'?
pada pāṭha: adhi | naḥ | indra | eṣām | viṣṇo iti | sa-jātyānām || ita | marutaḥ | aśvinā ||8.83.7||

IAST: itā maruto aśvinā
Griffith: When hasten they whose might ispure?
pada pāṭha: adhi | naḥ | indra | eṣām | viṣṇo iti | sa-jātyānām || ita | marutaḥ | aśvinā ||8.83.7||

IAST: pra bhrātṛtvaṁ sudānavo 'dha dvitā samānyā
Griffith: What favour do I claim this day of you great Deities, you who are
pada pāṭha: pra | bhrātr̥-tvam | su-dānavaḥ | adha | dvitā | samānyā || mātuḥ | garbhe | bharāmahe ||8.83.8||

IAST: mātur garbhe bharāmahe
Griffith: Wondrously splendid in yourselves?
pada pāṭha: pra | bhrātr̥-tvam | su-dānavaḥ | adha | dvitā | samānyā || mātuḥ | garbhe | bharāmahe ||8.83.8||

IAST: yūyaṁ hi ṣṭhā sudānava indrajyeṣṭhā abhidyavaḥ
Griffith: call, to drink the Soma, those Maruts who spread all realms of earth
Devanāgarī: यूयं हि ष्ठा सुदानव इन्द्रज्येष्ठा अभिद्यवः
pada pāṭha: yūyam | hi | stha | su-dānavaḥ | indra-jyeṣṭhāḥ | abhi-dyavaḥ || adha | cit | vaḥ | uta | bruve ||8.83.9||

IAST: adhā cid va uta bruve
Griffith: And luminous regions of the sky.
pada pāṭha: yūyam | hi | stha | su-dānavaḥ | indra-jyeṣṭhāḥ | abhi-dyavaḥ || adha | cit | vaḥ | uta | bruve ||8.83.9||

IAST: preṣṭhaṁ vo atithiṁ stuṣe mitram iva priyam
Griffith: SONG-LOVER! like a charioteer come songs to thee when Soma flows.
Devanāgarī: प्रेष्ठं वो अतिथिं स्तुषे मित्रमिव प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: preṣṭham | vaḥ | atithim | stuṣe | mitram-iva | priyam || agnim | ratham | na | vedyam ||8.84.1||

IAST: agniṁ rathaṁ na vedyam
Griffith: O Indra, they have called to thee as mother-kine unto their calves.
pada pāṭha: preṣṭham | vaḥ | atithim | stuṣe | mitram-iva | priyam || agnim | ratham | na | vedyam ||8.84.1||

IAST: kavim iva pracetasaṁ yaṁ devāso adha dvitā
Griffith: Bright juices bitherward have sped thee, Indra, Lover of the Song.
Devanāgarī: कविमिव प्रचेतसं यं देवासो अध द्विता
pada pāṭha: kavim-iva | pra-cetasam | yam | devāsaḥ | adha | dvitā || ni | martyeṣu | ā-dadhuḥ ||8.84.2||

IAST: ni martyeṣv ādadhuḥ
Griffith: Drink, Indra, of this flowing sap: in every house 'tis set for thee.
pada pāṭha: kavim-iva | pra-cetasam | yam | devāsaḥ | adha | dvitā || ni | martyeṣu | ā-dadhuḥ ||8.84.2||

IAST: tvaṁ yaviṣṭha dāśuṣo nṝm̐ḥ pāhi śṛṇudhī giraḥ
Griffith: Drink Soma to inspirit thee, juice, Indra, which the Falcon brought:
Devanāgarī: त्वं यविष्ठ दाशुषो नॄँः पाहि शृणुधी गिरः
pada pāṭha: tvam | yaviṣṭha | dāśuṣaḥ | nr̥̄n | pāhi | śr̥ṇudhi | giraḥ || rakṣa | tokam | uta | tmanā ||8.84.3||

IAST: rakṣā tokam uta tmanā
Griffith: For thou art King and Sovran Lord of all the families of men.
pada pāṭha: tvam | yaviṣṭha | dāśuṣaḥ | nr̥̄n | pāhi | śr̥ṇudhi | giraḥ || rakṣa | tokam | uta | tmanā ||8.84.3||

IAST: kayā te agne aṅgira ūrjo napād upastutim
Griffith: O Indra, hear Tirasci's call, the call of him who serveth thee.
Devanāgarī: कया ते अग्ने अङ्गिर ऊर्जो नपादुपस्तुतिम्
pada pāṭha: kayā | te | agne | aṅgiraḥ | ūrjaḥ | napāt | upa-stutim || varāya | deva | manyave ||8.84.4||

IAST: varāya deva manyave
Griffith: Satisfy him with wealth of kine and valiant offspring: Great art thou.
pada pāṭha: kayā | te | agne | aṅgiraḥ | ūrjaḥ | napāt | upa-stutim || varāya | deva | manyave ||8.84.4||

IAST: dāśema kasya manasā yajñasya sahaso yaho
Griffith: For he, O Indra, hath produced for thee the newest gladdening song,
Devanāgarī: दाशेम कस्य मनसा यज्ञस्य सहसो यहो
pada pāṭha: dāśema | kasya | manasā | yajñasya | sahasaḥ | yaho iti || kat | ūm̐ iti | voce | idam | namaḥ ||8.84.5||

IAST: kad u voca idaṁ namaḥ
Griffith: A hymn that springs from careful thought, ancient, and full of sacred truth.
pada pāṭha: dāśema | kasya | manasā | yajñasya | sahasaḥ | yaho iti || kat | ūm̐ iti | voce | idam | namaḥ ||8.84.5||

IAST: adhā tvaṁ hi nas karo viśvā asmabhyaṁ sukṣitīḥ
Griffith: That Indra will we laud whom songs and hymns of praise have magnified.
Devanāgarī: अधा त्वं हि नस्करो विश्वा अस्मभ्यं सुक्षितीः
pada pāṭha: adha | tvam | hi | naḥ | karaḥ | viśvāḥ | asmabhyam | su-kṣitīḥ || vāja-draviṇasaḥ | giraḥ ||8.84.6||

IAST: vājadraviṇaso giraḥ
Griffith: Striving to win, we celebrate his many deeds of hero might.
pada pāṭha: adha | tvam | hi | naḥ | karaḥ | viśvāḥ | asmabhyam | su-kṣitīḥ || vāja-draviṇasaḥ | giraḥ ||8.84.6||

IAST: kasya nūnam parīṇaso dhiyo jinvasi dampate
Griffith: Come now and let us glorify pure Indra with pure Sama hymns.
Devanāgarī: कस्य नूनं परीणसो धियो जिन्वसि दम्पते
pada pāṭha: kasya | nūnam | parīṇasaḥ | dhiyaḥ | jinvasi | dam-pate || go-sātā | yasya | te | giraḥ ||8.84.7||

IAST: goṣātā yasya te giraḥ
Griffith: Let the pure milky draught delight him strengthened by pure songs of praise.
pada pāṭha: kasya | nūnam | parīṇasaḥ | dhiyaḥ | jinvasi | dam-pate || go-sātā | yasya | te | giraḥ ||8.84.7||

IAST: tam marjayanta sukratum puroyāvānam ājiṣu
Griffith: O Indra, come thou pure to us, with pure assistance, pure thyself.
pada pāṭha: tam | marjayanta | su-kratum | puraḥ-yāvānam | ājiṣu || sveṣu | kṣayeṣu | vājinam ||8.84.8||

IAST: sveṣu kṣayeṣu vājinam
Griffith: Pure, send thou riches down to us, and, meet for Soma, pure, be glad.
pada pāṭha: tam | marjayanta | su-kratum | puraḥ-yāvānam | ājiṣu || sveṣu | kṣayeṣu | vājinam ||8.84.8||

IAST: kṣeti kṣemebhiḥ sādhubhir nakir yaṁ ghnanti hanti yaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, pure, vouchsafe us wealth, and, pure, enrich the worshipper.
Devanāgarī: क्षेति क्षेमेभिः साधुभिर्नकिर्यं घ्नन्ति हन्ति यः
pada pāṭha: kṣeti | kṣemebhiḥ | sādhu-bhiḥ | nakiḥ | yam | ghnanti | hanti | yaḥ || agne | su-vīraḥ | edhate ||8.84.9||

IAST: agne suvīra edhate
Griffith: Pure, thou dost strike the Vrtras dead, and strivest, pure, to win the spoil.
pada pāṭha: kṣeti | kṣemebhiḥ | sādhu-bhiḥ | nakiḥ | yam | ghnanti | hanti | yaḥ || agne | su-vīraḥ | edhate ||8.84.9||

IAST: ā me havaṁ nāsatyāśvinā gacchataṁ yuvam
Griffith: FOR him the Mornings made their courses longer, and Nights with pleasant voices spake to Indra.
Devanāgarī: आ मे हवं नासत्याश्विना गच्छतं युवम्
pada pāṭha: ā | me | havam | nāsatyā | aśvinā | gacchatam | yuvam || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.1||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: For him the Floods stood still, the Seven Mothers, Streams easy for the heroes to pass over.
pada pāṭha: ā | me | havam | nāsatyā | aśvinā | gacchatam | yuvam || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.1||

IAST: imam me stomam aśvinemam me śṛṇutaṁ havam
Griffith: The Darter penetrated, though in trouble, thrice-seven close-pressed ridges of the mountains.
Devanāgarī: इमं मे स्तोममश्विनेमं मे शृणुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: imam | me | stomam | aśvinā | imam | me | śr̥ṇutam | havam || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.2||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: Neither might God nor mortal man accomplish what the Strong Hero wrought in full-grown vigour.
pada pāṭha: imam | me | stomam | aśvinā | imam | me | śr̥ṇutam | havam || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.2||

IAST: ayaṁ vāṁ kṛṣṇo aśvinā havate vājinīvasū
Griffith: The mightiest force is Indra's bolt of iron when firmly grasped in both the arms of Indra.
Devanāgarī: अयं वां कृष्णो अश्विना हवते वाजिनीवसू
pada pāṭha: ayam | vām | kr̥ṣṇaḥ | aśvinā | havate | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.3||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: His head and mouth have powers that pass all others, and all his people hasten near to listen.
pada pāṭha: ayam | vām | kr̥ṣṇaḥ | aśvinā | havate | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.3||

IAST: śṛṇutaṁ jaritur havaṁ kṛṣṇasya stuvato narā
Griffith: count thee as the Holiest of the Holy, the caster-down of what hath ne'er been shaken.
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇutam | jarituḥ | havam | kr̥ṣṇasya | stuvataḥ | narā || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.4||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: I count thee as the Banner of the heroes, I count thee as the Chief of all men living.
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇutam | jarituḥ | havam | kr̥ṣṇasya | stuvataḥ | narā || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.4||

IAST: chardir yantam adābhyaṁ viprāya stuvate narā
Griffith: What time, O Indra, in thine arms thou tookest thy wildly rushing bolt to Slay the Dragon,
pada pāṭha: chardiḥ | yantam | adābhyam | viprāya | stuvate | narā || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.5||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: The mountains roared, the cattle loudly bellowed, the Brahmans with their hymns drew nigh to Indra.
pada pāṭha: chardiḥ | yantam | adābhyam | viprāya | stuvate | narā || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.5||

IAST: gacchataṁ dāśuṣo gṛham itthā stuvato aśvinā
Griffith: Let us praise him who made these worlds and creatures, all things that after him sprang into being.
pada pāṭha: gacchatam | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham | itthā | stuvataḥ | aśvinā || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.6||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: May we win Mitra with our songs, and Indra, and. wait upon our Lord with adoration.
pada pāṭha: gacchatam | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham | itthā | stuvataḥ | aśvinā || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.6||

IAST: yuñjāthāṁ rāsabhaṁ rathe vīḍvaṅge vṛṣaṇvasū
Griffith: Flying in terror from the snort of Vrtra, all Deities who were thy friends forsook thee.
pada pāṭha: yuñjāthām | rāsabham | rathe | vīḷu-aṅge | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.7||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: So, Indra, be thy friendship with the Maruts: in all these battles thou shalt be the victor.
pada pāṭha: yuñjāthām | rāsabham | rathe | vīḷu-aṅge | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.7||

IAST: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā rathenā yātam aśvinā
Griffith: Thrice-sixty Maruts, waxing strong, were with thee, like piles of beaming light, worthy of worship.
pada pāṭha: tri-vandhureṇa | tri-vr̥tā | rathena | ā | yātam | aśvinā || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.8||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: We come to thee: grant us a happy portion. Let us adore thy might with this oblation.
pada pāṭha: tri-vandhureṇa | tri-vr̥tā | rathena | ā | yātam | aśvinā || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.8||

IAST: nū me giro nāsatyāśvinā prāvataṁ yuvam
Griffith: A sharpened weapon is the host of Maruts. Who, Indra, dares withstand thy bolt of thunder?
Devanāgarī: नू मे गिरो नासत्याश्विना प्रावतं युवम्
pada pāṭha: nu | me | giraḥ | nāsatyā | aśvinā | pra | avatam | yuvam || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.9||

IAST: madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
Griffith: Weaponless are the Asuras, the godless: scatter them with thy wheel, Impetuous Hero.
pada pāṭha: nu | me | giraḥ | nāsatyā | aśvinā | pra | avatam | yuvam || madhvaḥ | somasya | pītaye ||8.85.9||

IAST: ubhā hi dasrā bhiṣajā mayobhuvobhā dakṣasya vacaso babhūvathuḥ
Griffith: O INDRA, Lord of Light, what joys thou broughtest from the Asuras,
Devanāgarī: उभा हि दस्रा भिषजा मयोभुवोभा दक्षस्य वचसो बभूवथुः
pada pāṭha: ubhā | hi | dasrā | bhiṣajā | mayaḥ-bhuvā | ubhā | dakṣasya | vacasaḥ | babhūvathuḥ || tā | vām | viśvakaḥ | havate | tanū-kr̥the | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.1||

IAST: tā vāṁ viśvako havate tanūkṛthe mā no vi yauṣṭaṁ sakhyā mumocatam
Griffith: Prosper therewith, O Maghavan, him who lauds that deed, and those whose grass is trimmed for thee.
Devanāgarī: ता वां विश्वको हवते तनूकृथे मा नो वि यौष्टं सख्या मुमोचतम्
pada pāṭha: ubhā | hi | dasrā | bhiṣajā | mayaḥ-bhuvā | ubhā | dakṣasya | vacasaḥ | babhūvathuḥ || tā | vām | viśvakaḥ | havate | tanū-kr̥the | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.1||

IAST: kathā nūnaṁ vāṁ vimanā upa stavad yuvaṁ dhiyaṁ dadathur vasyaïṣṭaye
Griffith: The unwasting share of steeds and kine which, Indra, thou hast fast secured,
Devanāgarī: कथा नूनं वां विमना उप स्तवद्युवं धियं ददथुर्वस्य‍इष्टये
pada pāṭha: kathā | nūnam | vām | vi-manāḥ | upa | stavat | yuvam | dhiyam | dadathuḥ | vasyaḥ-iṣṭaye || tā | vām | viśvakaḥ | havate | tanū-kr̥the | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.2||

IAST: tā vāṁ viśvako havate tanūkṛthe mā no vi yauṣṭaṁ sakhyā mumocatam
Griffith: Grant to the worshipper who presses Soma and gives guerdon, not unto the churl.
Devanāgarī: ता वां विश्वको हवते तनूकृथे मा नो वि यौष्टं सख्या मुमोचतम्
pada pāṭha: kathā | nūnam | vām | vi-manāḥ | upa | stavat | yuvam | dhiyam | dadathuḥ | vasyaḥ-iṣṭaye || tā | vām | viśvakaḥ | havate | tanū-kr̥the | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.2||

IAST: yuvaṁ hi ṣmā purubhujemam edhatuṁ viṣṇāpve dadathur vasyaïṣṭaye
Griffith: The riteless, godless man who sleeps, O Indra, his unbroken steep,-
Devanāgarī: युवं हि ष्मा पुरुभुजेममेधतुं विष्णाप्वे ददथुर्वस्य‍इष्टये
pada pāṭha: yuvam | hi | sma | puru-bhujā | imam | edhatum | viṣṇāpve | dadathuḥ | vasyaḥ-iṣṭaye || tā | vām | viśvakaḥ | havate | tanū-kr̥the | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.3||

IAST: tā vāṁ viśvako havate tanūkṛthe mā no vi yauṣṭaṁ sakhyā mumocatam
Griffith: May he by following his own devices die. Hide from him wealth that nourishes.
Devanāgarī: ता वां विश्वको हवते तनूकृथे मा नो वि यौष्टं सख्या मुमोचतम्
pada pāṭha: yuvam | hi | sma | puru-bhujā | imam | edhatum | viṣṇāpve | dadathuḥ | vasyaḥ-iṣṭaye || tā | vām | viśvakaḥ | havate | tanū-kr̥the | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.3||

IAST: uta tyaṁ vīraṁ dhanasām ṛjīṣiṇaṁ dūre cit santam avase havāmahe
Griffith: Whether, O Sakra, thou be far, or, Vrtra-slayer, near at hand,
Devanāgarī: उत त्यं वीरं धनसामृजीषिणं दूरे चित्सन्तमवसे हवामहे
pada pāṭha: uta | tyam | vīram | dhana-sām | r̥jīṣiṇam | dūre | cit | santam | avase | havāmahe || yasya | svādiṣṭhā | su-matiḥ | pituḥ | yathā | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.4||

IAST: yasya svādiṣṭhā sumatiḥ pitur yathā mā no vi yauṣṭaṁ sakhyā mumocatam
Griffith: Thence by heaven-reaching songs he who hath pressed the juice invites thee with thy long-maned Steeds.
Devanāgarī: यस्य स्वादिष्ठा सुमतिः पितुर्यथा मा नो वि यौष्टं सख्या मुमोचतम्
pada pāṭha: uta | tyam | vīram | dhana-sām | r̥jīṣiṇam | dūre | cit | santam | avase | havāmahe || yasya | svādiṣṭhā | su-matiḥ | pituḥ | yathā | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.4||

IAST: ṛtena devaḥ savitā śamāyata ṛtasya śṛṅgam urviyā vi paprathe
Griffith: Whether thou art in heaven's bright sphere, or in the basin of the sea;
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन देवः सविता शमायत ऋतस्य शृङ्गमुर्विया वि पप्रथे
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | devaḥ | savitā | śam-āyate | r̥tasya | śr̥ṅgam | urviyā | vi | paprathe || r̥tam | sasāha | mahi | cit | pr̥tanyataḥ | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.5||

IAST: ṛtaṁ sāsāha mahi cit pṛtanyato mā no vi yauṣṭaṁ sakhyā mumocatam
Griffith: Whether, chief Vrtra-slayer, in some place on earth, or in the firmament, approach.
Devanāgarī: ऋतं सासाह महि चित्पृतन्यतो मा नो वि यौष्टं सख्या मुमोचतम्
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | devaḥ | savitā | śam-āyate | r̥tasya | śr̥ṅgam | urviyā | vi | paprathe || r̥tam | sasāha | mahi | cit | pr̥tanyataḥ | mā | naḥ | vi | yauṣṭam | sakhyā | mumocatam ||8.86.5||

IAST: dyumnī vāṁ stomo aśvinā krivir na seka ā gatam
Griffith: To Indra sing a Sama hymn, a lofty song to Lofty Sage,
Devanāgarī: द्युम्नी वां स्तोमो अश्विना क्रिविर्न सेक आ गतम्
pada pāṭha: dyumnī | vām | stomaḥ | aśvinā | kriviḥ | na | seke | ā | gatam || madhvaḥ | sutasya | saḥ | divi | priyaḥ | narā | pātam | gaurau-iva | iriṇe ||8.87.1||

IAST: madhvaḥ sutasya sa divi priyo narā pātaṁ gaurāv iveriṇe
Griffith: To him who guards the Law, inspired, and fain for praise.
Devanāgarī: मध्वः सुतस्य स दिवि प्रियो नरा पातं गौराविवेरिणे
pada pāṭha: dyumnī | vām | stomaḥ | aśvinā | kriviḥ | na | seke | ā | gatam || madhvaḥ | sutasya | saḥ | divi | priyaḥ | narā | pātam | gaurau-iva | iriṇe ||8.87.1||

IAST: pibataṁ gharmam madhumantam aśvinā barhiḥ sīdataṁ narā
Griffith: Thou, Indra, art the Conqueror: thou gavest splendour to the Sun.
Devanāgarī: पिबतं घर्मं मधुमन्तमश्विना बर्हिः सीदतं नरा
pada pāṭha: pibatam | gharmam | madhu-mantam | aśvinā | ā | barhiḥ | sīdatam | narā || tā | mandasānā | manuṣaḥ | duroṇe | ā | ni | pātam | vedasā | vayaḥ ||8.87.2||

IAST: tā mandasānā manuṣo duroṇa ā ni pātaṁ vedasā vayaḥ
Griffith: Maker of all things, thou art Mighty and All-God.
Devanāgarī: ता मन्दसाना मनुषो दुरोण आ नि पातं वेदसा वयः
pada pāṭha: pibatam | gharmam | madhu-mantam | aśvinā | ā | barhiḥ | sīdatam | narā || tā | mandasānā | manuṣaḥ | duroṇe | ā | ni | pātam | vedasā | vayaḥ ||8.87.2||

IAST: ā vāṁ viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ priyamedhā ahūṣata
Griffith: Radiant with light thou wentest to the sky, the luminous realm of heaven.
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | priya-medhāḥ | ahūṣata || tā | vartiḥ | yātam | upa | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | juṣṭam | yajñam | diviṣṭiṣu ||8.87.3||

IAST: tā vartir yātam upa vṛktabarhiṣo juṣṭaṁ yajñaṁ diviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: ne Deities, Indra strove to win thee for their Friend.
Devanāgarī: ता वर्तिर्यातमुप वृक्तबर्हिषो जुष्टं यज्ञं दिविष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | priya-medhāḥ | ahūṣata || tā | vartiḥ | yātam | upa | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | juṣṭam | yajñam | diviṣṭiṣu ||8.87.3||

IAST: pibataṁ somam madhumantam aśvinā barhiḥ sīdataṁ sumat
Griffith: Come unto us, O Indra, dear, still conquering, unconcealable,
Devanāgarī: पिबतं सोमं मधुमन्तमश्विना बर्हिः सीदतं सुमत्
pada pāṭha: pibatam | somam | madhu-mantam | aśvinā | ā | barhiḥ | sīdatam | su-mat || tā | vavr̥dhānau | upa | su-stutim | divaḥ | gantam | gaurau-iva | iriṇam ||8.87.4||

IAST: tā vāvṛdhānā upa suṣṭutiṁ divo gantaṁ gaurāv iveriṇam
Griffith: Vast as a mountain spread on all sides, Lord of Heaven.
Devanāgarī: ता वावृधाना उप सुष्टुतिं दिवो गन्तं गौराविवेरिणम्
pada pāṭha: pibatam | somam | madhu-mantam | aśvinā | ā | barhiḥ | sīdatam | su-mat || tā | vavr̥dhānau | upa | su-stutim | divaḥ | gantam | gaurau-iva | iriṇam ||8.87.4||

IAST: ā nūnaṁ yātam aśvināśvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ
Griffith: O truthful Soma-drinker, thou art mightier than both the worlds.
pada pāṭha: ā | nūnam | yātam | aśvinā | aśvebhiḥ | pruṣitapsu-bhiḥ || dasrā | hiraṇyavartanī iti hiraṇya-vartanī | śubhaḥ | patī iti | pātam | somam | r̥ta-vr̥dhā ||8.87.5||

IAST: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī śubhas patī pātaṁ somam ṛtāvṛdhā
Griffith: Thou strengthenest him who pours libation, Lord of Heaven.
pada pāṭha: ā | nūnam | yātam | aśvinā | aśvebhiḥ | pruṣitapsu-bhiḥ || dasrā | hiraṇyavartanī iti hiraṇya-vartanī | śubhaḥ | patī iti | pātam | somam | r̥ta-vr̥dhā ||8.87.5||

IAST: vayaṁ hi vāṁ havāmahe vipanyavo viprāso vājasātaye
Griffith: For thou art he, O Indra, wiio stormeth all castles of the foe,
Devanāgarī: वयं हि वां हवामहे विपन्यवो विप्रासो वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: vayam | hi | vām | havāmahe | vipanyavaḥ | viprāsaḥ | vāja-sātaye || tā | valgū iti | dasrā | puru-daṁsasā | dhiyā | aśvinā | śruṣṭī | ā | gatam ||8.87.6||

IAST: tā valgū dasrā purudaṁsasā dhiyāśvinā śruṣṭy ā gatam
Griffith: Slayer of Dasyus, man's Supporter, Lord of Heaven.
Devanāgarī: ता वल्गू दस्रा पुरुदंससा धियाश्विना श्रुष्ट्या गतम्
pada pāṭha: vayam | hi | vām | havāmahe | vipanyavaḥ | viprāsaḥ | vāja-sātaye || tā | valgū iti | dasrā | puru-daṁsasā | dhiyā | aśvinā | śruṣṭī | ā | gatam ||8.87.6||

IAST: taṁ vo dasmam ṛtīṣahaṁ vasor mandānam andhasaḥ
Griffith: O THUNDERER, zealous worshippers gave thee drink this time yesterday.
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | dasmam | r̥ti-saham | vasoḥ | mandānam | andhasaḥ || abhi | vatsam | na | svasareṣu | dhenavaḥ | indram | gīḥ-bhiḥ | navāmahe ||8.88.1||

IAST: abhi vatsaṁ na svasareṣu dhenava indraṁ gīrbhir navāmahe
Griffith: So, Indra, listen here to those who bring the laud: come near unto our dwellingplace.
Devanāgarī: अभि वत्सं न स्वसरेषु धेनव इन्द्रं गीर्भिर्नवामहे
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | dasmam | r̥ti-saham | vasoḥ | mandānam | andhasaḥ || abhi | vatsam | na | svasareṣu | dhenavaḥ | indram | gīḥ-bhiḥ | navāmahe ||8.88.1||

IAST: dyukṣaṁ sudānuṁ taviṣībhir āvṛtaṁ giriṁ na purubhojasam
Griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, fair-helmed, rejoice thee: this we crave. Here the disposers wait on thee.
Devanāgarī: द्युक्षं सुदानुं तविषीभिरावृतं गिरिं न पुरुभोजसम्
pada pāṭha: dyukṣam | su-dānum | taviṣībhiḥ | ā-vr̥tam | girim | na | puru-bhojasam || kṣu-mantam | vājam | śatinam | sahasriṇam | makṣu | go-mantam | īmahe ||8.88.2||

IAST: kṣumantaṁ vājaṁ śatinaṁ sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe
Griffith: Thy loftiest glories claim our lauds beside the juice, O Indra, Lover of the Song.
Devanāgarī: क्षुमन्तं वाजं शतिनं सहस्रिणं मक्षू गोमन्तमीमहे
pada pāṭha: dyukṣam | su-dānum | taviṣībhiḥ | ā-vr̥tam | girim | na | puru-bhojasam || kṣu-mantam | vājam | śatinam | sahasriṇam | makṣu | go-mantam | īmahe ||8.88.2||

IAST: na tvā bṛhanto adrayo varanta indra vīḻavaḥ
Griffith: Turning, as 'twere, to meet the Sun, enjoy from Indra all good things.
Devanāgarī: न त्वा बृहन्तो अद्रयो वरन्त इन्द्र वीळवः
pada pāṭha: na | tvā | br̥hantaḥ | adrayaḥ | varante | indra | vīḷavaḥ || yat | ditsasi | stuvate | mā-vate | vasu | nakiḥ | tat | ā | mināti | te ||8.88.3||

IAST: yad ditsasi stuvate māvate vasu nakiṣ ṭad ā mināti te
Griffith: When he who will be born is born with power we look to treasures as our heritage.
Devanāgarī: यद्दित्ससि स्तुवते मावते वसु नकिष्टदा मिनाति ते
pada pāṭha: na | tvā | br̥hantaḥ | adrayaḥ | varante | indra | vīḷavaḥ || yat | ditsasi | stuvate | mā-vate | vasu | nakiḥ | tat | ā | mināti | te ||8.88.3||

IAST: yoddhāsi kratvā śavasota daṁsanā viśvā jātābhi majmanā
Griffith: Praise him who sends us wealth, whose bounties injure none: good are the gifts which Indra. grants.
Devanāgarī: योद्धासि क्रत्वा शवसोत दंसना विश्वा जाताभि मज्मना
pada pāṭha: yoddhā | asi | kratvā | śavasā | uta | daṁsanā | viśvā | jātā | abhi | majmanā || ā | tvā | ayam | arkaḥ | ūtaye | vavartati | yam | gotamāḥ | ajījanan ||8.88.4||

IAST: ā tvāyam arka ūtaye vavartati yaṁ gotamā ajījanan
Griffith: He is not worth with one who satisfies his wish: he turns his mind to giving boons.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वायमर्क ऊतये ववर्तति यं गोतमा अजीजनन्
pada pāṭha: yoddhā | asi | kratvā | śavasā | uta | daṁsanā | viśvā | jātā | abhi | majmanā || ā | tvā | ayam | arkaḥ | ūtaye | vavartati | yam | gotamāḥ | ajījanan ||8.88.4||

IAST: pra hi ririkṣa ojasā divo antebhyas pari
Griffith: Thou in thy battles, Indra, art subduer of all hostile bands.
Devanāgarī: प्र हि रिरिक्ष ओजसा दिवो अन्तेभ्यस्परि
pada pāṭha: pra | hi | ririkṣe | ojasā | divaḥ | antebhyaḥ | pari || na | tvā | vivyāca | rajaḥ | indra | pārthivam | anu | svadhām | vavakṣitha ||8.88.5||

IAST: na tvā vivyāca raja indra pārthivam anu svadhāṁ vavakṣitha
Griffith: Father art thou, aIl-conquering, cancelling the curse, thou victor of the vanquisher.
Devanāgarī: न त्वा विव्याच रज इन्द्र पार्थिवमनु स्वधां ववक्षिथ
pada pāṭha: pra | hi | ririkṣe | ojasā | divaḥ | antebhyaḥ | pari || na | tvā | vivyāca | rajaḥ | indra | pārthivam | anu | svadhām | vavakṣitha ||8.88.5||

IAST: nakiḥ pariṣṭir maghavan maghasya te yad dāśuṣe daśasyasi
Griffith: The Earth and Heaven clung close to thy victorious might as to their calf two mother-cows.
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | pariṣṭiḥ | magha-van | maghasya | te | yat | dāśuṣe | daśasyasi || asmākam | bodhi | ucathasya | coditā | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | vāja-sātaye ||8.88.6||

IAST: asmākam bodhy ucathasya coditā maṁhiṣṭho vājasātaye
Griffith: When thou attackest Vrtra all the hostile bands shrink and faint, Indra, at thy wrath.
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | pariṣṭiḥ | magha-van | maghasya | te | yat | dāśuṣe | daśasyasi || asmākam | bodhi | ucathasya | coditā | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | vāja-sātaye ||8.88.6||

IAST: bṛhad indrāya gāyata maruto vṛtrahaṁtamam
Griffith: I MOVE before thee here present in person, and all the Deities follow behind me.
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | indrāya | gāyata | marutaḥ | vr̥traham-tamam || yena | jyotiḥ | ajanayan | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | devam | devāya | jāgr̥vi ||8.89.1||

IAST: yena jyotir ajanayann ṛtāvṛdho devaṁ devāya jāgṛvi
Griffith: When, Indra, thou securest me my portion, with me thou shalt perform heroic actions.
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | indrāya | gāyata | marutaḥ | vr̥traham-tamam || yena | jyotiḥ | ajanayan | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | devam | devāya | jāgr̥vi ||8.89.1||

IAST: apādhamad abhiśastīr aśastihāthendro dyumny ābhavat
Griffith: The food of meath in foremost place I give thee, thy Soma shall be pressed, thy share appointed.
pada pāṭha: apa | adhamat | abhi-śastīḥ | aśasti-hā | atha | indraḥ | dyumnī | ā | abhavat || devāḥ | te | indra | sakhyāya | yemire | br̥hadbhāno iti br̥hat-bhāno | marut-gaṇa ||8.89.2||

IAST: devās ta indra sakhyāya yemire bṛhadbhāno marudgaṇa
Griffith: Thou on my right shalt be my friend and comrade: then shall we two smite dead full many a foeman.
Devanāgarī: देवास्त इन्द्र सख्याय येमिरे बृहद्भानो मरुद्गण
pada pāṭha: apa | adhamat | abhi-śastīḥ | aśasti-hā | atha | indraḥ | dyumnī | ā | abhavat || devāḥ | te | indra | sakhyāya | yemire | br̥hadbhāno iti br̥hat-bhāno | marut-gaṇa ||8.89.2||

IAST: pra va indrāya bṛhate maruto brahmārcata
Griffith: Striving for strength bring forth a laud to Indra, a truthful hymn if he in truth existeth.
Devanāgarī: प्र व इन्द्राय बृहते मरुतो ब्रह्मार्चत
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | indrāya | br̥hate | marutaḥ | brahma | arcata || vr̥tram | hanati | vr̥tra-hā | śata-kratuḥ | vajreṇa | śata-parvaṇā ||8.89.3||

IAST: vṛtraṁ hanati vṛtrahā śatakratur vajreṇa śataparvaṇā
Griffith: One and another say, There is no Indra. Who hath beheld him? Whom then shall we honour?
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | indrāya | br̥hate | marutaḥ | brahma | arcata || vr̥tram | hanati | vr̥tra-hā | śata-kratuḥ | vajreṇa | śata-parvaṇā ||8.89.3||

IAST: abhi pra bhara dhṛṣatā dhṛṣanmanaḥ śravaś cit te asad bṛhat
Griffith: Here am I, look upon me here, O singer. All that existeth surpass in greatness.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्र भर धृषता धृषन्मनः श्रवश्चित्ते असद्बृहत्
pada pāṭha: abhi | pra | bhara | dhr̥ṣatā | dhr̥ṣat-manaḥ | śravaḥ | cit | te | asat | br̥hat || arṣantu | āpaḥ | javasā | vi | mātaraḥ | hanaḥ | vr̥tram | jaya | svariti svaḥ ||8.89.4||

IAST: arṣantv āpo javasā vi mātaro hano vṛtraṁ jayā svaḥ
Griffith: The Holy Law's commandments make me mighty. Rending with strength I rend the worlds asunder.
Devanāgarī: अर्षन्त्वापो जवसा वि मातरो हनो वृत्रं जया स्वः
pada pāṭha: abhi | pra | bhara | dhr̥ṣatā | dhr̥ṣat-manaḥ | śravaḥ | cit | te | asat | br̥hat || arṣantu | āpaḥ | javasā | vi | mātaraḥ | hanaḥ | vr̥tram | jaya | svariti svaḥ ||8.89.4||

IAST: yaj jāyathā apūrvya maghavan vṛtrahatyāya
Griffith: When the Law's lovers mounted and ap. proached me as sate lone upon the dear sky's summit.
pada pāṭha: yat | jāyathāḥ | apūrvya | magha-van | vr̥tra-hatyāya || tat | pr̥thivīm | aprathayaḥ | tat | astabhnāḥ | uta | dyām ||8.89.5||

IAST: tat pṛthivīm aprathayas tad astabhnā uta dyām
Griffith: Then spake my spirit to the heart within me, My friends have cried unto me with their children.
pada pāṭha: yat | jāyathāḥ | apūrvya | magha-van | vr̥tra-hatyāya || tat | pr̥thivīm | aprathayaḥ | tat | astabhnāḥ | uta | dyām ||8.89.5||

IAST: tat te yajño ajāyata tad arka uta haskṛtiḥ
Griffith: All these thy deeds must be declared at Soma-feasts, wrought, Indra, Bounteous Lord, for him who sheds the
Devanāgarī: तत्ते यज्ञो अजायत तदर्क उत हस्कृतिः
pada pāṭha: tat | te | yajñaḥ | ajāyata | tat | arkaḥ | uta | haskr̥tiḥ || tat | viśvam | abhi-bhūḥ | asi | yat | jātam | yat | ca | jantvam ||8.89.6||

IAST: tad viśvam abhibhūr asi yaj jātaṁ yac ca jantvam
Griffith: When thou didst open wealth heaped up by many, brought from far away to Sarablia, the Rsi's kin.
pada pāṭha: tat | te | yajñaḥ | ajāyata | tat | arkaḥ | uta | haskr̥tiḥ || tat | viśvam | abhi-bhūḥ | asi | yat | jātam | yat | ca | jantvam ||8.89.6||

IAST: āmāsu pakvam airaya ā sūryaṁ rohayo divi
Griffith: Now run ye forth your several ways: he is not here who kept you back.
Devanāgarī: आमासु पक्वमैरय आ सूर्यं रोहयो दिवि
pada pāṭha: āmāsu | pakvam | airayaḥ | ā | sūryam | rohayaḥ | divi || gharmam | na | sāman | tapata | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | juṣṭam | girvaṇase | br̥hat ||8.89.7||

IAST: gharmaṁ na sāman tapatā suvṛktibhir juṣṭaṁ girvaṇase bṛhat
Griffith: For hath not Indra sunk his bolt deep down in Vrtra's vital part?
Devanāgarī: घर्मं न सामन्तपता सुवृक्तिभिर्जुष्टं गिर्वणसे बृहत्
pada pāṭha: āmāsu | pakvam | airayaḥ | ā | sūryam | rohayaḥ | divi || gharmam | na | sāman | tapata | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | juṣṭam | girvaṇase | br̥hat ||8.89.7||

IAST: ā no viśvāsu havya indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu
Griffith: YEA, specially that mortal man hath toiled for service of the Gods,
Devanāgarī: आ नो विश्वासु हव्य इन्द्रः समत्सु भूषतु
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | viśvāsu | havyaḥ | indraḥ | samat-su | bhūṣatu || upa | brahmāṇi | savanāni | vr̥tra-hā | parama-jyāḥ | r̥cīṣamaḥ ||8.90.1||

IAST: upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahā paramajyā ṛcīṣamaḥ
Griffith: Who quickly hath brought near Mitra and Varuna. to share his sacrificial gifts.
Devanāgarī: उप ब्रह्माणि सवनानि वृत्रहा परमज्या ऋचीषमः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | viśvāsu | havyaḥ | indraḥ | samat-su | bhūṣatu || upa | brahmāṇi | savanāni | vr̥tra-hā | parama-jyāḥ | r̥cīṣamaḥ ||8.90.1||

IAST: tvaṁ dātā prathamo rādhasām asy asi satya īśānakṛt
Griffith: Supreme in sovran power, far-sighted, Chiefs and Kings, most swift to hear from far away,
Devanāgarī: त्वं दाता प्रथमो राधसामस्यसि सत्य ईशानकृत्
pada pāṭha: tvam | dātā | prathamaḥ | rādhasām | asi | asi | satyaḥ | īśāna-kr̥t || tuvi-dyumnasya | yujyā | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe | putrasya | śavasaḥ | mahaḥ ||8.90.2||

IAST: tuvidyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavaso mahaḥ
Griffith: Both, wondrously, set them in motion as with arms, in company with Surya's beams.
Devanāgarī: तुविद्युम्नस्य युज्या वृणीमहे पुत्रस्य शवसो महः
pada pāṭha: tvam | dātā | prathamaḥ | rādhasām | asi | asi | satyaḥ | īśāna-kr̥t || tuvi-dyumnasya | yujyā | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe | putrasya | śavasaḥ | mahaḥ ||8.90.2||

IAST: brahmā ta indra girvaṇaḥ kriyante anatidbhutā
Griffith: The rapid messenger who runs before you, Mitra-Varuna,
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मा त इन्द्र गिर्वणः क्रियन्ते अनतिद्भुता
pada pāṭha: brahma | te | indra | girvaṇaḥ | kriyante | anatidbhutā || imā | juṣasva | hari-aśva | yojanā | indra | yā | te | amanmahi ||8.90.3||

IAST: imā juṣasva haryaśva yojanendra yā te amanmahi
Griffith: with iron head, swift to the draught,
Devanāgarī: इमा जुषस्व हर्यश्व योजनेन्द्र या ते अमन्महि
pada pāṭha: brahma | te | indra | girvaṇaḥ | kriyante | anatidbhutā || imā | juṣasva | hari-aśva | yojanā | indra | yā | te | amanmahi ||8.90.3||

IAST: tvaṁ hi satyo maghavann anānato vṛtrā bhūri nyṛñjase
Griffith: He whom no man may question, none may summon back, who stands not still for colloquy,-
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि सत्यो मघवन्ननानतो वृत्रा भूरि न्यृञ्जसे
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | satyaḥ | magha-van | anānataḥ | vr̥trā | bhūri | ni-r̥ñjase || saḥ | tvam | śaviṣṭha | vajra-hasta | dāśuṣe | arvāñcam | rayim | ā | kr̥dhi ||8.90.4||

IAST: sa tvaṁ śaviṣṭha vajrahasta dāśuṣe 'rvāñcaṁ rayim ā kṛdhi
Griffith: From hostile clash with him keep ye us safe this day: keep us in safety with your arms.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं शविष्ठ वज्रहस्त दाशुषेऽर्वाञ्चं रयिमा कृधि
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | satyaḥ | magha-van | anānataḥ | vr̥trā | bhūri | ni-r̥ñjase || saḥ | tvam | śaviṣṭha | vajra-hasta | dāśuṣe | arvāñcam | rayim | ā | kr̥dhi ||8.90.4||

IAST: tvam indra yaśā asy ṛjīṣī śavasas pate
Griffith: To Aryaman and Mitra sing a reverent song, O pious one,
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | yaśāḥ | asi | r̥jīṣī | śavasaḥ | pate || tvam | vr̥trāṇi | haṁsi | apratīni | ekaḥ | it | anuttā | carṣaṇi-dhr̥tā ||8.90.5||

IAST: tvaṁ vṛtrāṇi haṁsy apratīny eka id anuttā carṣaṇīdhṛtā
Griffith: A pleasant hymn that shall protect to Varuna: sing forth a laud unto the Kings.
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | yaśāḥ | asi | r̥jīṣī | śavasaḥ | pate || tvam | vr̥trāṇi | haṁsi | apratīni | ekaḥ | it | anuttā | carṣaṇi-dhr̥tā ||8.90.5||

IAST: tam u tvā nūnam asura pracetasaṁ rādho bhāgam ivemahe
Griffith: The true, Red Treasure they have sent, one only Son born of the Three.
Devanāgarī: तमु त्वा नूनमसुर प्रचेतसं राधो भागमिवेमहे
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | nūnam | asura | pra-cetasam | rādhaḥ | bhāgam-iva | īmahe || mahī-iva | kr̥ttiḥ | śaraṇā | te | indra | pra | te | sumnā | naḥ | aśnavan ||8.90.6||

IAST: mahīva kṛttiḥ śaraṇā ta indra pra te sumnā no aśnavan
Griffith: They, the Immortal Ones, never deceived, survey the families of mortal men.
Devanāgarī: महीव कृत्तिः शरणा त इन्द्र प्र ते सुम्ना नो अश्नवन्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | nūnam | asura | pra-cetasam | rādhaḥ | bhāgam-iva | īmahe || mahī-iva | kr̥ttiḥ | śaraṇā | te | indra | pra | te | sumnā | naḥ | aśnavan ||8.90.6||

IAST: kanyā vār avāyatī somam api srutāvidat
Griffith: LORD of the house, Sage, ever young, high power of life, O Agni, God,
pada pāṭha: kanyā | vāḥ | ava-yatī | somam | api | srutā | avidat || astam | bharantī | abravīt | indrāya | sunavai | tvā | śakrāya | sunavai | tvā ||8.91.1||

IAST: astam bharanty abravīd indrāya sunavai tvā śakrāya sunavai tvā
Griffith: Thou givest to thy worshipper.
Devanāgarī: अस्तं भरन्त्यब्रवीदिन्द्राय सुनवै त्वा शक्राय सुनवै त्वा
pada pāṭha: kanyā | vāḥ | ava-yatī | somam | api | srutā | avidat || astam | bharantī | abravīt | indrāya | sunavai | tvā | śakrāya | sunavai | tvā ||8.91.1||

IAST: asau ya eṣi vīrako gṛhaṁ-gṛhaṁ vicākaśad
Griffith: So with our song that prays and serves, attentive, Lord of spreading light,
Devanāgarī: असौ य एषि वीरको गृहंगृहं विचाकशद्
pada pāṭha: asau | yaḥ | eṣi | vīrakaḥ | gr̥ham-gr̥ham | vi-cākaśat || imam | jambha-sutam | piba | dhānā-vantam | karambhiṇam | apūpa-vantam | ukthinam ||8.91.2||

IAST: imaṁ jambhasutam piba dhānāvantaṁ karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam
Griffith: Agni, bring hitherward the Gods.
pada pāṭha: asau | yaḥ | eṣi | vīrakaḥ | gr̥ham-gr̥ham | vi-cākaśat || imam | jambha-sutam | piba | dhānā-vantam | karambhiṇam | apūpa-vantam | ukthinam ||8.91.2||

IAST: ā cana tvā cikitsāmo 'dhi cana tvā nemasi
Griffith: For, Ever-Youthful One, with thee, best Furtherer, as our ally,
Devanāgarī: आ चन त्वा चिकित्सामोऽधि चन त्वा नेमसि
pada pāṭha: ā | cana | tvā | cikitsāmaḥ | adhi | cana | tvā | na | imasi || śanaiḥ-iva | śanakaiḥ-iva | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||8.91.3||

IAST: śanair iva śanakair ivendrāyendo pari srava
Griffith: We overcome, to win the spoil.
pada pāṭha: ā | cana | tvā | cikitsāmaḥ | adhi | cana | tvā | na | imasi || śanaiḥ-iva | śanakaiḥ-iva | indrāya | indo iti | pari | srava ||8.91.3||

IAST: kuvic chakat kuvit karat kuvin no vasyasas karat
Griffith: As Aurva Bhrgu used, as Apnavana used, I call the pure
pada pāṭha: kuvit | śakat | kuvit | karat | kuvit | naḥ | vasyasaḥ | karat || kuvit | pati-dviṣaḥ | yatīḥ | indreṇa | sam-gamāmahai ||8.91.4||

IAST: kuvit patidviṣo yatīr indreṇa saṁgamāmahai
Griffith: Agni who clothes him with the sea.
pada pāṭha: kuvit | śakat | kuvit | karat | kuvit | naḥ | vasyasaḥ | karat || kuvit | pati-dviṣaḥ | yatīḥ | indreṇa | sam-gamāmahai ||8.91.4||

IAST: imāni trīṇi viṣṭapā tānīndra vi rohaya
Griffith: call the Sage who sounds like wind, the Might that like Parjanya roars,
Devanāgarī: इमानि त्रीणि विष्टपा तानीन्द्र वि रोहय
pada pāṭha: imāni | trīṇi | viṣṭapā | tāni | indra | vi | rohaya || śiraḥ | tatasya | urvarām | āt | idam | me | upa | udare ||8.91.5||

IAST: śiras tatasyorvarām ād idam ma upodare
Griffith: Agni who clothes him with the sea.
pada pāṭha: imāni | trīṇi | viṣṭapā | tāni | indra | vi | rohaya || śiraḥ | tatasya | urvarām | āt | idam | me | upa | udare ||8.91.5||

IAST: asau ca yā na urvarād imāṁ tanvam mama
Griffith: As Savitar's productive Power, as him who sends down bliss, I call
Devanāgarī: असौ च या न उर्वरादिमां तन्वं मम
pada pāṭha: asau | ca | yā | naḥ | urvarā | āt | imām | tanvam | mama || atho iti | tatasya | yat | śiraḥ | sarvā | tā | romaśā | kr̥dhi ||8.91.6||

IAST: atho tatasya yac chiraḥ sarvā tā romaśā kṛdhi
Griffith: Agni who clothes him with the sea.
Devanāgarī: अथो ततस्य यच्छिरः सर्वा ता रोमशा कृधि
pada pāṭha: asau | ca | yā | naḥ | urvarā | āt | imām | tanvam | mama || atho iti | tatasya | yat | śiraḥ | sarvā | tā | romaśā | kr̥dhi ||8.91.6||

IAST: khe rathasya khe 'nasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato

Griffith: SAKRA I praise, to win his aid, far-famed, exceeding bountiful,
pada pāṭha: gauḥ | dhayati | marutām | śravasyuḥ | mātā | maghonām || yuktā | vahniḥ | rathānām ||8.94.1||

IAST: yuktā vahnī rathānām
Griffith: Who gives, as 'twere in thousands, precious wealth to him who sheds the juice and worships him.
pada pāṭha: gauḥ | dhayati | marutām | śravasyuḥ | mātā | maghonām || yuktā | vahniḥ | rathānām ||8.94.1||

IAST: yasyā devā upasthe vratā viśve dhārayante
Griffith: Arrows with hundred points, unconquerable, are this Indra's n-dghty arms in war.
Devanāgarī: यस्या देवा उपस्थे व्रता विश्वे धारयन्ते
pada pāṭha: yasyāḥ | devāḥ | upa-sthe | vratā | viśve | dhārayante || sūryāmāsā | dr̥śe | kam ||8.94.2||

IAST: sūryāmāsā dṛśe kam
Griffith: He streams on liberal worshippers like a hill with springs, when juices poured have gladdened him.
pada pāṭha: yasyāḥ | devāḥ | upa-sthe | vratā | viśve | dhārayante || sūryāmāsā | dr̥śe | kam ||8.94.2||

IAST: tat su no viśve arya ā sadā gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
Griffith: What time the flowing Soma-drops have gladdened with their taste the Friend,
Devanāgarī: तत्सु नो विश्वे अर्य आ सदा गृणन्ति कारवः
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | viśve | aryaḥ | ā | sadā | gr̥ṇanti | kāravaḥ || marutaḥ | soma-pītaye ||8.94.3||

IAST: marutaḥ somapītaye
Griffith: Like water, gracious Lord! were my libations made, like milch-kine to the worshipper.
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | viśve | aryaḥ | ā | sadā | gr̥ṇanti | kāravaḥ || marutaḥ | soma-pītaye ||8.94.3||

IAST: asti somo ayaṁ sutaḥ pibanty asya marutaḥ
Griffith: To him the peerless, who is calling you to give you aid, forth flow the drops of pleasant meath.
Devanāgarī: अस्ति सोमो अयं सुतः पिबन्त्यस्य मरुतः
pada pāṭha: asti | somaḥ | ayam | sutaḥ | pibanti | asya | marutaḥ || uta | sva-rājaḥ | aśvinā ||8.94.4||

IAST: uta svarājo aśvinā
Griffith: The Soloa-drops which call on thee, O gracious Lord, have brought thee to our hymn of praise.
pada pāṭha: asti | somaḥ | ayam | sutaḥ | pibanti | asya | marutaḥ || uta | sva-rājaḥ | aśvinā ||8.94.4||

IAST: pibanti mitro aryamā tanā pūtasya varuṇaḥ
Griffith: He rushes hurrying like a steed to Soma that adorns our rite,
Devanāgarī: पिबन्ति मित्रो अर्यमा तना पूतस्य वरुणः
pada pāṭha: pibanti | mitraḥ | aryamā | tanā | pūtasya | varuṇaḥ || tri-sadhasthasya | jā-vataḥ ||8.94.5||

IAST: triṣadhasthasya jāvataḥ
Griffith: Which hymns make sweet to thee, lover of pleasant food. The call to Paura thou dost love.
pada pāṭha: pibanti | mitraḥ | aryamā | tanā | pūtasya | varuṇaḥ || tri-sadhasthasya | jā-vataḥ ||8.94.5||

IAST: uto nv asya joṣam ām̐ indraḥ sutasya gomataḥ
Griffith: Praise the strong, grasping Hero, winner of the spoil, ruling supreme oer mighty wealth.
Devanāgarī: उतो न्वस्य जोषमाँ इन्द्रः सुतस्य गोमतः
pada pāṭha: uto iti | nu | asya | joṣam | ā | indraḥ | sutasya | go-mataḥ || prātaḥ | hotā-iva | matsati ||8.94.6||

IAST: prātar hoteva matsati
Griffith: Like a full spring, O Thunderer, from thy store hast thou poured on the worshipper evermore.
pada pāṭha: uto iti | nu | asya | joṣam | ā | indraḥ | sutasya | go-mataḥ || prātaḥ | hotā-iva | matsati ||8.94.6||

IAST: kad atviṣanta sūrayas tira āpa iva sridhaḥ
Griffith: Now whether thou be far away, or in the heavens, or on the earth,
pada pāṭha: kat | atviṣanta | sūrayaḥ | tiraḥ | āpaḥ-iva | sridhaḥ || arṣanti | pūta-dakṣasaḥ ||8.94.7||

IAST: arṣanti pūtadakṣasaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, mighty- thoughted, harnessing thy Bays, come Lofty with the Lofty Ones.
pada pāṭha: kat | atviṣanta | sūrayaḥ | tiraḥ | āpaḥ-iva | sridhaḥ || arṣanti | pūta-dakṣasaḥ ||8.94.7||

IAST: kad vo adya mahānāṁ devānām avo vṛṇe
Griffith: The Bays who draw thy chariot, Steeds who injure none, surpass the wind's impetuous strength-
pada pāṭha: kat | vaḥ | adya | mahānām | devānām | avaḥ | vr̥ṇe || tmanā | ca | dasma-varcasām ||8.94.8||

IAST: tmanā ca dasmavarcasām
Griffith: With whom thou silencest the enemy of man, with whon; thou goest round the sky.
pada pāṭha: kat | vaḥ | adya | mahānām | devānām | avaḥ | vr̥ṇe || tmanā | ca | dasma-varcasām ||8.94.8||

IAST: ā ye viśvā pārthivāni paprathan rocanā divaḥ
Griffith: O gracious Hero, may we learn anew to know thee as thou art:
Devanāgarī: आ ये विश्वा पार्थिवानि पप्रथन्रोचना दिवः
pada pāṭha: ā | ye | viśvā | pārthivāni | paprathan | rocanā | divaḥ || marutaḥ | soma-pītaye ||8.94.9||

IAST: marutaḥ somapītaye
Griffith: As in decisive fight thou holpest Etasa, or Vasa 'gainst Dasavraja,
pada pāṭha: ā | ye | viśvā | pārthivāni | paprathan | rocanā | divaḥ || marutaḥ | soma-pītaye ||8.94.9||

IAST: tyān nu pūtadakṣaso divo vo maruto huve
Griffith: As, Maghavan, to Kanva at the sacred feast, to Dirghanitha thine home-friend,
Devanāgarī: त्यान्नु पूतदक्षसो दिवो वो मरुतो हुवे
pada pāṭha: tyān | nu | pūta-dakṣasaḥ | divaḥ | vaḥ | marutaḥ | huve || asya | somasya | pītaye ||8.94.10||

IAST: asya somasya pītaye
Griffith: As to Gosarya thou, Stone-darter, gavest wealth, give me a gold-bright stall of kine.
pada pāṭha: tyān | nu | pūta-dakṣasaḥ | divaḥ | vaḥ | marutaḥ | huve || asya | somasya | pītaye ||8.94.10||

IAST: tyān nu ye vi rodasī tastabhur maruto huve
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: त्यान्नु ये वि रोदसी तस्तभुर्मरुतो हुवे
pada pāṭha: tyān | nu | ye | vi | rodasī iti | tastabhuḥ | marutaḥ | huve || asya | somasya | pītaye ||8.94.11||

IAST: asya somasya pītaye
Griffith: Not Available
pada pāṭha: tyān | nu | ye | vi | rodasī iti | tastabhuḥ | marutaḥ | huve || asya | somasya | pītaye ||8.94.11||

IAST: tyaṁ nu mārutaṁ gaṇaṁ giriṣṭhāṁ vṛṣaṇaṁ huve
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: त्यं नु मारुतं गणं गिरिष्ठां वृषणं हुवे
pada pāṭha: tyam | nu | mārutam | gaṇam | giri-sthām | vr̥ṣaṇam | huve || asya | somasya | pītaye ||8.94.12||

IAST: asya somasya pītaye
Griffith: Not Available
pada pāṭha: tyam | nu | mārutam | gaṇam | giri-sthām | vr̥ṣaṇam | huve || asya | somasya | pītaye ||8.94.12||

IAST: ā tvā giro rathīr ivāsthuḥ suteṣu girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: As with Manu Samvarani, Indra, thou drankest Soma juice,
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा गिरो रथीरिवास्थुः सुतेषु गिर्वणः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | giraḥ | rathīḥ-iva | asthuḥ | suteṣu | girvaṇaḥ || abhi | tvā | sam | anūṣata | indra | vatsam | na | mātaraḥ ||8.95.1||

IAST: abhi tvā sam anūṣatendra vatsaṁ na mātaraḥ
Griffith: And, Maghavan, with Nipatithi, Medbyatithi, with Pustigu and Srustigu,-
Devanāgarī: अभि त्वा समनूषतेन्द्र वत्सं न मातरः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | giraḥ | rathīḥ-iva | asthuḥ | suteṣu | girvaṇaḥ || abhi | tvā | sam | anūṣata | indra | vatsam | na | mātaraḥ ||8.95.1||

IAST: ā tvā śukrā acucyavuḥ sutāsa indra girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: T'he son of Prsadvana was Praskaniva's host, who lay decrepit and forlorn.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा शुक्रा अचुच्यवुः सुतास इन्द्र गिर्वणः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | śukrāḥ | acucyavuḥ | sutāsaḥ | indra | girvaṇaḥ || piba | tu | asya | andhasaḥ | indra | viśvāsu | te | hitam ||8.95.2||

IAST: pibā tv asyāndhasa indra viśvāsu te hitam
Griffith: Aided by thee the Rsi Dasyave-vrka strove to obtain thousands of kine.
Devanāgarī: पिबा त्वस्यान्धस इन्द्र विश्वासु ते हितम्
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | śukrāḥ | acucyavuḥ | sutāsaḥ | indra | girvaṇaḥ || piba | tu | asya | andhasaḥ | indra | viśvāsu | te | hitam ||8.95.2||

IAST: pibā somam madāya kam indra śyenābhṛtaṁ sutam
Griffith: Call hither with thy newest song Indra who lacks not hymns of praise,
Devanāgarī: पिबा सोमं मदाय कमिन्द्र श्येनाभृतं सुतम्
pada pāṭha: piba | somam | madāya | kam | indra | śyena-ābhr̥tam | sutam || tvam | hi | śaśvatīnām | patiḥ | rājā | viśām | asi ||8.95.3||

IAST: tvaṁ hi śaśvatīnām patī rājā viśām asi
Griffith: Him who observes and knows, inspirer of the sage, him who seems eager to enjoy.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि शश्वतीनां पती राजा विशामसि
pada pāṭha: piba | somam | madāya | kam | indra | śyena-ābhr̥tam | sutam || tvam | hi | śaśvatīnām | patiḥ | rājā | viśām | asi ||8.95.3||

IAST: śrudhī havaṁ tiraścyā indra yas tvā saparyati
Griffith: He unto whom they sang the seven-headed hymn, three-parted, in the loftiest place,
Devanāgarī: श्रुधी हवं तिरश्च्या इन्द्र यस्त्वा सपर्यति
pada pāṭha: śrudhi | havam | tiraścyāḥ | indra | yaḥ | tvā | saparyati || su-vīryasya | go-mataḥ | rāyaḥ | pūrdhi | mahān | asi ||8.95.4||

IAST: suvīryasya gomato rāyas pūrdhi mahām̐ asi
Griffith: He sent his thunder down on all these living things, and so displayed heroic might.
pada pāṭha: śrudhi | havam | tiraścyāḥ | indra | yaḥ | tvā | saparyati || su-vīryasya | go-mataḥ | rāyaḥ | pūrdhi | mahān | asi ||8.95.4||

IAST: indra yas te navīyasīṁ giram mandrām ajījanat
Griffith: We invocate that Indra who bestoweth precious things on us.
pada pāṭha: indra | yaḥ | te | navīyasīm | giram | mandrām | ajījanat || cikitvit-manasam | dhiyam | pratnām | r̥tasya | pipyuṣīm ||8.95.5||

IAST: cikitvinmanasaṁ dhiyam pratnām ṛtasya pipyuṣīm
Griffith: Now do we know his newest favour; may we gain a stable that is full of kine.
pada pāṭha: indra | yaḥ | te | navīyasīm | giram | mandrām | ajījanat || cikitvit-manasam | dhiyam | pratnām | r̥tasya | pipyuṣīm ||8.95.5||

IAST: tam u ṣṭavāma yaṁ gira indram ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ
Griffith: He whom thou aidest, gracious Lord, to give again, obtains great wealth to nourish him.
Devanāgarī: तमु ष्टवाम यं गिर इन्द्रमुक्थानि वावृधुः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stavāma | yam | giraḥ | indram | ukthāni | vavr̥dhuḥ || purūṇi | asya | pauṁsyā | sisāsantaḥ | vanāmahe ||8.95.6||

IAST: purūṇy asya pauṁsyā siṣāsanto vanāmahe
Griffith: We with our Soma ready, Lover of the Song! call, Indra Maghavan, on thee.
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stavāma | yam | giraḥ | indram | ukthāni | vavr̥dhuḥ || purūṇi | asya | pauṁsyā | sisāsantaḥ | vanāmahe ||8.95.6||

IAST: eto nv indraṁ stavāma śuddhaṁ śuddhena sāmnā
Griffith: Ne'er art thou fruitless, Indra ne'er dost thou desert the worshipper
Devanāgarī: एतो न्विन्द्रं स्तवाम शुद्धं शुद्धेन साम्ना
pada pāṭha: eto iti | nu | indram | stavāma | śuddham | śuddhena | sāmnā || śuddhaiḥ | ukthaiḥ | vavr̥dhvāṁsam | śuddhaḥ | āśīḥ-vān | mamattu ||8.95.7||

IAST: śuddhair ukthair vāvṛdhvāṁsaṁ śuddha āśīrvān mamattu
Griffith: But now, O Maghavan, thy bounty as a God is poured forth ever more and more.
pada pāṭha: eto iti | nu | indram | stavāma | śuddham | śuddhena | sāmnā || śuddhaiḥ | ukthaiḥ | vavr̥dhvāṁsam | śuddhaḥ | āśīḥ-vān | mamattu ||8.95.7||

IAST: indra śuddho na ā gahi śuddhaḥ śuddhābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: He who hath. overtaken Krvi with his might, and silenced Susna with deathbolts,-
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र शुद्धो न आ गहि शुद्धः शुद्धाभिरूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: indra | śuddhaḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | śuddhaḥ | śuddhābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || śuddhaḥ | rayim | ni | dhāraya | śuddhaḥ | mamaddhi | somyaḥ ||8.95.8||

IAST: śuddho rayiṁ ni dhāraya śuddho mamaddhi somyaḥ
Griffith: When he supported yonder heaven and spread it out, then first the son of earth was born.
Devanāgarī: शुद्धो रयिं नि धारय शुद्धो ममद्धि सोम्यः
pada pāṭha: indra | śuddhaḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | śuddhaḥ | śuddhābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || śuddhaḥ | rayim | ni | dhāraya | śuddhaḥ | mamaddhi | somyaḥ ||8.95.8||

IAST: indra śuddho hi no rayiṁ śuddho ratnāni dāśuṣe
Griffith: Good Lord of wealth is he to whom all Aryas, Dasas here belong.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र शुद्धो हि नो रयिं शुद्धो रत्नानि दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: indra | śuddhaḥ | hi | naḥ | rayim | śuddhaḥ | ratnāni | dāśuṣe || śuddhaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jighnase | śuddhaḥ | vājam | sisāsasi ||8.95.9||

IAST: śuddho vṛtrāṇi jighnase śuddho vājaṁ siṣāsasi
Griffith: Directly unto thee, the pious Rusama Paviru, is that wealth brought nigh.
Devanāgarī: शुद्धो वृत्राणि जिघ्नसे शुद्धो वाजं सिषाससि
pada pāṭha: indra | śuddhaḥ | hi | naḥ | rayim | śuddhaḥ | ratnāni | dāśuṣe || śuddhaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jighnase | śuddhaḥ | vājam | sisāsasi ||8.95.9||

IAST: asmā uṣāsa ātiranta yāmam indrāya naktam ūrmyāḥ suvācaḥ
Griffith: As, Sakra, thou with Manu called Vivasvan drankest Soma juice,
Devanāgarī: अस्मा उषास आतिरन्त याममिन्द्राय नक्तमूर्म्याः सुवाचः
pada pāṭha: asmai | uṣasaḥ | ā | atiranta | yāmam | indrāya | naktam | ūrmyāḥ | su-vācaḥ || asmai | āpaḥ | mātaraḥ | sapta | tasthuḥ | nr̥-bhyaḥ | tarāya | sindhavaḥ | su-pārāḥ ||8.96.1||

IAST: asmā āpo mātaraḥ sapta tasthur nṛbhyas tarāya sindhavaḥ supārāḥ
Griffith: As, Indra, thou didst love the hymn by Trita's side, so dost thou joy with Ayu now.
Devanāgarī: अस्मा आपो मातरः सप्त तस्थुर्नृभ्यस्तराय सिन्धवः सुपाराः
pada pāṭha: asmai | uṣasaḥ | ā | atiranta | yāmam | indrāya | naktam | ūrmyāḥ | su-vācaḥ || asmai | āpaḥ | mātaraḥ | sapta | tasthuḥ | nr̥-bhyaḥ | tarāya | sindhavaḥ | su-pārāḥ ||8.96.1||

IAST: atividdhā vithureṇā cid astrā triḥ sapta sānu saṁhitā girīṇām
Griffith: As thou with Matarisvan, Medhya, Prsadhra, hast cheered thee Indra, with pressed juice,
Devanāgarī: अतिविद्धा विथुरेणा चिदस्त्रा त्रिः सप्त सानु संहिता गिरीणाम्
pada pāṭha: ati-viddhā | vithureṇa | cit | asrā | triḥ | sapta | sānu | sam-hitā | girīṇām || na | tat | devaḥ | na | martyaḥ | tuturyāt | yāni | pra-vr̥ddhaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | cakāra ||8.96.2||

IAST: na tad devo na martyas tuturyād yāni pravṛddho vṛṣabhaś cakāra
Griffith: Drunk Soma with Rjunas, Syumarasmi, by Dasonya's Dasasipra's side.
Devanāgarī: न तद्देवो न मर्त्यस्तुतुर्याद्यानि प्रवृद्धो वृषभश्चकार
pada pāṭha: ati-viddhā | vithureṇa | cit | asrā | triḥ | sapta | sānu | sam-hitā | girīṇām || na | tat | devaḥ | na | martyaḥ | tuturyāt | yāni | pra-vr̥ddhaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | cakāra ||8.96.2||

IAST: indrasya vajra āyaso nimiśla indrasya bāhvor bhūyiṣṭham ojaḥ
Griffith: Tis he who made the lauds his own and boldly drank the Soma juice,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य वज्र आयसो निमिश्ल इन्द्रस्य बाह्वोर्भूयिष्ठमोजः
pada pāṭha: indrasya | vajraḥ | āyasaḥ | ni-miślaḥ | indrasya | bāhvoḥ | bhūyiṣṭham | ojaḥ || śīrṣan | indrasya | kratavaḥ | nireke | āsan | ā | īṣanta | śrutyai | upāke ||8.96.3||

IAST: śīrṣann indrasya kratavo nireka āsann eṣanta śrutyā upāke
Griffith: He to whom Visnu came striding his three wide steps, as Mitra's statutes ordered it.
Devanāgarī: शीर्षन्निन्द्रस्य क्रतवो निरेक आसन्नेषन्त श्रुत्या उपाके
pada pāṭha: indrasya | vajraḥ | āyasaḥ | ni-miślaḥ | indrasya | bāhvoḥ | bhūyiṣṭham | ojaḥ || śīrṣan | indrasya | kratavaḥ | nireke | āsan | ā | īṣanta | śrutyai | upāke ||8.96.3||

IAST: manye tvā yajñiyaṁ yajñiyānām manye tvā cyavanam acyutānām
Griffith: In whose laud thou didst joy, Indra, at the great deed, O Satakratu, Mighty One!
Devanāgarī: मन्ये त्वा यज्ञियं यज्ञियानां मन्ये त्वा च्यवनमच्युतानाम्
pada pāṭha: manye | tvā | yajñiyam | yajñiyānām | manye | tvā | cyavanam | acyutānām || manye | tvā | satvanām | indra | ketum | manye | tvā | vr̥ṣabham | carṣaṇīnām ||8.96.4||

IAST: manye tvā satvanām indra ketum manye tvā vṛṣabhaṁ carṣaṇīnām
Griffith: Seeking renown we call thee as the milkers call the cow who yields abundant milk.
Devanāgarī: मन्ये त्वा सत्वनामिन्द्र केतुं मन्ये त्वा वृषभं चर्षणीनाम्
pada pāṭha: manye | tvā | yajñiyam | yajñiyānām | manye | tvā | cyavanam | acyutānām || manye | tvā | satvanām | indra | ketum | manye | tvā | vr̥ṣabham | carṣaṇīnām ||8.96.4||

IAST: ā yad vajram bāhvor indra dhatse madacyutam ahaye hantavā u
Griffith: He is our Sire who gives to us, Great, Mighty, ruling as he wills.
Devanāgarī: आ यद्वज्रं बाह्वोरिन्द्र धत्से मदच्युतमहये हन्तवा उ
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | vajram | bāhvoḥ | indra | dhatse | mada-cyutam | ahaye | hantavai | ūm̐ iti || pra | parvatāḥ | anavanta | pra | gāvaḥ | pra | brahmāṇaḥ | abhi-nakṣantaḥ | indram ||8.96.5||

IAST: pra parvatā anavanta pra gāvaḥ pra brahmāṇo abhinakṣanta indram
Griffith: Unsought, may he the Strong, Rich, Lord of ample wealth, give us of horses and of kine.
Devanāgarī: प्र पर्वता अनवन्त प्र गावः प्र ब्रह्माणो अभिनक्षन्त इन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | vajram | bāhvoḥ | indra | dhatse | mada-cyutam | ahaye | hantavai | ūm̐ iti || pra | parvatāḥ | anavanta | pra | gāvaḥ | pra | brahmāṇaḥ | abhi-nakṣantaḥ | indram ||8.96.5||

IAST: tam u ṣṭavāma ya imā jajāna viśvā jātāny avarāṇy asmāt
Griffith: He to whom thou, Good Lord, givest that he may give increases wealth that nourishes.
Devanāgarī: तमु ष्टवाम य इमा जजान विश्वा जातान्यवराण्यस्मात्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stavāma | yaḥ | imā | jajāna | viśvā | jātāni | avarāṇi | asmāt || indreṇa | mitram | didhiṣema | gīḥ-bhiḥ | upo iti | namaḥ-bhiḥ | vr̥ṣabham | viśema ||8.96.6||

IAST: indreṇa mitraṁ didhiṣema gīrbhir upo namobhir vṛṣabhaṁ viśema
Griffith: Eager for wealth we call on Indra, Lord of wealth, on Satakratu with our lauds.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेण मित्रं दिधिषेम गीर्भिरुपो नमोभिर्वृषभं विशेम
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stavāma | yaḥ | imā | jajāna | viśvā | jātāni | avarāṇi | asmāt || indreṇa | mitram | didhiṣema | gīḥ-bhiḥ | upo iti | namaḥ-bhiḥ | vr̥ṣabham | viśema ||8.96.6||

IAST: vṛtrasya tvā śvasathād īṣamāṇā viśve devā ajahur ye sakhāyaḥ
Griffith: Never art thou neglectful: thou guardest both races with thy care.
Devanāgarī: वृत्रस्य त्वा श्वसथादीषमाणा विश्वे देवा अजहुर्ये सखायः
pada pāṭha: vr̥trasya | tvā | śvasathāt | īṣamāṇāḥ | viśve | devāḥ | ajahuḥ | ye | sakhāyaḥ || marut-bhiḥ | indra | sakhyam | te | astu | atha | imāḥ | viśvāḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | jayāsi ||8.96.7||

IAST: marudbhir indra sakhyaṁ te astv athemā viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayāsi
Griffith: The call on Indra, fourth Aditya! is thine own. Amrta is stablished in the heavens.
Devanāgarī: मरुद्भिरिन्द्र सख्यं ते अस्त्वथेमा विश्वाः पृतना जयासि
pada pāṭha: vr̥trasya | tvā | śvasathāt | īṣamāṇāḥ | viśve | devāḥ | ajahuḥ | ye | sakhāyaḥ || marut-bhiḥ | indra | sakhyam | te | astu | atha | imāḥ | viśvāḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | jayāsi ||8.96.7||

IAST: triḥ ṣaṣṭis tvā maruto vāvṛdhānā usrā iva rāśayo yajñiyāsaḥ
Griffith: The offercr whom thou, Indra, Lover of the Song, liberal Maghavan, favourest,-
Devanāgarī: त्रिः षष्टिस्त्वा मरुतो वावृधाना उस्रा इव राशयो यज्ञियासः
pada pāṭha: triḥ | ṣaṣṭiḥ | tvā | marutaḥ | vavr̥dhānāḥ | usrāḥ-iva | rāśayaḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ || upa | tvā | ā | imaḥ | kr̥dhi | naḥ | bhāga-dheyam | śuṣmam | te | enā | haviṣā | vidhema ||8.96.8||

IAST: upa tvemaḥ kṛdhi no bhāgadheyaṁ śuṣmaṁ ta enā haviṣā vidhema
Griffith: As at the call of Kanva so, O gracious Lord, hear, thou our songs and eulogy.
Devanāgarī: उप त्वेमः कृधि नो भागधेयं शुष्मं त एना हविषा विधेम
pada pāṭha: triḥ | ṣaṣṭiḥ | tvā | marutaḥ | vavr̥dhānāḥ | usrāḥ-iva | rāśayaḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ || upa | tvā | ā | imaḥ | kr̥dhi | naḥ | bhāga-dheyam | śuṣmam | te | enā | haviṣā | vidhema ||8.96.8||

IAST: tigmam āyudham marutām anīkaṁ kas ta indra prati vajraṁ dadharṣa
Griffith: Sung is the song of ancient time: to Indra have ye said the prayer.
Devanāgarī: तिग्ममायुधं मरुतामनीकं कस्त इन्द्र प्रति वज्रं दधर्ष
pada pāṭha: tigmam | āyudham | marutām | anīkam | kaḥ | te | indra | prati | vajram | dadharṣa || anāyudhāsaḥ | asurāḥ | adevāḥ | cakreṇa | tān | apa | vapa | r̥jīṣin ||8.96.9||

IAST: anāyudhāso asurā adevāś cakreṇa tām̐ apa vapa ṛjīṣin
Griffith: They have sung many a Brhati of sacrifice, poured forth the worshipper's many thoughts.
Devanāgarī: अनायुधासो असुरा अदेवाश्चक्रेण ताँ अप वप ऋजीषिन्
pada pāṭha: tigmam | āyudham | marutām | anīkam | kaḥ | te | indra | prati | vajram | dadharṣa || anāyudhāsaḥ | asurāḥ | adevāḥ | cakreṇa | tān | apa | vapa | r̥jīṣin ||8.96.9||

IAST: maha ugrāya tavase suvṛktim preraya śivatamāya paśvaḥ
Griffith: Indra hath tossed together mighty stores of wealth, and both the worlds, yea, and the Sun.
Devanāgarī: मह उग्राय तवसे सुवृक्तिं प्रेरय शिवतमाय पश्वः
pada pāṭha: mahe | ugrāya | tavase | su-vr̥ktim | pra | īraya | śiva-tamāya | paśvaḥ || girvāhase | giraḥ | indrāya | pūrvīḥ | dhehi | tanve | kuvit | aṅga | vedat ||8.96.10||

IAST: girvāhase gira indrāya pūrvīr dhehi tanve kuvid aṅga vedat
Griffith: Pure, brightly-shining, mingled with the milk, the draughts of Soma have made Indra glad.
Devanāgarī: गिर्वाहसे गिर इन्द्राय पूर्वीर्धेहि तन्वे कुविदङ्ग वेदत्
pada pāṭha: mahe | ugrāya | tavase | su-vr̥ktim | pra | īraya | śiva-tamāya | paśvaḥ || girvāhase | giraḥ | indrāya | pūrvīḥ | dhehi | tanve | kuvit | aṅga | vedat ||8.96.10||

Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: उक्थवाहसे विभ्वे मनीषां द्रुणा न पारमीरया नदीनाम्
pada pāṭha: uktha-vāhase | vi-bhve | manīṣām | druṇā | na | pāram | īraya | nadīnām || ni | spr̥śa | dhiyā | tanvi | śrutasya | juṣṭa-tarasya | kuvit | aṅga | vedat ||8.96.11||

IAST: ni spṛśa dhiyā tanvi śrutasya juṣṭatarasya kuvid aṅga vedat
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: नि स्पृश धिया तन्वि श्रुतस्य जुष्टतरस्य कुविदङ्ग वेदत्
pada pāṭha: uktha-vāhase | vi-bhve | manīṣām | druṇā | na | pāram | īraya | nadīnām || ni | spr̥śa | dhiyā | tanvi | śrutasya | juṣṭa-tarasya | kuvit | aṅga | vedat ||8.96.11||

Griffith: Not Available

pada pāṭha: tat | viviḍḍhi | yat | te | indraḥ | jujoṣat | stuhi | su-stutim | namasā | ā | vivāsa || upa | bhūṣa | jaritaḥ | mā | ruvaṇyaḥ | śravaya | vācam | kuvit | aṅga | vedat ||8.96.12||

IAST: upa bhūṣa jaritar mā ruvaṇyaḥ śrāvayā vācaṁ kuvid aṅga vedat
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: उप भूष जरितर्मा रुवण्यः श्रावया वाचं कुविदङ्ग वेदत्
pada pāṭha: tat | viviḍḍhi | yat | te | indraḥ | jujoṣat | stuhi | su-stutim | namasā | ā | vivāsa || upa | bhūṣa | jaritaḥ | mā | ruvaṇyaḥ | śravaya | vācam | kuvit | aṅga | vedat ||8.96.12||

Griffith: Not Available
pada pāṭha: ava | drapsaḥ | aṁśu-matīm | atiṣṭhat | iyānaḥ | kr̥ṣṇaḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | sahasraiḥ || āvat | tam | indraḥ | śacyā | dhamantam | apa | snehitīḥ | nr̥-manāḥ | adhatta ||8.96.13||

Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: नभो न कृष्णमवतस्थिवांसमिष्यामि वो वृषणो युध्यताजौ
pada pāṭha: drapsam | apaśyam | viṣuṇe | carantam | upa-hvare | nadyaḥ | aṁśu-matyāḥ || nabhaḥ | na | kr̥ṣṇam | avatasthi-vāṁsam | iṣyāmi | vaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yudhyata | ājau ||8.96.14||

IAST: adha drapso aṁśumatyā upasthe 'dhārayat tanvaṁ titviṣāṇaḥ
Griffith: Not Available
pada pāṭha: adha | drapsaḥ | aṁśu-matyāḥ | upa-sthe | adhārayat | tanvam | titviṣāṇaḥ || viśaḥ | adevīḥ | abhi | ā-carantīḥ | br̥haspatinā | yujā | indraḥ | sasahe ||8.96.15||

IAST: viśo adevīr abhy ācarantīr bṛhaspatinā yujendraḥ sasāhe
Griffith: Not Available
pada pāṭha: adha | drapsaḥ | aṁśu-matyāḥ | upa-sthe | adhārayat | tanvam | titviṣāṇaḥ || viśaḥ | adevīḥ | abhi | ā-carantīḥ | br̥haspatinā | yujā | indraḥ | sasahe ||8.96.15||

Griffith: Not Available

pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | tyat | sapta-bhyaḥ | jāyamānaḥ | aśatru-bhyaḥ | abhavaḥ | śatruḥ | indra || gūḷhe iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | anu | avindaḥ | vibhumat-bhyaḥ | bhuvanebhyaḥ | raṇam | dhāḥ ||8.96.16||

IAST: gūḻhe dyāvāpṛthivī anv avindo vibhumadbhyo bhuvanebhyo raṇaṁ dhāḥ
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: गूळ्हे द्यावापृथिवी अन्वविन्दो विभुमद्भ्यो भुवनेभ्यो रणं धाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | tyat | sapta-bhyaḥ | jāyamānaḥ | aśatru-bhyaḥ | abhavaḥ | śatruḥ | indra || gūḷhe iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | anu | avindaḥ | vibhumat-bhyaḥ | bhuvanebhyaḥ | raṇam | dhāḥ ||8.96.16||

Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह त्यदप्रतिमानमोजो वज्रेण वज्रिन्धृषितो जघन्थ
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | tyat | aprati-mānam | ojaḥ | vajreṇa | vajrin | dhr̥ṣitaḥ | jaghantha || tvam | śuṣṇasya | ava | atiraḥ | vadhatraiḥ | tvam | gāḥ | indra | śacyā | it | avindaḥ ||8.96.17||

IAST: tvaṁ śuṣṇasyāvātiro vadhatrais tvaṁ gā indra śacyed avindaḥ
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: त्वं शुष्णस्यावातिरो वधत्रैस्त्वं गा इन्द्र शच्येदविन्दः
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | tyat | aprati-mānam | ojaḥ | vajreṇa | vajrin | dhr̥ṣitaḥ | jaghantha || tvam | śuṣṇasya | ava | atiraḥ | vadhatraiḥ | tvam | gāḥ | indra | śacyā | it | avindaḥ ||8.96.17||

IAST: tvaṁ ha tyad vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnāṁ ghano vṛtrāṇāṁ taviṣo babhūtha
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह त्यद्वृषभ चर्षणीनां घनो वृत्राणां तविषो बभूथ
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | tyat | vr̥ṣabha | carṣaṇīnām | ghanaḥ | vr̥trāṇām | taviṣaḥ | babhūtha || tvam | sindhūn | asr̥jaḥ | tastabhānān | tvam | apaḥ | ajayaḥ | dāsa-patnīḥ ||8.96.18||

IAST: tvaṁ sindhūm̐r asṛjas tastabhānān tvam apo ajayo dāsapatnīḥ
Griffith: Not Available
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | tyat | vr̥ṣabha | carṣaṇīnām | ghanaḥ | vr̥trāṇām | taviṣaḥ | babhūtha || tvam | sindhūn | asr̥jaḥ | tastabhānān | tvam | apaḥ | ajayaḥ | dāsa-patnīḥ ||8.96.18||

IAST: sa sukratū raṇitā yaḥ suteṣv anuttamanyur yo aheva revān
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: स सुक्रतू रणिता यः सुतेष्वनुत्तमन्युर्यो अहेव रेवान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | su-kratuḥ | raṇitā | yaḥ | suteṣu | anutta-manyuḥ | yaḥ | ahā-iva | revān || yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | nari | apāṁsi | kartā | saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | prati | it | anyam | āhuḥ ||8.96.19||

IAST: ya eka in nary apāṁsi kartā sa vṛtrahā pratīd anyam āhuḥ
Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: य एक इन्नर्यपांसि कर्ता स वृत्रहा प्रतीदन्यमाहुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | su-kratuḥ | raṇitā | yaḥ | suteṣu | anutta-manyuḥ | yaḥ | ahā-iva | revān || yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | nari | apāṁsi | kartā | saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | prati | it | anyam | āhuḥ ||8.96.19||

IAST: sa vṛtrahendraś carṣaṇīdhṛt taṁ suṣṭutyā havyaṁ huvema
Griffith: Not Available
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | indraḥ | carṣaṇi-dhr̥t | tam | su-stutyā | havyam | huvema || saḥ | pra-avitā | magha-vā | naḥ | adhi-vaktā | saḥ | vājasya | śravasyasya | dātā ||8.96.20||

Griffith: Not Available

pada pāṭha: saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | indraḥ | carṣaṇi-dhr̥t | tam | su-stutyā | havyam | huvema || saḥ | pra-avitā | magha-vā | naḥ | adhi-vaktā | saḥ | vājasya | śravasyasya | dātā ||8.96.20||

IAST: sa vṛtrahendra ṛbhukṣāḥ sadyo jajñāno havyo babhūva
Griffith: Not Available

Griffith: Not Available
Devanāgarī: कृण्वन्नपांसि नर्या पुरूणि सोमो न पीतो हव्यः सखिभ्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | indraḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | sadyaḥ | jajñānaḥ | havyaḥ | babhūva || kr̥ṇvan | apāṁsi | naryā | purūṇi | somaḥ | na | pītaḥ | havyaḥ | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||8.96.21||

IAST: yā indra bhuja ābharaḥ svarvām̐ asurebhyaḥ
Griffith: As highest of the Maghavans, preeminent among the Bulls,
